title: Group Vacation Consultant
description:
The Group Sales Consultant has overall responsibility to understand group travel needs while developing the group travel market. This includes growing the number of groups, the number of passengers, and the profitability of the groups department. Sales activities are both reactive – responding to incoming leads; and proactive – actively soliciting repeat business, initiating sales calls, prospecting new customers, and developing new markets.
Key Areas of Accountability:

  • Maximize group sales in cooperation with field sales activities and through coordinating telemarketing, direct sales calls, database marketing and mail-outs
  • Log all leads, revenue opportunities, and sales activities in Salesforce
  • Prepare detailed proposals for Group clients from all markets, including developing timely and accurate quotations and itineraries; and including blocking rail inventory prior to submitting proposal to client
  • Create customized itineraries as appropriate
  • Either individually or in tandem with field sales, manage the sales pipeline by following up on proposals in order to secure the business and make proposal adjustments as appropriate
  • Ensure, either directly or through an operations specialist, that the execution of charters or group bookings to the highest possible standard
  • Effectively manage the sales funnel through timely completion of sales activities (keeping tasks current in Salesforce)
  • Build all quotations and bookings in Kaptio
  • Perform additional group activities which include invoicing and collecting deposit and final payments
  • Work closely with clients and field sales to maximize number of guests booked on contracted programs through creative promotional ideas specifically designed for their clientele
  • Meet and greet groups during the season
  • Cross train other members of the Sales Department on product knowledge and operations policies
  • Follow up with the client after the group has travelled to ensure customer satisfaction and secure repeat business – future booking
  • Contribute to the overall Groups strategy including assisting with the development of the Sales & Marketing Plan, assisting with group pricing strategy, assisting with the development of Group Consultants, and working on special projects to enhance the Organizational Efficiency as it relates to the Groups department.
  • Liaise closely with the Guest Services and Product Department to maintain an up-to-date supplier database on hotels, attractions, transportation and sightseeing in Canada and work with Group Sales Coordinator to ensure accurate, organized and easily accessible filling system
  • Contribute with constructive feedback and solutions at Groups Department Meetings
  • Attend and participate in trade show, familiarization tours, and industry events relevant to the group market segments as required
  • Develop systems, procedures, and functions to eliminate redundancy and increase efficiency and effectiveness of all members of the Groups team
  • Work closely with the Manager, Groups and Field Sales to ensure good communication between Groups and the rest of the Sales team
  • Develop sales skills and techniques and cross train to understand all processes of the Sales team
  • Ensure complete and ongoing knowledge of Rocky Mountaineer policies, procedures, and products
  • Liaise with Produce Operations team
  • Participate in meals, menu selections
  • Briefing Tour Directors on itineraries
  • Other operational tasks as required

Experience

  • Proven organizational and administrative skills
  • 3 - 5 years’ experience in coordinating groups or proven sales account management experience
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Demonstrated ability to prioritize and work on several projects simultaneously
  • Commitment to guest service excellence
  • Solid business acumen
  • Previous experience with CRM systems (Salesforce) an asset
  • Computer literate (Microsoft Office: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
  • Established connections in business, hospitality, and tourism communities an asset
  • Preference will be given to those candidates who have previous hospitality sales, event planning and/or hospitality operational experience

Skills

  • Motivated, outgoing, and personable
  • Exhibits initiative, creativity and develops relationships easily
  • Team player with flexibility and a positive attitude
  • Responsible for action – enjoys working in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment
  • Exercises good judgment in decision-making
  • Results-oriented
  • Courteous, tactful, and diplomatic
  • Detail-oriented

Attributes

  • Represent Rocky Mountaineer as an ambassador
  • Meet and exceed sales goal expectations including revenue goals, guest count goals and new product sales goals
  • Maintain current and accurate client files
  • Effectively assess priorities, balance responsibilities and be able to organize and work with multiple priorities and deadlines
  • Use discretion and maintain confidentiality in working with and conveying confidential or sensitive information
  • Demonstrate professional demeanor in all interactions with others
  • Contribute consistently
  • Maintain positive and constructive relationships throughout the company
  • Seeks opportunities for continuous learning
  • Ensure complete and on-going familiarity of Rocky Mountaineer’s products

_
Covid - 19 Vaccination Policy: _

_
Rocky Mountaineer (RM) is committed to the safety and health of our team members through providing a safe working environment. As a federally regulated transportation organization, we have a duty to comply with all applicable legislative requirements._

_
Therefore, all individuals who will start working with RM on November 12, 2021, onwards, will be required to present proof of vaccination confirming they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to beginning their employment. An individual is fully vaccinated 14 days after receiving their second dose of a two-dose COVID-19 vaccine series or their first dose of a one-dose approved vaccine by Health Canada. Offers of employment to start work with RM on or after November 12, 2021, will be conditional upon receipt of proof of the job candidate being fully vaccinated against COVID-19._

_
Note: Reasonable accommodations will be considered if they comply with the medical or religious exemptions permitted by applicable federal legislation and ministerial orders._

Job Type: Full-time

title: Customer Success Support
description:
Customer Success Support

Are you ready for a new opportunity where you’ll be recognized for your contributions, build meaningful relationships and drive change in a real way? If you answered yes, keep reading.


Our HQ is in beautiful Montreal, we are a work from anywhere company. Preferred is Canada based


PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Answering calls, emails and chats from travelers who have inquiries specifically on the Online Booking Tools (Concur and Certify) or their profile tool (Concur, Certify or Zii)
  • Supporting basic and advanced online booking tool and profile tool problems with the use of a frequently updated FAQ, as well as training on how to troubleshoot, investigate and solve more complex problems
  • Further escalating problems that you are unable to solve by opening support cases with vendors
  • Using a ticket-logging platform (Zoho) to keep track of all customer problems
  • Receiving escalated calls, emails and chats from a team of Travel Consultants
  • Investigation of after-the-fact files that require it for potential error
  • Documentation of investigations within ticket-logging platform and provide feedback to the product team to improve our product.
  • Getting back to customers with solutions when their cases are solved


PROFESSIONAL REQUIREMENTS

  • Excellent communication skills English and French (oral & written).
  • Proficiency in GDS system (Apollo is an asset)
  • Knowledge of ticketing procedures for the airline, hotel, and car rental systems.


KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS

  • Working knowledge of Online Booking Tools (Concur, NuTravel) is an asset
  • Analytical mindset to identify the proper root cause analysis to prevent issue or the same question to come again
  • Knowledge of MS Office
  • Excellent problem-solving skills
  • Team player that is detail-oriented, proactive, rigorous and reliable


HOW DO WE TAKE CARE OF YOU?

  • Competitive salary, commensurate with experience
  • Extended healthcare benefits plus a Virtual Healthcare service
  • Work from home, work from anywhere!
  • Unlimited time off
  • Internet Stipend
  • Opportunities for professional development
  • One-on-ones, focused on mentorship
  • Collaborative and supportive team (seriously stellar!)
  • Be part of a global growth strategy!


Come as you are! At Encore Travel and Zii Technologies we celebrate our diversity and commit ourselves to maintaining an environment of tolerance, inclusivity and respect for all folk. We ensure that you are welcomed into a safe workplace, free from discrimination or harassment. Encore Travel and Zii Technologies offers equal opportunity to all candidates and employees regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or genetics. And…we are Woman Owned!


About Encore
Encore Travel is a customer and planet centric travel management company (TMC). We build technology that solves corporate problems and customize services to support the evolution of our clients. We have a deep understanding of their needs and of the market, that’s how we innovate. We seek out opportunities to continuously improve the client experience with a focus on taking the trouble away from them and owning it.

About Zii Technologies
Zii Travel Technologies is a brand new, never-before-seen solution to the fundamental challenges of booking travel, envisioned by our very own team. Zii will be stand-alone product based on our love of travel, veteran industry experience and advanced technology!

title: newAdministrative Assistant
description:
Position Overview


Reporting to the Office Manager and ATIP Officer or the Senior Administrative Assistant, the Administrative Assistant is responsible for providing administrative assistance and general office services to the Corporate Services business line, ensuring alignment with the FMB Board policies and procedures.


The Administrative Assistant is primarily an internally focused position, however as requested, this position may liaise and build relationships with various external stakeholders, partners, organizations, and individuals.


Accountabilities


Team Collaboration

  • Oversees third party contractors and suppliers to ensure delivery of professional and applicable business line services;
  • Provides strong, effective, and highly visible team collaboration, is motivated, and contributes fully to the realization of FMB’s vision, mission, and objectives;
  • Promotes and maintains a workplace culture that encourages ethical practices, individual integrity, and economic and social responsibility;
  • Provides support to and works with the Executive Assistant to the Board of Directors to facilitate and conduct virtual and in-person meetings;
  • Conducts role related internal training on policies, processes, procedures, and operational support services.

Administrative Assistance / Office Services

  • Ensures compliance with FMB requirements related to the role;
  • Anticipates role related administrative issues and assesses risks, identifying proactive solutions which will eliminate or mitigate such risks;
  • Drafts, prepares or reviews specific FMB documents, prioritizing workflow, and level of importance;
  • Handles phone calls and emails, answering inquiries, resolving concerns, and managing messages;
  • Handles reception, mail, couriers, telephones, and general business line administrative support;
  • Manages calendars and schedules appointments with Microsoft Outlook;
  • Coordinates meetings, including room setup/tear down, catering requirements, prepares and distributes agendas, minutes, and packages;
  • Coordinates travel requests including flights, hotel bookings and car rentals;
  • Procures and monitors inventory of office supplies;
  • Coordinates workshops, trade shows, special projects, and events;
  • Collaborates with all business lines to ensure provision of consistent documents and processes;
  • Ensures office facilities follow applicable safety standards, regulations, codes, and laws.

Facility / Property Management

  • Assists with individual office assignments and moves including desks, phones, and other assets;
  • Assists with security for office spaces including keys, codes, and parking;
  • Ensures office facilities follow applicable safety standards, regulations, codes, and laws and communicates the organizations safety policies.

The Administrative Assistant performs other related duties as requested.


Qualifications

  • Post-secondary education in business administration, office administration or equivalent;
  • Minimum of three (3) years experience working in an administrative position, preferably within a professional services, accounting, or legal environment;
  • Proficiency in Microsoft 365 and Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook);
  • Exceptional organizational skills and ability to prioritize multiple tasks seamlessly in a rapidly changing environment with excellent attention to detail;
  • Experience working with information and records management systems;
  • Experience working with and/or contracting external vendors and consultants an asset;
  • Experience working with Indigenous Governments, organizations, and communities an asset;
  • Valid first aid certificate, or willingness to undertake first aid training
  • Must have an understanding, awareness and appreciation of Indigenous culture and history;
  • Willing to participate in ongoing education and training for the role;
  • Willingness to participate in ongoing education and training for the role including Indigenous Cultural studies;
  • Must be fluent in English (spoken and written), French language is considered an asset.

Equivalent or relevant education and/or experience may be considered.


Working Conditions

  • This position is based in West Vancouver, British Columbia;
  • May require occasional national travel.

What We Offer

  • Salary and annual bonus eligibility;
  • Flexible 37.5-hour work week
  • Employer paid extended benefits;
  • Matching group RRSP contributions;
  • Annual vacation allowance and generous paid stat & non-stat days;
  • Work-life balance;
  • Professional development & career growth opportunities.

FMB is an equal opportunity employer that recognizes and celebrates the diversity of all First Nations and people across Canada. We are an inclusive organization that treats all employees equally. As a First Nations Organization, applicants of Indigenous descent are highly encouraged to apply.

title: Hotel Booking Coordinator (Seasonal, Full Time)
description:
As a Hotel Coordinator you will be a member of the Rocky Mountaineer Hotel Services Team which supports the sales efforts of the Sales Center's Vacation Consultants.
The Hotel Coordinator processes guests’ hotel and cruise accommodation in an accurate and timely manner, administers all hotel inventory, solicits non-block properties for rooms as required and builds hotel inventory & pricing in our reservation system.
Key Areas of Accountability:

  • Effective daily administration of accommodation service requirements within a 24 hour period.
  • Run required Reservation System's reports 1–2 times per day in order to facilitate the process of administering hotel inventory.
  • Process last minute bookings, cancellations, or revisions within a 2-hour period.
  • Procure additional space as required to confirm bookings.
  • Assist Team Lead, Product Operations with releasing space in a timely manner to avoid unnecessary penalties.
  • Perform other duties assigned as by the Product Operations Management.

Qualifications:
Experience

  • Minimum 2 years’ experience in tourism industry. Preference will be given to those with experience in the Canadian Rockies and Pacific Northwest
  • Reservations systems knowledge

Skills

  • Attention to detail
  • Record of professionalism in dealing with confidential and sensitive information
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Proficient in MS Office (Excel, Word and Outlook)
  • Excellent interpersonal skills; the ability to build rapport with business partners and the ability to lead by influence.
  • Organization and time management skills
  • Represents company positively, and demonstrates RM’s trademark capability of going “beyond the call of duty”

COVID-19 Vaccination
Rocky Mountaineer (RM) is committed to the safety and health of our team members through providing a safe working environment. As a federally regulated transportation organization, we have a duty to comply with all applicable legislative requirements.
Therefore, all individuals who will start working with RM on November 12, 2021, onwards, will be required to present proof of vaccination confirming they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to beginning their employment. An individual is fully vaccinated 14 days after receiving their second dose of a two-dose COVID-19 vaccine series or their first dose of a one-dose approved vaccine by Health Canada. Offers of employment to start work with RM on or after November 12, 2021, will be conditional upon receipt of proof of the job candidate being fully vaccinated against COVID-19.
Note: Reasonable accommodations will be considered if they comply with the medical or religious exemptions permitted by applicable federal legislation and ministerial orders.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • On-site gym

title: Associate
description:
HVS Hospitality Consulting is seeking hotel school graduates that are looking to get out of the back office and move into the forefront of the hotel consulting and appraisal industry with a dynamic and collaborative team (Bachelor’s degree required). Those with a passion for finance and hotel management are welcome to apply.

Every Day is Different: we consult on hotels and markets throughout the province of Quebec and the Maritimes, and no submarket or hotel is alike. If you have become tired of the monotony of your hotel operations existence, let us breathe new life into your career with a move into consulting and valuation. Our consultants travel and learn about hundreds of submarkets and hotels, and our team is able to interact with industry participants that are equally passionate about this work. No day is like the last, and we couple this experience with a great hands on training and fund licensing and continuing education appraisal courses at UBC. Market studies, feasibility studies, and appraisals (valuations) are the mainstay of our business, and we train new associates how to expertly put together highly credible analyses and written reports to back up our conclusions. This work is a perfect career move for a college-graduate that has spent some time in hotel accounting and is ready for a change.

Ideal candidate: If you have your bachelor’s degree and at least six months of hotel experience, are a self-starter who is looking to start a career with advancement opportunities, and have a desire to work within a multicultural community, apply today. (If you are or have been a Hotel Revenue Manager, work in Hotel Accounting, you may also be ideally suited for this position - other hospitality industry professionals with a passion for numbers are encouraged to apply!)

Job Location: Montreal

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
  • Perform valuations of hotels and other hospitality-related income-producing real estate, as well as supply-and-demand analyses
  • Prepare forecasts of income and expenses
  • Write appraisals, market studies, feasibility studies, and consulting reports
  • Use HVS models to conduct analyses
  • Carry out fieldwork and property inspections, as directed
Essential Skills, Qualifications, and Requirements
  • Basic understanding of hotel operation fundamentals
  • Analyze hotel financial statements and economic, lodging, and market area trends to arrive at supportable supply-and-demand forecasts
  • Work as part of a team to meet individual and office objectives with lots of flexibility
  • Prioritize and organize work to meet deadlines
  • Travel -often times local/drive-to markets
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills in French and English
  • Effective organizational, analytical, and interpersonal skills
  • Advanced Excel skills and experience in Microsoft Word and Outlook
  • Strong work ethic with attention to detail and demonstrated problem-solving skills
  • A valid driver’s license
Education/Experience
  • Bachelor’s degree in hotel/tourism administration
  • Experience in hotel operations (6 months to 2 years+ of hotel operations preferred)
Physical Demands
Physical demands are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Physical demands include:
  • Frequent sitting (e.g., at the computer or in a car or airplane in transit to fieldwork); standing desks provided

Working Environment
Work environment characteristics are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The individual works in an office environment with the requirement to travel approximately 20%-40% of the time to carry out fieldwork and property inspections (this is often local inspections/fieldwork that takes you out of the office but not too far from home).
Competitive Pay & Benefits
  • Company-paid employee health insurance, including long-term disability, dental, and life insurance - 100% of premium covered
  • Paid cellphone service
  • Company-paid continuing education, Appraisal Institute of Canada membership, insurance, and professional development
  • Attend Annual industry conferences/events

Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Build a meaningful career
At LifeWorks, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of a more than 7,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 24,000 workplaces.
The Administrative Assistant provides administrative support to the Consulting practice area, which includes the Pension, and Health and Benefits Consulting Teams.
Responsibilities:
  • Prepare invoices and enter into system (JD Edwards), follow up with consultants as necessary to meet tight deadlines
  • Prepare written correspondence, labels, and mail merges; arrange couriers.
  • Proof read and format reports and client deliverables.
  • Format PowerPoint presentations for consultants for client meetings and seminars, and ensure copies are printed or put on a USB; arrange audio-visual equipment as necessary.
  • Transcribe correspondence, reports and other documents from hand-written notes and/or voice messages.
  • Attend meetings, take and distribute meeting minutes
  • Act as a resource and subject matter expert for database (CRM)
  • Provide general administration, including faxing, photocopying, scanning documents, filing, archiving, and ordering supplies.
  • Open, sort, and distribute group mail.
  • Manage the office equipment and liaise with Informational Technology to ensure equipment and internet services are fully functional at all times.
  • Organize the day-to-day schedule of Partners and Principals
  • Manage multiple calendars in outlook
  • Send meeting invitations, organize meeting facilities, and order food/beverages if necessary
  • Coordinate spacing requirements and logistics for new hires
  • Assist Consultants with membership renewals, conference registrations
  • Book travel and hotel arrangements for internal team members.
  • Submit expenses for team members, as required
  • Track budget, purchase orders and expenses
  • Devise ways to continuously improve team operations
  • Assist with special projects, as required.
  • Provide administrative support for the Consulting team as required, working as a team with other Administrative Assistants
Qualifications:
  • The ideal candidate requires a two-year diploma preferably in Business or Office Administration along with a minimum of five years’ experience as an administrative assistant.
  • High proficiency in Microsoft applications, particularly PowerPoint, Word, Excel and Adobe Acrobat are essential, as well as comfort using the internet as a research tool
  • Strong mathematical skills are essential, comfort with accounting principles is an asset
  • Familiarity with JD Edwards billing system is an asset
  • Comfort in a fast paced environment is vital. Candidate must be detail-oriented and work must be highly accurate.
  • Ability to prioritize requests, juggle multiple tasks and handle rush situations
  • Flexibility to come early or stay late if required due to client commitment.
  • A dedicated and flexible team player with a high energy level and solid organizational abilities. In addition, the candidate must possess a high degree of professional maturity, and be mindful of the significant degree of confidentiality required in this position.
  • Organizational and time management skills must be excellent in order to coordinate and track schedules, projects and activities.
  • Professionalism and high regard for confidentiality is a must, to allow the candidate to effectively interact with all levels of the organization.
#LI-SS2
Where permitted by law, LifeWorks employees must be fully immunized to access a LifeWorks office or customer premises.
Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to
talentacquisitiononboarding@lifeworks.com
Fulfilling work that matters
LifeWorks is in the business of helping organizations help their people and in the process, we strive to elevate ours. We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders looking to make a difference in the lives of the people we serve. We appreciate the interest of every applicant; however, we contact only those selected for an interview.
At LifeWorks, we are committed to putting our people first. Our priority is to optimize the health and productivity of our people. In light of COVID-19, our company continues to monitor the global situation and following local guidance in each of our communities to ensure the health and wellbeing of our employees. Safety is our highest priority, and while the goal is to ultimately return to the office, we are currently working remotely and are connecting with candidates through virtual interviews, recruitment events, and information sessions. We are excited to connect with you virtually, and look forward to receiving your application.

title: VP, Sports
description:
Company Description


Founded in 2006, Kensington Tours is a $170 million privately held company that has been rapidly growing for the past few years. We are a multi-award-winning luxury tour operator offering tailor-made, private-guided experiences to the world’s most extraordinary destinations. Anchored by an industry-leading team of 150+ destination specialists, we deliver curated travel experiences for the most discerning clients. The success of Kensington Tours has been its ability to provide customized tours for each and every client in a market with increasingly sophisticated consumer knowledge and a heightened search for “authenticity of experience.” We do this with our pioneering technology platform that allows the company to connect tour experts all over the world into a single, streamlined database and booking engine.

Our tours consist of local hotels, private guides, airport transfers, transport between cities, and special experiences (e.g., hot air balloon ride). Our Procurement team finds destination management companies (DMC) around the world who provide these services, or they source them directly. The Product team curates these product components and then weaves them together into itineraries that span varying price levels and themes.

Kensington strives to surprise and delight at every turn with authentic, extraordinary, and unexpected experiences. Our brand promise - to create the experience that changes the life.


Job Description


Ideally based in Toronto, the Vice President, Sports at Kensington Tours will be responsible for sales and product leadership for a newly created Sports division. This includes defining the business strategy, building a sales team and expanding Kensington’s unique product offering. Managing end-to-end sales operations processes including training, technology, client experience and employee engagement is also integral to the role.

The ideal candidate will have proven experience developing sports itineraries and active vacations and a combination of visionary leadership, sales management, operations strategy development and execution, a strong metrics/data driven orientation. The ability to create and lead high performing teams within a nimble, entrepreneurial environment is a must. The successful candidate is a leader who can tap into their people’s individual motivation, who leads by example and who models the behavior needed to create success in his/her team. They will have proven experience in assessing the development needs required by the organization and the know-how to implement an efficient multi-phased sales program for both in-house and remote consultants. They will be a “process builder’, with the ability to transition between high-level visions and detail-oriented execution and have had success at translating business vision into action for aggressive growth.

Product and Marketing

  • Define the product and partner strategy
  • Develop unique experiences featuring world class sporting events
  • Develop active itineraries featured golf and ski
  • Partner with Marketing to develop marketing plans for multi-channel (direct and agent) customers
  • Work with the Product team to set the product direction and itinerary design
  • Partner with Procurement on sourcing preferred cruise partners and pricing

People

  • Ability to motivate and drive profitable sales growth
  • Lead the recruitment and training process for sales specialists and other support staff
  • Achieve sales training objectives by developing, implementing, and managing ongoing sales training programs that enable staff to achieve their potential and drive productivity, quality, employee engagement, satisfaction, and retention results
  • Collaborate with our Learning & Development team in the development and implementation of sales and training budgets, performance metrics, KPI’s and targets aligned to sales, productivity, quality, and customer service standards
  • Define an oversee incentive programs that motivate the sales team to achieve their sales targets

Clients/Partners

  • Accountable for Net Promoter Score response rate and results and sharing results with our partner network to support insight sharing, issue management & problem resolution to drive efficiencies and improve the end-to-end customer experience
  • Analyze customer feedback from various sources to quickly identify opportunities for improvement with the development of a project plan/roadmap for achievement
  • Lead and drive a customer focused culture, in collaboration with other key functional partners, to drive efficiencies and improve customer experience
  • Collaborate with various stakeholder groups (i.e., Learning & Development, Product & Procurement) to develop customer-centric and relevant training solutions for both the Sales and Customer Care Teams that meet business and operational needs and standards
  • Communicate Operations updates effectively with the sales floor via weekly and monthly updates, internal newsletters, and Sales meetings
  • Work with our partners to support capability building, best practice, and standards implementation, strengthen two-way communication, collaboration and deliver a consistent brand experience across the network

Process

  • Use NPS and other customer feedback to gain insights on how to improve the customer experience and ensure the overall effectiveness of the team with the goal of driving innovation and continuous improvement
  • Provide leadership for problem resolution/issue management, analyzing and providing solutions
  • Work closely with multi-level customer contacts (sales team, vendor partners, client, agent) to answer questions, resolve problems and recommend corrective actions where needed to address escalated situations
  • Ensure processes and systems are in place to effectively manage the operational details

Technology

  • Work with the technology platform director to develop a product roadmap to optimize performance for Sales Experts, Operations team, and external partners
  • Work with Technology and Marketing to map the customer lifecycle journey and to personalize the client experience based on repeat traveler information

Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree and associated industry or related business experience
  • 15+ years of travel sales operations management experience in the travel or events industry with demonstrated ability to drive revenue growth, streamline operations and improve profitability
  • 10+ years in a management role leading cross-functional teams. Ability to collaborate and enable teams to work toward a common goal, both internally and externally
  • Industry experience with luxury and bespoke travel product and their associated markets an asset
  • Experience in a premium/luxury service business. Ability to bring a clear sense of style and brand consistency to our premium and luxury product
  • Demonstrated experience working with key industry suppliers (Hotel chains/Golf Courses/Ski Resorts) and an understanding of the Tours Market/Specialist Travel/Luxury Travel space is an asset
  • Outstanding research and analytical capabilities
  • Strong project management mindset and is hyper organized in approach in delivering and managing operations
  • Demonstrated ability to think strategically yet maintain contact with day-to-day performance. Hands on with high energy, an entrepreneurial spirit, and a positive attitude
  • Excellent communication skills

Additional Information


Cultural Fit – people like working here if they

  • Thrive working in a KPI driven organization.
  • Have an entrepreneurial mindset
  • Learn from what’s working and not working
  • Build trust and work maturely through conflict both upwards and downward

We know our success is dependent on the people who join our team, which is why we recruit the best. Our team is made up of owners; people who are smart, low ego, and who are accountable for their results. We all play a part in the success of the company and are proud of what we do.

We thank all candidates for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

We are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If you require accommodation due to a disability at any stage of our hiring process, please advise us when completing your application.

title: Hospitality Operations Consultant - Contract 6 months
description:
Hospitality Operations Consultant – Contract 6 months

Viaggio Hospitality Group (“Viaggio”) is a collection of upscale and casual restaurants, bars, nightclubs, hotels, private liquor stores, golf course, and breweries throughout British Columbia (“BC”). Each establishment is its own unique concept but all are unified in exceptional service, quality offerings, and genuine hospitality. The newest additions to the award-winning Viaggio portfolio are Birchbank Golf Course in Genelle, BC and Howe Sound Inn & Brewing in Squamish, BC.

We are currently looking for an experienced Hospitality Operations Consultant to join our talented team on a 6 month contract basis. The successful candidate will work directly with the President and will be an integral part of this highly successful, rapidly-growing restaurant group within Viaggio. This individual will have experience in the industry and will lead with a strong desire to accomplish ambitious goals. They are not afraid of tackling unfamiliar challenges and enjoy working with different types of people to come to solutions. You are looking to leave your mark on a growing organization and love thinking of creative and efficient ways to improve operations. There is an opportunity after 6 months for the right candidate to move into a Vice President of Operations role.

Responsibilities:

  • Champion Viaggio’s Culture, Mission, Vision and Values
  • Work directly with the President in the planning and direction of operations to develop and meet company goals while supplying expertise and guidance on operations projects and systems
  • Review and approve cost-control reports, cost estimates, and staffing requirements for the venues allocated to the candidate while ensuring controls are in place for the operations, they have been appropriately implemented and are operating effectively
  • Lead and support Venue Managers in the achievement of their financial and operational targets
  • Identify, recommend, and implement new operations-related processes, practices, standards, technologies, and systems to improve organizational efficiency and use of resources and materials where applicable
  • Present periodic performance reports and metrics to the President
  • Identify training needs for Venue Managers and ensure proper training is developed and provided
  • Collaborates with other divisions and departments to carry out the organization’s goals and objectives
  • Perform other related duties as assigned.

Requirements

  • Previous experience in a senior leadership role and extensive restaurant and hospitality operations experience is required
  • Proven ability to lead a team and place strong focus on the growth and development of individuals on the team
  • Exceptional communication, interpersonal and guest handling skills
  • Analytical skills, strength as a developer and a leader of others, creativity, and strong planning skills are essential for this position
  • Ability to build strong relationships, interact and influence others at all levels of the organization
  • Proven record of coordinating and leading multiple departments to work towards achieving targeted results
  • Self-confident, proactive and able to prioritize and make effective decisions
  • Highly responsible & reliable with the ability to work well under pressure in a fast paced environment
  • Clearly demonstrated ability to be innovative, creative and able to think outside the box

You’ll succeed at this job if you demonstrate the following:

  • Motivated and positive attitude
  • Curiosity and questioning status quo
  • Self-starter who is eager to learn and doesn’t wait to be assigned tasks/ projects
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Effective verbal and listening skills
  • Attention to detail and well organized
  • Ability to multi-task and works well under pressure
  • Analytical and problem-solving skills as well as a creative mind
  • Computer skills (especially excel) to use the power of tech to automate mundane tasks
  • Sense of humor

Working Conditions, Compensation, and Next Steps:

Viaggio offers a competitive compensation and medical and dental benefits. Candidates must be legally authorized to work in Canada to be considered.

If this sounds like an opportunity that would allow to move your career forward, get in touch by applying to this posting.

Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
We follow COVID-19 regulations and guidelines.

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

title: Bilingual Business Travel Consultant
description:
Company Description


As Travel Edge continues to experience the swell of the return to travel, we are currently hiring talented Corporate Travel Consultants to join our busy North American Corporate travel team. Be a part of an exciting group of experienced team members who have exemplary customer service skills, assist with our client’s travel needs, have an eagle eye for details, and love the challenge of working with multiple clients.

If you are satisfied with just fulfilling each request as they come, stop here! Our team members strive to provide consultative and cost-effective travel services for our clients.

Our top-tier team has a, “Yes! I can do that for you!” attitude that understands the need to follow policies and procedures but are empowered to make decisions that are best for our clients.

Why work for us?

We pride ourselves on attracting and retaining top talent by offering challenge and opportunity combined with an attractive compensation plan. Our evolving environment fosters a spirit of innovation allowing our employees to unleash their creativity and achieve a greater level of productivity. While Travel Edge offers great perks, it’s not just the benefits that make our culture great. It’s the way management and teammates treat one another. Our willingness to trust our employees is what breeds creativity, above-and-beyond performance, and job satisfaction.


Job Description


Responsibilities

  • Arrange routine and complex domestic and international business travel for air, car, hotel, limousine, and rail
  • Maintain an exceptional and consistent relationship with our clients
  • Assist with researching and resolving client enquiries
  • Creates and update traveler profile information and share the knowledge within the team
  • Support group travel reservations
  • Other tasks as requested

Qualifications
  • A minimum of 2 years of experience in corporate travel
  • GDS experience in Native Sabre
  • Must be Fluent in French and English, both written and spoken
  • Demonstrated ability to liaise with clients and establish positive relationships
  • Experience in a matrix based and collaborative environment
  • Strong attention to detail, being highly organized and showing the ability to multi-task
  • Ability to function in a fast-paced, demanding environment
  • Experience using Microsoft products such as Excel and SharePoint

Team Culture

  • Thrives working in a technology and KPI-driven organization.
  • Able to thrive in an entrepreneurial environment with ambiguity.
  • Highly functional in a fast paced, constantly changing workplace - building plans through iterations from learning on what’s working and not working.
  • Low ego and a team player.
  • Has the ability to build trust and work through conflict

Additional Information


We thank all candidates for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Successful candidates will receive communications from the Navigatr Talent Acquisition team, our exclusive recruitment partner.

We are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If you require accommodation due to a disability at any stage of our hiring process, please advise us when completing your application.

title: Administrative Assistant- Dollard Des Ormeaux - Dollard-des-...
description:
We are looking for a candidate for an administrative agent position for a temporary replacement of minimum 2 months with possibility of extension. The Administrative Agent performs secretarial duties related to the job, the incumbent
The incumbent manages the Elders' grant applications and provides customer service to the Branch.

Advantages
Monday to Friday 8AM-4PM (35 hrs)
Temporary position minimum 2 months
  • Start date : As soon as possible
  • Hourly salary 2022 : 32.38$-42.49$/hr
  • 35 hours per week: daytime schedule
  • Work from home / office

Responsibilities
EXAMPLES OF TASKS PERFORMED
1. Performs secretarial work for the Director General and his/her immediate superior.
Writes, composes, translates and verifies, in two (2) languages (French-English), communications
communications intended for the public as well as for internal clients.
2. Ensures the quality and consistency of texts or documents produced according to established standards,
and this, for all types of texts (City newspaper, Internet site, letters, press releases
etc.). To this end, proofreads documents, performs text entry and appropriate page layout
with particular attention to grammar, spelling and presentation, in both official languages.
presentation of these works, in both languages (French-English).
3. 3. Analyzes files and documents according to urgency; distributes and
follow up on the progress and deadlines; make the necessary reminders to the persons concerned.
with the persons concerned.
4. Coordinates and follows up on administrative activities related to the directorate, such as
correspondence, documents required for internal or external printing services, and
for internal or external printing services, production of reports, presentations, minutes, minutes
minutes, minutes, processing of paper and electronic mail, photocopying, faxing and
photocopying, faxing, scanning of documents, messaging, etc.
5. Participates in the planning and management of the Executive Director's and Mayor's agenda. Receives
requests for meetings, assesses their importance and priority and reconciles them with
activities already planned.

JOB DESCRIPTION - ADMINISTRATIVE TECHNICIAN - GENERAL MANAGEMENT

2
6. Organizes and follows up on meetings and meetings of the Executive Director. To this end, he/she
prepares the agendas based on the indications received, convenes the persons concerned and
concerned and prepares the relevant documents or files. Attends meetings or
meetings of the various committees, if required, prepares the minutes and does the necessary
necessary.
7. In agreement with his/her superior, designs and drafts memos, acknowledgements, notices of meetings or
Receipts, notices of meetings or routine correspondence. Accumulates, verifies,
corrects if necessary and transmits all data for the preparation of the various
management reports.
8. 8. Follows up on files with elected municipal officials in order to find answers to their requests and
and to ensure the settlement to the satisfaction of the parties.
9. Responds to telephone calls and handles them when possible. If applicable,
Directs or takes messages.
10. Maintain and update information on the City's website.
11. Greets visitors, consultants, citizens, etc. and ensures that they are attended to.
12. Assist his/her immediate supervisor in the organization, preparation and conduct of special
events, receptions, etc. (caucuses, various luncheons, Mayor's dinner, volunteer
volunteers, executive cocktail parties and others, room reservations, catering, hotel reservations
etc.).
13. Prepares documents and other work as requested by the City's administrative departments
(Human Resources Department, Financial and Material Resources Department
Information Systems Department, Buildings Department and City Patrol).
14. Sits on the City's newspaper committee, drafts French and English versions of departmental
articles for his/her department and forward them to the responsible individuals.
15. Manage and classify all departmental documents in accordance with the instructions and
15. Shall manage and classify all departmental documents in accordance with the instructions and rules issued by the Legal Affairs and Registry Department.
16. Prepare files to be submitted to Council for approval, register them in the
16. Prepares files to be submitted to Council for approval, records them in the Decision Management System (DMS) and follows up on them.
17. Manages applications for Elder Grants.
18. Manages departmental petty cash.
19. May act as Commissioner of Oaths, if necessary.
20. Performs all other related tasks assigned by the General Manager or his/her immediate superior.
immediate superior.

Qualifications
Proficiency in spoken and written French and English and translation from French to English and
English and from English to French;
  • Advanced knowledge of computer tools, including MS Office
(Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel) and Adobe Acrobat Pro.
Skills or Abilities
  • Ability to communicate fluently in both languages, verbally and in writing;
  • Write clearly and concisely in both languages;
  • Demonstrate good judgment, tact and courtesy;
  • Demonstrate initiative;
  • Be able to manage various work-related activities simultaneously;
  • Discern and adapt to various situations;
  • Be able to perceive details and identify errors in texts;
  • Ability to transcribe data accurately;
  • Research files.

If you are interested in this opportunity or know someone who might be a good fit. Please send your resume to brandon.freger@randstad.ca or sean.lynch@randstad.ca or melissa.cumetti@randstad.ca or call us at 514-695-3315.

Summary
Why Randstad?

There are a lot of good jobs, great companies and great bosses.
At Randstad, we're here to help you find the right fit.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. title: newSpecial Events Developer
description:
:

General Information:


As an equal opportunity employer, the City of Thunder Bay encourages applications from Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, members of visible minority groups and women.


ONTARIO HUMAN RIGHTS CODE: It is a contravention of the Human Rights Code of Ontario to discriminate on the basis of: race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, family status, disability, age, record of offences, gender identity or gender expression. Therefore, a resume submitted to the City must not include references to any of the above characteristics. Do not include:

  • Photos
  • Any certificates that have photo identification
  • Driver’s licences
  • Police records checks

Note: The above documentation will be requested by the Human Resources & Division should you be the successful applicant. If a Criminal Record Check is required it will be requested by Human Resources should you be the successful applicant. Please do not submit your Criminal Record Check with your application.


ACCOMMODATION: Reasonable accommodations are available upon request for all parts of the recruitment process.


PRIVACY: Personal information on this form is collected under the authority of the Municipal Act, c. 302, as amended, and will be used to determine eligibility for employment. Questions about this collection of personal information should be directed to the Human Resources & Corporate Safety Division, 125 Syndicate Ave Suite 42, Thunder Bay, Ontario, P7E 6H8, Telephone: 625-3866


Application forms must reference the competition number and be submitted to Human Resources by 11:59 p.m. on the closing date.


Job Description:

POSITION SUMMARY: Under the general supervision of the Cultural Development & Events Supervisor, develops and delivers year-round Divisional events and activities at Prince Arthurs Landing – Marina Park and other locations and facilities throughout the city. Key responsibilities include planning and delivery of annual and one-time events including, but not limited to: Snow Day on the Waterfront, Quest: Tech & Gaming, Kite Festival, Teddy Bears Picnic, Live on the Waterfront Performance Series, Thunder Bay Arts & Heritage Awards Gala, Culture Days and various commemoration/celebration events.


MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Participates as a member of the Section’s service delivery team to carry out the goals and objectives of the Section.
  • Assesses staffing needs, makes recommendations on complement amendments, participates in recruitment processes and makes effective hiring decisions.
  • Supervises program & service staff including staff development, performance management/review, coaching/mentoring, health and safety, discipline and termination decisions.
  • Determines and coordinates appropriate staff and volunteer support for Division events in cooperation with Cultural Development & Event Supervisor and Volunteer Program Coordinator.
  • Identifies community needs and priorities for events, programs and services through research, community consultation and trends/issues identification.
  • Coordinates all aspects of event/program planning and delivery including: venue booking, concession/merchandise opportunities, community group involvement, family activities, performers/artisans, site logistics and all associated site and equipment requirements.
  • Develops and maintains records, administrative reports and statistics.
  • Prepares and monitors operating budgets for site services and programs, and makes recommendations on resource allocations, and improvements; seeks alternate funding sources in cooperation with the Cultural Development & Event Supervisor.
  • Liaises with community groups, service providers and staff in the Corporation; maintains a high standard of public relations.
  • Establishes and maintains positive working relationships with internal and external stakeholders including the Yacht Club, Marina Boaters, Water Garden Pavilion Restaurant operator, Baggage Building operator, Waterfront hotel operator, relevant private developers, Event Services, Volunteers, Tourism, Cultural Development & Public Art, Children & Youth, Police and Fire.
  • Develops, administers and maintains policies, procedures and standards of service and complies with appropriate legislation and regulations in cooperation with the Cultural Development & Events Supervisor
  • Supervises and participates in the set-up, delivery and take-down of events including using a City vehicle, rental vehicle or personal vehicle as required.
  • Participates in developing and implements safety procedures and ensures standards are met.
  • Performs such other related duties as may be assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS:


Education/Experience:

  • Degree in a related human services discipline such as recreation, arts administration, events management or a related field with two years related experience in programming, special events, supervising staff, marketing and working with the community; or
  • Diploma in a related human services discipline such as recreation, arts administration, events management or a related field with four years related experience in programming, special events, supervising staff, marketing and working with the community; and
  • Previous supervisory experience
  • Proven experience interacting with and coordinating the work of contractors and service providers
  • Knowledge of budgeting and financial principles and purchasing processes
  • Knowledge of applicable legislation

Skills/Abilities:

  • Ability to communicate effectively and concisely, both orally and in writing
  • Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with superiors, customers, Municipal staff, consultants, contractors, private and public officials, and the general public
  • Ability to identify, understand, and meet/exceed the requirements of internal and external customers
  • Strong project/time management, analytical/critical thinking, problem-solving, and decision-making skills
  • Ability to work well under pressure and deadlines
  • Demonstrated programming, organizational, and public relations skills
  • Self-starter with proven planning, organizing, and coordinating skills
  • Strong leadership skills, including the ability to direct, motivate, evaluate, and recognize staff; proven ability to share skills and knowledge with others
  • Proven conflict management abilities and mediation skills
  • Must be at an intermediate skill level in word processing and spreadsheet software
  • Must possess and maintain a valid Class “G” Ontario Drivers Licence, or equivalent
  • Must meet the definition of a competent driver as defined by the Corporation
  • Competent within the meaning of the Occupational Health and Safety Act

CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT:

  • Must undergo a successful Criminal Record and Judicial Matters Check (CRJMC)
  • May be required to travel to various work locations and provide own transportation
  • Must remain a competent driver as defined by the Corporation
  • May be required to provide a successful driver’s record (uncertified)
  • Must be able to work irregular hours (days/evenings/weekends)

title: VIP Travel Counselor
description:
Overview of VIP Travel Counselor Role:
The Traveler Counsellor role at GBT is to deliver exceptional travel service experience for our Corporate Business Customers. By working together as a high performing team, our Travel Counsellors provide exceptional traveler care, first call resolution and the highest quality of customer service to GBT corporate clients. It is a high touch service environment, where you will have true accountability for the service relationship and customer experience, by providing creative and timely travel solutions, using available tools and technology as needed, while maximizing supplier revenue.
The role will form part of a highly skilled team of Corporate Travel Counsellors located virtually from home, at one of our Business Travel Centers or on-site at client locations. The role will report to a Team Coach.
Key Responsibilities:
  • Operating in a 24 hour a day, 7 days a week team, with variable shift opportunities for days, nights and weekends.
  • Act as Travel Advisor and Consultant to a single or multiple Corporate Business accounts with the willingness to jump in and flexibility in shifts to meet client needs
  • Act as the point of sale on all Domestic & International travel requirements, arranging both routine and complex travel for air, rail, car, and Hotel accommodation, utilizing one or multiple Global Distribution Systems (GDS), Sabre, Apollo, Galileo, Amadeus.
  • Provide consultative advice, solutions and recommendations. Additionally, pro-actively selling additional service for our travelers (e.g. Hotel and Car), whilst ensuring adherence to the customers agreed travel policy and requirements
  • Complying with all legal standard requirements, which include mandatory training, compliance and sanctions
  • Deliver expectations on individual/shared team goals and support all business Key Performance Indicators. Proactively review your metrics to check on and improve performance
  • Follow internal compliance and regulatory requirements for all customers and locations supported
  • Manage the end-to-end booking process through the ticketing and order fulfillment, either over the telephone, via messaging or via email or back office systems and servicing platforms.
  • Operate in a telephony servicing environment where you are accountable to key performance indicators of success, such as customer satisfaction (CSAT), key productivity metrics (for example call adherence and call service metrics), and driving key partnerships and sale of preferred air and hotel partners
  • Operate in a Multi-Channel servicing environment where you are accountable to key performance indicators of success, such as customer satisfaction (CSAT), key productivity metrics (for example call adherence and call service metrics
  • Use positive telephone service techniques; act on special customer requests and maintain excellent client relations
  • Meeting the servicing of your nominated account or clients travel requirements, whilst adhering to your nominated call schedule daily, and reporting any variances in the workforce management scheduling tool to your Team Coach
  • Coach, develop and mentor more junior Travel Counsellor colleagues in the team as needed
  • Express enthusiasm and energy within the organization and always act according to company ethics, values and Compliance guidelines.
Additional Accountabilities
  • Working phone, email or chat booking air, rail, hotel and car rental
  • Investigates/action Travel Counsellors reservations/PNR for ticketing, quality/accuracy, client escalations or lowest fare (e.g., CSI/CSR, Trailblazer)
Key Qualifications and Attributes:
  • Detailed understanding of fares and ticketing rules, for car, air, hotel travel
  • Knowledge and experience of:
    • Air, rail, hotel, car booking
    • Calculating and Processing exchanges
    • High proficiency in one or multiple GDS
      • Sabre, Apollo, Galileo, Amadeus
  • Experience working in a high touch service environment where performance is measured
  • Individual to make solid decisions on behalf of the customer and GBT point of sale/in the moment; fearless decision making
  • Interact and assist all customers of a distinguished level within the client portfolio they are supporting
  • Consultative, proactive, anticipate the callers needs
  • Adept management of all communication channels (chat/email/telephony) required by the role
  • Detail oriented, ability to review all facets of the request and respond fully and completely
  • Strategic thinking; process improvement, what brings value to our customers and GBT
  • Management of multiple and complex requirements fluently, such as (not all but including things like):
  • 1 GDS, multiple countries, complex client/internal process (versus "out of the ordinary"), specialty travelers, ancillary services, customer driven entitlements et al
  • Experience working in a team
  • Background in Business Travel, leisure or airline reservation required
  • Passion for Excellence in Client Service
  • Excellent Professional Communication – both written and verbal
  • Detail-oriented - ability to act with integrity, and deal sensitively with personal and confidential traveler information
  • Ability to research and resolve customer service and traveler issues independently and /or with supplier
  • Problem Solving, with a process improvement mindset
  • Able to work under pressure, with a sense of urgency while maintaining a professional rapport and multi-task, accepting and adapting to change quickly and professionally
  • Ability to positively influence team and peers
  • Learning agility and ability to act on constructive feedback
  • Possess a strong understanding of travel trends and industry best practices

Location
Canada - Virtual Location

It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals based on job-related qualifications and ability to perform a job, without regard to age, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, creed, national origin, disability, genetic information, veteran status, citizenship or marital status, and to maintain a non-discriminatory environment free from intimidation, harassment or bias based upon these grounds.

GBT Recruitment Privacy Statement

title: Project Manager (Development)
company: Andromeda Investments ULC o/a Maclab Development...
description:
When we build, we think about the way we want to live safely, with beauty and with room to play.
For us, success is long term. It is about people and their experiences: their first home, their dream home, the park where their children and their grandchildren take their first steps, their view at sunset, their favourite tree.

As a family-owned company, our values and our commitment to our community are non-negotiable. They determine how we treat people, how we choose partners, how we give, how we do business.

Maclab Development Group Ltd (MDG) is a highly innovative and entrepreneurial group that is continually exploring new ways to meet the evolving needs of contemporary individuals and families. MDG is responsible for the sourcing, acquisition, design, development, and marketing of MDG’s development projects focused on new communities, retail, and multifamily assets.

The company’s efforts to source new revenue properties and continue the rejuvenation and redevelopment of recently acquired assets and properties held by the company for many years is a focus of significant energy and will allow the company to drive the growth of the asset base in the future.

NATURE AND SCOPE OF WORK

Reporting directly to the President, the Project Manager will have oversight over several key projects under development including:

1. Management of new neighbourhood retail developments including the sourcing of tenants, managing new construction and tenant improvements, financial reporting
2. Management of the expansion and addition of new cabins at Tekarra Lodge, a 53 unit seasonal hotel located Jasper Alberta.
3. Revitalization of an existing asset through the change of use from office to multifamily.
4. Monthly and quarterly reporting and annual budgeting.

DUTIES AND RESPONSBILITIES
Project Management:

  • Negotiates offers to lease and leases with tenants
  • Determines the appropriate method to complete construction and manages the tender and negotiation for new construction.
  • Analyzes tender results and summarizes the results for ownership decision making.
  • Works with and coordinates a team of consultants including architects, engineers, and designers and can convey the timing and delivery of the program to each member
  • Manages and oversees the construction of projects to ensure delivery according to the schedule.
  • Communicates with ownership, commercial team, and finance team to ensure everyone is aware of timing, cash flow needs and delivery issues.

KNOWLEDGE, ABILITIES AND SKILLS
· Desire to be a part of a high functioning team
· 5+ years of comprehensive experience in commercial real estate, leasing office, commercial and retail properties, asset management, acquisitions & relationship management.
· Able to understand the big picture, strong communicator, able to work independently while using the resources that are available to him. Strong people management and leadership skills.
· Strong relationship building skills especially with partners and stakeholders.
· Entrepreneurial, able to move quickly and adept at seeing opportunities.
· Interest in continually learning and developing.

EDUCATION, TRAINING AND EXPERIENCE
· 5+ years of real estate, development or construction experience would be an asset
· Exposure to and understanding of the real estate development cycle.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $58,155.00-$121,747.00 per year

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Application question(s):

  • Are you fully vaccinated?

Experience:

  • real estate, development or construction: 5 years (preferred)
  • real estate development cycle: 2 years (preferred)
  • comprehensive experience in commercial real estate: 3 years (preferred)
  • Project Management (Development): 5 years (preferred)

title: Corporate Sr. Travel Advisor - Remote
description:
Sr Corporate Travel Advisor- Remote

If working at a highly regarded corporate travel management company and offering exceptional service to high-profile clients sounds exciting, then we would like to hear from you.
We are recognized for ‘doing whatever it takes’ for our corporate clientele. We exceed industry standards in terms of service and ability in the most difficult and unexpected circumstances, consistently exceeding client expectations.
This position can be fully remote or hybrid in our Toronto office.
Position Overview

As a Senior Corporate Travel Consultant at Direct Travel, you will be working in a collaborative team environment that caters to our long-standing and new corporate clients.

Responsibilities

  • Managing all aspects of client travel reservations.
  • Developing creative solutions to serve client needs.
  • Keeping up to date with industry developments.
  • Fulfilling complex and unusual travel requests.
  • Reviews all reservations for travel policy and procedure compliance
  • Advising clients on lowest fare and routing option
  • Ensures that all reservation files pass quality control prior to ticket issuance
  • Follows all policy and procedures as outlined in the training manual
  • Provides quality service to each corporate client
  • Supports preferred vendor agreements
  • Responsible for developing relationships with travel arrangers and travelers
  • Callbacks to clients; Updating profiles
  • Researching client needs or special requests when required
  • Supporting team members with client requests

*
Expectations*

  • Strong knowledge of domestic and international corporate travel, international fare construction, and airline routings.
  • Ability to act with absolute discretion.
  • Able to work business hours Monday to Friday, with a willingness to occasionally work other hours as needed.

Preferred Qualifications

*
Minimum 2 years experience as a corporate travel advisor

  • Travel School Graduate preferred
  • Experience with Domestic, Transborder, and International reservations
  • Hands-on Car/ Hotel reservation knowledge
  • Extensive experience on designated team GDS
  • Excellent customer service ability
  • Excellent attention to detail and accuracy
  • Strong communications techniques
  • Problem solver and ability to think ‘outside the box’ for customers
  • Team player
  • Ability to be flexible and multi-task

Direct Travel is an EOE/AA/Veteran/People with Disabilities employer.
*
About Direct Travel*

Our growing company relies on excellence to deliver on our commitments to our customers. This starts with our employees. Our inclusive culture encourages entrepreneurial spirit empowering employees to build strong, long-lasting relationships with our clients and deliver innovative solutions. Direct Travel is one of the most respected Travel Management Companies in the industry providing our customers with smart consultation, tailored solutions and a true partnership. Our specific focus on the mid-market means our travel experts deliver personalized service to every client.

Additionally, Direct Travel offers full-service performance improvement solutions, including meeting and event management, group incentive travel and individual recognition solutions through its wholly-owned subsidiary Creative Group, Inc. An industry leader, Creative Group has been honored with the CMI 25 Award, which recognizes the top 25 most influential meeting and incentive management companies in the US each year since the award’s inception in 2007. The company is headquartered in Schaumburg, Illinois and maintains offices in Detroit, Appleton, San Francisco and Toronto. For more information about Creative Group, please visit www.creativegroupinc.com.

Together we will help our clients Navigate Their Way and Create Truly Moving Experiences. For more information, visit www.dt.com. Follow us on Twitter, YouTube and LinkedIn.

Job Type: Full-time

title: Event Coordinator
description:
Calgary, AB

Do you have administration, marketing, and event planning experience This may be the role for you! Lock Search Group is pleased to present an exciting opportunity to join an industry leader in their market. Our client is looking for an Event Coordinator in Calgary, Alberta. This individual will be responsible for assisting in the planning and execution of world-class events.

What you will be doing:
  • Assist in the logistics and planning of various events
  • Prepare marketing communications and coordinate print materials/ event materials
  • Provide administrative support to the event division
  • Act as a liaison with the venue and/or hotel
  • Aid with on-site event delivery
  • Collaborate with various internal departments, external vendors, and suppliers
  • Collect post event feedback for review
The experience you bring:
  • Diploma (Events, Communications, or Business preferred)
  • 3+ years of related experience
  • Ability to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing
  • Ability to work individually as well as part of a team
If you are an experienced event coordinator looking for a new and exciting opportunity apply in confidence for immediate consideration using the “Apply” button.

Thank you in advance for your interest, only individuals deemed to have the skill set and experience to fit the role will be contacted. Applicants must be legally entitled to work in Canada without sponsorship.

Lock Search Group is a National Executive Recruitment firm with a dozen offices in Canada, a staff of more than 50 Consultants and Associates, and expertise in 11 major disciplines. Our mission is to provide exceptional Recruitment and Consulting Services to clients and candidates. We apply our experience and expertise to deliver solutions with a personalized approach that focuses on clients’ needs and candidates’ goals.

Follow us on LinkedIn!

title: Product Consultant - Rehabilitative Equipment
description:
ECO Medical Equipment is one of the largest home medical equipment vendors in Western Canada and has been serving Edmonton and the surrounding area with quality home care mobility and accessibility equipment for 40 years. We know that our clients depend on us to provide them with high quality products and efficient support and service.

We are looking for a self-motivated individual that is looking for a fulfilling career opportunity in the home medical equipment industry as a Rehab Product Consultant at our high-volume Grande Prairie location. The Rehab Product Consultant provides professional sales relations and solutions with private clientele, government authorized Therapists, as well as funding agencies.

This individual should be comfortable dealing with vulnerable people that have various special needs and be empathetic to their circumstances. If you possess the skills required, are passionate about helping people and thrive working in a fast-paced family-oriented work environment we would love to meet you!

What we offer our employees:

Benefits that include:

  • Health & Dental
  • Life Insurance
  • Long Term Disability
  • Flexible Spending Account (Health Care Spending, Group RRSP, Taxable Wellness, Tax-free savings and more options) $300 per year for Single, $600 per year for Family)
  • Emergency Travel Assistance
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Employee discounts that extends to family members
  • Perkopolis Membership that includes discounts for flights, hotels, entertainment, shopping, automotive and much more
  • 10% off Mark’s Work Warehouse Discount Card
  • $150 towards Safety Shoes every two years
  • Continuous improvement towards adding more value to employee benefits
  • Vacation increases to three weeks on 3rd anniversary, four weeks on 9th anniversary and five weeks on 16th anniversary
  • Long Service Recognition Program
  • Ongoing training and development
  • Rewarding career opportunities

The ideal candidate would possess the following skill sets:

  • Patience, compassion and strong listening skills
  • Clear communication and a positive attitude
  • Excellent time management capabilities and flexibility
  • Client focused including going above and beyond so our clients leave feeling everything has been taken care of for them
  • Willingness to learn and develop new skills
  • Computer skills required

Responsibilities:

  • Manage specific sales territory (TBD)
  • Advise clients and Therapists on the selection of Mobility, Seating, Positioning, Accessibility equipment and Home Care supplies
  • Work directly with Occupational and Physical Therapists in a team to develop and implement an appropriate plan for setting clients up with mobility and seating equipment.
  • Demonstrates products and services to existing/potential customers and assists them in selecting those best suited to their needs.
  • Establish and maintain positive, productive and mutually beneficial relationships
  • Forecast and influence stock levels based on data from the field, determined in conjunction with many components of the supply management chain
  • Control and monitor inventory of trial equipment used by Therapists in the assessment process of client needs and requirements.
  • Coordinate with internal sales and support employees to provide efficient service to address clients needs and provide a positive outcome
  • Safely operate provided company vehicle as well as maintenance
  • Includes travel to various facilities as necessary to provide services and attend training as required
  • Register equipment, process paperwork necessary including quotes and prior approval documents for funding and billing, as well as provide appropriate billing codes to Therapists for AADL billing purposes
  • Protect company assets

Minimum Education and Experience:

  • Post-Secondary education in Physical Therapy or Occupational Therapy an asset
  • Minimum 3-5 years’ experience as a Product Consultant for Rehabilitation Equipment including area of Seating preferred
  • Current manufacturer certificates (Ex. Sunrise Medical, Pride Mobility, Invacare, Permobil, Humancare, Arjo Huntleigh, etc.
  • Knowledge of AADL required
  • Knowledge and experience with Windward POS system an asset
  • Managing processes and a knowledge of the market and clients’ needs
  • Customer service experience

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • rehabilitative equipment sales: 1 year (preferred)
