title: Manual Mobility Technician
description:
About us

ECO Medical Equipment is one of the largest home medical equipment vendors in Western Canada and has been serving Edmonton and the surrounding area with quality home care mobility and accessibility equipment for 40 years. We know that our clients depend on us to provide them with high quality products and efficient support and service.

We are looking for a self-motivated individual that is looking for a fulfilling career opportunity in the home medical equipment industry as a Manual Mobility Technician at our high-volume Edmonton location. The Manual Mobility Technician is responsible for the efficient maintenance, repair and set up for all manual mobility equipment (Manual wheelchairs, commodes, walkers, etc.)

This individual should be comfortable dealing with vulnerable people that have various special needs and be empathetic to their circumstances. If you possess the skills required, are passionate about helping people and thrive working in a fast-paced family-oriented work environment we would love to meet you!

What we offer our employees:

· Benefits that include:

ο Health & Dental

ο Life Insurance

ο Long Term Disability

ο Flexible Spending Account (Health Care Spending, Group RRSP, Taxable Wellness, Tax-free savings and more options) $300 per year for Single, $600 per year for Family)

ο Emergency Travel Assistance

ο Employee Assistance Program

ο Employee discounts that extend to family members

ο Perkopolis Membership that includes discounts for flights, hotels, entertainment, shopping, automotive and much more.

ο 10% off Mark’s Work Warehouse Discount Card

ο $150 towards Safety Shoes every two years

ο Continuous improvement towards adding more value to employee benefits

· Vacation increases to three weeks on 3rd anniversary, four weeks on 9th anniversary and five weeks on 16th anniversary

· Long Service Recognition Program

· Ongoing training and development

· Rewarding career opportunities

The ideal candidate would possess the following skill sets:

· Patience, compassion, and strong listening skills

· Clear communication and a positive attitude

· Excellent time management capabilities and flexibility

· Exceptional troubleshooting skills

· Willingness to learn and develop new skills

· Knowledge of products an asset

· Technical and mechanical experience required including use of power tools

· Customer service experience an advantage

· Excellent computer skills

· Ability to lift and move items up to 70 lbs.

  • Clean Alberta Driver’s abstract and valid driver’s license

Responsibilities:

  • Repair and maintenance of all manual/power related mobility equipment ensuring that manufacturers’ guidelines and specifications are adhered to and that equipment is safe to operate
  • Equipment includes manual wheelchairs, cushions, commodes, more
  • Troubleshooting problems clients are having with their equipment
  • Maintenance and repairs on electrical and electronic devices specific to the equipment
  • Set up of new product for Product Consultants, customers
  • Inspect and test rental and loaner equipment prior to use by customers
  • Contact manufacturers for assistance with repair guidance
  • Quality control checks done on all repairs

Requirements:

· Experience with Manual Mobility Equipment considered valuable

· Knowledge of Provincial and Federal Third-Party Funding Agencies an asset

· Product knowledge favoured

· Knowledge of fasteners, metric, and standard thread

· Electronics & mechanical background

Schedule and Compensation:

· Monday through Friday

· Salary will commensurate on level of experience in the home medical equipment industry as a Manual Mobility Technician

We thank all applicants for their interest, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Closing date would be as soon as possible pending the hire of a suitable candidate.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Store discount
  • Wellness program

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

  • Equipment repair: 2 years (preferred)

title: Admin Assistant - Postelsia division
description:
Postelsia, a division of Where Food Comes From, Inc., is a seafood consulting company located in Victoria, British Columbia. Postelsia is a leader in place-based multi-dimensional sustainability initiatives for the global seafood industry striving to drive transformative change across global seafood supply chains through equitable, inclusive, and sustainable improvement programs. Postelsia partners with producers, sellers, buyers, technologists, public agencies, and NGOs to deliver innovative market solutions that are backed by science and based on cultural understanding.


The Administrative Assistant is responsible for daily customer management responsibilities of Postelsia’s corporate clientele and provides project assistance internally and externally. As an associate with Postelsia, you will be responsible for managing audit coordination, responding to multiple buyer and stakeholder inquiries on a range of topics, all while maintaining a high level of customer satisfaction. Postelsia is seeking an organized professional who values productivity, customer engagement, and hard work.


Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Provide full administrative support including overseeing emails and internal correspondence across multiple platforms and user accounts

  • Keep track of important company documents and share company documents with clients when requested

  • Provide extensive calendar management by organizing executives’ calendars, including adding events and scheduling/rescheduling appointments

  • Help ensure requests are responded to in a timely manner, using best judgment to assist and make decisions without supervision when applicable

  • Keep important information and company documents organized electronically while maintaining a high level of confidentiality and discretion

  • Ensure timely expense reporting within compliance by organizing receipts and relay information to the WFCF Corporate Accounts Payable Team

  • Manage and edit consultant contracts and share with the WFCF Accounting Manager

  • Coordinate travel arrangements (both domestic and international), manage itineraries, book flights, hotels, ground transportation and restaurants reservations and adjust schedules as needed, including nights and weekends

  • Catalog and organize supplier related emails into an AirTable database

  • Assist other team members with tasks relating to all Postelsia's various projects

  • Conduct research and create reports/overviews of different company information and relating to various topics by building PowerPoint, Excel and Word documents

  • Other duties as assigned



Required Skills & Experience:

  • 2+ years of administrative assistant experience

  • Exceptional communication skills and heightened attention to detail

  • Strong sense of urgency towards customer service and task management while working in a high paced environment under pressure

  • 1+ years’ experience working directly with clients and stakeholders

  • Ability to think critically and ahead

  • Self-motivated with a desire for continuous learning

  • Ability to multi-task and manage priorities effectively and efficiently with completing deadlines.

  • Must have a positive, solution-oriented attitude and be a team player

  • Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office Applications with word processing and spreadsheets knowledge (e.g., Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)



Additional Preferred Qualifications:

  • Secondary Education

  • Practical field experience in production, science, and or management, preferably seafood

  • International experience and bilingual

  • Sustainability and project management

  • Service and consulting industry experience

  • Food safety and quality standards


Working Conditions

  • Victoria, BC (Canada) office

  • Remote Option

  • Additionally, due to the nature of the information handled within this position, complete confidentiality and refrain from conflict of interest is demanded, and failure to adhere to these requirements is a terminable offense. We are a company that encourages self-starters and we reward highly motivated employees. There is opportunity for growth within this position for the individual who consistently excels in their performance.

Equal Employment Opportunity:

Where Food Comes From, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.


This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

title: Environmental Consultant
description:
OAKRIDGE has an immediate opening for a Intermediate Environmental Consultant.

This role will be responsible for working on remediation and reclamation projects in the oil and gas industry, producing professional reports, quality fieldwork, and general environmental consulting duties. This is a dynamic and flexible field position requiring the applicant to be located (or ability to relocate) within the Peace Region.

Required:

  • 3-5 years environmental related experience in the field of remediation and/or reclamation with a focus on projects in the oil and gas sector
  • environmental related degree or diploma
  • ability to work independently on multi-disciplinary projects
  • ability to work outside in all weather conditions.
  • ability to work extended hours when required, as well as travel to and from remote jobsites (often requiring overnight stays in camps or hotels)
  • ability to carry a minimum of 50 lbs. without assistance
  • a high level of personal responsibility and ethics
  • ability to direct and supervise others respectfully and efficiently
  • excellent verbal and written communication skills

· Valid Canadian Driver’s License

The Ideal Candidate will have:

  • Registration or ability to register with a Professional Designation in their field
  • have experience in the oil and gas and environmental fields, particularly in Alberta and BC

OAKRIDGE is an equal opportunity employer. We offer competitive salaries and a full benefit program that includes health, dental, life insurance, travel insurance, and employee assistance program.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $40.87-$45.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 12 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • On call
  • Overtime
  • Weekend availability

title: Environmental Monitor Consultant
description:
Energy

Calgary, AB

Full-Time


RPS Energy Canada Ltd. (RPS), a subsidiary of RPS Group PLC (www.rpsgroup.com), provides independent expertise worldwide, delivering advice based on science and supporting our client’s projects at all stages of an asset life cycle. We specialize in geotechnical and engineering solutions for projects delivered in remote, sensitive, and operationally challenging environments. We work with clients to manage environmental impacts, optimize their return on investment, develop their staff and bring energy to market cost-effectively and safely.

RPS has been based in Calgary for more than 40 years is part of a global multi-disciplinary consultancy providing integrated technical, commercial and project management support in the fields of geoscience, engineering and HS&E to the energy and resources sector. Our activities in North America include petroleum engineering; wellsite geology; seismic project management; seismic data processing oversight and interpretation; geology and geophysical studies; and industry training. Internationally, the RPS Group provides advice on the development of natural resources, land and property, management of the environment, and the health and safety of people, and includes advice to professional bodies, NOCs and international aid agencies. RPS is a public company listed on the main London Stock Exchange (LSE).

Description:

RPS is looking for an Environmental Consultant to join our Technical, Training & Advisory Team in Calgary, Alberta. This role requires expertise in environmental consulting and project management focused on environmental monitoring, environmental assessment, site investigation and remediation, emerging contaminants, and brownfield redevelopment. The selected candidate will be a key member of a growing team and contribute to the tailored risk based environmental solutions for our diverse client base. In this position, you will have responsibility for field work, technical report writing, client relationship management, project and time management, as well as business development. The selected candidate will also work in conjunction with RPS’s Environmental Risk Team and will partner with internal RPS colleagues in the fields of Environmental Due Diligence, Regulatory Compliance, and Environmental Health & Safety.

This position will be based in the RPS Calgary office. The ideal candidate will be an experienced environmental consultant with ~5 years of experience in all aspects of environmental assessment, site investigation, remediation, and regulatory closure.

Key Responsibilities:

  • The selected candidate’s primary role will be to act as an Environmental Monitor on all RPS seismic projects. Therefore, the selected candidate must possess an understanding of oil and natural gas/resource exploration and development procedures, related environmental protection measures and industry construction practices.
  • The selected candidate must possess the ability and aptitude to develop an understanding of the ecological processes and sensitivities of a given project area and landscape relative to the execution of a surface exploration project.
  • Proven experience working in a collaborative manner to achieve client and project goals.
  • Selected candidate should be able to recognize and analyze potential environmental issues as well as have familiarity with risk-based environmental decision making, remediation, and brownfield redevelopment.
  • The selected candidate must possess good technical writing skills and the ability to communicate effectively with clients, regulatory agents, and other stakeholders.
  • Preparation and communication of project updates and status reports to government, industrial, financial, and real estate clients relative to the findings of environmental assessments, sampling investigations, and/or remediation projects.
  • Ability to manage several projects with overlapping deadlines at any one time.
  • The successful candidate will manage field, office and client relationships for site investigation, remediation and redevelopment projects for real estate, legal and industrial clients.
  • The secondary role of the Environmental Consultant is to conduct Phase I Environmental site assessments (ESA’s), environmental compliance audits, which may include historical research on properties and reference environmental laws & regulations for due diligence.
  • Selected candidate must be knowledgeable of and experienced in writing Phase I environmental site assessments to the Canadian CSA Z768-01 standard.
  • Selected candidate must be able to evaluate all types of environmental regulatory cases, such as: Leaking Underground Storage Tanks, State Hazardous Wastes, Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation & Liability Information System and National Priority List Sites.
  • Collaborate with Technical Leaders (TL’s) and Project Managers (PM’s) to plan and meet timelines and requirements along with budget goals.

Requirements:

  • Post-secondary degree or diploma in environmental, or natural sciences or applicable discipline of engineering.
  • A minimum of 5 years of experience in environmental consulting with a proven track record exhibiting the ability to effectively communicate, network and maintain client relationships is highly desirable.
  • Candidate must be willing conduct field work. 25% travel should be expected with extended periods (4-6 weeks at a time) of field work occurring during winter.

Working at RPS:

RPS is a dedicated team of talented scientific and technical individuals working together to provide our clients with cutting edge solutions to meet their evolving needs. As a recognized industry leader our clients seek our guidance, and we provide a service that ensures their success. We do this in an exciting and collaborative environment that combines our scientific knowledge and technical expertise to provide unique solutions. Our global footprint enables us to work with a variety of government and private client through diverse projects.

RPS is proud to offer their employees a competitive total rewards package, including medical, dental and vision benefits, annual fitness allowance, mental health support, and so much more. Specific to this role, employees are also eligible for additional field pay above salary, vehicle allowance, fuel, hotel, subsistence, UTV allowance for each day worked in the field.

Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
Mindful that a truly inclusive organization must make appropriate use of talent on a global basis and without unnecessary barriers, we are committed to embedding diversity and inclusion principles in all People processes in order to be as diverse as the communities and clients we work with, thereby securing, developing, and retaining the best available talent for the company’s future.

Our approach to Diversity and Inclusion
Our people live our purpose, deliver our promise, and demonstrate our behaviours every day. Our behaviours define who we are. Developed by our people, they underpin everything that we do. They create the memorable experiences we are known for and make RPS a great place to do great work.

‘Stronger Together’ is one of our five core behaviours and it is inherent in creating an inclusive workplace:
‘We are respectful, acknowledge diversity, and recognise the potential and contribution of everyone. We bring out the best in one another, always assuming best intent. People who learn and grow thrive in our business, sharing in our success.’

Recruitment Agencies
We have a Preferred Supplier List of trusted partners to assist us when required and do not acknowledge any speculative CVs or unsolicited candidate introductions from agencies not on this list. Please refer to the careers page on our website if you require any further information.

Therefore, the selected candidate must possess an understanding of oil and natural gas/resource exploration and development procedures, related environmental protection measures and industry construction practices.', 'Proven experience working in a collaborative manner to achieve client and project goals.', 'Selected candidate should be able to recognize and analyze potential environmental issues as well as have familiarity with risk-based environmental decision making, remediation, and brownfield redevelopment.']

title: Catering Manager
company: Cambridge Red Deer Hotel & Conference Centre
description:
A HOTEL WITH THE FREEDOM OF STYLE!

Located in the heart of Central Alberta, the CAMBRIDGE RED DEER HOTEL & CONFERENCE CENTRE is the ideal place to start your career in hospitality while providing excellent and personalized service to our guests while working within a positive team environment.

Under the direction of the Director or Sales and Marketing, the Catering Manager is responsible for the direction and the full operation of the Catering Consultant team. The Catering Manager is responsible for revenue maximization, negotiation services and detail oriented planning to ensure flawless execution of group functions. Attention to detail is a must in this position with the planning and coordinating of meals, guestroom blocks and all other areas required to ensure meetings and events occur smoothly.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Train, supervise and work with all catering staff, in order to solicit and book banquet and catering functions;
  • Ensure customer satisfaction and maximize hotel revenue and profitability;
  • Maintain achievement of revenue goals;
  • Determines the customer's needs, space availability, meeting details and food and beverage requirements;
  • Evaluate profitability, timeliness, and desirability of the business;
  • Negotiate pricing and aggressively and immediately close the sale;
  • Responsible for maximizing revenues as well as maximizing function space usage and profitability;
  • Must practice superior sales skills that result in building/maintaining of professional business relations;
  • The individual must have solid knowledge of Delphi or equivalent and the ability to understand booking guidelines, and rate parameters;
  • Responsible for communication and following through with hotel management and outside vendors to ensure the sale commitment is fulfilled;
  • Distribute written communications detailing the needs of the customer and sales commitment (group resumes, event orders, etc.);
  • Responsible for establishing customer relationships that will encourage repeat business;
  • Maintains up to date computer data files to ensure proper coordination of sales commitment as well as customer needs;
  • Analyze and identify booking trends and patterns to maximize revenue opportunities;
  • Attend and participate in daily stand-up meetings, and other meetings as requested;
  • Act as a liaison with competitors, industry associations, keeping abreast of competitor's services, facilities, and accounts to ensure the hotel remains in a competitive position;
  • Prepare contracts, rate proposals and property information databases;
  • Maintain account files including signed contracts with current direct-bill applications;
  • Work with accounts payable to ensure clients on direct billing are paying in a timely manner;
  • Serve as effective liaison between hotel and accounts regarding billing;
  • Anticipate guests' needs, respond promptly and acknowledge all guests;
  • Maintain positive guest relations at all times, participate in hotel and departmental functions for clients and employees;
  • Facilitate Daily EO meetings; Responsible for collecting and reviewing EO's;
  • Review space releases prior to sending to DOSM for final approval;
  • Establish one-on-ones with Catering team to coach and develop;
  • Develop annual catering sales budget with DOSM and Director of F&B as required;
  • Maintain Catering forecast sharing this information is with the hotel Catering and Leadership team;
  • Develop and direct yearly/quarterly marketing plan to meet and exceed budgeted catering sales goal;
  • Maintain prospecting of at least 25 calls/visits per week; networking and attending at least one civic/professional activity per month;
  • Return all inquiry phone calls/walk-ins, conduct tours/entertain potential clients, create menu presentations for potential clients;
  • Communicate to Banquet Manager/Chef, the needs of the clients;
  • Coordinate sales efforts between hotel sales department and catering/private dining sales to ensure proper utilization of function space to yield maximum revenues;
  • Be part of creation of appropriate sales collateral and tools for department;
  • Ensure that function set- up meets and/or exceeds customer expectations by working closely with each group’s meeting planners to determine their needs for meeting rooms, food & beverage, and audio-visual equipment requirements;
  • In coordination with the banquet department, ensure functions meet the customer’s expectations by following up before and during the function;
  • Maintain control of functions including complete details of bookings in the software program provided;
  • Responsible for the day to day negotiation of prices with clients for catering functions and meeting rooms, as well as guest rooms and all aspects pertaining to each client file;
  • Prepare contracts for incoming catering client’s and prepare proposals for potential clients;
  • Conduct post-function reviews with clients;
  • Solicits re-booking from meeting planners prior to customer’s departure;
  • Take the initiative to exceed guest’s expectations;
  • Participate in sales missions and activities; participate in customer appreciation functions;
  • Acquire full knowledge of the hotel, in-house facilities, and local information to respond to guest inquiries;
  • Host pre-event meetings, as required, to ensure clients are comfortable with their decisions;
  • Performs other duties and special projects as assigned;

Education, Knowledge and Skills Required:

  • University or college diploma or degree in Business Administration or Hotel Management preferred
  • Two or more years experience in Catering and Events department preferred
  • Proven leadership skills; able to train and mentor Catering Team;
  • Strong multi-tasking abilities; exceptional communication and organizational skills;
  • Detail orientated with strong analytical and problem-solving skills;
  • Understands customers, builds organizational creditability;
  • Displays a positive attitude, maintains enthusiasm and celebrates successes with the team;
  • Meets deadlines that are decisive and achievement orientated;

Physical Requirements as per job description but will include more:

  • Ability to sit for extended periods of time;
  • Ability to work on a computer for extended period;
  • Repetitive work such as keyboarding, filing, answering phones, etc.;
  • Forward bending and squatting while performing filing duties;

Hours of Work:
The hours of work for this position are typically Monday to Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Additional hours or hours outside of these timelines may be required due to operational requirements. Any additional hours or overtime must be approved by the Director of Sales and Marketing prior to being worked.
Full Time hours: 40 hours per week
Job Types: Full Time, Permanent

The CAMBRIDGE RED DEER HOTEL & CONFERENCE CENTRE is an equal opportunity employer and believes diversity strengthens us as a workplace;

All applicants must be legally entitled to work in Canada. The successful candidate will be subject to a criminal record check and/or other background checks. This position will remain open until a suitable candidate is found. We appreciate and consider all applications; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

Job Type: Full-time

title: Member Services Counsellor - Part Time (Empress Street, WPG...
description:
About Us

As a Member Service Consultant (MSC) you will have the proven ability to provide exceptional experiences to our Members. In this role, you would be required to sell Memberships, and merchandise. You will also be required to make car rental reservations, take passport photos, issue International Driving permits and educate and provide Travel Insurance options to our Members.

Who we are

As Canada's largest automobile association, we are passionate about keeping our Members safe- whether they are on the road, at home, or travelling abroad. Meeting the diverse needs of our two-million Members requires high performing, forward thinking, and innovative people who work collaboratively to keep propelling our business forward. Life at CAA Club Group is fast paced, performance-driven and rewarding. We value our Associates' career growth and ongoing professional development- and we regularly recognize their achievements and outstanding results. CAA Club Group (CCG) is known for providing stellar emergency roadside assistance to our motoring Members and non-Members. We work hard and play hard. We're about doing what's right and feeling good about it.

Position Details

DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Receives, counsels, and processes inquiries from clients regarding memberships, membership benefits, travel routings, hotel reservations, travel health insurance and information on all CAA products, services, and benefits.
  • Utilizes CAA methodologies to identify and sell relevant products and services to members and customers.
  • Counsels members regarding route selection, points of interest, construction areas, road conditions, mileage, driving times, toll information, and other relevant travel information available.
  • Utilizes relevant CAA partner websites to counsel and process various product transactions
  • Verifies key information with clients and makes appropriate data entries in the SAP system in order to complete and fulfill all transactions following established procedures.
  • Receives and responds to members or other staff regarding problems with CAA Products and Services, and takes action to investigate, process, and resolve the situations.
  • Completes all monetary/financial transactions procedures according to established procedures.
  • Displays a positive attitude towards CCG product, services and initiatives
  • Demonstrate daily, the Core Values & Service Principles of CCG
  • Performs other job-related duties as assigned.
REQUIREMENTS:
  • Post-Secondary education in Tourism, or Travel Counselling preferred.
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Windows and Microsoft Office applications.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of maps, routings, points of interest and symbols, geography, destinations and appropriate reference materials.
  • Minimum 1 – 2 years of experience in a similar or related position.

Our Commitment

We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Manitoba Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Manitobans with Disabilities Act, 2013 (AMA). CAA CCG will provide accommodations to job applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require an accommodation, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Sales Manager Home Care
company: EG Consultants Inc. Operated as Stay Home Forever
description:
SALES MANAGER HOME CARE

Come join us and help make a difference in the lives of older adults! As employees at a Stay Home Forever, our primary goal is to help each person, have a great day, every day! Our employees thrive on collaboration and have a passion for excellence, as part of our team, the things you do are key to helping us achieve our shared vision of helping seniors live longer, better. Oh, and you’ll also have a lot of fun doing it.

ACCOUNTABILITY OBJECTIVE:

Under the direction of the Owner Operator, develops and implements Franchise specific marketing and sales programs to achieve targets.

BACKGROUND/QUALIFICATIONS:

Sales, marketing, communication or public relations, or a background in an industry related to the position: healthcare, or sales. Minimum 2 years of business experience, preferably in retirement, hospitality, healthcare or consumer sales sectors. Excellent verbal and written communication skills in the English language. Must be a self-starter. Must have a valid Ontario driver’s license and be willing to drive own vehicle. Must have proficiency with computers. Must be available for a flexible schedule,

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Develops both new and existing potential Client contacts through follow-up.

  • Prepares care Agreements accurately.
  • Reviews Marketing plan with owner quarterly.
  • Schedules care assessments with the company RPN.
  • Co-ordinates open house & Events.
  • Keeps Generation software up to date with prospects.
  • Collects and forwards pertinent information on clients to owners.
  • Keep an email data base.
  • Meet weekly sales targets.
  • Conduct community visits and promote Stay Home Forever brand.
  • Develops and implements an annual marketing plan, and updates and reviews it as needed.
  • Enhances the home’s community awareness/image through public speaking engagements.
  • Acts as a representative at community functions as appropriate.
  • Maintains ongoing contact with potential Clients and Retirement homes and LTC.

Maintains statistics to evaluate sales and marketing effectiveness:

  • Maintains complete and accurate sales records in accordance with established procedures and programs.
  • Prepares marketing and sales reports for submission to the Owner Operator.
  • Meets regularly with the Owner.
  • Conducts competitor survey at least annually.

Implements the marketing objectives, policies and procedures of the company.

Attends and participates in marketing events.

Complies with all relevant corporate/company policies and procedures.

All offers of employment are subject to a Criminal Background Check. We thank all those who apply; however only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

Job Types: Part-time, Permanent

Salary: From $18 to 25 per Hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay.

Experience:

  • Retirement/ Hotel: 1 year (preferred)
  • Marketing & Advertising Occupations: 1 year (preferred)

Work remotely:

  • YES

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent
Part-time hours: 20 per week

Salary: $16.00-$18.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Commission pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress

Schedule:

  • Day shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Etobicoke, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Education:

  • Secondary School (required)

Experience:

  • Retirement Home: 1 year (required)

title: Special Events Coordinator
description:
As a team member at The Ancaster Mill, you are a part of the Pearle Hospitality family.

Pearle Hospitality’s mission and focus is to enrich each moment through genuine and thoughtful actions. Each of Pearle Hospitality’s dining establishments, event venues, hotel and spas, and affiliated businesses are focused on providing guests and customers a setting in which to appreciate and enjoy the good things in life with good people.

Our guests and customers have a trust in the experience they are about to enjoy. They trust that any event hosted at one of our properties, stays in our hotels or experiences at our spas will be a memorable experience for all involved. This idea has been reinforced through years of dedication to providing those people with soulful and delicious food, impeccably maintained historical buildings and bright, hardworking, and enthusiastic team members.

With a focus on local and in-season ingredients, the food prepared is rooted in family recipes passed down over generations, artisan products and a deep-rooted respect for culinary traditions are the base of our food philosophy and dedication to creating delicious food.

Nestled under the Niagara escarpment, alongside a waterfall and creek, Ancaster Mill invites its guests to sweep themselves away. Boasting spectacular forested scenery and historic charm, it's like a breath of fresh air. The chefs work directly with local farmers to create harvest-inspired menus that capture the essence of the season.

Job Purpose:

The Special Event Coordinator plays a key role in the organization and execution of all private events and making event hosts’ visions come to life within our Pearle Hospitality properties. The Coordinator manages and completes day-to-day tasks in the events office and acts as a liaison between the Sales Consultants, our clients and other members of the Events Team. This person makes certain that information regarding each event is gathered accurately and shared effectively to ensure the smooth delivery of services. This individual is often the first point of contact for our potential clients and provides a warm and welcoming atmosphere.

What makes you the perfect candidate:

  • Smart Serve Certificate
  • Post-secondary education in Events/Events Management considered an asset.
  • Previous experience in Hospitality and/or Event Planning considered an asset.
  • Knowledge: Working knowledge of Opera, Mircos, OpenTable, Microsoft Office Suite, and experience with multi-line phone systems considered an asset.
  • Customer Service: Ability to effectively communicate with clients, remaining professional but also expressing a warm and welcoming presence during interactions. Understand the importance of providing clients and guests with memorable and positive experiences at any and all Pearle Hospitality locations.
  • Attention to Detail: Remain mindful of smallest details expressed by the event hosts, making sure to note any specific wants expressed (i.e., DJs, transportation, ceremony officiants, important moments, etc.) and noting any specific vendors.
  • Organization: Work with event hosts to plan follow up appointments pertaining to menu tastings, rehearsals, final detail appointments and any dates for payments.
  • Adaptability: Ability to remain poised and professional in a fast-paced environment and positively interact with a variety of diverse guests and team members.

Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Effectively manage the front desk of the Special Events Office, including:
  • Answering incoming phone call and email inquiries
  • Booking restaurant reservations and answering special menu inquiries for large parties.
  • Greet visitors to the office and direct them appropriately as required
  • Maintain appearance of the Special Events office and Wedding Suites as needed.
  • Secure appointment times for clients to meet with Special Events Consultants and maintain the event office calendar.
  • Create proposals for clients using Opera.
  • Build event files and complete the file checklist once a deposit has been received to secure a booking.
  • Update event files as necessary with updates such as décor updates, timing, vendor information, menu selections and special requests.
  • Create, proof-read, and receive approval for all special event menus prior to printing.
  • Email reminders to clients regarding important appointments and confirm dates with them for their menu tastings, rehearsals, final detail appointments, etc.
  • Communicate details of each upcoming event to the Front and Back of House teams by providing copies of the most up-to-date event orders.
  • Accept and perform additional tasks as required for optimal performance of the restaurant.
  • Actively represent and promote Pearle Hospitality’s core values within the workplace.
  • Act as an ambassador of The Ancaster Mill and Pearle Hospitality.
  • Follow company policies and procedures as defined and outlined by Pearle Hospitality.
  • Follow all Health and Safety standards to ensure a safe work environment for all guests and team members.
  • Adhere to all cleanliness and sanitization practices.
  • Maintain professional appearance and act with integrity and honesty.

Advantages to being part of the Ancaster Mill team:

  • Competitive wages
  • Discounts at all Pearle Hospitality properties (restaurants, hotels and spas)
  • Training and Development to support personal & professional growth
  • Career opportunities across all Pearle Hospitality properties
  • A fun place to work with an amazing team & company culture!

Pearle Hospitality and affiliated companies, including Ancaster Mill, accommodate the needs of job applicants throughout its recruitment and selection processes in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Accommodation needs must be provided in advance. To discuss your needs, please contact the hiring manager.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $21.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Discounted or free food
  • Employee assistance program
  • On-site parking
  • Store discount
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Day shift

Experience:

  • Event Planners & Managers: 1 year (preferred)

title: General Housekeeper Team Member
description:
This position is working in clients’ homes with an established house cleaning business. A safe, healthy, and happy work environment where you will be appreciated.

Position details/requirements:

  • $18-$25 per hour (plus $250 signing bonus and tips!).
  • Up to 35 hours available weekly.
  • This is a progressive position. Opportunity for paid training to become internally certified cleaning consultants/team leads.
  • Must be able to provide a clear police check, a mobile phone with data, and work in a team environment.
  • Drivers license and a reliable vehicle is required as the meeting point for each shift is at the main office in Lisle followed by travel in a company car to clients.
  • 1+ years experience as professional residential cleaner required OR 1+ years experience in hotel cleaning/hotel maintenance/hotel housekeeping

Please note, Perfect Clean uses natural products. Reliable, professional, energetic, applicants who are interested in a career in cleaning and strive to be the best can apply.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent
Part-time hours: 35 per week

Pay: $18.00-$25.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Casual dress

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 12 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
All team members are required to wear a N95 mask. All equipment is disinfected before each use.

Experience:

  • cleaning: 1 year (required)

Expected start date: 2022-05-02

title: Service Associate - Health Club (Part-Time) (149131)
description:
Shangri-La hotel, Toronto

Make the most positive impact on guest experiences throughout all aspects of their visit to the Health Club with personal commitment and an emotional sense of true hospitality.

With high integrity and creativity, personal commitment to service excellence and an emotional sense of gracious hospitality, deliver Shangri-La hospitality from caring people, according to luxury health club standards.
As a true service Ambassador, meet service expectations proactively, promptly, professionally, with genuine care to attention and detail, while projecting truly nurturing and warm hospitality, respecting privacy and emotional well-being.
As a Health Club Attendant specialist, the consultant provides hands-on guidance and expertise of all fitness equipment and facilities in accordance with the needs and demands of guests.
Advise and assist guests regarding fitness classes, personal training sessions and other specialized fitness requests.
Open and/or close the Health Club on a daily basis.
Greet guests respectfully and courteously – by name where possible and provide information about the facilities, services and offer orientation tours.
Monitor all exercise equipment and report any defaults or errors immediately, control all stock related supplies and maintain impeccable standards of cleanliness, safety and hygiene.
Circulate, observe and interact with guests to maintain close contact, actively seeking feedback regarding the guest experience.
Pay close attention to the pool and participate in taking food and beverage orders from guests / residents including keeping the pool deck clean at all times.
Maintain excellent knowledge of all cardiovascular and resistance exercise equipment including fitness programs, fitness accessories and keep up to date on industry trends luxury Health Club standards.
Inform the security department of any matter or incident which may be detrimental to guests, Associates and/or their well-being.
Ensure compliance to all hotel policies, programs and core practices.
Participate in ongoing training and undertake other related responsibilities, as required.

Shangri-La hotel, Toronto is compliant with its obligations under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005, and will provide reasonable accommodation in the application and interview process for this position upon request.

Other Requirements:
Minimum 2 years previous work experience in a similar capacity with an international world-class luxury Health Club mandatory.
Previous Shangri-La Hotels and Resorts experience highly preferred or comparable experience with key competitor.
Fitness related courses in a Fitness organization an asset.
Required to work nights, weekends, and/or holidays.
Must be in possession of valid Canadian work permit to be eligible to be considered.
Possession of CPR, First Aid or relevant certificates considered an asset.
Possession of Personal Trainer of Fitness Instructor certificates considered an asset.

title: Contract Administrator
description:
• GGA On Design
  • Careers
  • 403.233.2000
  • About
  • Portfolio
  • People
  • Contact
  • Home
  • About
  • Portfolio
  • People
  • Contact
  • GGA On Design
  • Careers

Back to Careers
Contract Administrator
Here’s what we are about.
Gibbs Gage Architects is one of Western Canada’s largest architecture firms offering services in architecture, interior design, and urban design. Working from our office in Calgary we continue to be involved in some of the most exciting projects in Western Canada. Gibbs Gage Architects is an Alberta-based architectural and design firm with 39 years of experience in Western Canada. We work on a variety of projects across all different sectors, including well-known destinations like Brookfield Residential YMCA at Seton, the Trades & Technology Complex at SAIT, Project Thrive and the Dorian Hotel in Downtown Calgary, among many others.
We are proud of our work and our people. We take great care to hire amazing individuals who are motivated to build their career with us. Our firm is focused on developing an energetic, fun and diverse work atmosphere, with the opportunity to contribute to an ongoing legacy. Our culture acknowledges the importance of family and individual health. We believe in the culture we have created, committed to promoting equality, diversity and inclusivity.
Job Description
Reporting to the Managing Director of Projects you will work with clients, municipalities, project manager in the preparation and review of Contact Documents and resolving contractual and construction issues.
Key Responsibilities:

  • A Contract Administrator will be responsible for the administration of small to medium sized projects and support to a Senior Contract Administrator on selected large projects.
  • Maintain regular communication with project managers, designers, field inspectors, contractors, property owners and clients daily throughout the construction period to ensure project goals are met
  • Establishment and maintenance of logs, registers and filing systems
  • Review plans, specifications, and contract and present and explain contract condition and details to project stakeholders
  • Ensure that the contractor follows legal requirements, owner specifications and government regulations at all times.
  • Oversee change requests and claims
  • Ensure staff complete tasks in accordance with safety policies, procedures and legislative requirements
  • Preform all work in accordance with the company’s policies
  • Lead by example in all areas of work

Skills & Experience

  • A Contract Administrator should have a minimum of 5 – 10 years’ experience in a Contract Administration role. These requirements are also subject to review by GGA management upon the 3-month probationary period
  • Experience with contract administration documents
  • Excellent organization and prioritization skills with the ability to work independently
  • Strong skills in conflict resolution
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Excellent English written and verbal communication skills
  • Proficient with MS Office applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook
  • Valid class 5 driver’s license

Resumes should reflect an excellent track record of project success working within an Architectural environment. Gibbs Gage Architects offer a creative and rewarding work environment and an attractive benefits package.
Culture
Working at GGA is more than a job.
It is an opportunity to build a career in a collaborative and supportive environment where you are part of a team. Our values and operating principles stem from a people first approach where the respect for each of our team members and their family’s well-being comes first. We accommodate this through offering flexible work hours, 40-hours of flex time per year, a robust health plan and through social activities that encourage mental health and social breaks. This respect extends to our clients’ and consultants’ teams and fosters positive working environments on every project.
Equal Opportunity
GGA is an equal opportunity employer.
We work hard to enable our team members to succeed and, to that end, we prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and creativity.
We're committed to building a company and a community where people thrive by being themselves and are inspired to do their best work every day. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs.
Please forward your covering letter and resume to careers@gibbsgage.com.
Apply Now

Office:
350, 140 10th Ave SE

Reception:
403.233.2000

Social:

General:
info@gibbsgage.com

Employment:
careers@gibbsgage.com

title: Rehab Product Consultant
description:
ECO Medical Equipment is one of the largest home medical equipment vendors in Western Canada and has been serving Edmonton and the surrounding area with quality home care mobility and accessibility equipment for 40 years. We know that our clients depend on us to provide them with high quality products and efficient support and service.

We are looking for a self-motivated individual that is looking for a fulfilling career opportunity in the home medical equipment industry as a Rehab Product Consultant at our high-volume Calgary location. The Rehab Product Consultant provides professional sales relations and solutions with private clientele, government authorized Therapists, as well as funding agencies.

This individual should be comfortable dealing with vulnerable people that have various special needs and be empathetic to their circumstances. If you possess the skills required, are passionate about helping people and thrive working in a fast-paced family-oriented work environment we would love to meet you!

What we offer our employees:

Benefits that include:

  • Health & Dental
  • Life Insurance
  • Long Term Disability
  • Flexible Spending Account (Health Care Spending, Group RRSP, Taxable Wellness, Tax-free savings and more options) $300 per year for Single, $600 per year for Family)
  • Emergency Travel Assistance
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Employee discounts that extends to family members
  • Perkopolis Membership that includes discounts for flights, hotels, entertainment, shopping, automotive and much more
  • 10% off Mark’s Work Warehouse Discount Card
  • $150 towards Safety Shoes every two years
  • Continuous improvement towards adding more value to employee benefits
  • Vacation increases to three weeks on 3rd anniversary, four weeks on 9th anniversary and five weeks on 16th anniversary
  • Long Service Recognition Program
  • Ongoing training and development
  • Rewarding career opportunities

The ideal candidate would possess the following skill sets:

  • Patience, compassion and strong listening skills
  • Clear communication and a positive attitude
  • Excellent time management capabilities and flexibility
  • Client focused including going above and beyond so our clients leave feeling everything has been taken care of for them
  • Willingness to learn and develop new skills
  • Computer skills required

Responsibilities:

  • Manage specific sales territory (TBD)
  • Advise clients and Therapists on the selection of Mobility, Seating, Positioning, Accessibility equipment and Home Care supplies
  • Work directly with Occupational and Physical Therapists in a team to develop and implement an appropriate plan for setting clients up with mobility and seating equipment.
  • Demonstrates products and services to existing/potential customers and assists them in selecting those best suited to their needs.
  • Establish and maintain positive, productive and mutually beneficial relationships
  • Forecast and influence stock levels based on data from the field, determined in conjunction with many components of the supply management chain
  • Control and monitor inventory of trial equipment used by Therapists in the assessment processof client needs and requirements.
  • Coordinate with internal sales and support employees to provide efficient service to address clients needs and provide a positive outcome
  • Safely operate provided company vehicle as well as maintenance
  • Includes travel to various facilities as necessary to provide services and attend training as required
  • Register equipment, process paperwork necessary including quotes and prior approval documents for funding and billing, as well as provide appropriate billing codes to Therapists for AADL billing purposes
  • Protect company assets

Minimum Education and Experience:

  • Post-Secondary education in Physical Therapy or Occupational Therapy an asset
  • Minimum 3-5 years’ experience as a Product Consultant for Rehabilitation Equipment including area of Seating preferred
  • Current manufacturer certificates (Ex. Sunrise Medical, Pride Mobility, Invacare, Permobil, Humancare, Arjo Huntleigh, etc.
  • Knowledge of AADL required
  • Knowledge and experience with Windward POS system an asset
  • Managing processes and a knowledge of the market and clients’ needs
  • Customer service experience

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Store discount
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Rehab Product Consultant: 3 years (preferred)

title: Project Coordinator
description:
The Project Coordinator is an important member of Nunastar's tight-knit team based in Edmonton, Alberta. Nunastar is the Arctic's premium hotel, residential, and commercial real estate developer. Each year Nunastar undertakes many projects, ranging from construction of new buildings to large and small renovations of our existing properties. As the Coordinator, you are instrumental in bringing these projects to fruition.

The Coordinator position should contribute a strong understanding of mechanical design, contract administration, and project management to add to the existing expertise Nunastar has on the architetectural, project management, development, and management aspects of the real estate business. The Coordinator will also have a significant role in the design and operation of the mechanical systems of our assets, which combined include over seven hundred hotel and residential units as well as commercial spaces.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Manage architects, engineers, and interior designers
  • Discuss the operational needs and priorities with our property management team
  • Propose options for the best systems, seeking advice and approvals from Nunastar's executives and clients
  • Summarize and present information to senior management for discussion and decision
  • Assess environmental, design alternatives, and construction risks associated with each project
  • Analyze and coordinate plans and drawings from all disciplines, highlighting any possible risks or problems
  • Work with the finance team for cost-benefit analyses, risk analyses, and ROI calculations to determine project feasibility
  • Value engineer throughout the design process to ensure budgets, ROI objectives and building performance objectives are achieved
  • Manage via a project plan for each project
  • Implement tender process, provide recommendations to management on bids and contracts, and finalize construction/renovation contract agreements
  • Review submissions, value engineer, negotiate and complete purchases
  • Source and purchase owner supplied items for construction projects
  • Manage project activities throughout the life cycle of the project
  • Act as the primary liaison with major contractors
  • Visit project construction sites to review progress, inspect work, troubleshoot, and gather design parameters and input project design and renovations
  • Manage completion requests, tenant occupancy dates, and project close-out meetings and dates
  • Manage project transition from contractor to in-house building operation team
  • Conduct project post-mortems to identify areas for improvement; make recommendations based on findings
  • Manage small projects alongside the building operations team
  • Support operations team with technical insights as well as planning and coordination activities
  • Ensure all company, safety, client, and project policies, procedures, and standards are followed
  • Ensure projects meet or exceed all planning, development, regulatory, health and life safety requirements
Qualifications:
  • Training as Mechanical Engineering Technologist or Mechanical Engineer
  • 5-10 years of relevant industry working experience, preferably in contract administration and design
  • Experience in Northern Canada is an asset
  • Competence with AutoCAD and/or Revit. Strong general computer skills and experience with Microsoft Office
  • Experience with BIM systems is considered an asset
  • Experience in project coordination throughout the entire design and construction process, managing both consultants and contractors
  • Exceptional organization skills
  • A keen attention to details
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • High integrity and ethical standards
  • A collaborative nature to understand that the best outcomes result from asking the right questions
  • A highly disciplined and accountable approach to your work
  • A desire to be part of a close-knit team with a family feel. A love of community and making a difference

title: Corporate Travel Consultant (6 months contract)
description:
Corporate Travel Consultant

Kaltire is looking for a Corporate Travel Consultant. This is a 6-month contract role supporting the team while a team member is away.
The Travel Consultant will provide travel reservation services for all of Kal Tire’s Team Members. These travel services include Airlines, Hotels, Rental Vehicles, Meeting Facilities, and conference facilities. Arrange audio visual requests, projectors, and sound system.

This person will ensure that these activities are accomplished in accordance with the policies and procedures defined in the Kal Tire Travel Policy Manual.

Responsibilities

  • Booking commercial flights, car rentals and hotels on the GDS system and online platforms.
  • Issuing of airline tickets meeting BSP and IATA regulations
  • Booking of hotel rooms, meeting rooms, car rentals, Kal Tire vehicles, catering and shuttle transportation
  • Provide a high level of customized service to a variety of clients

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

  • Recent advanced Apollo/Travelport or equivalent GDS experience in a corporate travel environment with minimum 2 years’ experience
  • Thorough knowledge of international travel reservations and ticketing requirements
  • Thorough knowledge of ticket exchange procedures
  • A commitment to deliver exceptional customer service to a variety of high expectation team members
  • Well-developed interpersonal and communication skills – both verbal and written
  • The ability to work as a team as well as independently and be self-motivated
  • The ability to manage conflicting priorities to ensure team members satisfaction levels are achieved
  • Experience in all administrative areas with demonstrated computer skills in MS Office Programs
  • Exceptional organizational and time management skills
  • Attention to detail
  • Good understanding of worldwide geography and IATA City Airport Codes

Education

  • Travel training program, Certified Travel Manager/Consultant (CTM or CTC designation), or equivalent experience.

About Kal Tire
Kal Tire is the largest independently owned tire dealer in Canada with over 250 locations. Our business philosophy centers on exceeding our customers’ expectations and relies on our entrepreneurial team members to provide exceptional customer service.

title: Product Consultant - Rehabilitation Equipment
description:
ECO Medical Equipment is one of the largest home medical equipment vendors in Western Canada and has been serving Edmonton and the surrounding area with quality home care mobility and accessibility equipment for 40 years. We know that our clients depend on us to provide them with high quality products and efficient support and service.

We are looking for a self-motivated individual that is looking for a fulfilling career opportunity in the home medical equipment industry as a Product Consultant – Rehabilitation Equipment at our Winnipeg location. The Product Consultant provides professional sales relations and solutions with private clientele, government authorized Therapists, as well as funding agencies.

This individual should be comfortable dealing with vulnerable people that have various special needs and be empathetic to their circumstances. If you possess the skills required, are passionate about helping people and thrive working in a fast-paced family-oriented work environment we would love to meet you!

What we offer our employees:

  • Competitive base salary + commission in our industry

Benefits that include:

  • Health & Dental
  • Life Insurance
  • Long Term Disability
  • Flexible Spending Account (Health Care Spending, Group RRSP and/or Taxable Wellness options) $300 per year for Single, $600 per year for Family
  • Emergency Travel Assistance
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Employee discounts that extends to family members
  • Perkopolis Membership that includes discounts for flights, hotels, entertainment, shopping, automotive and much more
  • 10% off Mark’s Work Warehouse Discount Card
  • $150 towards Safety Shoes every two years
  • Continuous improvement towards adding more value to employee benefits
  • Vacation increases to three weeks on 3rd anniversary, four weeks on 9th anniversary and five weeks on 16th anniversary
  • Long Service Recognition Program
  • Ongoing training and development
  • Rewarding career opportunities

The ideal candidate would possess the following skill sets:

  • Patience, compassion and strong listening skills
  • Clear communication and a positive attitude
  • Excellent time management capabilities and flexibility
  • High level of problem solving abilities on many levels (selection, application of equipment relative to client’s physical needs/conditions) looking at favorable long-term solutions
  • Client focused including going above and beyond so our clients leave feeling everything has been taken care of for them
  • Willingness to learn and develop new skills
  • Knowledge of products required
  • Ability to diagnose mechanical problems and make necessary adjustments on equipment
  • Good understanding of anatomy, physiology and diseases processes
  • Customer service experience an advantage
  • Clean and valid driver’s license

Responsibilities:

· Manage specific sales territory (TBD)

· Advise clients and Therapists on the selection of Mobility, Seating, Positioning, Accessibility equipment and Home Care supplies

· Work directly with Occupational and Physical Therapists in a team to develop and implement an appropriate plan for setting clients up with mobility and seating equipment.

· Demonstrates products and services to existing/potential customers and assists them in selecting those best suited to their needs.

· Establish and maintain positive, productive and mutually beneficial relationships

· Forecast and influence stock levels based on data from the field, determined in conjunction with many components of the supply management chain

· Control and monitor inventory of trial equipment used by Therapists in the assessment process of client needs and requirements.

· Coordinate with internal sales and support employees to provide efficient service to address clients needs and provide a positive outcome

· Safely operate provided company vehicle as well as maintenance

· Includes travel to various facilities as necessary to provide services and attend training as required

· Register equipment, process paperwork necessary including quotes and prior approval documents for funding and billing, as well as provide appropriate billing codes to Therapists for Provincial and Federal Third-Party Funding Agencies billing purposes

· Protect company assets

· Attend training, seminars and conferences pertaining to home medical equipment. These expenses will be covered by the organization

Requirements:

· Post-Secondary education in Physical Therapy or Occupational Therapy an asset

· Knowledge of Provincial and Federal Third-Party Funding Agencies an asset

· Product knowledge favoured

· Knowledge and experience with Windward POS system an asset

· Managing processes and a knowledge of the market and clients’ needs

· Customer service experience

Schedule and Compensation:

· Monday through Friday

· Salary will commensurate on level of experience in the home medical equipment industry as a Product Consultant – Rehabilitation Equipment

We thank all applicants for their interest, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Closing date would be as soon as possible pending the hire of a suitable candidate.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Store discount
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Sales: 2 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • driver's license (preferred)

title: Travel Agent (Empress Street, WPG, location)
description:
About Us

Do you have a passion for Travel and Customer Service? At the heart of our business is a desire to make dreams come true with the perfect vacation. As part of our Travel Agent Team at CAA Club Group of companies, you will be able to sells a full range of travel products and services, counsels and advises clients in order to provide a pleasant and enjoyable travel experience. Performs related processing functions.

Who we are

As Canada's largest automobile association, we are passionate about keeping our Members safe- whether they are on the road, at home, or travelling abroad. Meeting the diverse needs of our two-million Members requires high performing, forward thinking, and innovative people who work collaboratively to keep propelling our business forward. Life at CAA Club Group is fast paced, performance-driven and rewarding. We value our Associates' career growth and ongoing professional development- and we regularly recognize their achievements and outstanding results. CAA Club Group (CCG) is known for providing stellar emergency roadside assistance to our motoring Members and non-Members. We work hard and play hard. We're about doing what's right and feeling good about it.

Position Details

DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Utilizes the Connections methodologies to identify and counsel members and clients via the telephone or in person in order to sell travel products and services.
  • Makes recommendations on all aspects of travel planning to improve trip, save money, and enhance the quality of the travel experience.
  • Sells all travel products including domestic and international air, train, cruise, tour, CAA exclusive group departures, travel insurance, hotel and car reservations
  • Promotes CAA memberships and all CAA products, services and benefits
  • Support all CAA/AAA preferred partnerships and marketing initiatives
  • Researches client request, quotes fares and schedules, issues tickets, and prepares all required travel related documents and applications.
  • Advises client of product terms and conditions.
  • Creates accurate computerized passenger records using Apollo Focal Point Computer Reservation System (CRS), SAP System and Sales Automation.
  • Establishes and maintains member’s travel files, accepts and processes payments, refunds, lost tickets and documents.
  • Displays a positive attitude towards CCG product, services and initiatives
  • Demonstrate daily, the Core Values & Service Principles of CCG
  • Participates in the resolution of client complaints.
  • Performs other job-related duties as assigned.
REQUIREMENTS:
  • Graduate of Post Secondary Education Program in Travel Counselling.
  • Enrolment in or accreditation as a CITC (Canadian Institute of Travel Consultants) or Certified Travel Consultant (CTC).
  • Three (3) years of experience in a Travel Consultant (Agent) position.
  • Certification in Apollo (Focal Point) GDS.
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Windows and Microsoft Office applications.

Our Commitment

We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Manitoba Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Manitobans with Disabilities Act, 2013 (AMA). CAA CCG will provide accommodations to job applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require an accommodation, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Travel Agent
description:
Job Description:

Reporting to the Travel Manager, the successful Travel Consultant candidate will be a professional that possesses sound knowledge of the travel industry and travel products.

The individual will share a passion for travel, sales growth, and customer excellence.

They will creatively tailor travel arrangements to exceed our customer expectations, and promote and sell travel products to clients while ensuring both outstanding quality and that the highest level of sales and service excellence is achieved, aligning with Robert Q Travel’s core values.

Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Plan, Co-ordinate and sell transportation, accommodations, tours, cruises, package holidays, insurance, and other travel related services.
  • Promote particular tour packages and products to align with and support our preferred suppliers, whenever possible.
  • Provide advice and guidance regarding suppliers, attractions, customs, languages, entry/exit requirements, foreign currency, etc.
  • Promote particular tour packages and products to align with and support our preferred suppliers, whenever possible.
  • Make transportation and accommodation reservations
  • Sell single fare tickets and package tours to clients
  • Promote particular destinations, tour packages and other travel services
  • Investigate new travel destinations, hotels and other facilities and attractions
  • Provide travel tips regarding tourist attractions, foreign currency, customs, languages and travel safety.
  • Take part in familiarization visits to new destinations
  • Liaise with travel partners, including airlines and hotels
  • Manage customer enquiries in a timely manner aiming to exceed their expectations
  • Develop strategies to achieve and exceed your sales targets

Qualifications:

  • A college diploma or vocational training in travel or tourism
  • TICO Certified with education in travel and the hospitality industry
  • Knowledge of ITC, FIT, Cruise, Group products, travel trends and tailored holidays
  • Enthusiastic individual who is multi-skilled with effective promotion abilities
  • Superior customer service and proven ability to foster a positive team environment
  • Organized, detail orientated and innovative with a desire to drive success
  • Confident and self-motivated professional who possesses exceptional communication skills
  • Demonstrated ability to manage challenging situations and surpass sales goals
  • Proficient computer skills
  • Demonstrated commitment to Robert Q’s core values
  • Proven attendance and punctuality

Robert Q's Travel Mart Inc. is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to fostering a inclusive environment in the workplace for all employees. Applicants should contact Robert Q should they require any accommodation during the application/ interview process.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $16.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Commission pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift

title: newLafrentz | Foreman
description:
Subsidiary: Canadian Road Builders

Lafrentz Road Marking - Durables Division


Lafrentz Road Marking, a division of Canadian Road Builders Inc., is Western Canada’s leading road marking company, applying painted road markings, durable road markings and safety markings / surfaces. An industry innovator, Lafrentz is involved in the entire production cycle of road marking materials. We also manufacture our own proprietary products. We perform on-site application of road marking products, and supply our products directly to a range of companies and government agencies.


This posting is for a postition within:

Lafrentz Road Marking

Based in Acheson, AB

Full-time Seasonal Position

Main Responsibilities

This position will be part of the Lafrentz Road Marking Durables Department. This position is based out of Acheson and may require working out of town from time to time, and occasional night shifts. As a Foreperson you will be responsible for safety meetings, site layout, site planning, managing a crew of 4-6 workers and complying with safe working procedures and practices while you contribute to the teams various projects. Versatility, flexibility, responsibility, and a positive attitude are required in this position.

Requirements

  • A high school diploma.
  • 2-5 years in the construction industry.
  • Must follow safety regulations and safe work practices.
  • Conducting business in a professional manner with co-workers, clients, owners, consultants, and the public.
  • Valid driver’s license (Class 5) along with a recent driver’s abstract is required.
  • Must own reliable transportation. (no public transit in Acheson)
  • Must be able to read, write, and communicate effectively in English.
  • Must be able to perform manual labour. (ability to lift 50lbs)
  • Willing to work weekends, evenings, and occasional night shifts.
  • The ability and willingness to work regular overtime hours. (up to 70 hours per week)
  • Willing to occasionally work away from the Edmonton area is necessary. (Work in AB, BC, SK & MB)
  • Eagerness and willingness to learn new technical skills.
  • Excellent communication and leadership skills.
  • High level of dependability.
  • Experience with traffic control and setting up and maintaining temporary traffic accommodation is considered an asset.
  • First aid & CPR is an asset.
  • Ability to provide a passing drug, alcohol, and fitness-to-work test result, as this is a safety sensitive position.
  • Strict adherence to our COVID-19 protocols is required.
  • This position reports to the Operations Manager and Project Coordinator.


Total Compensation

  • Competitive salary.
  • This is a long term position for the right candidate.
  • Regular overtime hours are available.
  • Night shift premium.
  • Working holiday weekends is voluntary.
  • Hotels and per-diem provided when working away from Edmonton, travel time is paid.
  • Lafrentz has been awarded sizeable contracts with years of work remaining.
  • Applicable in house training is provided.
  • Group health benefits (dental, vision, medical, disability, life).
  • Employee assistance program.
  • Boot allowance.
  • RSP matching.
  • This position allows for use a company truck and phone.


Lafrentz Road Marking offers competitive salary and benefits packages, along with in-house training, an incredible work environment, and career advancement opportunities.

Must be able to meet all safety requirements including pre-employment fit and drug/alcohol testing.

Please submit your resumes to our HR Department by replying to this ad.

Website: www.lafrentz.ca

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted.
