title: newSales Consultant - Household and Commercial Moving
description:
Household Relocation Sales Consultant

London, ON

AMJ Campbell London has a full time Household Sales Consultant position available in London, ON.

We are looking for candidates who have a proven track record of success in sales. The Household Sales Consultant is a fast-paced sales position with a focus on excellent customer service. This position will be responsible to quote, handle paperwork and maintain relationships with your clients for a range of small, medium and larger sized household and occasional commercial moves. We are seeking experienced, dynamic, high-performing, client-focused individuals with professional sales experience for this position.

Sales Administrative responsibilities:

· Speaking with potential clients over the phone and in person (in house estimates) to explain our services and provide sound advice

· Working with internal programs and technology

· Project management

· Contacting all 3rd party resources as needed for items such as truck rentals, 3rd party labour, bins, etc.

· Manage and track in house leads provided to you via our corporate website, employees and parent company

· Responsible to input all information on every booking into internal program

· Prospect in new target markets and opportunities

Requirements:

· Outstanding communication (written/verbal)

· Ability to work independently under guidance of the Sales Manager

· Provide reports and updates regularly to the Sales Manager

· Highly motivated, driven, business development professional with a positive attitude

· 1-3 years of sales experience

Good to have:

Related experience in the moving or logistics industry

Valid G class driver’s license and reliable vehicle

What we offer:

· Payable commissions

· Benefit plan

· Monthly and quarterly financial incentives

· Marketing & sales initiatives of your choosing upon management confirmation

· Company provided cell phone and iPad

· Continuous training and ongoing support

· Opportunity for advancement in a growing company

About AMJ Campbell:

When we started out years ago, we were a family business moving families.

After decades of helping local families, businesses, retirees, and people within our communities move, AMJ Campbell has grown to six partners and now offer a wide range of superior moving, storing and packing services at a very competitive price.

Moving offices is often a huge undertaking. Many factors come into play in a successful office move. Having been in this business for over three decades, we fully understand those factors and know how to work around obstacles and make the best use of opportunities. The experience and knowledge we have acquired has helped us become one of the leaders in office moving, furniture sales and installation, logistics and project management.

AMJ Campbell specializes in the following services related to commercial moving: Hotel moves, Machinery moves, Nationwide Store Roll-outs, Museum Moves, Liquidation, E-Waste Removal, Furniture Sales/Installation and more.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $50,000.00-$100,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Commission pay

Benefits:

  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Experience:

  • sales: 1 year (required)

title: Graphic Designer
description:
Charity: Vancouver Chinatown Foundation
Reports to: Marketing Manager
Start Date: Immediate
Location: Vancouver, BC
Vancouver Chinatown Foundation
The Vancouver Chinatown Foundation is a registered charity founded in 2011 to honour a culture and
community established in Vancouver over 100 years ago and is dedicated to building a more resilient and
inclusive community by promoting the wellbeing of those in need while preserving Chinatown’s
irreplaceable cultural heritage. We have a vision of a prosperous, vibrant, and inclusive Chinatown, where
people come to live, work, and play.
The Vancouver Chinatown Foundation’s efforts to revitalize this important neighbourhood are grounded on
three interconnected pillars: physical, commercial & cultural revitalization. There are a number of projects

and initiatives that support these pillars, including:
  • Chinatown Storytelling Centre
  • Foo Hung Curios retail shop at the Chinatown Storytelling Centre
  • Chinatown Vintage fashion boutique
  • 58 West Hastings (an innovative, 230-unit social housing project in the DTES)
  • May Wah Hotel (SRO in Chinatown)
To learn more about any of these initiatives, we encourage you to visit:
https://www.chinatownfoundation.org/ and https://www.chinatownstorytellingcentre.org/.
Role Overview
The Graphic Designer will be an integral part of the marketing team and work to deliver branded digital
graphics across a number of channels including: social media & e-communications, templates, signage,
and custom-designed marketing collaterals to support organizational and project initiatives of the
Vancouver Chinatown Foundation. This position requires proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite,
competency in MS Office suite, and familiarity with email marketing and social media platforms. You
would report directly to the marketing manager, and work in close collaboration with the marketing
coordinator and external advisors and consultants. If you enjoy working with a collaborative and
enthusiastic team, come join us!
Responsibilities
  • Design and manage the production of print and digital marketing materials for the Foundation
initiatives. This involves template-based and custom-designed materials including:
o print assets such as brochures, mailers, postcards, and invitations
o project based marketing assets (online and offline) for signature events (Gala, Spring
Banquet, Light Up Chinatown), and our projects (Chinatown Storytelling Centre,
Chinatown Vintage, May Wah and Foo Hung Curios).
o digital assets including website design and updates, newsletters, online ads, social media
graphics, email marketing templates, and powerpoint presentations.
  • Contribute to maintaining the visual brand of the Foundation and its projects, and work with the
leadership team, advisors, consultants, and other team members
  • Oversee visual updates to the Vancouver Chinatown Foundation website and project websites
and portals
  • Support the visual planning and execution of email and digital marketing initiatives
  • The ability to work on multiple projects and consistently deliver results within a tight timeframe
  • Occasional original photography required to support social media efforts as well as sourcing stock
photography
  • File management of library of visual assets, logos, fonts and other brand standards and
guidelines

Qualifications:
  • Completion of post-secondary certification in graphic design
  • 1-3 years of related graphic design experience
  • Strong competency in Adobe Creative Suite applications specifically InDesign, Photoshop and
Illustrator
  • Demonstrated experience in creating strong visual communications both in print and digital/online
applications with a keen eye for design and attention to detail
  • Experience using email marketing platforms and working knowledge of HTML would be
considered an asset
  • Experience using social media channels including Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn and Twitter;
experience with planning tools such as Canva and Planoly would be considered an asset
  • Superior project management skills and demonstrated experience in managing multiple projects
and adhering to deadlines
  • Strong photography skills would be considered an asset
  • Experience with Wordpress would be considered an asset
  • Staying up-to-date with best practices in visual design
  • Experience working in a community or non-profit organization would be considered an asset
  • Ability to accept feedback and direction, and work effectively under pressure
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Thrives in a fast paced, dynamic-environment
Please submit a cover letter and your resume to careers@chinatownfoundation.org.
We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, colour, religion, national origin,
sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status.
We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for the position; however, only
candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

title: Tenant Improvement Coordinator
description:
Pinnacle International is one of Canada's leading builders of luxury condominium residences, hotels, and commercial developments. Based in Vancouver, BC, Pinnacle has been involved in development, design, construction and management for over three decades. Our portfolio includes landmark locations in Vancouver, Toronto, and San Diego.

We are currently seeking a talented Tenant Improvement Coordinator to join our growing team in Vancouver. The ideal candidate is a self-motivated, detail-oriented professional with a strong initiative to take on a wide variety of tasks. If you are excited about the opportunity to learn from experienced professionals and thrive in a diverse and fast-paced environment, Pinnacle is the place for you.

Duties and Responsibilities

· Assist Senior Management with overall project performance

· Prepare bid documents and clear, concise scopes of work

· Maintain project budgets and perform cost estimating

· Analyze bids, prepare summaries and propose subcontractor selections

· Communicate project details and work cohesively with teams of subcontractors, tenants, consultants and other project stakeholders, and participate actively in meetings as required

· Prepare contracts and confidently negotiate revisions, changes and additions to contractual agreements

· Review project documentation, drawings and specifications in detail

· Administer requests for information and shop drawings, and manage submittal process

· Plan and manage daily operations, construction schedules while monitoring project progress

· Understand the importance of quality at every stage of the construction

Qualifications & Knowledge

· Construction management, or related field preferred

· Ability to read and interpret contract specifications, drawings and other construction documents

· At least one year of experience working in the Vancouver construction market for a General Contractor preferred

· Have proven capabilities in multi-tasking, problem solving and prioritizing workloads

· Fluent English and excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

· Experience using Microsoft office Suite

We provide a competitive salary and benefits package for the right candidate. If you believe that this position would be a good fit for you, please reply to this posting and submit your resume.

We thank all interested applicants for applying, however only qualified candidates will be contacted. No telephone calls please.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Vision care

title: Spa Administrator
description:
Beauty Incubator Recruitment are excited to announce that we have been retained by a luxury hotel spa in Toronto who is seeking a Spa Administrator to join their amazing Spa Team! As a Spa Administrator you will be responsible for the following:
  • Greeting guests, scheduling services for individuals and large groups using spa reservations software system.
  • Call both guests and service providers to confirm scheduled services. Answer questions about available services, promote and sell spa services and/or products.
  • Update the reservations/cancellations list throughout the day, inform providers of last-minute changes, and resolve scheduling issues as needed by working with supervisor/manager.
  • Check in guests for appointments, confirm first and last name, and provide general spa orientation to guests upon arrival.
  • Process guest payments for spa services and obtain payment authorization as needed.
  • Perform Spa rounds every 20 minutes. (Cleaning, restocking, taking guests into change-room) Comply with quality assurance expectations and standards.
  • Perform other reasonable job duties as requested by Spa Manager.

Qualifications:

  • Minimum 1 year previous spa experience in a similar capacity
  • Excellent command of the English language, secondary language a benefit
  • Must enjoy team work and multi-tasking environment
  • Must be able to work flexible hours including evenings, weekends and holidays
  • Should be computer literate with good knowledge of Microsoft Software
  • Must be detail oriented and have strong ability to multi-task
  • Must be eligible to work in Canada

    Beauty Incubator Recruitment Inc. are niche recruiters for the esthetic and wellness sector across Canada. Our consultants have many years industry experience from consulting, medical practices, sales, and education. With our extensive experience and contacts, we seek out the best jobs for our candidates and the best candidates for our clients.

    Our mission is to enable esthetic & wellness professionals to unlock their full potential.

title: Strategy & Operations - Manager, Strategy & Operations
description:
THE TEAM
The mission of the Strategy & Operations Department, or the Aritzia Consulting Group (ACG), is to be thought partners to the business, collaborating to design the way we operate and setting our organization up to scale.
THE OPPORTUNITY
As a member of the Strategy & Operations team, or Aritzia Consulting Group (ACG), you will be part of the team responsible for evaluating business growth opportunities and then building the required infrastructure to ensure that our business is set up for profitable growth. In this role, you will act as an internal consultant to the business, identifying, recommending, and developing the people, process, technology, and space solutions that the business needs to accelerate growth and operate at the highest level of effectiveness. And, with the skills you gain in this role, the opportunities are endless – from a rewarding career in ACG, to continued growth and development with Aritzia.
THE ROLE
As a member of the Strategy & Operations department you will:
  • Evaluate opportunities, develop plans, and ensure optimal execution of sales driving or profit maximizing initiatives
  • Build operating models to design or optimize the organizational structure of business functions
  • Build standard and customized operating tools to address opportunities in the business
  • Design or optimize the cyclical programs that enable our business
  • Significantly renovate divisions, departments, or large cross-functional business functions
  • Seamlessly integrate optimized infrastructure into the day to day of the business
THE QUALIFICATIONS
Members of the Strategy & Operations department have:
  • A commitment to learn and apply Aritzia's Business and People Leadership principles
  • An enthusiastic approach to taking on new opportunities and challenges
  • A commitment to navigating our internal operations to achieve the best team and business results
  • The ability to collaborate fluently with cross-functional partners
  • The skills to set clear objectives with an emphasis on accountability while striving to reach your highest potential
  • The skills and/or education that are an asset to perform in the role and the appetite to continuously learn and develop oneself
  • A commitment to quality and investing in results that add value and drive the business
  • A sense of urgency executing job responsibilities, prioritizing urgent and important work
  • An understanding and a passion for the industry in which we operate
PERKS OF BEING AN INTERNAL CONSULTANT
As an internal consultant for Strategy & Operations, Aritzia Consulting Group, you will:
  • See your work come to life and the direct impact of your improvements realized by seeing through the implementation of your recommendations
  • Own your career growth trajectory through endless opportunities, with development tracks in Strategy & Operations leadership or Business function/department leadership
  • Have a say in what you work on by being part of the strategic planning for Strategy & Operations priorities, rather than having pre-determined solutions passed to you for execution
  • Be on the same team as the client; with internal clients, we operate as one unified team with the same goals, shared language, and a common understanding of business best practices
  • Enjoy a work-life blend with little to no travel and enjoy a strong, connected Aritzia community
THE PERKS
Some of the industry-leading benefits you will receive working at Aritzia:
  • A-OK Commissary & Café - Our in-office, world-class bistro and café
  • The SET - Our in-house gym, with state-of-the art equipment and custom classes
  • Employee Assistance Program - 24/7 support, resources, and information available to your and your family
  • Aspirational Workspace - Every detail is considered to connect to the energy of the culture
  • Dog Friendly Office - Bring your best friend to work
  • Amenities - Facilities include private parent's room, bike storage rooms, and shower facilities with complimentary conveniences
  • Talent Mobility Program - From out of town? No problem - we offer a highly supportive relocation program
  • Competitive Pay Packages - A commitment to performance based pay increases and career progression
  • Product Discount - Our famous product discount, online and in store
  • Health Benefits - Comprehensive health, vision and dental packages for eligible employees
  • Extras - A multitude of other perks like dry-cleaning, hotel and restaurant discounts, self-care promos, on-site medical care and more
  • Health & Safety - Industry-leading health and safety precautions, including on-site screenings, mask and distancing protocols, and cleaning supplies
ARITZIA
Aritzia is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Our goal is to be inclusive, diverse, and representative of the communities where we work while creating an environment where every person can enjoy a successful career. This commitment applies to all candidates and employees regardless of race, ethnicity, citizenship, creed, place of origin, religion, sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, family status, marital status, disability, age, and any other protected characteristic.
Requests for accommodation due to a disability or any other protected characteristic can be made at any stage of the recruitment process and during employment by contacting our People & Culture Team.

title: Product Analyst
description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join an innovative, global real estate company who builds communities and connects people to exceptional places? If so, we would love to tell you our story.

At Oxford, our culture is truly one of a kind. Across business lines and around the world, we embrace the complex and tackle opportunities with speed and agility. We are ambitious and humble, forward looking and service-focused. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live. We believe that what is good for the environment is good for business. Together we deliver exceptional experiences to our over 2 million daily customers.

The Product Consultant, Cyber Security and Service Excellence will responsible to help support the Operational Technology Network and Cyber Security suite of products. The successful candidate will be required to work in a fluid environment and adapt to different processes as the organization works towards a steady-state model. This will involve multiple facets of the value chain from strategy to support, including product design and testing, documentation, cost modeling, and data visualization. It will also require working across multiple teams at Oxford including Investments, Asset Management, Development, and Property Management.

Duties & Responsibilities
Support the development and maintenance of multiple product requirement documents (PRDs).
Maintain the Infrastructure and Cyber Roadmap.
Act as the day-to-day liaison between the product and technical teams within Infrastructure and Cyber Security.
Support the technology and cyber security due diligence process across all types of investment types as needed.
Gather and organize financial data in Power BI from multiple internal and external parties to support the annual budgeting process.

Skills and Experience
Undergraduate/Graduate degree in Engineering or Business/Commerce.
Familiarity with PRDs and the ability to manage complex products with some oversight and the ability to manage smaller products independently.
Intermediate knowledge with Microsoft Excel including comfort with lookups, pivot tables, and other common functions related to decision support.
Must be comfortable working in an unstructured environment with a willingness to follow up on tasks independently with limited oversight.
2-3 years of experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
Basic knowledge of SQL and simple data structures preferred.
Familiarity with enterprise networking concepts is strongly preferred.
Familiarity with Atlassian and Jira is a plus.
Experience working with largely SaaS-based technology budgets is a plus.

Our story:
Oxford Properties Group (“Oxford”) is a leading global real estate investor, asset manager and business builder. It builds, buys and grows defined real estate operating business with world-class management teams. Established in 1960, Oxford and its portfolio companies manage approximately C$70 billion of assets across four continents on behalf of their investment partners. Oxford’s owned portfolio encompasses office, logistics, retail, multifamily residential, life sciences and hotels; it spans more than 150 million square feet in global gateway cities and high-growth hubs. A thematic investor with a committed source of capital, Oxford invests in properties, portfolios, development sites, debt, securities and real estate businesses across the risk-reward spectrum. Together with its portfolio companies, Oxford is one of the world’s most active developers with over 100 projects currently underway globally across all major asset classes. Oxford is owned by OMERS, the Canadian defined benefit pension plan for Ontario's municipal employees.

For more information on Oxford, visit www.oxfordproperties.com

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

Vaccination Policy

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

title: Energy Manager
description:
THE POSITION:

Pacific Reach is a developer, owner and operator of state of the art Seniors Facilities, Hotels and Multi-Family/Commercial buildings both in British Columbia and other locations in North America. Over the years, we have taken our responsibility for sustainability seriously via proactive programs both during the construction phase and in all parts of our operations. With over 56 separate building locations, we have been an active Power Smart partner and long standing member of BC Hydro’s Commercial Energy Manager program. Our dedication to ensuring that we remain good business citizens is ongoing, as we strive to ensure that we maintain our focus on cultivating and maintaining a strong energy conservation culture across all aspects of our business together with the implementation of viable and practical energy efficient technologies within our buildings and operations.

Pacific Reach is currently looking to fill its vacant Energy Manager position at the earliest. The Energy Manager will be responsible for directing the energy reduction efforts of the company. The successful candidate will set energy usage reduction targets while developing and implementing plans to achieve these targets. They will work directly with our utility partners and consultants to maximize incentives for selected energy conservation projects. We are seeking a strong, proactive and qualified candidate with the proper requisite experience, as follows:

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Establish and maintain an energy management policy
  • Devise a strategy for reducing energy costs and environmental impact resulting from energy consumption
  • Identify and detail projects for reducing energy consumption together with the relevant business cases
  • Maintain a register of energy saving opportunities and measure and verify the savings achieved
  • Monitor technologies and products which have energy saving value
  • Monitor regulations and policies both governmental and commercial which impact the company’s energy management program
  • Issue and review proposals and negotiate with bidders to optimize value of spending
  • Commission energy audits to attain a database of infrastructure/energy usage for each building together with energy conservation/savings opportunities
  • Monitor weather patterns and statistics to allow forecasting of energy usage
  • Work with utility brokers and companies to devise a cost effective gas procurement program
  • Review consumption histories, detect anomalies and provide corrective initiatives
  • Assist with the development of utility budgets together with ongoing tracking and variance management
  • Develop and maintain a staff energy conservation program

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Must have at least one of the following:
  • Registered Professional Engineer or Registered Certified Technologist or BCIT Sustainable Energy Management Associate
  • Certified Energy Manager (CEM) designation through the Association of Energy Engineers. We will support someone to obtain this designation if needed.
  • Certified Technician (HVAC, Instrumentation or other relevant discipline)
  • UBC Masters in Clean Energy
  • Certified Journeyman Electrician
  • Bachelor’s degree with minimum 3 years experience in energy management
  • Demonstrated interest and enthusiasm related to energy efficiency
  • Ability to develop comprehensive business cases and reports
  • Experience in financial analysis and managing budgets
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Word, Excel and PowerPoint
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills both verbal and written, plus time management skills

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Application question(s):

  • Are you a registered Professional Engineer?
  • Do you have a Certified Energy Manager (CEM) designation through the Association of Energy Engineers?
  • Are you a certified Journeyman Electrician

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

  • energy management: 3 years (preferred)

title: Special Event Setup - Overnight
company: The Pearle Hotel and Spa, Autograph Collection
description:
The Special Event Set Up team prepares the backdrop for the flawless execution of the guests’ vision. With incredible attention to detail, the Set Up team members follow the instructions provided in the Banquet Event Order to ensure the room is set to guest satisfaction. The Set Up team is helpful and knowledgeable about the property- assisting guests and vendors alike as required. Meticulous and driven by a desire to make everything “perfect”, the Event Set Up Lead guides the team to success by providing an incredible example.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Prepare yourself and your team by thoroughly reviewing upcoming event BEOs, making note of special details and consulting with the Special Event Consultant if there are any questions
  • Set up event / wedding space as per instructions of the Event Manager and BEO details.
  • Prepare rooms for an event by polishing glassware & cutlery, placing tables & chairs, placing tablecloths and setting tables according to Pearle standards.
  • Cleaning of event spaces following events, by vacuuming and mopping the foyer spaces and event floors daily.
  • Disposal of any garbage left behind by suppliers and guests.
  • Be cordial to all guests & vendors- answer questions and direct them appropriately as required.
  • Use radio communication clearly and briefly. Respond to all radio calls in a polite and clear manner.
  • Set up and operate AV equipment as required – including music, microphones, slideshows and other equipment.
  • Be able to lift and carry furniture, supplies, floral arrangements, glassware, etc
  • Report all broken or damaged property or equipment to a manager promptly.
  • Care for all equipment and supplies by using and handling appropriately and carefully and replacing safely after use.
  • Assist in setting and stocking bars, food stations and beverage stations.
  • Protect the establishment and guests by adhering to sanitation, safety, and alcoholic beverage control policies.
  • Additional preventative maintenance and cleaning as required.
  • Clearing the dishwasher area when necessary due to business levels.
  • Be alert and conscientious to guests and their needs, and strive to accommodate any requests to ensure a 5 star experience.

What we'd like you to bring to the team!

  • Great attention to detail
  • Ability to lift up to 50lbs without assistance
  • Be open and flexible regarding work hours and schedule, understanding that being fully prepared for upcoming events is priority
  • Demonstrate a sense of urgency while remaining poised during peak periods and seek out additional tasks during slower periods.
  • Be comfortable working independently, taking direction and capable of following instructions
  • Maintain positive relationships within the team unit as well as with those outside of it, work together with others toward the common goal of success across the property.

Why join theteam at The Pearle Hotel & Spa

  • Competitive wages
  • Discounts at all Pearle Hospitality properties (restaurants, hotels and spas)
  • Marriott discounts
  • Training and Development to support personal & professional growth
  • Career opportunities across all Pearle Hospitality properties
  • A fun place to work with an amazing team & company culture!

Pearle Hospitality and affiliated companies, including The Pearle Hotel & Spa, accommodate the needs of job applicants throughout its recruitment and selection processes in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Accommodation needs must be provided in advance. To discuss your needs, please contact the hiring manager.

Job Types: Part-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Discounted or free food
  • Employee assistance program

Schedule:

  • Night shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Burlington, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

title: Electrical Engineer
description:
Overview:
M & E Engineering Ltd., A Rimkus Company (M&E) is a Consulting Engineering firm, specializing in Mechanical & Electrical designs for Commercial, Institutional, & High-Rise Residential Buildings. The professional staff at M & E Engineering have been completing designs, problem investigation, & building condition assessments for over 30 years on hundreds of buildings for our clients in Ontario, across Canada, US, and in Europe.

M&E has more than 40 employees including Professional Engineers, LEED Consultants, Designers, & Project Managers. Clients are provided with specific and comprehensive services from Detailed Designs in both the Mechanical & Electrical disciplines, Building Condition Assessments, Feasibility Studies, Energy Studies, LEED Certification, System Reviews, and Building System Designs from concept design through to final commissioning of projects. M&E designs for office & hotel buildings, condominium complexes & rental buildings, retail complexes, & institutional building. M&E specializes in Energy Savings Conversions and upgrades incorporating chiller & boiler designs upgrades to Building Automation systems, new lighting designs, & water savings conversions.

M&E designs plumbing retrofits for piping replacement, emergency generator compliance & fire alarm upgrades & replacement. M&E has completed building reviews for Building Condition Assessments for pre-purchase inspections, re-finance, to general reviews for budget purposes & capital planning.
Responsibilities:
The Electrical Engineering role reports directly to a principal within the company and will be responsible for projects and working with a team consisting of other Engineers and designers.
Qualifications:
  • University degree from an Electrical Engineering (or related) program.
  • Licensed P.Eng (Registered with PEO)
  • Minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar / relevant position.
  • Educational background focusing on Electrical Engineering in building systems.
  • Working knowledge of AutoCAD, Outlook, Work, and Excel.
  • Knowledge of Electrical Systems and Designs for commercial, retail, and high-rise residential buildings.
  • Experience coordinating with disciplines internally as well as externally with Consultants /Architects.
  • Experience conducting and attending site visits, as well as preparing site reports.
  • Excellent command of the English language.
  • The selected candidate will be working in a professional and friendly environment.

title: Shipping Supervisor
description:
Established in 1979, Toro Aluminum has become the window wall and door supplier for high-rise condominiums, office buildings and hotels, across Canada, the United States and Mexico. At Toro Aluminum, we continue to maintain the highest levels of professionalism and integrity, in our relationships with our suppliers, subcontractors, architects, engineers and envelope consultants.

Over the years, Toro has been committed and focused to ensure the longevity of our company, through repeat and referral business achieved by customer satisfaction in all areas including, applied testing programs, quality control, design innovations, attention to detail, competitive pricing and service minded attitudes.

In order to achieve the highest possible quality standards in our industry we will strive to advocate and provide dynamic leadership in a work environment that encourages employee involvement. The Shipping Supervisor will report to the Shipping Manager.

SHIFT: MONDAY – THURSDAY 7:30PM – 6AM

RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Establish methods to meet work schedules and coordinate work activities with other departments, stakeholders and customers.
  • Determine shipping priorities and assign work to the department based on delivery requirements.
  • Organize and direct the loading/unloading of material at the factory and the job/delivery site. Assist with loading/unloading where required.
  • Prepare production and other reports where required.
  • Attend and contribute to production meetings.
  • Ensure Management is informed daily about quality, quantity, personnel, safety and any other issues that require immediate attention.
  • Undertake projects as assigned by Management to improve the operation.
  • Train and evaluate employees in job duties, safety procedures and company policies.
  • Investigate and deal with personnel issues. Administrate progressive disciplinary action, when required.
  • Maintain a safe working environment. Ensure safety rules and regulations are followed. Ensure protective gear is worn as required.
  • Perform other duties as required.
REQUIREMENTS:
  • 5+ years of related experience in a shipping department of a glass or window manufacturing facility is a strong asset. Experience in a high-volume environment is preferred.
  • Knowledge of legal requirements as well as shipping methods, procedures and practices.
  • Experience managing 3rd-party logistics providers.
  • Demonstrate leadership, problem solving, coaching, technical skills, interpersonal skills and the ability to multitask.
  • Able to comfortably lift product and/or materials using lifting devices and by hand where necessary.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Strong analytical and process-oriented skills.
  • Experience in dealing with personnel issues and issuing progressive discipline.
  • Ability to influence others and effectively work in a team.
  • Computer skills including Microsoft Office, Word, and Excel.

title: Senior Director, Project Management
description:
• Role Impact:

    The Senior Director, Project Management (SDPM) in support of the Vice President, Project Management will manage the project management process with various internal disciplines (Development, Architecture & Design, Client Design and Delivery, Leasing, Operations, Finance, Acquisitions) from the point of acquisition or initial concept through to the completion of construction and startup of property management on time and within budget. The SDPM will continually review project activities for opportunities to enhance value will coach and mentor Directors to develop as leaders and team players; and, will ensure that projects are completed following Cadillac Fairview’s processes and procedures.


    What you will deliver:


  • Supports the pre-development phase of the project by providing budgets, schedules and technical advice to the Development managers to assist in the preparation of proformas;
  • Negotiates contracts with contractors, architects and consultants;
  • Administers contracts by monitoring the progress and cost of the projects on an ongoing basis to avoid schedule and cost over-runs, legal complications and/or claims; Interfaces with architect and consultants to develop and ensure completeness of design, drawings and specifications, depending on project stream and stage of development
  • Manages application of all required building, environmental and jurisdictional permits to ensure they are being attained
  • Evaluates tenders and proposals received from contractors, suppliers and consultants to ensure best value for CF;
  • Monitors construction activities, scheduling and budgets
  • Evaluates leasing agreements with landlords and clients to assist in ensuring that the cost of entering into a lease is fully understood and accounted for in the Offer to Lease. Advises Leasing and Development Executive of the cost exposure for deviations from the norm;
  • Prepares project budgets, schedules and technical reports;
  • Prepares monthly Construction Status Reports;
  • Ensures the required quality standards are met as stipulated in the contract documents
  • Provides ongoing technical input and support to Development, Leasing, Operations and Insurance departments with respect to the construction process and activities;
  • Liaises with architects, engineers, consultants, third party owners, tenants, lawyers and municipal and utility officials on various aspects of project construction and other activities;
  • Prepares technical reports for submission to Senior Management and Co-owners to provide justification for proceeding with a project or related to the manner in which a project should be administered;
  • Provides and evaluates alternative solutions for resolving site conditions as projects progress; and,
  • Supports a team environment and assists in the development and implementation of project strategies.

SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY (financial, people, operations):

People relationships are critical in this role and include: executives and management, all departments involved in development projects, consultants, architects, engineers, municipal staff, construction managers and clients.Project construction budgets ranging typically from $50 million to $250 million.

What you need to succeed:


  • Undergraduate degree in Engineering, Architecture or Construction/Project Management
  • Minimum of 15 years of relevant and progressive experience primarily in mixed use projects with a focus on high rise residential, commercial office, retail and hotel projects , however, experience would also be beneficial in one or more of the following areas; construction (both field and office), real estate development or operations, civil engineering or architecture.
  • PMP and LEED accreditation would be an asset.
  • Experience leading and mentoring others is required.

What your strengths are:


  • Thorough knowledge of the residential, office, and retail real estate industries and related technologies
  • Proficient in the use of Word, Excel, Power Point, Microsoft Project or Primavera
  • Strong financial and business acumen
  • Strong written and verbal communications skills; effective at delivering difficult messages with tact and diplomacy
  • Ability to deliver strong presentations in a confident and credible manner
  • Strong and effective problem solving and negotiation skills with the ability to influence others
  • Effective prioritization skills with proven success in managing multiple priorities with varying deadlines
  • Superior and proven capability for identifying, assessing and managing both risks and opportunities
  • Demonstrated capability in being open minded and flexible in both thoughts and approach
  • Well-honed ability to collaborate, consult and build strong relationships within a national organization
  • Demonstrated capacity to work under pressure and to embrace change
  • Ability to complete a large scale, multi-faceted project from start to finish with minimal direction
  • Solid working knowledge of the Building Code and Industry related technology
  • Fluent in English and French (written and oral)
  • Team Player with exceptional leadership skills
  • Self Starter who requires minimal supervision
  • Proven ability to coach and mentor junior staff

Working Conditions:


  • Typical office and field environment
  • Regular site visits as required, including climbing ladders, exposed to dust and/or external elements. Hard Hat and Safety boots required. Frequent travel may be required

Why you should join us:

At Cadillac Fairview we have been transforming communities for over 50 years. We are so much more than our properties. We are building leaders at all levels. We offer the challenge of interesting work, a great organizational culture, the opportunity to collaborate with the best in the business, and support for your growth and development. We reward values-based behavior and superior results with a competitive rewards package that includes best-in-class benefits and pension. Imagine a place where you can make a difference!
At CF our everyday actions and critical business decisions are guided by our CF Values. Achieving results is naturally important for us and we achieve results through behaviours that are consistent with our CF Values.
Are you someone who believes in our values?
  • Aim Higher – we strive to exceed expectations
  • Own Your Expertise – we empower ourselves and each other
  • Collaborate Effectively – we bring the right people together to get the right results
  • Engage with Empathy – we objectively consider the needs of others
  • Embrace Change – we drive, learn from, and adapt to change
At CF you’ll join a diverse community and award-winning team where your talent and commitment to excellence are welcomed, valued and respected. We’re ready to meet you there – are you?
CF is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment. If you need reasonable accommodation during the recruitment, assessment, and/or selection process, please notify your CF contact or email cfcareers@cadillacfairview.com.

CF currently has a vaccination policy that is a condition of employment.

title: newMarketing and Communications Manager
description:
WE’RE HIRING

Who we are:

Strategic Site Selection is Canada’s leading independent Hotel and Venue Sourcing company. Over fifteen years established, with clients ranging from large National Associations to Fortune 500 corporations, our business thrives on our people. Our culture demands dedication, integrity, intelligence, and resiliency.

The heartbeat of our brand includes growth, creative ideation, personal care, passion for planning, empathy, kindness, and care for each other. We provide a flexible work environment, while being challenged, forward thinking, and fun. We are a fierce, driven team. We put our clients first and proudly celebrate a work hard/play hard methodology.

Alongside our rapid growth and expansion, we are committed to investing in the well-being of our people. Unlimited paid time off, flexible hours, and a fresh “work from anywhere” concept are only some of the perks you’ll experience as a member of our team. Join us as our brand undergoes a complete revitalization – celebrating our resilience and recognizing our unrivalled position within the industry.

What we are looking for:

We are looking for a well-rounded marketer who has experience in a wide variety of marketing tactics. You’ll experience full agency and ownership over your own role - highlighting the importance of resourcefulness and initiative. A passion for learning and the drive to upskill independently will bring success. Ultimately, your goal will be to help ensure clear communication of our company’s message across all channels.

Responsibilities:

  • Strategically lead all areas of marketing company wide and be accountable for the creation and execution of the company’s marketing plan providing a detailed strategy;
  • Administer all company social media accounts – designing social media strategies and setting specific objectives to achieve marketing targets;
  • Work in collaboration with the sales department to ensure they have the appropriate resources to be successful. This includes lead generation, coordinating the participation of various industry related events, providing marketing collateral, promotions and other resources as required;
  • Draft, edit and oversee all communications materials;
  • Maintain brand integrity across all platforms, projecting a positive company image to the public;
  • Assist in the creation and publishing of digital, video, audio and print content;
  • Facilitate effective internal communications, ensuring consistency among various teams and departments;
  • Assist in the strategic development and organization of marketing events;
  • Create and implement concepts, guidelines and strategies in various creative projects and overseeing them to completion;
  • Collaborate with an external marketing consultant to maintain and evolve our strategic vision;
  • Lead brainstorming/creative sessions to generate ideas.

Requirements:

  • Proven work experience – at least 3 to 5 years in a Marketing and Communications Management role;
  • Bachelor’s degree in communications, marketing or a related discipline is preferred;
  • Exceptional communication skills – both written and verbal;
  • Expert knowledge of social media platforms and social media marketing;
  • Demonstrated knowledge and proficiency with communications technologies;
  • Strong computer skills in MS Office, particularly Outlook, Word, and Excel;
  • Hands-on experience in creative process, marketing, and brand development;
  • Strong writing and editing skills;
  • Basic knowledge of graphic design – experienced with various entry level design tools such as Canva;
  • Ability to speak, read and write in French is an asset;
  • Self-motivated with ability to work well both in a team and independently.

Strategic Site Selection is proud to be an equal opportunity employer - thriving with a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our staff and committed to inclusion.

We thank all interested applicants; however, only qualified candidates will be contacted.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule
  • Paid time off
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Marketing and Communications: 3 years (required)

title: Chargé de projets en génie civil
description:
Des racines fortes
pour innover et grandir

Chargé de projets en génie civil – Siège social, Saint-Hyacinthe

Poste permanent à temps plein

Le Groupe Robin, c’est une entreprise familiale qui réalise depuis près de 50 au Québec des projets d‘envergure en tant que promoteur, constructeur et gestionnaire immobilier. Avouez qu’après un demi-siècle de réalisations, nous pouvons affirmer que nous avons des racines fortes!

Le Groupe Robin, c’est aussi une grande famille de 175 employés de tous âges, de tous horizons et de diverses disciplines qui travaillent pour créer de la valeur pour nos clients, nos partenaires et nos propriétés. Faire partie d’une famille, c’est savoir qu’on peut compter sur les membres de notre équipe. C’est avoir sa place bien à soi. Et chez Groupe Robin, c’est aussi avoir toute la place et le soutien pour innover, se développer et grandir.

Envie d’avoir une place chez nous?

Le Groupe Robin est à la recherche d’un(e) Chargé de projets en génie civil, à Saint-Hyacinthe. C’est peut-être vous!

Vous aurez alors comme principales responsabilités la planification des phases préalables à l’étape de la construction du projet, notamment des implantations aux étapes de réalisation pré-exécution. Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec les équipes d’urbanistes, de développement et de construction.

Vous trouverez bien plus qu’un emploi.

En joignant le Groupe Robin, vous ferez partie d’une famille où on prend soin les uns des autres. Voyez comment nous prenons soin de nos gens :

Pour vous aider à prendre soin de vous et de ceux qui comptent pour vous

  • Assurances collectives
  • Programme d’aide aux employés, incluant la télémédecine
  • Programme de remboursement des activités physiques

Pour vous aider à économiser et à atteindre vos objectifs

  • Possibilité de cotiser au Régime volontaire d’épargne-retraite
  • Programme de référencement avec prime de 500 $
  • Rabais mensuel sur le prix d’un logement du Groupe Robin
  • Tarifs préférentiels pour séjourner dans tous les hôtels de la bannière IHG (InterContinental Hotels Group)
  • Multitude de rabais chez nos commerçants partenaires
  • Café illimité gratuit

Parce qu’il est important d’avoir du temps pour soi

  • Congés mobiles
  • Télétravail
  • Horaire de travail flexible

Parce que nous avons à cœur la communauté et l’environnement

  • Activités de bénévolat et d’engagement communautaire
  • Stationnement pour vélos
  • Bornes de recharge pour voitures électriques

Pour vous encourager à innover et à grandir chez nous et avec nous

  • Politique de formation et de perfectionnement
  • Semaine de reconnaissance annuelle des employés : cinq jours consécutifs d’activités et de festivités
  • Équipe de direction humaine, accessible et engagée

Être Chargé de projets en génie civil au Groupe Robin, c’est :

  • Participer à l’analyse de nouveaux projets de développement ;
  • Assurer la réalisation du plan de développement des terrains vacants de l’organisation;
  • Participer au processus de sélection des sous-traitants du projet (architectes, ingénieur mécanique, ingénieur structure…);
  • Coordonner les professionnels et consultants dans la phase de pré-exécution;

*

  • Évaluer les types de fondations performantes en lien avec les capacités portantes des sites;
  • Planifier la préparation des terrains tel que le remblai ou la compaction dynamique lorsque requis;
  • Assurer de desservir les projets en termes d’infrastructures et de services;
  • Être en charge des comptes de branchements pour HQ et Energir des nouveaux projets;
  • Appuyer les contremaîtres lors de l’exécution des travaux de creusage et de fondation des futurs bâtiments;
  • Support aux travaux civils et coordonner, avec les professionnels, la réalisation des futures rues.
  • Piloter des rencontres interdisciplinaires (construction, mise en marché, finance, gestion, etc);
  • S’assurer du respect des objectifs financiers et des échéanciers;
  • Adopter une position proactive dans les initiatives et les fonctions relatives au développement des affaires, des communautés et de nos projets;
  • Être responsable de l’entretien des terrains vacants;
  • Produire des rapports et mises à jour concernant les activités sous sa responsabilité;
  • Toutes autres responsabilités connexes.

Le/la Chargé de projet en génie civil est aussi une personne qui :

  • A une technique en génie civil;
  • A un minimum de 5 ans d’expérience dans un rôle similaire (développement immobilier) ;
  • A de l’expérience dans le domaine municipal (atout) ;
  • Est passionné de son métier ;
  • Est soucieux d’exceller et de performer ;
  • Est habile à gérer plusieurs dossiers simultanément où les activités se déroulent rapidement ;
  • A des compétences marquées au niveau de l’organisation du travail ;
  • A des habiletés de négociateur et est axé sur la résolution de problèmes ;
  • A des habiletés à entretenir d’excellentes relations professionnelles ;
  • A une très bonne qualité de français écrit ;
  • Fait preuve d’un professionnalisme exemplaire.

Vous vous voyez innover et grandir chez nous et avec nous?

POSEZ VOTRE CANDIDATURE!

Type d'emploi : Temps plein

Avantages :

  • Horaires flexibles
  • Travail à Distance

Horaire :

  • Du Lundi au Vendredi
  • Quart de jour

Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec les équipes d’urbanistes, de développement et de construction.', 'Vous vous voyez innover et grandir chez nous et avec nous?', 'Planifier la préparation des terrains tel que le remblai ou la compaction dynamique lorsque requis;', 'Pour vous aider à prendre soin de vous et de ceux qui comptent pour vous', 'Pour vous aider à économiser et à atteindre vos objectifs']

title: Administrator
description:
The Toronto office of Smith + Andersen is seeking an Administrator to support the Tenant team. You are highly organized and have the ability to prioritize tasks in order to manage your workload. You enjoy taking on new challenges and efficiently get work done. You’re a team player with excellent communication skills and you’re looking for an opportunity to work in a dynamic environment.
Does this sound like you? If so, here are some of the more detailed responsibilities you can expect in this position:
  • Coordinate daily administrative operations including managing scheduling of meetings and related logistics, directing incoming calls/emails, and supporting agenda management.
  • Organize and distribute new project folders to the design team. Correspond via email with design team for all new projects. Assist the project managers with the selection of design team members.
  • Maintain accurate records of projects; track project status and completion.
  • Coordinate the review and signing process of design drawings. Download and prepare transmittals, send for printing, bind drawings and send to clients as required.
  • Responsible for managing the online Project Initiation Forms (PIFs) process for tenant team, including creating and maintaining online PIF’s for new and existing projects.
  • Complete request for additional fees forms (RAF’s) forms and review with senior design team for accuracy. Correspond with clients and communicate RAF’s.
  • Assist in the preparation of documents such as General Review Commitment form, Life Safety forms, Occupancy Letters and Panel Schedules.
  • Prepare specifications and run macros. Ensure each aspect of the job is specified correctly; format macros according to S + A standards or using client templates. Additionally provide support to designers and project managers in editing job specifications.
  • Coordinate travel for leadership team, book fights, hotels and car rentals as required.
  • Provide additional administrative support to other work groups during periods of absence.
A few more qualifications which will help you with these responsibilities:
  • Two to five years of experience providing office Administration support.
  • University or College degree in Business Administration, or acceptable combination of education and experience.
  • Strong written and oral communication skills; able to communicate with internal and external clients.
  • Advanced working knowledge of MS Office Suite: Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
  • Superior organization and administrative skills with the ability to prioritize and multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
  • Highly innovative with an attention to detail and an ability to accept direction.
  • Highly organized and able to prioritize work schedule.
  • Able to work independently as well as part of a team.
  • Advanced computer skills, with knowledge of all Microsoft Office Suites.
For more information about Smith + Andersen, please visit our website at www.smithandandersen.com.

Appropriate accommodations will be provided to candidates upon request throughout the recruitment and hiring process. Successful applicants will be advised of Smith + Andersen’s accommodation policies at the time the employment offer is extended. Only qualified candidates will be contacted.
Smith + Andersen is a trusted Canadian consulting engineering firm with offices in Vancouver, Kelowna, Calgary, Edmonton, Winnipeg, London, Toronto, Ottawa, and Halifax. Founded in 1965, Smith + Andersen has organically grown from an established reputation as trusted mechanical and electrical consultants, reaching new levels of engineering and design excellence in the communications, security and audiovisual fields, and providing enhanced services such as lighting, building automation systems, and intelligent integrated systems design. Thanks to their client-focused approach, Smith + Andersen is able to apply efficient, sustainable, and reliable design and engineering solutions on the most exciting projects across Canada. From fully integrated hospitals and welcoming schools, to healthy workplaces and secure transit stations, their team has established lasting relationships with public and private sector clients across the country.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Job Summary

Reporting to the Managing Directors, the Executive Assistant for the Vancouver office is responsible for all essential administration, facilities and operational support for their assigned regional branches.

Key responsibilities include: ensuring 100% phone and reception coverage; making an outstanding first impression of S.i. Systems when consultants, prospective employees and other individuals visit the branch office; scheduling meetings; arranging travel; procurement of office supplies and other administrative duties. Special projects are also required on a regular basis, such as imparting training for new office equipment, office moves, consultant & team event planning, contest administration, and monthly reporting.

This position is in person Mon-Thurs and remote on Fridays.

Job Responsibilities

  • Answer phone and direct calls with efficiency and professionalism
  • Ensure all interviewees/appointments are greeted professionally and offered a beverage
  • Set up requested Appointments and Meetings
  • Meeting requests to include location, phone numbers, flight times, hotel as required for all trips
  • Receive and distribute branch mail
  • Responsible for branches filing and record maintenance
  • Order, receive and distribute stationery for Branches
  • Order, and receive office supplies
  • Order Promotional material for Branches
  • Prepare and distribute meeting materials, including minutes
  • Prepare and distribute Contest materials
  • Maintain a list of key external contacts for office: photocopier, coffee machine, property management office, etc.
  • Create expense reports for levels of Leadership and above only
  • Ensure reception, interview rooms, lunch and staff lounge spaces, and boardrooms are neat and clean at all times
  • Ensuring kitchen is clean and fully stocked with required inventory (perishable and otherwise)
  • Manage all inbound and outbound couriers
  • Organize Consultant/Client Events and Team Events which include, but not limited to, catering, reservations, ordering client/personnel gifts as required as well as arranging appropriate transportation for those in attendance.
  • Forward new candidate profiles to recruiters as they are received via the general mailbox and/or voicemail
  • Maintain required contact, follow up and administration for the branch phone number
  • Responsible for new hire transition which includes ordering of business cards, phone set up and stationary
  • Responsible for assisting MDs during an employee offboarding as needed
  • Responsible for liaising and being the point of contact with all vendors, suppliers and property managers and to be the subject matter expert on all BEA and office procedures
  • Manage, update and actively participate in their assigned S.I. Systems social media platform
  • Co-chair the health and safety committee for their regions
  • Other special projects as assigned
  • Responsible for branches filing and record maintenance

Experience & Education

  • Minimum 2 years of Administrative experience in a fast paced, dynamic organization
  • Exceptional knowledge of MS Office computer skills (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel)
  • Post Secondary Degree/Diploma in Business Administration or equivalent work experience

Personal Attributes

  • Optimistic, self-organized, keen attention to detail
  • Displays a Can-do attitude
  • Maintains professional and diplomatic interactions with all staff members and external contacts. Includes professional spoken, and written (grammatically correct) language skills.
  • Must have superior organizational, multi-tasking, communication, interpersonal, and administrative skills.
  • Able to multi-task and prioritize easily
  • Ability to perform tasks independently after training
  • Ability to prioritize
  • Ability to efficiently manage multiple tasks at the same time and ensure on time and successful delivery of all assigned projects

title: Intermediate Interior Designer
description:
Intermediate Interior Designer

Are you looking to be part of a skilled, creative, and award-winning firm?

Moncur Design Associates Inc. has been recognized by numerous publications and organizations for our stylistically versatile and beautiful interiors. Since 1992 Moncur Design Associates Inc. has been committed to designing dynamic and distinguished hospitality spaces in North America.

As an Intermediate Designer, you will be working hands on in our office with located in the heart of Toronto at Designer’s Walk, adjacent to the vibrant Annex and Yorkville neighbourhoods where there is no short of inspiration. Specializing in AutoCAD, you will provide technical guidance to our team to develop documentation for various Hotel Brands, boutique restaurants, and beyond. At Moncur Design Associates Inc, we are a tight knit team of hard-working individuals that that are dedicated to producing the highest quality of documentation.

Qualifications:

- Interior Design Degree (or related field of study) from a recognized institution

- Minimum 5 years working in a recognized Interior Design firm (Residential or Hospitality)

- Passion for Hospitality Interior Design and detailed documentation

- Comprehensive Knowledge of AutoCAD Software (XREF’s, blocks, layers, commands, etc...)

- In-Depth Knowledge of Construction Documentation and Drawing Conventions (Furniture Plans, Construction Plans, Reflected Ceiling Plans, Elevations, Details, etc…)

- Microsoft Office (Outlook, Excel, Word)

- Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop/InDesign)

- Creative, innovative, driven

- Strong communication, problem solving, and critical thinking skills

- Strong leadership skills and ability to guide and mentor junior staff members

- Clear understanding of Building Code Regulations and Accessibility Standards

Responsibilities:

AutoCAD/Design

- Develop high quality drawings packages in AutoCAD from concept to final design (Furniture Plans, Construction Plans, Reflected Ceiling Plans, Elevations, and Architectural and Millwork Details, Tender Packages, etc…)

- Provide guidance to Junior Team Members for Project Documentation including Building Code, Accessibility and CAD Standards, as well as take direction from Senior Interior Design Team

- Ability to mark-up and correct drawing files

- Develop presentation material (Conceptual Packages, Rendered Elevations, etc…) using AutoCAD, InDesign, and Photoshop

- Coordination with Team to develop conceptual directions for projects as well as material and FF&E selection

- Develop FF&E and Base Building Specifications

- Review and approve shop drawings and finish samples as required

Project Management

- Work as a team by consulting, coordinating, and meeting with Brand, Client, Contractors, Team Consultants, and Purchasing Agents throughout the design and construction process.

- Prioritize multiple projects at various stages of development

- Work in a Team setting as well as independently

- Strong organizational and interpersonal skills

- Meet tight schedules and deadlines

- Utilize various third-party file hosting software’s such as Procore, Lobo, Hightail, Dropbox, etc.

- Participate in conference calls, producing and issuing meeting minutes

- Execute site measures and verifications as required (travel required)

Must:

*Be a Canadian citizen, permanent resident or legally entitled to work in Canada, living the in Greater Toronto Area.
*Travel to the USA is required and the selected applicant must have appropriate working Visa or Passport documentation.

Schedule:

Monday to Friday: 37.5 hours a week (in office)

If this sounds like you, please submit a sample of your portfolio along with a sample of your technical drawings.

All applications will be reviewed; however, we will only be contacting selected candidates for an interview.

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Regular sanitization and hand washing required by all employees. All surfaces are wiped down regularly.

Application question(s):

  • How many years of AutoCAD experience do you have?

Experience:

  • Interior Design: 5 years (preferred)

title: End User Consultant - Central region (Ontario)
description:
Our doors are open – to you. We are one of the Top 3 companies in our industry and globally leading in smart and secure access solutions. As a trusted partner, we stand for innovation, top performance and a fulfilling workplace. Join our team of 15,000 colleagues around the world and help us build trust every day.

End User Consultant - Central region (Ontario)

Whitby, CA, ON L1N 0E6
May 1, 2022

dormakaba: ranked in the top 100 global tech leaders by Thomson Reuters!

https://www.thomsonreuters.com/en/products-services/technology/top-100.html


Company


The dormakaba Group is one of the top three companies in the global market for access and security solutions. The company is a single source provider of products, solutions and services related to doors and secure access to buildings and rooms. No matter where you are, if you need reliable and innovative access and security solutions, we will provide you high quality service – in hotels, shops, sports facilities, airports, hospitals, at home or in the office. Around the globe.


With over 16,000 employees worldwide, dormakaba is present in over 130 countries and has more than 150 years of experience. The dormakaba Group is headquartered in Rümlang, Switzerland, and generates annual revenues of over 3 billion dollars CAD.


dormakaba offers you a career not a job. Join us now and make a real difference in creating the next generation of products and services. Visit our website www.dormakaba.com


Job Summary


An End User Consultant (EUC) at dormakaba Access Solutions will generate sales opportunities by marketing company product lines to existing and prospective commercial end users. The EUC should enhance end users’ perception of dormakaba as a leader in door hardware. This will be accomplished by the EUC becoming competent in all types of hardware lines and electronic products and partnering with subject matter experts such as Electronic Sales Engineers (ESEs) and Architectural Consultant Reps (ACRs). The EUC will develop and maintain their geographic area of responsibility as assigned to increase market share of the end user base.


Organizational Relationship


This position reports directly to the Regional Sales Manager. This position will work closely with other EUCs, End users, Authorized Distributors, DDMs (Distribution Development Managers), ESEs, ACRs and Spec Writers. There are no direct reports to this position.


Specific Responsibilities


  • Develop end user opportunities by marketing company product lines and offering value-added services to prospective end users
  • Maintain relationships with established end user accounts by coordinating with the Distributor and DDM to achieve mutually satisfactory solutions to end user concer
  • Gain understanding of new and current end user needs by following a consultative selling approach. This will allow the EUC to earn end user trust and potentially uncover additional opportunities
  • Responsible for implementing tactical programs; such as, but not limited to, “try-me” programs, etc., in an attempt to influence end users to switch from a competitive brand
  • Maintain close communication and coordination with the DDM to ensure we are meeting end user needs
  • Provide end users with on-site survey consultations develop professional presentation skills and provide system recommendations
  • Market/sell the entire door hardware “package”. Align with the subject matter experts-ESEs, ACRs and Spec Writers as needed to uncover more opportunities with end user
  • Develop ability to make competitive comparison presentations to end users
  • Assure completeness of all Account and Opportunity records and track all work in Salesforce.com
  • Work closely with teammates to achieve the monthly, quarterly and annual goals in place for your region or assigned territory
  • Establish periodic goals and objectives, understand how they will be measured, receive feedback from Regional Sales Manager and work towards achieving these agreed upon results within the state time period
  • Perform other duties as assigned to support the objectives of sales leadership
  • The candidate should reside in Greater Toronto Area (GTA).

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities


  • Develop a philosophy of sales and associated techniques consistent with corporate objectives, goals and stated policies
  • Works under general supervision and relies on general knowledge and sales experience to achieve goals and deliver sales plans
  • Organization and time management skills required
  • Knowledge of door hardware product lines preferred; electronic sales experience a plus
  • Possess excellent interpersonal skills
  • Must possess the ability to make group presentations
  • Salesforce.com experience preferred
  • Skills and experience with personal computers, including electronic E-mail, personal scheduling, word processing and electronic spreadsheet skills
  • Travel 50% +

Education/Experience


  • B.S. in Sales, Business, Marketing or similar field preferred
  • 2 - 4+ years’ sales experience.

Key Dimensions


  • Building End User loyalty
  • Sales Ability/Persuasiveness
  • Meeting Leadership
  • End user Focus
  • Continuous Improvement
  • Follow-up: Communication.

dormakaba Canada Inc. welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you are contacted to arrange an interview or testing, please advise us if you require an accommodation and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: newIntermediate Interior Designer - Hospitality
description:
Intermediate Interior Designer - Hospitality


Do you love to tell stories through design?

Are you inspired by the people, places, events, and objects surrounding you?


At Studio Munge, we bring spaces to life for many of the world’s most iconic luxury brands and sophisticated clientele. Our environments are holistically experiential, immersive, and thoughtfully curated thanks to an ever-expanding scope of work, including architecture, landscaping, interior, and product design. Closely mentored by Alessandro Munge, our award-winning multidisciplinary collective has created a global reputation through vibrant, purposeful, and narrative-driven designs.

Today, we are looking for an experienced Intermediate Hospitality Designer to join our quickly growing team.


By our side, your exciting projects could include five-star properties and brands such as ARIA and The Bellagio resorts in Las Vegas, multiple Pendry hotels in the US, two Ritz-Carlton, two CURIO Collection hotels and more boutique luxury projects around the world.


Join our team!


As an Intermediate Designer, you will be relied on to communicate, mentor and be proactive in collaborating with your team and clients alike, leveraging your innate ability to interpret directives from our Principal and Team Lead’s vision into a comprehensive design. This multi-faceted position will rely on your creativity and leadership skills to drive local and international hospitality projects - hotels, restaurants, bars, etc. from design concept and narrative phases to construction, ensuring all aspects of the project meet and exceed our innovation and quality standards.


Learn more about our design philosophy and if this sounds like a great way to express your multiple talents, join Alessandro and our dynamic collective in designing a better world, one space at a time.


RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Create, develop, and execute innovative design concepts that are impactful and aligned with the intended purpose and project design strategy
  • Improving SM design procedures while liaising with the team and management
  • Assist the Project Leads in the development of large-scale projects
  • Manage and carry out multiple hospitality projects of varying stages of completion from concept to construction within schedule and budget
  • Facilitate training and onboarding of new members of staff and the ongoing development of other designers through supportive mentorship
  • Establish trusting relationships with clients through successful management of expectations and requests, consistent communication, and captivating deliverables and presentations
  • Collaborate to establish the project schedule and team schedule
  • Coordinate and monitor the progress of work amongst junior designers
  • Select and specify all interior design elements with relevance to the established design narrative
  • Prepare design specifications documents using studio software, Fohlio

BENEFITS

  • Direct mentorship from Alessandro Munge and our world-class design team
  • Competitive salary based on experience and industry standards
  • Flex work location & schedule
  • Extra time off during the annual end of year studio closure
  • Inspiring workspace with free parking
  • Access to a state-of-the-art gym
  • Healthy snack pantry
  • Competitive health benefit package
  • Open invitation to our regular team-building company events

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s degree or diploma in Interior Design, Architecture or equivalent
  • Minimum 4 years of experience in hospitality design
  • Accustomed to working in a fast‐paced, deadline-oriented environment
  • Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills with internal colleagues, and external clients, consultants, and suppliers
  • Excellent design, time, and priority management through a high skillset in scheduling and resource management - practising proactive measures where possible
  • Resourceful, curious, inspired, and creative
  • Able to clearly express concepts in three dimensions through 3D modelling or freehand sketching
  • Well-versed with current global laws and regulations pertinent to the standard practices of interior design
  • Strong comprehension of FF&E; capable of working with in-house FF&E specialists
  • Ability to communicate, translate, and review drawings in Chinese/Mandarin an asset.

SOFTWARE SKILLS

  • AutoCAD
  • SketchUp
  • Revit
  • Autodesk Architecture
  • Adobe Creative Cloud (Photoshop, InDesign, Acrobat, Illustrator)
  • Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
