title: Proposal Coordinator
description:
rcs Construction is a family-orientated General Contractor that has thrived for the past 25 years building exciting commercial construction projects such as the Sutton Hotel in the Nova Centre, the Playdium and the Keg. We are a medium sized, innovative and communicative company that heavily invests in our communities and employees.


We support and develop our employees by promoting training, assisting in attaining professional designations, having an open-door policy with management and helping employees advance their careers.


We are currently seeking a highly motivated candidate for the position of Proposal Coordinator located at our office in Bedford. In this role you will be a welcome addition to our dynamic Business Development and Preconstruction team. You will showcase your organizational and communication skills, ability to filter information and produce comprehensive and compelling proposal documents that will speak to the unique needs of our customers. Your drive for excellence will present opportunities to chart your own path to success, and the continued success of the teams you will help represent. Your achievements will be a cornerstone to our business development pursuits.


Responsibilities:

Proposal Coordination

  • Review project opportunity documents to evaluate corporate alignments, resourcing and technical requirements, contractual terms and conditions, and evaluation criteria for bid submission compliance.
  • Work with leadership, management, consultants, and internal teams to coordinate, develop, organize, and complete professional, high-quality proposals from initiation through to production and delivery of winning submissions.
  • Work with marketing, preconstruction, and project delivery teams to compile historical and emerging data and promotional materials efficiently. Representing rcs construction and associate companies, you will prepare qualifying documentation, project specific presentations and standard corporate brochures while maintaining focus on client relationships, corporate identities, and target markets.
  • Facilitate initial proposal planning kick-off meetings, present key objectives, and specific requirements, identifying and delegating individual responsibilities and deadlines. Collaborate with multiple teams, external consultants and trades to coordinate the flow of information, ensuring all individual deadlines and milestones are met and appropriate reviews are completed.
  • Complete document formatting, editing, printing, distribution, and overall final review.
  • Coordinate the timely submission of proposal documents and ensure accurate processes are established for record keeping, monitoring and relevant follow-up.
  • Implement quality control measures to ensure proposal requirements and corporate standards are clearly communicated and maintained.
  • Occasional travel may be required.

Administration

  • Assist in tracking and monitoring potential project opportunities using internal systems.
  • Participate in proposal debriefings to ensure continuous quality improvement and to identify enhancements for proposal content and process.
  • Assist with other administrative duties as assigned or appropriate for efficient office activity.

Learning & Development

  • Self-advocate in coordination with department manager for continued professional development and efficiency.

Additional qualities that will help you excel in this position:

  • Five years’ experience in proposal writing, marketing or similar
  • Relevant post-secondary education in engineering, business administration, project management or communication
  • Training or work experience in graphic design, drafting and / or estimating would be an asset
  • Advanced skills in In-Design or similar software
  • Microsoft Office Applications and experience with complex document formatting
  • Proficiency with Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, Sketchup or Modeling Software would be considered an asset
  • Strong business writing, editing, and communication skills
  • Excellent attention to detail and a high regard for accuracy and quality
  • Strong interpersonal, organizational, and time management skills with the ability to work successfully in a fast-paced environment with changing workload demands
  • Experience in a professional services consulting firm (environmental/engineering/planning) is considered an asset

If you are interested in joining our dynamic team, check out our website for better insight into who we are: www.rcsinc.ca and apply directly through the Careers page. We prefer applications to be submitted digitally, but will gladly accept the tried and true paper method if that is what works best for you.


Please let us know in your application if you require any accommodations. We are an equal opportunity employer and committed to ensuring we provide an inclusive environment for everyone.


Check out the video page on our website to get a peek into life at rcs!


We hope to hear from you soon!

title: newDirector, Capital Planning
description:
Our Corporate Design and Construction team is growing, and we have an exciting position open for a Director, Capital Planning based in Toronto. This role has global responsibilities and will support all regions through long-term cross-functional Capital Planning, inclusive of scope development and budgetary requirements for effective implementation of Four Seasons’ Global Programs. They will be responsible for creating a consolidated view of Capital Projects, both for Executive Leadership approval as well as Board visibility. The role will work closely with counterparts in Sourcing & Procurement, Design & Construction, Information Technology, Residential, Finance, and Operations teams in accurately reporting the Company’s Capital Plans and improving assets as necessary, supporting the Company in its year-over-year Product Quality targets.
This role will lead discussions with Owners and other key stakeholders as it relates to contractual capital commitments and maintenance of the asset. The person will leverage and engage the Portfolio Management and Owner Relations team, in close collaboration with our operating teams, to align overall planning efforts and owner relations support for their Region more broadly.
Key roles and responsibilities:
Capital Planning for Hotel & Ownership Groups
  • Lead Capital Planning services to Hotels/Owners post-opening, which are subsequently captured in the Company’s 3-yr Capital Planning program and measured quarterly in the Four Seasons Product Quality Framework Report.
  • Support Owners, operating Hotels, Residential properties and Four Seasons Leadership team identified focus assets in identifying aligned areas of opportunity for renovation to maintain the asset to FS brand standards as market leaders.
  • Guide development of scope, budget, ROI analysis and other supporting documentation as required.
  • Upon successful confirmation of Owner-approved capital improvements, the Director, Capital Planning will engage the SVP of Architectural Design and Construction and SVP of Design and Innovation to identify the appropriate Project Lead who will oversee the execution of the property’s renovation through successful cross- functional engagement of Four Seasons stakeholders, as well as its Ownership groups and third-party consultants.
  • Lead General Managers/Planning Committee orientations as it relates to long- term Four Seasons’ Global/Regional initiatives that should be accounted for in properties’ Capital Plans, mitigating any competing priorities internally, as well as driving awareness for Operating Hotels of upcoming programs / financial commitments required by Four Seasons.
  • Engage Portfolio Management team in an effort to ensure Owners are aware of and delivering on their capital commitments per signed-Hotel Management Agreements or as it relates to any changes in commercial, legal or phasing issues.
Budget Development & Asset Management
  • Facilitate the creation and review of complete comprehensive Capital Project budgets for hotels (inc. high-level feasibility, Consultant Costs, General Construction, Directional FF&E/OS&E/UPI budgets) for final validation by FS recommended /or Owner consultants.
  • Individual to leverage all functions in creating these project budgets. Working closely with Operating Hotels, the individual will support their hotels in scope document development, securing internal Four Seasons approval, Project Lead assignment and FS approved Consultant recommendation to support obtaining Ownership approval and commitment of funding.
  • Monitor progress of renovation, ensuring critical milestones, schedules and program requirements are being implemented accordingly.
  • Leverage Product Quality Framework, Operational Framework and FOCUS data to inform / influence hotels/owners on their renovation priorities, ensuring each asset is successfully addressing / fulfilling their contractual capital commitments at minimum and working towards contributing to the overall Company’s product quality improvement targets.
Online Tool/Product Quality Framework (PQF)/Reports and Board updates
  • Work closely with Corporate Finance on the development of an online Capital Planning Tool (vs. existing Excel worksheets - Design / resourcing to develop tool), as well work closely with Dir. Of Product managing quarterly updates regarding project status for Corporate Operations and Board visibility.
  • Oversee update and issuance of monthly Capital Status report to internal stakeholders, quarterly Capital Renovation newsletter to the field highlighting upcoming milestone dates, planned and completed renovations and prepare post-renovation completion reports of large-scale renovations / metrics as required for Executive Leadership / Board communications.
  • The individual’s visits to hotels will support and inform capital priorities for each hotel, as well as work to educate / improve Hotel’s understanding of typical renovation timelines and resources required.
Global Programs
  • Work closely with internal stakeholders identifying Global Programs (issued by Corporate Finance) of relevance and integrating these financial requirements to the Region’s three-year Capital Plans
  • Identify and escalate competing Global Programs’ priorities (based on hotel feedback) to Regional Vice Presidents and Area Presidents, ensuring all stakeholders are in agreement on actual implementation dates, and any deviations / associated impacts to Product Quality ratings as a result.
Key Competencies:
  • Strong project / asset management skills
  • Skilled at facilitation, and conflict resolution when required
  • Experience in a hotel or restaurant environment
  • Able to travel independently as per project needs of hotels (25-30%)
  • Experience in a customer service or account management environment
  • Experience working with multi-cultural ownership/management/project teams
  • Proficient user of Microsoft Office software in particular Word and Excel
  • Ability to read and interpret designer specifications and floor plans
  • Effective communication skills both verbally (particularly on the telephone) and in writing
  • Relationship building skills that, at times, may require the ability to confront difficult issues.
Other prerequisites – Education and Experience:
  • University or college degree/diploma in a business-related discipline
  • Minimum of 10 years related work experience preferably with project or account management experience
  • Hotel or related experience an asset
  • Project management experience an asset.
  • This role will be a Hybrid working model, which will require 2-3 days per week in the Four Seasons Corporate Office located at 1165 Leslie Street , Toronto, Ontario.
  • All applicants must be legally eligible to work in Canada.
  • Internal applications must be approved in Workday by May 5, 2022.
#LI-Hybrid
Four Seasons is committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation.

title: newAssistant Spa Manager
description:
Beauty Incubator Recruitment are currently looking for an Assistant Spa Manager to provide support to the Spa Manager at one of southern Ontario’s leading hotel spas.

The successful candidate will thrive on providing genuine and thoughtful service, have exceptional customer service skills, be passionate about the spa world and will be knowledgeable about current spa trends.

The key responsibilities for this role include:

  • Optimizing profits by controlling costs.
  • Assist in recruiting, interviewing, hiring, training, and developing new employees.
  • Practices exceptional customer service skills and ensures that all team members are doing the same.
  • Establishes and maintains open, collaborative relationships with all spa employees.
  • Organizes and attends training sessions.

If the above sounds of interest and you have the following:

  • Minimum of 3 years experience as an assistant manager in a luxury spa
  • Working knowledge of Book 4 Time software

We want to hear from you!

To learn more about this exciting opportunity please get in touch. All conversations are treated in confidence.

Beauty Incubator Recruitment Inc. are niche recruiters for the esthetic and wellness sector across Canada. Our consultants have many years industry experience from consulting, medical practices, sales, and education. With our extensive experience and contacts, we seek out the best jobs for our candidates and the best candidates for our clients.

Our mission is to enable esthetic & wellness professionals to unlock their full potential

Job Type: Full-time

title: Senior Designer – Hospitality & Multi-Residential
description:
At Studio Munge, we bring spaces to life for many of the world’s most iconic luxury brands and sophisticated clientele. Our environments are holistically experiential, immersive, and thoughtfully curated thanks to an ever-expanding scope of work, including architecture, landscaping, interior, and product design. Closely mentored by Alessandro Munge, our award-winning multidisciplinary collective has created a global reputation through vibrant, purposeful, and narrative-driven designs.

Today, we are looking for an experienced Senior Interior Designer specialising in Multi-Residential or Hospitality to join our quickly growing team.

This multi-faceted position relies on your creativity and leadership to drive international projects of a large scale from design concept and narrative phases to construction, ensuring all aspects of the project meet and exceed our innovation and quality standards. As a Senior Designer, you will be relied on to clearly communicate, mentor and be proactive in collaborating with your team and client base alike; including the strong ability to interpret directives from our Principal and Team Lead’s vision into a comprehensive design. In addition to managing your own deliverables, you will also mentor Intermediate and Junior designers encouraging their overall skill and development.

We’re seeking an inspiring and passionate individual with accomplished talent to lead multiple luxury hospitality or residential projects. By our side, your exciting projects could include five-star properties and brands such as EDITION, Nobu, ARIA and The Bellagio resorts in Las Vegas, multiple Pendry hotels and residences in the US, two Ritz-Carlton, two CURIO Collection hotels and more boutique luxury projects around the world.

Learn more about our design philosophy and if this sounds like a great way to express your multiple talents, join Alessandro and our dynamic collective in designing a better world, one space at a time.

Required Qualifications

– Bachelor’s Degree or Diploma in Interior Design or equivalent

– Minimum 8 years of experience with multi-unit residential or large scale hospitality projects.

– Accustomed to working in a fast‐paced, deadline-oriented environment

– Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills with internal colleagues, and external clients, consultants, and suppliers

– Excellent design, time and priority management through a high skill-set in scheduling and resource management. Practising proactive measures where possible.

– Resourceful, curious, inspired and creative

– Able to clearly express concepts in three dimensions through 3D modelling or freehand sketching

– Well-versed with current global laws and regulations pertinent to the standard practices of interior design

– Strong comprehension of FF&E; capable of working with in-house FF&E specialists

Benefits

– Direct mentorship from Alessandro Munge and our world-class design team

– Competitive salary based on experience and industry standards

– Flex work location & schedule

– Extra time off during the annual end of year studio closure

– Inspiring workspace with free parking

– Access to a state-of-the-art gym

– Healthy snack pantry

– Competitive health benefit package

– Open invitation to our regular team-building company events

Software Skills

– AutoCAD

– SketchUp

– Revit

– Autodesk Architecture

– Adobe Creative Cloud (Photoshop, InDesign, Acrobat, Illustrator)

– Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)

Ready to join?

APPLY NOW

title: Warranty Inspector
description:
At Claridge Homes, we are dedicated to quality and craftsmanship without compromise. Established in 1986 and located in Ottawa, ON, we pride ourselves on providing a healthy, diverse, and balanced work environment. Working with a team of over 250 full-time employees, top contractors and professionals, we have grown to become Ottawa’s largest land developer with residential communities, condos, retirement communities & the Andaz hotel in our portfolio!
Our team is an invaluable part of our business, and we show it every day. We promote inclusion, balance and diversity and encourage the development of the skills and abilities of our employees supporting them in all areas of their personal and professional development.
Join our innovative, passionate and dedicated team of highly regarded professionals and help us build the future of Ottawa together.

Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities:
  • Conducts Quality Control Inspection, Customer PDI, 24-Hour Damage Report, 30-Day, Post Occupancy Inspection, Final and 2 Year Inspections
  • Explains the Tarion Warranty process to Homeowners and addresses any concerns
  • Reviews all Homeowner issues and determines appropriate course of action
  • Ensures timely quality completion of deficiencies and follows up on all inspection “work days”
  • Reviews all QCI and Customer PDI items with Production for completion of work
  • Ensures files are kept up to date for all work scheduled in the Spring and Summer, as per Tarion guidelines
  • Ensures timely closure of all service calls in the database
  • Responds to Homeowner telephone calls and emails
  • Interacts with production, trade partners to resolve construction issues
  • Ensures all completed inspection forms and correspondence are filed is Customer’s file
  • Reviews changes and ensures adherence to construction guidelines, Back Charge procedures, safety and workmanship, contracts and OBC on a regular basis
  • Ensures all staff and trades partners abide by Ministry of Ontario Labour regulations and Health & Safety policies
  • Other duties within the scope, spirit and purpose of the job, as requested by management
Responsibilities:
  • Addressing pre-occupancy and post possession homeowner concerns
  • Conducting visual inspections of warranty issues
  • Work collaboratively and creatively with parties to promote early resolution of warranty claims
  • Understand the relevant technical standards that provide the basis for identifying warranty issues and offers suggestions for possible resolution, in keeping with the merits of the warranty claim and the interests of the parties
  • Provide technical and warranty advice to vendors, builders, consultants and homeowners regarding warranty related issues
  • Authorize contractor services and monitor contractor progress
  • Provide fair, timely, quality and consistent service to home buyers, owners, vendor/builders and their agents and other stakeholders and clients
Qualifications:
  • Superior communication (verbal and written) observation, negotiation, problem solving, analytical and conflict resolution skills
  • Direct or related experience and skills related to creative interest based approaches to mediating or resolving disputes in different setting such as in person, telephone and videoconferencing or online
  • Ability to maintain confidences, exercise sound judgement and discretion and work collaboratively with others
  • Capacity to work in an empathetic and accessible manner, using effective communications to manage confrontational or stressful situations with diverse users
  • Excellent negotiating, time management and interpersonal skills
  • Comprehensive knowledge of the Ontario Building Code and construction practices in Ontario
  • Ability to work independently and as a part of a team within a dynamic environment
  • Above average keyboarding and computer skills in Microsoft Office and Internet environments
  • An out-going self-starter with the ability to make decisions based on practical building knowledge
  • Valid Class “G” driver’s license and reliable transportation is essential
Special Skills, Knowledge and Abilities:
  • Microsoft Office (Word) Outlook
  • Attention to detail
  • Problem solving
  • Strong sales and negotiation skills
  • Interpersonal Skills
  • Good Judgement
  • Professional in nature
  • Knowledge of the construction industry with trade partners in an asset
  • Knowledge in customer service is an asset
  • Communication skills (listening, verbal and written)
  • Bilingualism is an asset
  • Ability to read Blueprints is an asset
  • Access to a reliable vehicle. This position will require you to use your vehicle to get to various site locations. Mileage is reimbursed
Claridge Homes is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer. Please advise in advance if you require any accommodation during the application or selection process. Any information you send us will be handled professionally, respectfully and in complete confidence.

While we thank all candidates for their interest, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

title: Mechanical Engineer
description:
Overview:
M & E Engineering Ltd., A Rimkus Company (M&E) is a Consulting Engineering firm, specializing in Mechanical & Electrical designs for Commercial, Institutional, & High-Rise Residential Buildings. The professional staff at M & E Engineering have been completing designs, problem investigation, & building condition assessments for over 30 years on hundreds of buildings for our clients in Ontario, across Canada, US, and in Europe.

M&E has more than 40 employees including Professional Engineers, LEED Consultants, Designers, & Project Managers. Clients are provided with specific and comprehensive services from Detailed Designs in both the Mechanical & Electrical disciplines, Building Condition Assessments, Feasibility Studies, Energy Studies, LEED Certification, System Reviews, and Building System Designs from concept design through to final commissioning of projects. M&E designs for office & hotel buildings, condominium complexes & rental buildings, retail complexes, & institutional building. M&E specializes in Energy Savings Conversions and upgrades incorporating chiller & boiler designs upgrades to Building Automation systems, new lighting designs, & water savings conversions.

M&E designs plumbing retrofits for piping replacement, emergency generator compliance & fire alarm upgrades & replacement. M&E has completed building reviews for Building Condition Assessments for pre-purchase inspections, re-finance, to general reviews for budget purposes & capital planning.
Responsibilities:
  • Designing HVAC and Plumbing Systems for retrofit and new construction for Commercial and high-rise residential buildings
  • Coordinate with disciplines internally as well as externally with Consultants/Architects
  • Preparing, with the team, design drawings and specifications
  • Preparation of tender documents
  • Conduct and attend site visits and prepare site reports.
Qualifications:
  • University degree in Mechanical Engineering
  • Registered with PEO
  • Working knowledge of AutoCAD, REVIT, Outlook, Word, Excel]
  • 5-10 years of experience
  • Excellent command of the spoken and written English language
  • The selected candidate will be working in a professional and friendly environment

title: MRO Buyer
description:
Established in 1979, Toro Aluminum has become the window wall and door supplier for high-rise condominiums, office buildings and hotels, across Canada, the United States and Mexico. At Toro Aluminum, we continue to maintain the highest levels of professionalism and integrity, in our relationships with our suppliers, subcontractors, architects, engineers and envelope consultants.

Over the years, Toro has been committed and focused to ensure the longevity of our company, through repeat and referral business achieved by customer satisfaction in all areas including, applied testing programs, quality control, design innovations, attention to detail, competitive pricing and service minded attitudes.

In order to achieve the highest possible quality standards in our industry we will strive to advocate and provide dynamic leadership in a work environment that encourages employee involvement.

The MRO Buyer will report to the Group Purchasing and Inventory Control Manager.
RESPONSIBILITIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES

  • Provide Leadership and direct activities involving Toro Group Purchasing common projects and vendors.
  • Lead new vendor onboarding activities for the group and manage and improve vendor database.
  • Execute MRO purchases for selected Toro Group of Companies and set standards for purchasing methods and policy compliance.
  • Negotiate price reductions and supplier price increase avoidance.
  • Issuing purchase orders and ensuring vendor performance to them.
  • Hands on interaction with vendors and Toro plant personnel in support of manufacturing operations.
  • Requesting and analyzing supplier quotations.
  • Negotiating product price, delivery and quality.
  • Negotiate price reductions and supplier price increase avoidance.
  • Expediting material for some select inventory stock items.
  • Participate in and support company Lean Manufacturing initiatives.
QUALIFICATIONS

  • 5+ years purchasing experience in a complex manufacturing environment.
  • Experience in leading a multi-plant centralized purchasing role considered an asset.
  • Experience coordinating multi-plant purchasing activities considered an asset.
  • Experience within the commercial window and door industry consider a strong asset.
  • Completion of bachelor’s degree in procurement or related field.
  • Completion of SCMP designation (or equivalent experience).
  • Experience and involvement in quality and lean manufacturing initiatives.
  • Excellent communication and time management skills.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office and ERP software.

title: Digital Travel Consultant - Customer Service
description:
Cloud5 has helped the most recognized brands in the world deliver an exceptional customer experience through a combination of the best technology in the industry and a world-class contact center that behaves as an extension of our client's brand voice and promise.

Whether it’s expertly designed, built and supported future-state networks, or powerful, flexible voice solutions, Cloud5 delivers communication solutions rooted in hospitality and refined for businesses that have built their brand on the promise of exceptional service. Add the expertise of our award-winning Contact Center for inbound customer service, voice reservations, virtual guest services, and loyalty programs to realize the increased revenue that comes from higher call conversion, and the loyalty that comes from an experience that impresses even the most discerning customer.

Digital Travel Consultant

If you have a natural flair for exceptional customer service, an aptitude for learning and a true passion for travel, this role is for you. With an intensive 12-week, paid training and mentoring program, here is your chance to become a highly skilled Digital Travel Consultant in a 24/7 department.

Digital Travel Consultant Hours of Operation are 24/7.

NOTE: Additional $3.00 per hour premium for working overnight shifts. Overnight shifts are defined as any shift where the majority of the shift is after 7 pm.

RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:

Once you have completed the training, you will be ready to take whatever travel request comes your way.

  • Delight Card Members with unforgettable and unexpected experiences
  • Create a personalized rapport with the Card Member and represent the Customer’s brand to Partner Vendors
  • Stay current with Client product offerings and Travel Industry and Client changes
  • Research, plan and execute customized travel experiences, through booking flights, hotel, and/or car arrangements.
  • Assist Card Members with concierge requests by arranging fine dining reservations or obtaining tickets to unforgettable experiences.
  • Answer online navigation questions and offer assistance and troubleshooting with the co-browse function
  • Put the Card Members’ experience at the forefront of everything you do, reinforcing the WOW and winning their loyalty
  • Receive incoming chats and texts from Card Members
  • Research plan and execute customized travel experiences
  • Refine your understanding by asking personalized fact-finding questions.
  • De-escalate a Card Member’s stress when unforeseen travel issues arise
  • Provide exceptional customer service
  • Email servicing through client computer tools

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • High School Diploma is required, and 1-2 years of post-secondary education would be considered an asset
  • Experience servicing customers ideally in travel, hospitality, high-end customer service or sales roles
  • Passion for building customer loyalty by carefully listening, building rapport, and providing extraordinary customer care
  • Experience in or ability to thrive in a metric driven environment, with a healthy competitiveness to meet or exceed goals
  • Confident computer skills and the ability to use multiple screens and multitask with 2 chats simultaneously is essential
  • Excellent knowledge of geography or history
  • Passion for or interest in Travel and if they have spent time travelling it would be an asset
  • Strong work ethic and reliable
  • Resilience and composure to remain positive under pressure and constantly evolving circumstances
  • Flexibility to work shifts, including early mornings, evenings, and weekends in a 24/7/365 day environment with the possibility of permanent overnight shift if interested
  • Proven ability to provide extraordinary customer service
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Natural consultative skills, with the ability to offer confident recommendations
  • Home internet requirement:

Wired Internet
25 mbps download x 5 mbps upload min speed

Wired -cable broadband (no WIFI, satellite, Hotspots etc.) Connect to your internet and conduct your speed test

Visit www.speedtest.net and select GO

TRAINING:

  • Training may be on-site and/or virtual
  • Position can be worked from site or from work at home office
  • 12 weeks of training, which includes on the job training on the phones, followed by a transition to the Digital Travel Counselor role

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $18.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Nova Scotia: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

  • Customer service: 1 year (preferred)
  • Travel Consultant: 1 year (preferred)

title: Coordinator, Retail Design and Construction
description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join an innovative, global real estate company who builds communities and connects people to exceptional places? If so, we would love to tell you our story.

At Oxford, our culture is truly one of a kind. Across business lines and around the world, we embrace the complex and tackle opportunities with speed and agility. We are ambitious and humble, forward looking and service-focused. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live. We believe that what is good for the environment is good for business. Together we deliver exceptional experiences to our over 2 million daily customers.

We are currently looking for a Retail Tenant Coordinator to join our Retail Design and Construction team. In this role you will be responsible for assisting manager, retail design and construction with the coordination of Landlord and Tenant work both prior to construction and on-site during the Tenant fit out. This is an excellent opportunity to join a winning organization and to qualify for this position; you will demonstrate a track record of success in a similar role.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:
Property, Development, Leasing and Consultant Liaison – Working closely with all groups on current or future Tenant construction coordination. I.E.: Access to legal documentation, base building drawings, mall rules and regulations, other coordination assistance as required.

Maintain correspondence with Tenants through issuance of: fixturing notices, design packages, drawing approval letters, work authorizations and chargebacks

Coordinate review of all drawings by analyzing and distributing them to consultants and in-house operations personnel.

Tenant drawing review for design and Design Criteria compliance.

Create, maintain and distribute status reporting documents.

Recording, consolidating and updating all Tenant related construction activity, including access to Landlord and Retail Tenant drawings and documents.

Attending and participating in project, and construction meetings as required.

Inspection and review of Retail Tenant construction projects to ensure strict adherence to the approved Landlord reviewed drawings, Tenant Design Criteria and the mall rules and regulations.

Identify potential design and construction problems with team and aids in arriving at common solutions to repetitive/complex design and construction issues.

Informing Tenant’s General Contractors that are not performing to schedule, and working directly with these parties to resolve any outstanding issues.

Assist Manager, Retail Design and Construction with day to day coordination for contractor access and construction permit compliance, for Urban Portfolio.

Respond to queries from Tenants, consultants and contractors

Surveying Tenant spaces, as requested, to ensure accuracy of information.

Perform post construction inspections and reports for the completed Tenant construction.

To succeed in this role you:
Possess a University Degree/College Diploma / Certificate in related fields.

Have good knowledge of Building Systems, Retail Design & Construction, and/or Commercial Construction Project Management experience combined with lease documentation experience.

5 years of experience in real estate construction and/or interior design preferably within a commercial/retail environment.

Are skilled at reviewing architectural and engineering drawings.

Have excellent verbal and written communication skills coupled with the ability to communicate effectively across all levels.

Have the ability to manage multiple priorities.

Are proficient in Adobe Acrobat, Microsoft Office.

AutoCAD experience would be an asset.

Our story:
Oxford Properties Group (“Oxford”) is a leading global real estate investor, asset manager and business builder. It builds, buys and grows defined real estate operating business with world-class management teams. Established in 1960, Oxford and its portfolio companies manage approximately C$70 billion of assets across four continents on behalf of their investment partners. Oxford’s owned portfolio encompasses office, logistics, retail, multifamily residential, life sciences and hotels; it spans more than 150 million square feet in global gateway cities and high-growth hubs. A thematic investor with a committed source of capital, Oxford invests in properties, portfolios, development sites, debt, securities and real estate businesses across the risk-reward spectrum. Together with its portfolio companies, Oxford is one of the world’s most active developers with over 100 projects currently underway globally across all major asset classes. Oxford is owned by OMERS, the Canadian defined benefit pension plan for Ontario's municipal employees.

For more information on Oxford, visit www.oxfordproperties.com

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

Vaccination Policy

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

title: Bilingual Event Coordinator
description:
Position Description: Bilingual Event Coordinator

Are you proactive, results-oriented, with demonstrated communication skills and a passion for learning? If so, a position at MEDUCOM is right for you!

What can you expect from MEDUCOM?

  • An enthusiastic and dynamic culture, with flexibility that supports work-life balance
  • A commitment to mentorship that fosters professional development and career growth
  • Empowerment to be a decision-maker, and make a significant impact within a nimble organization

MEDUCOM is a full-service, integrated healthcare communications agency, which conceptualizes and delivers pharmaceutical marketing, medical advertising and healthcare education services. MEDUCOM has established a leadership position in Canada as strategic consultants and communication strategists who excel at delivering quality programs and services valued by leading pharmaceutical companies and physicians across Canada.

Job Description

As a Bilingual Planner/Coordinator at MEDUCOM, you will be an integral part of a multidisciplinary team focused on developing and delivering high quality communications and professional programs. You will be involved in a variety of internal and external tasks and be responsible for the logistical success of our innovative marketing programs and events. In this role, you will be continuously challenged to expand your skills and knowledge, building and sustaining relationships with existing clients and partnering with internal team members and external vendors to seamlessly execute tasks. The successful candidate will be responsible for the coordination of national sales meetings, conferences, advisory board meetings, web broadcasts, video production and CME administration from inception through to completion.

Primary Accountabilities
Showcase MEDUCOM’s high standards for quality through exceptional attention to detail and prioritization

  • Source, negotiate and provide logistical management of venues, hotels, flights, catering, AV, etc.
  • Manage audio-visual and video production suppliers

Own trusted healthcare professional/client relationships, maintained with clear, concise and thoughtful communication

  • Execute physician recruitment and other event related correspondences
  • Build and sustain relationships through coordination with clients, suppliers and team members for event planning

Be recognized as the strategic partner in the planning and execution of projects and events

  • Develop innovative ideas and solutions to improve ongoing processes
  • Provide strategic input on program logistics and execution

Deliver first-class service and programs by embodying an adaptable, proactive and growth-oriented attitude

  • Provide ongoing feedback and support to management team
  • Complete daily administrative tasks as requested
  • Lead on-site live logistical meeting execution (some travel within Canada may be required)

Essential Skills & Qualifications

  • Bilingualism (ENG/FR) is required
  • A college diploma or university degree in Business, Hospitality and Tourism or a related discipline
  • 1-2 years of work experience in a position directly involved in event planning and execution
  • Polished oral and written communication skills that allow you to relate easily to a wide variety of professionals
  • Superior time management skills, the ability to prioritize effectively with a strong attention to detail and accuracy
  • Ability to problem solve, think on your feet and be analytical in a dynamic, multi-tasking environment
  • Uncompromised customer service skills necessary to build and maintain client and vendor relationships
  • Superior computer software skills including (but not limited to) Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Excel

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Guelph, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

title: Senior Administrative Assistant
description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO


You are essential to our office, essential to our success. We are Boston Consulting Group (BCG), a 50-years young strategy consulting firm. Over the past few years, BCG has been ranked #1 in Consulting Magazine's annual "Best Firms to Work For" survey, #12 on Glassdoor’s Best Places to Work list.

While we are proud of our heritage, we are even more excited about our future, and if you are the person we are looking for, we'd be excited to share it with you. In this role, you are the backbone of the function, ensuring that the Managing Director & Partners (MDPs) and the Partners you support have what they need to seamlessly serve the needs of our clients, and meet their internal commitments and goals. You anticipate the needs of your customers, look ahead and prevent problems from arising. This position involves scheduling (and rescheduling) meetings, booking (and unbooking) travel, managing case team logistics, keeping track of time and expenses, and keeping up with the fast pace of our Consulting Team.

We operate in a hybrid model, meaning you’ll be in the office about half of the time and have flexibility to work remotely (if you choose) for the other part of the week. While in the office, you will be surrounded by a community of intelligent, highly motivated and service-minded people. Sr. AAs help shape our culture by actively participating in office life, and collaborate across functions to help fellow Business Services Team (BST) members. Our philosophy is to grow by growing others, and you will serve as role models to more junior members of the Admin team. We work hard together, and we go out of our way to support each other – we want everyone to be successful, individually and as a team.

We won't define a career path for you – but some of our Sr. AAs we've hired in this role have gone on to have long and successful careers as Executive Assistants at BCG; others have gone into work in one of our many Practice Areas; some have managed teams or rotated through a number of other functions. Your career at BCG will be at the intersection of your skills and desires and the needs of our business; it will only be limited by your investment.


YOU'RE GOOD AT


  • Proactive calendar management in a fast-paced, high volume, and ever-changing client service environment:

    • Organizing and scheduling client and internal meetings and events

  • Coordinating end-to-end travel needs, including booking all travel and hotels, directions, commuting time and ground transportation

  • Processing timesheets and expenses on a timely basis

  • Supporting administrative aspects of MDP and Partners’ internal commitments: practice area activities, BCG leadership committees, recruiting, etc.

  • Building effective working relationships with key stakeholders (this will be crucial to your success!):

    • MDPs and Partners – understand preferences relating to travel, calendar, client work, etc.; learn business priorities and objectives

    • Clients and their Assistants – facilitate the scheduling process and relevant communications with friendly professionalism and high attention to detail; build client relationships

    • EA and AA peers – work together to support other Partners, Principals and BST leaders on the case team; provide back-up support to other assistant team members

    • BST peers and internal resources – obtain and share information with wider team as needed; help case team navigate internal resources

  • Proactively leaning in to support high leverage activities for MDPs and Partners (this will vary by need):

    • Assisting with account planning and client relationship management

    • Conducting research and gathering information

    • Assisting with the creation and preparation of client team materials – slides, proposals, onboarding decks, including proofreading and copying/binding

    • Additional items that you (or the MDPs) feel may be helpful – be creative and think outside the box

    • Acting as a thought partner and trusted advisor to MDPs, Partners, their teams and others at BCG

    • Keeping them informed of critical information they may not be aware of

    • Guiding them toward making right decisions about use of time

  • Taking initiative to bring things "from the back burner to the front burner" for your customers

  • Performing other duties as assigned or required, including some personal support for any MDPs you may support; responsibilities will vary. We let our MDP’s and Partners know that Personal requests are not part of the scope of the role while they may come in small one off’s it is not an expectation


YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)


  • Bachelor's degree, strongly preferred

  • Demonstrated customer service experience

  • Minimum of 2 years of experience in a fast-paced environment (extremely fast paced!), supporting executives, strongly preferred

DO THESE BEHAVIORS/MINDSET EXPECTATIONS RESONATE WITH YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE?

  • High customer service orientation – highly responsive, strong interpersonal and communication skills, wants to deliver great results at all times; obsessed with acts of service

  • Strong intellectual curiosity – a hunger and desire to always be learning, experiencing and growing

  • Insightful – drives the business forward by connecting the dots

  • Organized – excellent at time and project management, has clear systems and composure to deal with multiple tasks at once and ensures everything gets done in a timely manner

  • Sweats the small stuff – strong attention to detail and accuracy, particularly when under pressure

  • Relationship-oriented – ability to develop effective working relationships with the Consulting Team, clients, and the wider Business Services Team (BST) to help build trust, open doors, and create opportunity

  • Team player – proactively seeks opportunities to help others; will go above and beyond in order to get the job done

  • Lives and breathes our values – open and inclusive to all members of the team and support them as equals

  • Committed to improving the status quo – we respect and hire people who are willing to ask questions or make suggestions, even if it is turned down

  • Good judgment – highly professional and diplomatic (dealing with consultants who can be very demanding at times can be a challenge, but a challenge you're up for), knows when to ask for help or advice, is perceptive and practical

  • Trustworthy – a vault (you will be privy to confidential information)

  • Flexibility – doesn't get frustrated by priorities changing; open to feedback, adjusts to different working styles; embraces new ways of working in a hybrid environment

  • Self-motivated – a "can-do" attitude with an entrepreneurial spirit and a desire to take on an increasing level of responsibilities

  • Passion – hone your “superpower” and bring your true authentic self to work

Candidates will be considered at the Senior Administrative Assistant or Executive Assistant level, depending on experience.


YOU'LL WORK WITH


Our business management and operations team members work to ensure that BCG is running smoothly, efficiently, and productively. We are made up of executive and administrative (or case team) assistants, visual service artists, receptionists, facilities staff, and the team leaders and office coordinators who manage these operations and business management jobs.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION


RSRBCG

title: Project Manager
description:
Position Summary:

Under the general direction of the VP of Shared Services, this position is responsible for completing projects of all sizes related to all phases of development and construction, including project budgeting, project and construction scheduling, proposal work, and coordination among architects, internal stakeholders, consultants, regulatory bodies, and contractors.

Key Accountabilities:

  • Liaises and communicates effectively with all appropriate operational departments at a senior and executive level
  • Meets with local (city) jurisdiction regarding project scope, cost, and servicing agreements
  • Develops renovation project plans, including schedules, construction budget, FF&E and soft costs, ensuring cost and time effectiveness
  • Coordinate and execute an efficient project plan; leveraging former lessons learned and project artifacts and own enhancements
  • Oversees the performance of all trade contractors, reviewing architectural and engineering drawings (hard copies & AutoCAD format), ensuring all specifications and regulations are adhered to
  • Monitors and manages development project risks.
  • Assists the consultant team regarding design and owner input.
  • Documents, controls and tracks appropriate administrative records of construction contracts and obtains all necessary permits and licenses
  • Tracks and controls construction schedule and costs to achieve completion within time and budget, and takes corrective action as required
  • Provides regular weekly and monthly progress reports as required
  • Develops and cultivates strong working relationships with all stakeholders: guests, management, vendors, trades and employees
  • Ensures compliance with licensing laws, health and safety and other statutory regulations
  • Coordinates with gaming corporations and gaming authorities as it relates to project work.
  • Performs other duties as assigned or directed
  • Completes formal project close/lessons learned process

Education and Qualification Requirements:

  • Post-Secondary education in project management and construction management, architectural building technology or suitable combination of education and experience. Must have a sound technical understanding of building systems and structures.
  • Ability to meet deadlines and coordinate numerous internal & external resources
  • Computer literacy required in MS Office and MS project; AutoCAD familiarity desired.
  • Construction and design experience in commercial construction is required, preferably with experience in casinos, hotels and restaurants.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Must have a sound technical understanding of building systems and structures.', 'Construction and design experience in commercial construction is required, preferably with experience in casinos, hotels and restaurants.', 'Provides regular weekly and monthly progress reports as required', 'Meets with local (city) jurisdiction regarding project scope, cost, and servicing agreements']

title: General Manager - Riverheights Terrace
description:
Overview:
What’s the difference between a job and a meaningful, rewarding career? The people you serve. When you work at Atria, you have a front-row seat to the amazing life stories of the wisest people on earth. What’s more, you are part of an extraordinary company – one that’s investing in the future of senior living by investing in you. Don’t just do a job. Be part of an extraordinary life.

Atria is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable law. Atria will not tolerate harassment or discrimination based on any of these protected classifications.
Responsibilities:
The Executive Director is responsible for leading the day-to-day operations of the community, including full profit and loss responsibility and serving as the community sales leader. The Executive Director plans, implements, and evaluates all aspects of operations. He/she recruits and trains team members, has a direct supervisory responsibility for team members in order to create and maintain a highly functioning team environment, maintains high customer satisfaction, and ensures a quality-oriented workforce. The Executive Director complies with all local, state, and federal regulations, and focuses on creating a safe working and living environment.

  • Lead the development and implementation of all sales and operations strategies and tactics for the community consistent with Atria’s objectives. Regularly communicate performance with the Regional Vice President.
  • Actively partner with Community Sales Director to assess competitive threats, sales plan, and engage in business to business sales calls.
  • Understand the community’s care regulations and support the resident care program by regularly meeting with the Resident Services Director to discuss and address concerns of the department.
  • Develop and implement successful strategies regarding labor, occupancy growth, revenue growth, expense control, and quality of services, and review and redirect activity, if necessary.
  • Ensure adherence to the Resident’s Bill of Rights.
  • Interview, hire, orient, train, supervise and evaluate staff.
  • Constantly assess resident needs in staffing levels.
  • Operate the community in accordance with Atria policies and federal, state and local regulations.
  • Assist in the development of operational budgets and capital requirements, including forecasting and approving all expenses.
  • Act as a liaison between field operations and the Support Center. Build strong relationships with Support Center resources.
  • Remain active in local community activities. Establish networks and resources for resident referrals.
  • Perform regular reviews of and makes recommendations on all aspects of building construction and preventative maintenance.
  • Able to work in various positions at community and willing and able to fill in as needed.
  • Build a high performing team and keep morale high.
  • Meet financial management requirements for the community.
  • Maintain safe working and living environment.
  • Actively participate in “in-house” sales activities including prospective resident tours and special events.
  • May drive Company vehicle from community to social and other various destinations (only if required by community).
  • May perform other duties as needed and/or assigned.
Qualifications:
  • A Bachelor’s degree in business administration, healthcare administration, or related subject is required.
  • Three (3) to five (5) years of experience in operations management with demonstrated success in meeting financial and sales goals preferred.
  • The ability to become licensed as an administrator for assisted living within a prescribed timeframe in states requiring such a license.
  • Must possess valid driver’s license.
  • Must satisfactorily meet and be in compliance with Atria’s Motor Vehicle Policy standards.
  • Must have or be willing to get a COVID-19 vaccine, subject to legal requirements.
Executive Director, Administrator, Branch Administrator, director of professional, Operations manager, General Manager, GM, Operations Manager, Assisted Living Director, Director of Operations, Director of Services, Administrator, Property Manager, Long term care, Assisted Living, Retirement, Independent Living, Healthcare, Senior Living, Community, Hospitality, Hotel, Resort, Country Club, Senior Care, Train, Supervise, Manage, NOI, Implement, Budget, Residents, Census, Occupancy, Evaluate, Team, Customer, Client , Services, Quality, Compliance, Sales, Revenue, Grow, Growth, Hospitality, Facilities, Facility, Employees, Staff, Direct, Execute, Healthcare, Home Care, Consultant, CCRC

title: newManager, Real Estate Development
description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join an innovative, global real estate company who builds communities and connects people to exceptional places? If so, we would love to tell you our story.

At Oxford, our culture is truly one of a kind. Across business lines and around the world, we embrace the complex and tackle opportunities with speed and agility. We are ambitious and humble, forward looking and service-focused. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live. We believe that what is good for the environment is good for business. Together we deliver exceptional experiences to our over 2 million daily customers.

Oxford is seeking a highly motivated Development Manager to join the Canadian development team in Toronto. In this role, you will report to the Director, Development and become a key member of the team delivering on Oxford’s strategic developments across Canada, which include approximately $3.0 Billion in ongoing projects as well as a development pipeline in excess of $5.0 Billion.

As Development Manager, you will contribute to all aspects of the development process and the projects that you will work on range in size, complexity, geography, and asset class. Core responsibilities include managing third-party consultant engagement, managing pre-development/development budgets, leading project performance reporting, producing internal and co-owner approval documentation, and supporting the design, municipal entitlements, and construction processes.

More specifically, as a member of this team, you will:
Draft RFPs and manage the RFP process for project consultant engagement;
Manage scope, budget, and invoicing of multi-disciplinary project consultant teams to accurately track project phases and respective budgets;
Manage the underwriting process, collaborating with Director / VP;
Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to develop program requirements and support the project leasing team;
Prepare project schedules, coordinate meetings, and prepare meeting materials as required to deliver on project objectives;
Provide input on design and participate in development and construction meetings;
Support the community engagement and municipal entitlement processes;
Produce quarterly reports and project updates as required;
Draft investment committee and co-owner approval documents;
Support internal stakeholders (investments, asset management, property management, etc.) on acquisition due diligence and/or other strategic priorities;
Travel within Canada required.

To succeed in this role, you have / are:
Undergraduate or Post Graduate degree in Real Estate, Urban Planning/Development, Engineering, Architecture, Business or a related field;
3 to 5 years of relevant experience;
Excellent written, verbal communication and presentation skills;
Self-motivated individual with a strong work ethic and a high level of attention to detail;
Capacity to work well under pressure with multiple competing deadlines;
Ability to work both collaboratively in a team environment and independently;
Strong analytical skills and proficiency in Microsoft Excel (financial modeling). Experience leading the underwriting process for a development project is considered an asset;
Experience leading municipal entitlements is considered an asset;
Working knowledge of MS Project or other scheduling software is considered an asset;
Possession of a CFA, MBA, and/or other professional designation is considered an asset.

Our story:
Oxford Properties Group (“Oxford”) is a leading global real estate investor, asset manager and business builder. It builds, buys and grows defined real estate operating business with world-class management teams. Established in 1960, Oxford and its portfolio companies manage approximately C$70 billion of assets across four continents on behalf of their investment partners. Oxford’s owned portfolio encompasses office, logistics, retail, multifamily residential, life sciences and hotels; it spans more than 150 million square feet in global gateway cities and high-growth hubs. A thematic investor with a committed source of capital, Oxford invests in properties, portfolios, development sites, debt, securities and real estate businesses across the risk-reward spectrum. Together with its portfolio companies, Oxford is one of the world’s most active developers with over 100 projects currently underway globally across all major asset classes. Oxford is owned by OMERS, the Canadian defined benefit pension plan for Ontario's municipal employees.

For more information on Oxford, visit www.oxfordproperties.com

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

Vaccination Policy

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

title: Conseiller en stockage de données Azure / Consultant - Azure...
description:
English Version to follow

Microsoft a comme mission de permettre à chaque personne et à chaque organisation de la planète d’en accomplir davantage. Notre culture repose sur l’adoption d’une mentalité de croissance, tout en inspirant l’excellence et en encourageant les équipes et les dirigeants à donner le meilleur d’eux-mêmes chaque jour. Ce faisant, nous créons des innovations qui changent les vies de milliards de personnes dans le monde entier. Vous pouvez nous aider à accomplir notre mission.


Les Services consultatifs de Microsoft aident les clients de Microsoft du monde entier à tirer le meilleur parti de leurs investissements dans les dernières technologies infonuagiques de Microsoft. Nous concentrons nos efforts à outiller les clients dans leur parcours numérique en imaginant de nouvelles possibilités et en offrant des solutions qui mènent à des résultats commerciaux précis et à une expérience client exceptionnelle.

Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission.


Microsoft Consulting Services helps Microsoft customers around the world get the best outcomes from their investments in the latest Microsoft cloud technologies. We focus on empowering customers on their digital journey, from envisioning new possibilities to delivering solutions that result in targeted business outcomes and a great customer experience.

Responsibilities


Un conseiller travaillant au sein de l’organisation Nuage et intelligence artificielle Azure des Services consultatifs de Microsoft a la responsabilité d’offrir des solutions et des résultats commerciaux de haute qualité fondés sur la plateforme Microsoft. Dans votre rôle de conseiller, vous nous aiderez à concevoir et à créer la prochaine génération de solutions Azure pour nos clients. Si vous souhaitez vous joindre à notre grande équipe Azure et êtes un fervent défenseur des technologies de pointe ayant une expérience dans la conception ou le développement de solutions infonuagiques, voici une excellente occasion pour vous!
  • Passion pour les clients et l’apprentissage, capacité avérée à se concentrer sur le client et les résultats et à être proactif et collaboratif, et bonne confiance en soi sous la pression.
  • Expérience en direction d’équipe et en collaboration avec la gestion de projet et les intervenants du projet.
  • Fortes compétences en matière de gestion de temps, de projets et de priorités.
  • Expérience démontrable de travail avec la clientèle à différents niveaux au sein des organisations.
  • Capacité démontrée à s’adapter aux nouvelles technologies et à apprendre rapidement.
  • Passion pour le mentorat, la formation de pairs et le partage des connaissances.
  • Excellentes compétences écrites et en communication et présentation, en relations clients et partenaires, et en gestion des attentes.
  • La disponibilité à voyager jusqu’à 50 % du temps fait partie intégrante de ce travail.

A Consultant within the Azure Cloud & Artificial Intelligence (ACAI) organization of Microsoft Consulting Services is responsible for delivering high quality solutions and business outcomes based on the Microsoft Platform. In the Consultant role, you will help us design and build the next generation of Azure-based Solutions for our customers. If you're interested in joining a broader Azure team and if you're an enthusiastic advocate of cutting-edge technology with a background in designing or developing cloud solutions -this would be a great opportunity for you!
  • Passion for customers, learning, proven ability to be client focused, results-focused, proactive, collaborative and confident under pressure
  • Experience in team leadership, working with project management/project stakeholders
  • Strong time, project, and priority management skills
  • Demonstrable experience of working face-to-face at varying levels within organizations
  • Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly
  • Passion for mentoring, training peers and sharing knowledge
  • Great communication skills, presentation skills, written skills, customer/partner relationships and expectations management
  • Availability to travel up to 50% is an integral part of this job

Qualifications


Compétences minimales requises :
  • Baccalauréat en informatique, en ingénierie, en finance, en commerce ou dans domaine connexe ET au moins 3 ans d’expérience en direction dans un domaine d’activité pertinent
  • OU une expérience équivalente.


Qualifications supplémentaires ou souhaitables
  • Au moins 5 ans d’expérience en direction dans un domaine d’activité pertinent.
  • Certifications techniques

Nous comprenons et apprécions des expériences techniques variées, mais valorisons les compétences ci-dessous pour répondre aux besoins de nos infrastructures Azure :

  • Excellentes compétences en matière de gestion des intervenants, de communication et de présentation aux cadres.
  • Compétences fonctionnelles et techniques, y compris la connaissance et la maîtrise des technologies suivantes :
  • Stockage de données Azure – Cosmos DB, HD Insights, Databricks
  • Il disposera d’une expérience professionnelle pertinente de plus de cinq ans dans la mise en œuvre de solutions Azure à grande échelle au sein d’une entreprise.
  • Le candidat retenu aura une expérience pertinente en matière d’analyse, de conception, de développement, de test, de déploiement et de mise en œuvre opérationnelle dans la livraison Azure.
  • Une expérience de travail dans une organisation de services à titre de conseiller est hautement souhaitable.
  • Une expérience de travail sur des mises en œuvre globales en plusieurs étapes est souhaitable.
  • Lorsque la possibilité de voyager sera rétablie : les voyages dépendront des exigences du client, qui se composent généralement, sur une semaine de travail, de quatre jours de travail sur le lieu de travail du client et de trois nuits à l’hôtel, avec un cinquième jour de travail à distance à domicile.
  • Bilinguisme parfait (français et anglais) : des capacités de communication verbale et écrite sont requises.
Microsoft souscrit au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi. Tous les candidats admissibles seront considérés pour le poste, peu importe l’âge, l’ascendance, la couleur, la nécessité d’un congé familial ou d’un congé de maladie, l’identité ou l’expression sexuelle, l’information génétique, l’état civil, l’état de santé, l’origine nationale, le handicap physique ou mental, l’allégeance politique, le statut d’ancien combattant, la race, la religion, le genre, l’état de grossesse, l’orientation sexuelle ou toute autre caractéristique protégée par les lois applicables, les réglementations ou les ordonnances.

Les avantages énumérés ci-dessous peuvent varier selon la nature de votre emploi chez Microsoft et du pays où vous travaillez.


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Finance, Business, or related field AND 3+ years leadership experience in relevant area of business
    • OR equivalent experience.


Additional or Preferred Qualifications

  • 5+ years leadership experience in relevant area of business.
  • Technical certifications
We understand and appreciate varied technical backgrounds, but prioritize the skills listed below to support our Azure Infrastructure delivery needs:
  • Excellent stakeholder management, communication and executive presentation skills
  • Functional/Technical skills including knowledge / mastery of these technologies:
  • Azure Data Storage - Cosmos DB, HD Insights, Databricks
  • 5+ years relevant work experience with Azure large scale enterprise implementations
  • The successful candidate will have relevant analysis, design, develop, test, deploy, operate implementation experience in Azure delivery
  • Experience working in a Services organization in a consulting capacity is strongly preferred
  • Experience working on multi-phase global implementations is preferred
  • When Travel resumes: Travel is based on customer requirements, which are typically, over the duration of a work week, this is 3 nights in a hotel, 4 days on-site with the customer, and the 5th day working remotely from a home office
  • Fluently Bilingual ( French/English) both verbal and written communications skills are required.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

title: Senior Analyst, ESG and Operations
description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join an innovative, global real estate company who builds communities and connects people to exceptional places? If so, we would love to tell you our story.

At Oxford, our culture is truly one of a kind. Across business lines and around the world, we embrace the complex and tackle opportunities with speed and agility. We are ambitious and humble, forward looking and service-focused. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live. We believe that what is good for the environment is good for business. Together we deliver exceptional experiences to our over 2 million daily customers.

Why join us?
Are you looking to join an innovative industry leader? To lead a new enterprise discipline for a diverse global business? If so, we would love to tell you our story. Oxford is a global real estate investor, asset manager and builder of businesses and our culture is one of a kind. Across business lines and around the world, we embrace the complex and tackle opportunities with speed and agility. We are ambitious and humble, forward looking and service focused. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live. We believe that what is good for the environment is good for business. Together, we deliver exceptional experiences to our over 2 million daily customers.

We believe that the goal posts are shifting in commercial real-estate, driven by the rapid adoption of technology, the need for sustainable solutions, and by the commitment to providing healthy places. Over the past year, we have been working to reset the bar on what great looks like from an ESG point of view, expanding our program across business areas and global regions. As part of this we see a fantastic opportunity to do what we have done over the past 60 years, lead the market with the most innovative and customer-driven practices. To that end, we are looking for a Senior Analyst, ESG and Operations.

Reporting to the Senior Director of ESG and Operations, Hala El Akl, this important new global leadership role and hire will play a critical part in leveling up our ESG capabilities. We are looking for a well-rounded operations expert who is equally passionate about people, products and performance, and who is excited at the prospect of creating an industry leading practice that challenges the status quo to deliver superior returns for Oxford. A self-starter who remains calm under pressure, uncertainty and change. Capable of rolling up your sleeves to support diverse team of experts across our business. Eager to expand your expertise and work on projects that span the globe.

As a member of the team, you will be responsible for:
Contribute to setting ESG standards across asset classes and strategies
Provide day to day follow up to teams and sites in relation to the delivery of the Carbon targets and the ESG Framework
Support the development and implementation of tools and protocols to embed ESG performance in operations ( tracking of sustainability action plans)
Review and support implementation of Net Zero Strategies
Coordinate with third party consultants
Lead research into ESG trends across real estate industry
Support the preparation of internal and external material around key sustainability projects
Support sites with environmental reporting, including but not limited to GRESB, LEED, BREEAM, WELL, Fitwel, BOMA

To succeed in this role, you have:
3-5 years’ experience in ESG/Sustainability consulting specific to real estate
Degree in environmental studies or engineering is desirable
Familiarity with global Green Building Certification programmes
Strong interpersonal and project management skills
Ability to manage multiple stakeholders across the globe and their expectations
Strong ability to manage multiple priorities, work under pressure to meet deadlines
Experience working in or managing in one or more of the following areas would be an asset: Asset Lifecycle Management, Performance Improvement projects using digital solutions IoT, digital twin, robotics etc
Experience using Azure data services, Power BI and/or asset management tools an asset, but not required
Global or multi-national corporate experience is strongly preferred

Our story:
Oxford Properties Group (“Oxford”) is a leading global real estate investor, asset manager and business builder. It builds, buys and grows defined real estate operating business with world-class management teams. Established in 1960, Oxford and its portfolio companies manage approximately C$70 billion of assets across four continents on behalf of their investment partners. Oxford’s owned portfolio encompasses office, logistics, retail, multifamily residential, life sciences and hotels; it spans more than 150 million square feet in global gateway cities and high-growth hubs. A thematic investor with a committed source of capital, Oxford invests in properties, portfolios, development sites, debt, securities and real estate businesses across the risk-reward spectrum. Together with its portfolio companies, Oxford is one of the world’s most active developers with over 100 projects currently underway globally across all major asset classes. Oxford is owned by OMERS, the Canadian defined benefit pension plan for Ontario's municipal employees.

For more information on Oxford, visit www.oxfordproperties.com

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

Vaccination Policy

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.
