title: Paint Truck Driver
description:
Subsidiary: Miller Paving Limited


As a Paint Truck Driver, You Will:

  • Promote, lead, and execute a Safety-First culture for all employees, sub-contractors, and consultants in compliance with Miller Health, Safety and Environment (HSE) polices and contractual HSE obligation for the staff and public are met
  • Operate pavement marking trucks
  • Operate forklifts and loaders
  • Load/unload materials
  • Lay out and pre-mark on new and existing asphalt
  • Set up/take down traffic control, as per OTM book7
  • Maintain accurate documentation – driver logs, fuel records, time sheets and daily work logs
  • Book hotels, organize materials, plan daily routes and track inventory
  • Liaison with MTO and other clients
  • Other duties as assigned

What You'll Bring:

  • Class D commercial license with air brake endorsement (Z)
  • Previous experience operating highway line-striping trucks, an asset
  • Previous mechanical experience with the ability to perform minor repairs on equipment, considered an asset
  • Flexibility and organizational skills to multitask and manage time in a fast-paced environment with rapidly shifting priorities
  • Ability to perform manual labour and lift up to 50 pounds
  • Excellent team player to work productively in a highly functional team
  • Willingness to learn and appreciate Miller Values - safety, quality and integrity so we can continue “Building Greatness”
  • Willingness to work assigned shifts, including days, nights or weekends as required
  • Ability to travel with extended stays, when required

Miller is proud to provide this unique career opportunity, we offer continuous learning, opportunity for growth, and a competitive compensation package. At our core; we are our people. We succeed because we respect our people and invest in their development, safety and well-being. Miller is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that diversity and inclusion are key attributes to building greatness. Miller’s core values of Integrity and Community welcomes everyone, at work and in the community, and our value of Accountability, means that we own our actions, our decisions and our results. As a Miller employee, this will ultimately be your commitment to our inclusive culture.

We will contact candidates selected for an interview. Accommodation for applications with disabilities will be made during the recruitment process when requested.

title: newSenior Director, IT Finance
description:
Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts is a global, luxury hotel management company. We manage over 120 hotels and resorts and 47 private residences in 47 countries around the world and growing. At Four Seasons, we are powered by people and our culture enables everything we do.
We have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Director, IT Finance to join the Corporate Information Technology department. This role has global responsibility for all financial applications, systems and related support at properties and corporate offices. The Senior Director, IT Finance is the IT Partner to Finance Department across all divisions of hotel and corporate finance throughout all phases of transformation – including steady state operations - resulting in a reinvented finance function across people, process and technology; all of which supports the strategic priorities of the expanding organization. The Senior Director, IT Finance has a proven track record and experience implementing and supporting finance transformation including activities such as sourcing, implementation, change management and operation of new enterprise cloud platforms.
With strong and experienced financial acumen, the candidate has successfully overseen large scale implementation projects with expertise in vendor management and service delivery. The candidate has knowledge and experience leveraging third parties for project delivery, service, and support. The candidate has knowledge and experience working with onshore and offshore service delivery partners. The candidate has previously demonstrated how Finance technology can be used to improve processes, deliver actionable insights, forecast and measure KPI and improve overall satisfaction and efficiency of all members of Finance. This position shall challenge the status-quo and lead Finance through technology changes and opportunities.
The candidate has previous leadership experience overseeing IT operations for Finance departments. In advance of transformation, the role will also oversee 20+ disparate and legacy technologies supported by extensive manual processes whilst identifying options for transformation.
The candidate has a proven track-record integrating financial systems and operations with modern data culture, enterprise data strategy and global BI operation. The role is in partnership with all departments to enable a cohesive logical data model that empowers the business whilst increasing the ROI.

Key Activities
Internal Customers
  • Supports all divisions of Finance with strong financial acumen and technical expertise
  • Understands problems and objectives, identifies root cause and provides leadership to resolution
  • Participates in global Finance department planning, objectives and requirements
  • Creates, maintains and delivers upon roadmap and resource requirements for all improvements, projects and objectives that need technology
  • Trusted partner to all individuals and levels of Finance stakeholders
  • Support the ongoing finance transformation and behavior change with a focus on adoption and proficiency
  • Budgetary oversight and review of staffing, projects, and performance of Finance functions of the organization.
  • Establish and grow an IT learning program for Finance and business stakeholders
  • Provide guidelines for all IT Finance functions within the enterprise including to field IT personnel that may not report directly to this position.
  • Facilitate and orchestrate workshops and other collaborate to ensure the speedy and accurate creation of business requirements with a focus on integration across different divisions.
Technology
  • Update and maintain the strategic technology plan and architecture for Finance technology that delivers enhanced business functionality, improved service delivery and efficiency
  • Oversee day to day technical operations included release management
  • Play an expert role in business development by demonstrating how the company will use Finance technology products and services to change its competitive situation
  • Leads technology vendor negotiations including review, comment and approval of contracts
  • Analysis and recommendations for global operating and capital spending for all finance systems
  • Ensure a high level of service and availability daily across Finance technology systems and solutions.
  • Provide oversight and continuity in the delivery of technology with a focus on financial data quality, infrastructure, security, compliance.
  • Identify and solve gaps with existing products and facilitate plans for solution
  • Build and maintain an IT governance structure across Finance.
Projects & Project Delivery
  • IT program lead throughout all phases of Four Seasons’ multi-year Finance transformation program
  • Facilitate the successful management of all IT vendors delivering products or services the Finance department
  • Manage implementation of technology projects to ensure delivery on time and on budget.
  • Ensure SOW’s for project services vendors are reviewed to ensure accuracy and manage consultant deliverables and vendors to ensure quality is met.
  • Develop and deliver new technology solutions and applications, working with the business leaders to understand needs and trade-off service levels versus cost versus timing.
People Management
  • Manage a team of direct reports and various contractors providing specialized services to Finance
  • Builds and manages new and expanded in-house and third-party technical expertise to ensure Finance transformation success
  • Provide clear, direct leadership
  • Clear decision making
  • Constructive conflict management
Key Competencies
Leadership & Relationship Management
  • Applies a comprehensive range of problem-solving techniques, examining root causes and options in a systematic and analytical manner
  • Handles conflict constructively and sensitively, overcomes all barriers to ensure successful delivery of results
  • Translates long term strategic goals into clear working plans and proactively develops contingency plans to avoid time and resource problems
  • Systematically balances resources to achieve long-term goals and involves others to gain commitment
  • Builds and inspires trust and openness by making it safe to express different points of view
  • Has presence, gravitas, and self -confidence, demonstrates their own personal brand, aligned with Four Seasons values and standards
Influencing and Negotiating
  • Successfully manages difficult negotiations that have the potential to reach an impasse by managing conflict, emotions, and the balance of power
  • Pre-negotiates behind the scenes support in advance of meetings and proposals
  • Takes personal risk to achieve a successful outcome for the business, is highly persuasive without being manipulative or coercive
  • Can influence and achieve outcomes in areas outside their direct authority
  • Works effectively in situations where information is ambiguous easily switches approaches as required
  • Looks beyond the immediate problem and assesses the longer-term implications of different solutions (e.g. setting a precedent)
Innovation
  • Generates multiple new approaches and bold ideas that have commercial benefit to the organization
  • Continually pursues new business opportunities and takes quick action to make them a reality
  • Uses collaboration to connect ideas that are not obviously related
  • Shapes innovative ideas around market and stakeholder needs
  • Has in depth current knowledge and understanding of competitive products, services and trends within the industry
Technical Skills and Knowledge
Behavioural
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Excellent Time management skills.
  • High degree of self-motivation (strong initiative)
  • Effective personal persuasion skills
  • Be able to manage volume of work and deal with global conference calls
Functional
  • Vendor management, especially with professional services
  • Strong technical
  • Ability to achieve results through others
  • Excellent project management experience
  • Solid leadership skills
  • Strong vendor negotiations, commercial and contract management experience with legal
  • Strong finance and budgeting
  • Very strong conceptual, analytical, judgmental and communication abilities are critical.
  • Enterprise Finance Cloud Applications
  • Oracle Hyperion
  • Infor Sun Accounting Systems
  • SAP Concur
  • Dodeca
  • Workday
  • Microsoft Azure & Power BI
  • Microsoft Office 365
  • Microsoft excel and data modeling
  • Database management systems
  • Hospitality industry systems.
  • Residence club sales and operations systems.
  • Well versed with technological developments and platforms
Professional Experience & Education:
  • The successful candidate will be a natural leader with excellent business acumen and communication skills.
  • Bachelor’s degree Required; MBA preferred
  • Minimum 15 years related experience
  • Previous leadership, management and supervisory experience
All candidates must be eligible to work in Canada. Internal Applicants must apply by May 3, 2022 through Workday.
This role will be a Hybrid working model, which will require 2-3 days per week in the Four Seasons Corporate Office located at 1165 Leslie Street, Toronto, Ontario #LI-Hybrid
Four Seasons is committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation.

title: Site Supervisor - High Rise Construction
description:
At Claridge Homes, we are dedicated to quality and craftsmanship without compromise. Established in 1986 and located in Ottawa, ON, we pride ourselves on providing a healthy, diverse, and balanced work environment. Working with a team of over 250 full-time employees, top contractors and professionals, we have grown to become Ottawa’s largest land developer with residential communities, condos, retirement communities & the Andaz hotel in our portfolio!
Our team is an invaluable part of our business, and we show it every day. We promote inclusion, balance and diversity and encourage the development of the skills and abilities of our employees supporting them in all areas of their personal and professional development.
Join our innovative, passionate and dedicated team of highly regarded professionals and help us build the future of Ottawa together.

We are currently seeking Full Time High-Rise Site Superintendent to join our growing High-Rise on-site construction team. This role will be taking on a new project.

Reporting to the Project Manager, we are looking for a candidate with the following to work on a new exciting project in Ottawa from ground-breaking start-up to completion:

Responsibilities:
  • Working with the Project Manager, develop schedules and work plans to execute projects on time and on budget
  • Manage Labour, Trades, Equipment and all Material resources
  • Work with the Project Manager to ensure adherence to the project construction schedules
  • Review drawings and specifications to identify any value engineering opportunities and potential constructability issues
  • Monitors all site instructions and change notices and any/all revisions and adjustments as required
  • Identify errors, discrepancies, omissions, identified on drawings, scope of work etc.
  • Ability to identify problems or potential problems, evaluate alternatives, and produce workable solutions
  • Review and provide assistance regarding quality assurance and control
  • Maintain regular and open communication with the Project Manager, Coordinators, Consultants and Trade Contractors
  • Create a safe work environment by implementing and enforcing strict Health & Safety guidelines
  • Working cooperatively with, and in support of, other site trade safety representatives to enforce laws and safety policies and procedures.
  • Maintain a detailed daily job history log and as-built drawing set to ensure conformance with contractual obligations and project schedule
Education and Experience:
  • 7 years’ experience in High Rise Construction preferably as a Site Superintendent
  • Strong Communication and Interpersonal skills
  • Ability to pull together team members, build consensus and initiate direction
  • Strong negotiation, conflict resolution, negotiation, and problem solving skills
  • Customer service focused
  • Knowledge of Tarion guidelines, warranty programs and Ontario Building Code
  • Bilingualism is an asset
We are looking for a self-motivated and strong driven individual that is willing to learn and grow within this family owned company.

Claridge Homes is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer. Please advise in advance if you require any accommodation during the application or selection process. Any information you send us will be handled professionally, respectfully and in complete confidence.

While we thank all candidates for their interest, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

title: newClinical Intake Coord. - Ch/Youth MH OP (75241)
description:
Reporting to the Program Manager, Mental Health & Addiction Services, the Clinical Intake Coordinator assures streamlined access through a common entry point to intensive and specialized services which are patient-centred and fully integrated.

The Clinical Intake Coordinator is responsible for the effective coordination of the Centralized Intake Services, assigning and linking patients to the most appropriate mental health and addiction services and providers; facilitating redirection of referrals to community agencies and other specialized mental health resources and psychiatric facilities. The incumbent assures streamlined access through a common entry point to intensive and specialized services which are patient-centred and fully integrated. The incumbent provides initial screening and assessment, triage and assignment to services offered for individuals referred across the lifespan who suffer from various mental health, substance abuse and dependence disorders. The incumbent acts as a consultant and clinical resource to patients, family members and referral sources.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:
  • Conducts comprehensive clinical triage and screening of all referrals in collaboration with MHAS nursing, involved family member(s), most responsible physician and other members of the multidisciplinary team and aftercare providers, within two (2) working days of initial referral;
  • Complete detailed and comprehensive documentation during the referral process, and updating documentation in the Client Record Management System (CRMS); also works as an administrator to maintain and update CRMS.
  • Coordinates Central Intake Services and reception functions; ensures appropriate service coverage and access; services are provided dependably and reliably, consistent follow through with patient and referral source inquiries, requests or complaints, and are kept up-to-date;
  • Assists the Program Manager with planning, developing and evaluating patient care by participating in the development and revision of policies, procedures, protocols;
  • Participates in utilization reviews of regulated health professionals’ caseloads, developing recommendations to assure full utilization within scope of practice, staffing model adjustments to meet current and changing service demand and patient profiles; also maintains and tracks wait list times for various programs and services connected to Centralized Intake
  • Performs other related duties as assigned

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
  • A diploma or degree in related field (e.g. Psychology or counseling)
  • Minimum of 3 years recent and relevant experience in hospital-based acute mental health services with expertise in clinical triage and screening
  • In-depth knowledge of Ontario Mental Health Act, Health Care Consent Act, Powers of Attorney Act, Substitute Decisions Act and other relevant legislation
  • In-depth knowledge of DSM-V diagnostic criteria and psychopharmacological-somatic therapies, community-based and regional mental health and other relevant resources is essential
  • Excellent interpersonal, communication, presentational and documentation skills with the ability to work well with patients, families, all levels of staff and community providers, developing strong internal and external partnerships
  • Demonstrated strong mentoring, coaching and team building skills, ability to function as a change agent and within a leadership role
  • Demonstrated ability to effectively deal with conflict situations and proactively and effectively resolve issues impacting on quality and continuity of care
  • Exceptional time management, organizational and prioritization skills, with the ability to work well in stressful situations
  • Familiarity with scheduling, word processing, spreadsheet and database software
  • Familiarity with mental health case-management software (CRMS)
  • Capable of coping with a physically demanding workload, responding to medical and behavioural emergencies, ability to lift using appropriate lifting techniques and bend, push and pull using good body mechanics
  • Demonstrated commitment to the mission, vision and values of Hotel Dieu Hospital
  • Proven ability to attend work regularly.
  • Satisfactory criminal reference check and vulnerable sector search required.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
The applicant must meet the physical demands of this position.

We thank all applicants, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Kingston Health Sciences Centre is committed to inclusive and accessible employment practices.
If you require an accommodation to fully participate in the hiring process, please notify the Recruitment Team

title: CHIL Interior Designer
description:
Our Firm

CHIL Interior Design is the Hospitality Interior Design studio of B+H Architects. CHIL is a boutique studio with a specialization and focus on luxury hotels and high-end multi-family residential design. We are one studio within B+H - a global, award-winning, full-service design firm recognized for excellence in sustainable design, technical expertise and the delivery of complex, large-scale projects. A legacy of over 60 years of design innovation and problem solving has endowed B+H with a depth of knowledge, skill and agility that benefits each client we serve, wherever they are in the world.


With dedicated CHIL Interior Design studios in Vancouver, Hong Kong and Toronto we bid and work on hospitality projects around the world. With B+H studios, we are represented in Toronto, Vancouver, Calgary, Seattle, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Singapore, Ho Chi Minh City and Dubai.


We believe in the power of design to elevate people’s lives and we are committed to doing everything necessary to deliver environments that outperform our clients’ expectations, now and in the future.


Our Interiors Practice

With a history of over 45 years in hospitality design and more than 9 years as an important studio of the B+H practice, CHIL Interior Design has been providing high-quality design for our varied and prestigious clients.


A thriving standalone business with projects independent and distinct from our architectural practice, CHIL has been established with 3 global hospitality interior design studios in Vancouver, Toronto and Hong Kong, where we lead the creative aspects of all hospitality interior design. We develop unparalleled luxury hospitality and restaurant spaces for brands including Accor, Shangri-La, Fairmont, Marriott, Hilton, Hyatt and Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts. CHIL also creates leading edge residential design with projects built and in development in Vancouver, Toronto, Calgary, and Edmonton, as well as in Seattle, the Middle East and Southeast Asia.


CHIL Interior Design, as a specialty service offering within B+H, focuses on creating unparalleled hospitality experiences. CHIL lends the experienced hand of a highly specialized studio to B+H’s global interior design team. Partnership and respect across our global teams allows CHIL to deliver the best of both worlds: the tailored, collaborative approach of a specialized hospitality interior design studio with the resources and expertise of full-service architecture and design firm.


This Opportunity

CHIL Vancouver is looking for a highly motivated Interior Designers to join our Interiors Practice focusing on hospitality design. As a CHIL Interior Designer you will be creative, the one who is driven by success, and embraces being part of a high performance, best-in-class team.


CHIL is looking for a strong team player able to work in fast-paced collaborative environment and interested in working for a diverse, multi-disciplinary, multi-sector, global reaching firm. The Interior Designers will be able to effectively interact and collaborate with a broad range of service providers (architects, engineers, contractors, suppliers, regulators, etc.)


The Role:

As a CHIL Interior Designer, you will be responsible for:


  • Work with the team to produce compelling and informative presentations that exceed visual expectations.
  • Accompany senior colleagues to client meetings, being an effective presenter and representative.
  • Meet with clients to analyze their goals, needs and resources.
  • Effectively coordinate with local suppliers, project consultants, client representatives, and team members to deliver project milestones.
  • Provide space planning that accurately reflects the Program, functional requirements, and design considerations of the project, and meets all building code requirements.
  • Lead development of 2 and 3D design concepts, with emphasis on high quality renderings.
  • Support internal teams on a variety of projects to best service our other industry clients.
  • Research, gather, recommend, and present to the team appropriate finishes and furnishings that capture the functional, aesthetic, environmental and budgetary requirements of the project, understanding how texture, light, color and other factors interact to create an environment.
  • Prepare documentation for the selection, specification, procurement and installation of furnishings and equipment, including detailed layout drawings and schedules.
  • Produce Design Development & Contract Documents (plans, elevations, sections, details, and schedules) in ideally both AutoCAD and REVIT.
  • Produce and manage projects and schedules, with a Project Manager as needed, according to project size.
  • Understand the requirements of the plans, life safety issues, building codes and other technical aspects; knowledgeable in the areas of design, drawing and details, finishes and building materials, specifications, local codes, technical drawing, contract administration and business practices.
  • Assist with permit and bid applications as required.
  • Complete contract administration from tender through project close out with assistance from Project Manager and CA staff as required.
  • Mentor and train Junior interior designers and technicians.
  • Other duties as required.

Position Requirements

As a successful Interior Designer, you possess the following knowledge, experience, and skill set:


  • A degree or diploma from a CIDA accredited Interior Design program.
  • Attained your NCIDQ certification or in the process of completion.
  • Sound knowledge of AutoCAD, REVIT, Windows (Word, Excel, Project, PowerPoint) and a host of 3D graphic programs such as Sketch-up, Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, etc.
  • A solid portfolio of diverse creative projects with emphasis in Workplace, Corporate and Commercial design. Only use this for workplace position. Swap out workplace, corporate and commercial for hospitality, residential and F&B.
  • Technically savvy, able to learn and master new programs and apps.
  • Proficient with REVIT, both as a planning and modelling (3D) tool – only for workplace position, swap out for CAD for hospitality designer.
  • Self-directed, able to work independently and know when to reach out for guidance and support.
  • Ready to receive and welcome coaching from supervisors and colleagues, assimilate feedback and learn quickly from it.
  • Armed with excellent time management and organizational skills.
  • Passionate in design, positive outlook, collaborative, and patient individual

Ready to apply?


If this is a role you are interested in, we'd love to hear from you.


Click here to submit your resume and portfolio.


For more information about our firm please visit www.CHILdesign.com


B+H is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at B+H. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

title: Project Coordinator
description:
Job Location:
Calgary
State/Province:
Alberta

The Project Coordinator is responsible to oversee the field technician’s whereabouts, travel and work schedule. It will also be to coordinate the orders and shipments of equipment needed for the field technicians. This role is a primary point of contact for our field agents, in respect to orchestrating and providing them with their material needs regarding the project scheduling and at the same time to help anticipate any roadblocks.

Responsibilities

  • Coordination of hotels stay, Per Diem and Travel time between the sites
  • Coordinate any shipment and equipment reception with the Calgary Warehouse
  • Track and update spreadsheet on equipment
  • Send out for calibrations, order in any rentals if required
  • Coordinate activities between Field Technician’s and the material resupply needed
  • Coordinate roadblock resolution with Project Manager, rescheduling installation and/or cutovers when required
  • Responsible to maintain the technicians schedules
  • Track Daily timesheets & update spreadsheets as needed
  • Place material orders for the projects and update BOM spreadsheet
  • Update weekly progress reports
  • Test results, overlays utilizing Bluebeam/Linkware
  • Assist in any administrative support for Edmonton and Calgary as required
  • Create Shop drawings packages for submittals

Requirements

  • 3 to 5 years of Project Coordinator experience, preferably in a Construction and IT industry
  • Experience with project tracking, purchase order and invoicing
  • Experience with budgets, costs, and profitability analysis
  • Wiring Knowledge is a great asset
  • Computer literacy in Windows, Microsoft Office and Outlook
  • Proven time management skills with the ability to set priorities and meet objectives
  • Effective oral and written communication English skills
  • Ability to work and focus on multiple projects aspects in a fast-paced environment with a positive and upbeat attitude
  • Dynamic with excellent communication skills and the ablility to build and maintain excellent relationships with peers, customers, and internal resources
  • Organized, self-disciplined, reliable, detail oriented and capable of evaluating the workload and obtaining cooperation from other departments
  • Ability to work independently without constant supervision
  • Resourceful, good problem-solving skills, adaptable, high integrity, self-starter, and cool head under pressure

ABOUT TELECON GROUP

Telecon Group is a team of seasoned, innovative Professionals who are passionate about their work, committed to delighting customers and for whom health and safety is a core value. Telecon provides turnkey solutions for engineering, building, maintaining and repairing telecommunication networks that are underground, aerial, indoors and wireless. Over 3,000 passionate employees working across Canada provide design, installation, construction, verification and maintenance services for cabled and wireless networks. Driven by a desire to be the industry leader, we are committed to offering turnkey solutions and targeted, dedicated, superior quality services, on time and on budget, to meet our customers’ needs and requirements. Depending on the region and the type of work to be performed, Telecon operates under one of the following brands: Telecon, Telecon Design, AGIR Consultants, Promark-Telecon, Expercom, Chemco-Telecon Infrastructure, Telecon Enterprises, Marcomm, Plexus, Unified Systems Group, SC360, Questzones and TRJ Telecom. For more information on Telecon, visit telecon.com

Telecon Group welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Project Manager - Interior Design
description:
Project Manager - Interior Design


Are you a seasoned problem-solver driven by a passion for design?

At Studio Munge, we bring spaces to life for many of the world’s most iconic luxury brands and sophisticated clientele. Our environments are holistically experiential, immersive, and thoughtfully curated thanks to an ever-expanding scope of work, including architecture, landscaping, interior and product design. Closely mentored by Alessandro Munge, our award-winning multidisciplinary collective has created a global reputation through emotive, purposeful, and narrative-driven designs.


Are you our next dedicated and inspired team member?

You have a passion and appreciation for great design, understand the importance of maintaining a designer’s vision while implementing the most effective solutions on time and within budget. In addition to being highly organized, you also possess excellent problem solving and the ability to prioritize multiple ongoing projects at varied design stages.

Studio Munge Project Managers are proactive in overseeing site projects from start to finish, work collaboratively with design and construction teams to facilitate the completion of our projects. Those teams include internal and external consultants, site managers, designers, technologists, and clients.


Learn more about our design philosophy and if this sounds like a great way to express your multiple talents, join Alessandro and our dynamic collective in designing a better world, one space at a time. By our side, your exciting projects could include five-star properties and brands such as ARIA and The Bellagio resorts in Las Vegas, multiple Pendry hotels and residences in the US, two Ritz-Carlton, two CURIO Collection hotels and more boutique luxury projects around the world.


RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Work closely with Project Leads and Technical team members to plan and manage project schedules ensuring deliverables are achieved on time and in accordance with clients’ construction management processes and budgets
  • Review initial contract document with management prior to commencement of work to ensure the fee structure, project schedule, and staff allocation are clearly defined. During design, monitor the contract, manage the scope of work, and prepare ASP for additional scope.
  • Participate in key meetings with internal teams and clients during pre-tender phases
  • Communicate as primary contact for all project-related matters among clients, consultants, and construction managers during post-tender phases up to the turnover of the completed project
  • Coordinate design with all other consultants involved in the project
  • Advise designers and mentor technical team members
  • Review shop drawings and facilitate samples reviews
  • Conduct periodic site visits to ensure construction is faithful to construction documents
  • Address site issues by providing timely and appropriate solutions in liaison with the internal design team
  • Monitor site work and flag work that is not completed in accordance with the design intent
  • Issue Addendum Site Instructions and change orders

BENEFITS

  • Direct mentorship from Alessandro Munge and our world-class design team
  • Competitive salary based on experience and industry standards
  • Flex work location & schedule
  • Extra time off during the annual end of year studio closure
  • Inspiring workspace with free parking
  • Access to a state-of-the-art gym
  • Healthy snack pantry
  • Competitive health benefit package
  • Open invitation to our regular team-building company events

QUALIFICATIONS - Required

  • Bachelor’s Degree or Diploma in Interior Design or Architecture
  • Minimum 5 years of project management experience in all phases of projects for high-end hospitality, private or multi-residential projects
  • Working knowledge of interior construction, drawings, and specifications
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Technical skills: able to communicate or clarify design intent by way of hand-sketch or 3D Sketchup
  • Ability to travel to Canadian and international projects

QUALIFICATIONS - Preferred

  • PMP Certification or equivalent
  • Demonstrated experience managing international projects
  • Bilingual and trilingual an asset

SOFTWARE SKILLS – High Proficiency

  • AutoCAD
  • Bluebeam Revu
  • Adobe Acrobat
  • Microsoft Office

SOFTWARE SKILLS – Knowledge of

  • Revit
  • Microsoft Project Software

Ready to join our team?


APPLY NOW!

title: Auxiliary Driver/Route Salesperson - Southwestern Ontario
description:
Are you looking to join one of Canada's Greatest Places to Work and be a part of making it even better?


Who we are:


Mister Safety Shoes is an Industry Leader who has been helping fit customers with the proper safety footwear and work clothing since 1972 and we are looking for an Auxiliary Driver/Route Salesperson to help service our clients in the Southwestern region of Ontario.


In this role, you will act as a backup to Mobile Footwear Consultants (MFC) by servicing the safety footwear needs of our corporate customers within a pre-defined territory.

We are looking for an individual who is passionate about service. Our Mobile Footwear Consultants are obsessed with providing the best service possible to each of their customers.

A successful candidate must be self driven, able to be a strong team player while working autonomously. You must also be flexible in terms of location. We service customers all over the province and are looking for someone who enjoys the ability to be on the road, and not tied to one location!


What we offer:


  • Benefits that are fully paid for by the company for all full-time employees.
  • 3-Weeks paid vacation for full-time employees.
  • Uncapped earning potential (base salary + commission)
  • We are closed on ALL statutory holidays – Including Boxing Day!
  • Complete training for the role, to set you up for success.
  • We invest in people and often promote from within.

Duties and responsibilities may include but not limited to:


Customer Service:

  • Successfully perform the Mister Safety Shoes Customer Service and POS standards while demonstrating professional etiquette through integrity, honesty, and respect.
  • Ensure customer concerns are dealt with effectively, promptly, and with the utmost consideration.
  • Build lasting relationships with corporate contacts, stay connected, and convey suggestions for improvement.

Operations:

  • Provide leave coverage for the Mobile Footwear Consultants.
  • Provide leave coverage for the company delivery truck in the GTA.
  • Develop proficiency in all operational policies and procedures.
  • Responsible for inventory counting, ordering, and stocking of new merchandise.
  • Accurately process sales and exchanges/refunds using the company’s POS system.
  • Responsible for the daily housekeeping of the Mobile.
  • Identify maintenance needs and communicate to Management for repair.
  • Protect company assets and minimize loss by following MSS policies and procedures.
  • Keep an accurate daily driving log that is in compliance with the Ministry of Transportation.
  • Perform a daily circle check of the truck while serving as an MFC, with no exceptions.

Qualifications:

  • Ability to periodically stay overnight in hotels up to 5 consecutive nights.
  • Previous customer service experience preferred.
  • Route Sales-Driving experience will be considered an asset.
  • A D-license will be required. MSS will assist in obtaining a license if required.
  • A clean driving abstract is required.
  • Must be able to lift 50lbs.
  • Ability to provide exceptional customer service to each individual client.
  • Demonstrates the ability to work well under pressure, handles multiple tasks, and performs duties with a sense of urgency.

Mister Safety Shoes has been named a Great Place to Work® and is proud to be a 2021 Best Workplaces™ in Canada in Retail and Hospitality.


We are an equal opportunity employer and positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates. If required, please include accommodation requirements with your submission.


Please note our company has implemented a set of precautionary procedures surrounding the COVID-19 outbreak.

title: Traveler Counselor
description:
Overview of Role:
The Traveler Counsellor role at GBT is to deliver exceptional travel service experience for our Corporate Business Customers. By working together as a high performing team, our Travel Counsellors provide exceptional traveler care, first call resolution and the highest quality of customer service to GBT corporate clients. It is a high touch service environment, where you will have true accountability for the service relationship and customer experience, by providing creative and timely travel solutions, using available tools and technology as needed, while maximizing supplier revenue.
The role will form part of a highly skilled team of Corporate Travel Counsellors located virtually from home, at one of our Business Travel Centers or on-site at client locations. The role will report to a Team Coach.
Key Responsibilities:
  • 7a-9p ET M-F are the core hours, and we do have other shifts that offer later hours and weekends.
  • Act as Travel Advisor and Consultant to a single or multiple Corporate Business accounts with the willingness to jump in and flexibility in shifts to meet client needs. Support other GBT work, including other GBT customers when directed to do so by GBT leadership.
  • Act as the point of sale on all Domestic & International travel requirements, arranging both routine and complex travel for air, rail, car, and Hotel accommodation, utilizing one or multiple Global Distribution Systems (GDS), Sabre, Apollo, Galileo, Amadeus.
  • Provide consultative advice, solutions and recommendations. Additionally, pro-actively selling additional service for our travelers (e.g. Hotel and Car), whilst ensuring adherence to the customers agreed travel policy and requirements
  • Complying with all legal standard requirements, which include mandatory training, compliance and sanctions
  • Deliver expectations on individual/shared team goals and support all business Key Performance Indicators. Proactively review your metrics to check on and improve performance
  • Follow internal compliance and regulatory requirements for all customers and locations supported
  • Manage the end-to-end booking process through the ticketing and order fulfillment, either over the telephone, via messaging or via email or back office systems and servicing platforms.
  • Operate in a telephony servicing environment where you are accountable to key performance indicators of success, such as customer satisfaction (CSAT), key productivity metrics (for example call adherence and call service metrics), and driving key partnerships and sale of preferred air and hotel partners
  • Operate in a Multi-Channel servicing environment where you are accountable to key performance indicators of success, such as customer satisfaction (CSAT), key productivity metrics (for example call adherence and call service metrics
  • GBT Operates 24 hour a day, 7 days a week, with variable shift opportunities for days, nights and weekends.
  • Use positive telephone service techniques; act on special customer requests and maintain excellent client relations
  • Meeting the servicing of your nominated account or clients travel requirements, whilst adhering to your nominated call schedule daily, and reporting any variances in the workforce management scheduling tool to your Team Coach
  • Coach, develop and mentor more junior Travel Counsellor colleagues in the team as needed
  • Express enthusiasm and energy within the organization and always act according to company ethics, values and Compliance guidelines.
Additional Accountabilities
  • Working phone, email or chat booking air, rail, hotel and car rental
  • Investigates/action Travel Counsellors reservations/PNR for ticketing, quality/accuracy, client escalations or lowest fare (e.g., CSI/CSR, Trailblazer)
Key Qualifications and Attributes:
  • Detailed understanding of fares and ticketing rules, for car, air, hotel travel
  • Knowledge and experience of:
    • Air, rail, hotel, car booking
    • Calculating and Processing exchanges
      • High proficiency in one or multiple GDS: Sabre, Apollo, Galileo, Amadeus
  • Experience working in a high touch service environment where performance is measured
  • Experience working in a team
  • Background in Business Travel, leisure or airline reservation required
  • Passion for Excellence in Client Service
  • Excellent Professional Communication – both written and verbal
  • Detail-oriented - ability to act with integrity, and deal sensitively with personal and confidential traveler information
  • Ability to research and resolve customer service and traveler issues independently and /or with supplier
  • Problem Solving, with a process improvement mindset
  • Able to work under pressure, with a sense of urgency while maintaining a professional rapport and multi-task, accepting and adapting to change quickly and professionally
  • Ability to positively influence team and peers
  • Learning agility and ability to act on constructive feedback
  • Possess a strong understanding of travel trends and industry best practices

Location
Canada - Virtual Location

It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals based on job-related qualifications and ability to perform a job, without regard to age, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, creed, national origin, disability, genetic information, veteran status, citizenship or marital status, and to maintain a non-discriminatory environment free from intimidation, harassment or bias based upon these grounds.

GBT Recruitment Privacy Statement

title: newFitness Instructor / Membership Sales Consultant
description:
JOIN OUR WINNING TEAM! EXPERIENCE THE REWARD OF HELPING OTHERS SUCCEED IN ACHIEVING THEIR HEALTH AND FITNESS GOALS!!

FLEXIBLE AVAILABILITY TO WORK A WIDE VARIETY OF SHIFTS INCLUDING DAYTIME, NIGHTS AND WEEKENDS IS A MUST.

The ideal candidate must have a strong passion and talent for Sales & Customer Service and Fitness. Experience in Personal Training, Digital Marketing & Graphic Design are strong assets.

You must be a quick learner with outstanding retention skills, maturity, professionalism, and a shining personality, with a passion for helping and improving the lives of others through fitness, and must not be camera-shy! Paid training will be provided to the right candidate. A Proven Track Record of Strong Sales Ability (preferably in commission-based sales) is a significant asset, as are Personal Training, Digital Marketing, Graphic Design, and Social Media Management experience. Please quote Reference #4552 in your application.

COVID-19 precautions:

  • Personal protective equipment provided or required
  • Plastic shield at work stations
  • Temperature screenings
  • Social distancing guidelines in place
  • Virtual meetings
  • Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

title: Senior Designer
description:
/DesignAgency is one of the most distinguished design studios in Canada and our services are widely sought after, with clients in more than 26 cities and 9 countries worldwide. Our global success is based on our high level of design excellence and our ability to create special environments through narratives developed with the client. Working for leading companies, developers and hospitality groups, our clients work directly with one or more of our partners, reflecting our belief that great design requires leadership, focus and commitment.

DesignAgency relies on the Senior Designer to carry out projects and elements of projects. This individual will be responsible for designing, directing, and coordinating hospitality, commercial / retail, and multi-unit residential with minimal direction and oversight. This person will also mentor and direct staff, and effectively manage client requests and relationships. A knowledge and interest in all aspects and categories of interior design is required, as well as a desire for professional growth and development.



Senior Designers report to the Team Lead and Design Director or Partners or others as assigned.

Roles and Responsibilities

Design

  • Conceive, design and execute projects of moderate-high complexity from proposal through concept, construction and closeout
  • Strive for design impact through innovative, thoughtful, and functional design.
  • Strive for efficiency and to reduce errors, and omissions.
  • Generate concept, schematic design, design development, construction documents, bidding & tender phases, programs, and working budgets.
  • Work with teams to develop interior materials & finish specifications
  • Coordinate all FF&E and interior architectural plans and finishes and products with the client and project consultants as necessary

Leadership

  • Contribute to the development of systems and processes for improved design, technical quality, and client service.
  • Create sound relationships with colleagues, clients, contractors, and suppliers, to promote repeat business.
  • Assist in the development of project goals, targets and schedules.
  • Direct and review design development, construction documents and shop drawings for content, accuracy, and overall design integrity.
  • Serve as primary contact for all sub-consultants, supporting the Design Directors and Partners.

Management

  • Use Ajera to deliver assignments on-time and on-budget.
  • Demonstrate excellent personal time management.
  • Focus on service delivery while monitoring the status of assigned project tasks against the project schedule and participate on quality reviews of projects
  • Mentor project designers and intermediate designers and interns in design practice, office standards and policies

Qualifications

  • College-level degree (interior design or related field)
  • 10 years of interior design experience with a wide selection of advanced and various sized interior design and/or architectural projects
  • Hotel and Food & Beverage design experience required
  • Ability to supervise and direct project teams with minimal oversight
  • Ability to mentor and direct staff
  • Knowledge of design resources and evidence of creative sourcing and creative problem solving
  • Strong client management skills and experience
  • High level of CAD or Revit proficiency
  • Skilled in In Design, Sketch Up, Illustrator, Photoshop, and hand sketching
  • Must be positive, team-oriented, flexible, and productive.
  • Knowledge of Ajera is beneficial
  • Multi-unit residential experience is preferred

Achievement of professional credentials such as NCIDQ and LEED will be taken into account in promotion and compensation decisions, and preparatory studies or test costs may be eligible for firm support.

The above declarations are not intended to be an all-inclusive list of the duties and responsibilities of the job described, nor are they intended to be such a listing of the skills and abilities required to do the job. Rather, they are intended only to describe the general nature of the job.

A portfolio is required as part of your application.

title: newMarketing Communications Manager
description:
Charity: Vancouver Chinatown Foundation
Reports to: Chief Operating Officer
Start Date: Immediate
Location: Vancouver, BC
Vancouver Chinatown Foundation
The Vancouver Chinatown Foundation is a registered charity founded in 2011 to honour a culture and community
established in Vancouver over 100 years ago and is dedicated to building a more resilient and inclusive community
by promoting the wellbeing of those in need while preserving Chinatown’s irreplaceable cultural heritage. We have a
vision of a prosperous, vibrant, and inclusive Chinatown, where people come to live, work, and play.
The Vancouver Chinatown Foundation’s efforts to revitalize this important neighbourhood are grounded on three
interconnected pillars: physical, commercial & cultural revitalization. There are a number of projects and initiatives that

support these pillars, including:
Chinatown Storytelling Centre
Foo Hung Curios gift shop at the Chinatown Storytelling Centre
Chinatown Vintage fashion boutique
58 West Hastings (an innovative, 231-unit social housing project in the DTES)
May Wah Hotel
Light Up Chinatown! (economic revitalization program culminating in an annual outdoor festival)
To learn more about any of these initiatives, we encourage you to visit: https://www.chinatownfoundation.org/ and
https://www.chinatownstorytellingcentre.org/.
Role Overview
We are seeking an experienced and passionate marketing communications manager that is excited to help bring the
Foundation’s mission to life. This position is best suited for an individual that thrives in a fast-paced environment, and
is able to adapt quickly. This position will play a critical role on our marketing team and will lead many diverse
projects and initiatives in the Foundation’s portfolio. Key responsibilities include developing and managing marketing
communications campaigns; setting social media channel strategies; and implementing digital and print
communications. You will report directly to the Foundation’s Chief Operating Officer, manage a marketing coordinator
and work in close collaboration with external consultants.
If you enjoy working with a collaborative and enthusiastic team, come join us!
Responsibilities
Recommend, develop, and manage marketing campaigns for the Foundation’s initiatives, with a focus
on the Chinatown Storytelling Centre and Foo Hung Curios; Light Up Chinatown!; and the Vancouver
Chinatown Foundation brand
Setting and implementing the Foundation’s digital channel strategies - social media channels (FB, IG,
TW, TT), email marketing, and blog
Oversee the Foundation’s communications and digital channels with support from the Marketing
Coordinator (content for social media; updates to websites and blogs; e-newsletters; copy development;
new releases; and print collateral)
Actively contribute to the overall marketing & communications strategy, and work with leadership team,
advisors, consultants, and other team members
Manage and coach a Marketing Coordinator, and effectively work with external graphic designers and
consultants by providing on-brand, actionable creative briefs; managing and coordinating the design
and distribution of publications and collateral (print, digital and video assets); and fostering productive
relationships
Work in conjunction with the Foundation event planner and provide marketing assistance as needed
Actively grow the Foundation’s brand and digital presence (social media and email databases)

Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in marketing, communications or related field
3 – 5 years of related marketing and communications experience
Experience in campaign, brand, event, email and social media marketing is an asset
Superior writing skills with a talent for storytelling; experience in editing copy and a proficiency for attention
to detail
Proven track record and experience in traditional and digital marketing (ie. social media, blog, SEO)
Exceptional project management skills and demonstrated experience in managing multiple projects with
proven ability to consistently meet tight deadlines
Demonstrated use of digital content creation (including written, graphical, or video format)
Graphic design and photography skills are an asset but are not required
Ability to accept feedback and directions, and work effectively under pressure
Knowledge and use of a CRM platform; experience with Wordpress would be considered an asset
Experience working in a community or non-profit organization would be considered an asset
Experience in supervising staff and ability to work independently and as part of a team
To apply, please submit a cover letter and your resume to careers@chinatownfoundation.org.
We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, colour, religion, national origin, sexual
orientation, age, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status.
We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for the position; however, only candidates
selected for interviews will be contacted.

title: Electrical Engineer
company: M & E Engineering Ltd., A Rimkus Company Careers...
description:
Overview:

M & E Engineering Ltd., A Rimkus Company (M&E) is a Consulting Engineering firm, specializing in Mechanical & Electrical designs for Commercial, Institutional, & High-Rise Residential Buildings. The professional staff at M & E Engineering have been completing designs, problem investigation, & building condition assessments for over 30 years on hundreds of buildings for our clients in Ontario, across Canada, US, and in Europe.

M&E has more than 40 employees including Professional Engineers, LEED Consultants, Designers, & Project Managers. Clients are provided with specific and comprehensive services from Detailed Designs in both the Mechanical & Electrical disciplines, Building Condition Assessments, Feasibility Studies, Energy Studies, LEED Certification, System Reviews, and Building System Designs from concept design through to final commissioning of projects. M&E designs for office & hotel buildings, condominium complexes & rental buildings, retail complexes, & institutional building. M&E specializes in Energy Savings Conversions and upgrades incorporating chiller & boiler designs upgrades to Building Automation systems, new lighting designs, & water savings conversions.

M&E designs plumbing retrofits for piping replacement, emergency generator compliance & fire alarm upgrades & replacement. M&E has completed building reviews for Building Condition Assessments for pre-purchase inspections, re-finance, to general reviews for budget purposes & capital planning.

Responsibilities:

The Electrical Engineering role reports directly to a principal within the company and will be responsible for projects and working with a team consisting of other Engineers and designers.

Requirements/Qualifications:

  • University degree from an Electrical Engineering (or related) program.
  • Licensed P.Eng (Registered with PEO)
  • Minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar / relevant position.
  • Educational background focusing on Electrical Engineering in building systems.
  • Working knowledge of AutoCAD, Outlook, Work, and Excel.
  • Knowledge of Electrical Systems and Designs for commercial, retail, and high-rise residential buildings.
  • Experience coordinating with disciplines internally as well as externally with Consultants /Architects.
  • Experience conducting and attending site visits, as well as preparing site reports.
  • Excellent command of the English language.
  • The selected candidate will be working in a professional and friendly environment.

How to Apply

Note that while all submissions will be reviewed, only those that are to be considered for an interview will be contacted.

IRC is an equal opportunity employer. Accommodation is available for applicants selected for an interview.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

  • Electrical engineering: 5 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • P.Eng (Registered with PEO) license (preferred)

title: Senior Architectural Technologist
description:
CICCOZZI ARCHITECTURE INC. IS LOOKING FOR A NEW SENIOR TECHNOLOGIST TO JOIN THE TEAM

Ciccozzi Architecture Inc. is an award winning architectural firm providing comprehensive and creative architec- tural services to an extensive list of private and corporate clients. Multi-family res-idential projects (townhomes to high-rise apartment towers), retail, commercial and mixed-use devel-opments make up the majority of our current work. We also offer vast experience in custom single-family homes, resort and hotel design, industrial and institutional work.

We offer a great work environment with friendly colleagues in an open-concept office. You will have the oppor- tunity to work on a wide variety of projects with opportunities for ongoing career development and growth.

RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS:

We are looking for a talented Senior Technologist to join our team. This position offers opportunities to further develop skills in client relationships, project management and team leadership. You will be involved in all aspects of a variety of projects types from the schematic design phase through to contract administration. You will have a leadership role in coordinating the project team, consultants and the client as well as liaising with authorities having jurisdiction to meet project objectives. You will also use your keen technical knowledge to produce detailed design and project documentation as well as mentor your technical team through the process.

  • A University degree in Architecture or Building Science/Architectural Technology Diploma (minimum 2 year program) – AIBC or eligible
  • At least 15 years of experience within an Architectural firm
  • Strong technical skills with the ability to translate design intent into construction detailing with high attention to detail.
  • Construction detailing, coordination and milestone drawing reviews.
  • Working knowledge of Specifications.
  • Experience in all aspects of Construction Contact Administration
  • The ability to manage and lead a team through a variety of complex projects simultaneously
  • Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal)
  • Well organized with effective delegation skills.
  • Ability to work well individually, as part of a team and as a team leader in a fast paced environment.
  • Knowledgeable of the BC Building Code
  • High level of proficiency with AutoCAD or Vectorworks

HOW TO APPLY

Email your resume to hr@ciccozziarchitecture.com. Include a resume, references, cover letter, and samples of work/portfolio. Only qualified candidates will be contacted for in person interviews.

title: Leasing & Marketing Manager (Residential)
description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join an innovative, global real estate company who builds communities and connects people to exceptional places? If so, we would love to tell you our story.

At Oxford, our culture is truly one of a kind. Across business lines and around the world, we embrace the complex and tackle opportunities with speed and agility. We are ambitious and humble, forward looking and service-focused. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live. We believe that what is good for the environment is good for business. Together we deliver exceptional experiences to our over 2 million daily customers.

L’objectif de la gestion immobilière multirésidentielle du Groupe Oxford Properties est d’offrir une expérience client unique qui se différencie des autres dans ce secteur, par la poursuite inlassable de la satisfaction optimale du client, l’innovation en marketing, la location, le professionnalisme du personnel, l’utilisation de la technologie et les opérations immobilières.

La fonction principale du responsable de la location et du marketing (résidentiel) est de maximiser les revenus et de minimiser les pertes d'occupation. Pour accomplir ces tâches, cette personne doit gérer et diriger une équipe de professionnels de la vente qui se concentrent sur la prospection, la pénétration et la saturation des comptes à la recherche de logements meublés et non meublés de plus de 30 nuits à court et à long terme. En outre, le/la responsable de la location et du marketing sera en charge de l'élaboration et de l'exécution de stratégies de location novatrices et de la planification stratégique pour La Cité. Cela inclut des programmes visant à générer un trafic maximal par le développement d'initiatives de marketing.

Une attitude positive dans un environnement d'apprentissage est essentielle, et la participation à des ateliers/séminaires de formation et de développement de l'entreprise sera nécessaire pour un développement continu.

----
The objective of Oxford Properties Group multi-residential property management is to provide a unique, industry-differentiating customer experience, through the relentless pursuit of superior customer satisfaction, innovation in marketing, leasing, staff professionalism, technology utilization, and property operations.

The primary function of the Leasing & Marketing Manager - Residential is to maximize revenue and to minimize vacancy loss. This is achieved by managing and directing a team of sales professionals focused on prospecting, penetrating and saturating accounts in search of 30 plus night short-term and long-term Furnished and Unfurnished suites accommodation needs. In addition, the LMM will be responsible and accountable for the development and execution of innovative leasing strategies and strategic planning for LaCite. This includes programs to drive maximum traffic through the development of marketing initiatives.

A positive attitude within a learning environment is essential, and participation in company training and development workshops/seminars will be necessary for continued development.

RESPONSABILITÉS

Services à la clientèle :
S'assurer que tout le personnel de location offre un excellent service à la clientèle aux résidents actuels et potentiels.
Élaborer, administrer et surveiller les programmes de location, en fournissant à l'équipe de gestion un retour d'information ainsi que des renseignements et des résultats clés sur les clients.
Maintenir un objectif global d'amélioration de l'expérience client.
Encourager une forte culture de service à la clientèle parmi tout le personnel.

Gestion :
Le/la responsable de la location et du marketing est chargé(e) de la productivité et de l'efficacité globales de l'équipe de vente afin d'atteindre les objectifs de vente. Cela comprend la planification des ventes, l'établissement de rapports, la fixation et la gestion des quotas, l'optimisation des processus de vente, la formation à la vente, ainsi que le recrutement et la sélection de l'équipe de vente.
Aider à l'établissement et à la mise en œuvre d'un budget marketing/de location détaillé.
Coordonner les horaires du personnel de location afin de s'assurer que le bureau de location soit doté de personnel pendant toutes les heures d'ouverture.
Assister la direction des opérations dans l'exécution et la documentation des inspections mensuelles des sites et des logements vacants. Effectuer un suivi régulier pour s'assurer que tous les éléments défectueux identifiés soient traités en temps opportun.
Contrôler de manière proactive la conformité aux normes requises et s'efforcer de maintenir des niveaux élevés de qualité, de précision et de cohérence des processus dans les efforts de l'équipe de vente.
S'assurer que tous les objectifs de vente sont assignés en temps opportun.
Identifier de manière proactive les possibilités d'amélioration des processus de vente.
Surveiller l'exactitude et la distribution efficace des rapports sur le trafic des ventes, des enquêtes mystères, des études de marché et d'autres renseignements essentiels aux ventes.
Recommander des révisions aux rapports existants ou aider à l'élaboration de nouveaux outils de rapport, selon les besoins.
Diriger et soutenir la mise en œuvre cohérente du programme d'incitation à la vente et fournir une assistance à l'administration en fonction des besoins.
Responsable de la mise en œuvre ponctuelle des objectifs de performance de l'équipe de vente.
Participer à l'élaboration et à l'exécution du plan stratégique visant à atteindre les objectifs de vente et à élargir la clientèle de l'entreprise.
Embaucher, encadrer et développer les conseillers/conseillères en location ou tout personnel effectuant des tâches de location. Identifier les points forts et les possibilités de développement des coéquipiers et travailler à l'établissement de plans de développement de carrière, y compris l'apprentissage sur le tas, les possibilités de projets, les cours externes et les séminaires.
Montrer l'exemple en respectant la vision, l'objectif, les valeurs et la culture de l'entreprise.
Inspecter régulièrement les suites dans le cadre du programme d'assurance qualité.
Participer à des projets spéciaux de temps à autre, selon les directives du superviseur.

Marketing et location :
Aider à l'élaboration et à la mise en œuvre du plan de marketing annuel.
Aider à l'élaboration et à la mise en œuvre de stratégies médiatiques, y compris les annonces sur Internet et dans la presse écrite (structure et placement), le site Web et la signalisation. Soutenir le département marketing et location du siège social dans le développement de la créativité pour les campagnes de marketing et d'impression.
Chargé de rechercher, d'identifier et de développer des contacts pour attirer de nouvelles entreprises ou de nouveaux résidents à La Cité et de les transmettre à l'équipe de vente pour le suivi.
Répondre aux demandes de renseignements, aux commentaires, aux plaintes et aux préoccupations des résidents potentiels en temps opportun et de manière professionnelle, en veillant à différencier Oxford Résidentiel sur le marché ou en prenant des mesures correctives, le cas échéant, pour améliorer les processus ou les performances du personnel.
Communiquer efficacement la proposition de valeur par le biais de propositions et de présentations.
Encourager les rendez-vous ou les visites avec tous les clients potentiels.
Établir et maintenir des relations solides et durables avec les clients.
Qualifier les résidents potentiels pour déterminer leurs besoins et leurs aptitudes.
Organiser des visites avec les résidents potentiels.
Négocier les baux pour obtenir une valeur optimale.
Favoriser activement les programmes de recommandation.
Gestion des comptes. Contacter les clients tout au long de l'année pour s'assurer que leurs besoins sont satisfaits.
Réviser les tarifs de location et les incitations pour refléter les conditions actuelles du marché et les disponibilités futures.
Élaborer et coordonner tout événement spécial de location ou promotion.
Réaliser ou coordonner des études de marché mensuelles et avoir une connaissance approfondie des propriétés concurrentes et des conditions actuelles du marché..

EXIGENCES
Capacité à travailler de manière indépendante avec un horaire flexible
Minimum de 2 ans d'expérience dans le marché hôtelier à long terme à un poste de supervision.
Une passion pour l'excellence dans la prestation de services aux clients.
Une formation postsecondaire est préférable.
Compétences exceptionnelles en communication écrite et orale.
Solides compétences interpersonnelles.
Maîtrise parfaite des produits MS Office : Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Souci du détail; capacité à résoudre des problèmes en utilisant des faits, un raisonnement solide et du bon sens.
Autonome, faisant preuve d'un haut degré d'initiative, de créativité et de flexibilité.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Customer Service:
  • Ensure all leasing staff provides excellent customer service to current and prospective residents.
  • Develop, administer, and monitor leasing programs, providing feedback and key customer insights/results to the management team.
  • Maintain an overall focus on enhancing the customer experience.
  • Foster a strong customer service culture amongst all staff.
Management:
  • The Leasing & Marketing Manager is responsible for the overall productivity and effectiveness of the sales team in order to meet the sales objectives. This includes sales planning, reporting, quota setting and management, sales process optimization, sales training, and recruiting and selection of the sales team.
  • Assist with the establishment and implementation of a detailed marketing/leasing budget.
  • Coordinate leasing staff hours to ensure that the leasing office is staffed during all hours of operation.
  • Assist The Operations Management with the performance and documentation of monthly site and vacant suite inspections. Routinely follow up to ensure all deficient items identified are addressed in timely manner.
  • Proactively monitors compliance with required standards and strives to maintain high levels of quality, accuracy, and process consistency in the sales team's efforts.
  • Works to ensure all sales objectives are assigned in a timely fashion.
  • Proactively identifies opportunities for sales process improvement.
  • Monitors the accuracy and efficient distribution of sales traffic reports, mystery shops, market survey’s and other intelligence essential to sales.
  • Recommends revisions to existing reports, or assists in the development of new reporting tools as needed.
  • Directs and supports the consistent implementation of the sales incentive program and provides assistance with the administration on an as-needed basis
  • Accountable for the on-time implementation of sales team's performance objectives.
  • Participates in the development and execution of the strategic plan to achieve sales targets and to expand the company’s customer base.
  • Hire, coach and develop Leasing Consultants and/or any personnel completing leasing duties. Identify strengths and development opportunities of teammates, and work to establish career development plans including on-the-job learning and project opportunities, external courses, and seminars.
  • Lead by example, demonstrating attention to the company vision, purpose, values and culture.
  • Regularly inspect suites as part of the quality assurance program.
  • Participate in special projects from time-to-time as assigned by the supervisor.
Marketing and Leasing:
  • Assist with the development and implementation of the annual marketing plan.
  • Assist with the development and implementation of media strategies, including internet and print ads (structure and placement), website, and signage. Support Head Office’s Marketing and Leasing Department in developing creative for marketing and print campaigns.
  • Responsible to research, identify, and develop contacts to attract new companies or residents to LaCite and forward to the sales team for follow up.
  • Respond to potential resident inquiries, feedback, complaints and concerns in a timely and professional manner with attention to differentiating Oxford Residential in the marketplace or with attention to corrective action where required to improve process and/or staff performance.
  • Effectively communicate the value proposition through proposals and presentations.
  • Encourage appointments or viewings with all prospects.
  • Build and maintain strong, long-lasting customer relationships.
  • Qualify prospective residents to determine their needs and suitability.
  • Conduct viewings with prospective residents.
  • Negotiate leases to achieve optimum value.
  • Actively promote referral programs.
  • Account management. Contact clients throughout the year to ensure their needs are being met.
  • Review rental rates and incentives to reflect current market conditions and future availability.
  • Develop and co-ordinate any special leasing events and/or promotions.
  • Conduct and or coordinate monthly market surveys and have a thorough understanding of competing properties and current market conditions.
REQUIREMENTS
  • The ability to work independently with a flexible schedule
  • Minimum 2 years’ experience in the “Extended Stay” hotel market at a supervisory capacity.
  • A passion for excellence in customer service delivery.
  • Post Secondary education preferred.
  • Exceptional written and oral communication skills.
  • Strong interpersonal skills.
  • Strong command of MS Office products: Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
  • Detail-oriented; able to resolve problems using facts, sound reasoning and common sense.
  • Self starter with high degree of initiative, creativity and flexibility.
Our story:
Oxford Properties Group (“Oxford”) is a leading global real estate investor, asset manager and business builder. It builds, buys and grows defined real estate operating business with world-class management teams. Established in 1960, Oxford and its portfolio companies manage approximately C$70 billion of assets across four continents on behalf of their investment partners. Oxford’s owned portfolio encompasses office, logistics, retail, multifamily residential, life sciences and hotels; it spans more than 150 million square feet in global gateway cities and high-growth hubs. A thematic investor with a committed source of capital, Oxford invests in properties, portfolios, development sites, debt, securities and real estate businesses across the risk-reward spectrum. Together with its portfolio companies, Oxford is one of the world’s most active developers with over 100 projects currently underway globally across all major asset classes. Oxford is owned by OMERS, the Canadian defined benefit pension plan for Ontario's municipal employees.

For more information on Oxford, visit www.oxfordproperties.com

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

Vaccination Policy

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.
