title: newSenior Interior Designer - Hospitality & Multi-Residential
description:
SENIOR INTERIOR DESIGNER - HOSPITALITY & MULTI-RESIDENTIAL


Do you love to tell stories through design? Can you develop abstract ideas and turn them into a new reality?

Are you inspired by the people, places, and things that surround you?

Have you thought about the opportunity to grow yourself as a design leader and mentor?


At Studio Munge, we bring spaces to life for many of the world’s most iconic luxury brands and sophisticated clientele. Our environments are holistically experiential, immersive, and thoughtfully curated thanks to an ever-expanding scope of work, including architecture, landscaping, interior, and product design. Closely mentored by Alessandro Munge, our award-winning multidisciplinary collective has created a global reputation through vibrant, purposeful, and narrative-driven designs.


Today, we are looking for an experienced Senior Interior Designer specialising in Multi-Residential or Hospitality to join our quickly growing team.


This multi-faceted position relies on your creativity and leadership to drive international projects of a large scale from design concept and narrative phases to construction, ensuring all aspects of the project meet and exceed our innovation and quality standards. As a Senior Designer, you will be relied on to clearly communicate, mentor and be proactive in collaborating with your team and client base alike; including the strong ability to interpret directives from our Principal and Team Lead’s vision into a comprehensive design. In addition to managing your own deliverables, you will also mentor Intermediate and Junior designers encouraging their overall skill and development.


We’re seeking an inspiring and passionate individual with accomplished talent to lead multiple luxury hospitality or residential projects. By our side, your exciting projects could include five-star properties and brands such as EDITION, Nobu, ARIA and The Bellagio resorts in Las Vegas, multiple Pendry hotels and residences in the US, two Ritz-Carlton, two CURIO Collection hotels and more boutique luxury projects around the world.


Learn more about our design philosophy and if this sounds like a great way to express your multiple talents, join Alessandro and our dynamic collective in designing a better world, one space at a time.


RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Create, develop, and execute innovative design concepts from start to finish, that are impactful and aligned with the intended purpose and project design strategy
  • Improving SM design procedures and liaising with the team and management.
  • Lead, manage and carry out multiple complex projects of varying stages of completion from concept to construction within schedule.
  • Allocating resources and assisting in hiring when new resources are required. Forecasting required resources.
  • Facilitate training and onboarding of new members of staff and the ongoing development of junior/ intermediate designers through supportive mentorship.
  • Establish trusting relationships with clients through successful management of expectations and requests, consistent communication, and captivating deliverables and presentations.
  • Consulting with clients about project programming and feasibility. Assisting with drafting ASPs and communicating to clients, getting sign off.
  • Understand contracts and ensure SM is following the scope for deliverables and billing. Ensuring billing is completed on time every month.
  • Understanding project schedule and team schedule

BENEFITS

  • Direct mentorship from Alessandro Munge and our world-class design team
  • Competitive salary based on experience and industry standards
  • Flex work location & schedule
  • Extra time off during the annual end of year studio closure
  • Inspiring workspace with free parking
  • Access to a state-of-the-art gym
  • Healthy snack pantry
  • Competitive health benefit package
  • Open invitation to our regular team-building company events

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s Degree or Diploma in Interior Design or equivalent
  • Minimum 8 years of experience with multi-unit residential or large scale hospitality projects.
  • Accustomed to working in a fast‐paced, deadline-oriented environment
  • Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills with internal colleagues, and external clients, consultants, and suppliers
  • Excellent design, time and priority management through a high skill-set in scheduling and resource management. Practising proactive measures where possible.
  • Resourceful, curious, inspired and creative
  • Able to clearly express concepts in three dimensions through 3D modelling or freehand sketching
  • Well-versed with current global laws and regulations pertinent to the standard practices of interior design
  • Strong comprehension of FF&E; capable of working with in-house FF&E specialists

SOFTWARE SKILLS

  • AutoCAD
  • Revit
  • SketchUp
  • Adobe Creative Cloud (Photoshop, In-Design, Acrobat, Illustrator)
  • Autodesk Architecture
  • Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)

Ready to join? Apply today!

title: Regional Director of Finance
description:
The Regional Director of Finance is responsible for implementing, directing and evaluating a sound infrastructure to ensure that the financial operations and activities of assigned hotels are conducted in compliance with applicable policies, standards and procedures. In addition, the incumbent must ensure that adequate controls are in place to safeguard the assets of the organization. The work includes the timely and successful implementation of automated accounting systems and the re-engineering of existing ways of doing business to facilitate improvement in productivity and key financial indicators (i.e. EBITDA). This position serves as the key conduit for corporate/hotel/ownership communications with regards to financial matters.

Here are some of the key responsibilities of the role:

  • Establish, coordinate and administer an adequate plan for the control of operations within a select portfolio of hotels. This plan would provide profit planning, sales forecasts, expense budgets, capital requirement/needs, cost standards and the necessary procedures for effecting the plan.
  • Ensure hotels formulate local accounting policy, coordinate systems and procedures and prepare operating data and special reports as required to compare performance with operating plans and standards and to report and interpret the results of operations to all levels of management and ownership (where applicable) to ensure timely information is provided in order to maximize profits.
  • Act as a financial consultant; provide information on the financial impact of business decisions for all segments of management responsible for policy or action concerning any phase of the business that relates to attainment of objectives, effectiveness of policies and organization structure and procedures.
  • Be involved in tax audits and assist in coordinating the responses to governmental agencies when necessary.
  • Ensure hotels compliance with hotel and accounting policies and procedures, legal requirements and contractual obligations (including obligations under a management agreement) utilizing internal controls, auditing and security procedures to ensure deviations are brought to the attention of the General Manager and appropriate regional management and to protect the hotel's assets.
  • Work with transitional teams for on-boarding and off-boarding of properties ensuring smooth, thorough and accurate hotel transitions.
  • Supervise Directors of Finance/Accounting personnel within assigned hotels, in collaboration with General Managers.
  • Ensure compliance with Crescent internal controls as per established procedures, and interface with the Internal Audit department to foster a cooperative atmosphere between management and Internal Audit.
  • Establish, implement, enforce and evaluate policies and procedures designed to achieve company, operational goals, and legal requirements.
  • Review and monitor hotels’ annual plans for deviations from approved plans. Communicate with VP of Operations and VP of Hotel Finance all significant deviations from business plan(s) and recommend proper disposition of actions.
  • Monitor hotels’ revenues/expenses and ensure the accurate recording as per Crescent established guidelines.
  • Embrace a continuous growth environment by actively assisting in recruiting, reviewing, recommending and maintaining an inventory of Directors of Finance, Assistant Directors of Finance, Accounting Managers, and other managers for the organization.
  • Continually focus on training and development programs for accounting associates to cultivate the “brightest” and “best” talent within the industry.
  • Ensure coordination with VP of Operations on all communication with ownership regarding financial issues such as actual results, budgets, forecasts, cash-flow and capital recommendations.

Here is what we are looking for in an ideal candidate:

  • A minimum of 10 years of related progressive experience in hotel accounting or related field; or a 4-year university degree with an Accounting/Finance concentration and a minimum of 5 years of related progressive experience; or a 2-year college degree and a minimum of 8 years of related progressive experience.
  • Previous 3rd party management company experience preferred.
  • Must be proficient in Windows, Excel, Word for Windows and PowerPoint.
  • Proficiency in one or more back-office and front office systems is recommended.
  • Must be able to clearly convey information and ideas including complex or technical issues, orally and in writing.
  • Must be effective in handling problems in the workplace, including anticipating, preventing, identifying and solving problems as necessary.
  • Must have the ability to assimilate complex information, data, etc., from disparate sources and consider, adjust or modify to meet the constraints of the particular need.
  • Must be effective at listening to, understanding, and clarifying the concerns and issues raised by co-workers and guests.
  • Ability to travel to assigned hotels as required.

This is a remote based opportunity, and may be located in any province within Canada. Depending on location, flexibility with hours of work may be required to adapt to time zones of assigned hotel locations.

title: SENIOR INTERIOR DESIGNER & PROJECT MANAGER
description:
WHO WE ARE:

Life House is a venture-backed, vertically integrated hotel brand, operator and technology company. We develop, design, and operate boutique lifestyle hotels with a mission to make travel more meaningful and reliable for travelers, and to make hotels more seamless and more profitable for owners. We recently raised our Series C and are experiencing exciting growth! We are looking for great talent to join our award winning in-house design team.


THE ROLE:

We are looking for a Senior Interior Designer & Project Manager to manage the interior design execution of upcoming Life House branded properties as well as independently branded hotels and restaurants. The Senior Interior Designer & Project Manager will be responsible for leading the interior design of multiple projects, making sure the design meets budget, brand guidelines, client and operational needs. This role works closely with our internal Creative, Development, Procurement, Operations and F&B team to ensure success. This person will be able to represent the Design team while interfacing with clients and external consultants.


OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE:

  • A storyteller. You have an ability to make something worth far more than its elements by connecting your audience to its origin and meaning. Our hotels are more than a place to sleep. Our design details don’t just look aesthetically pretty, there are deeply rooted stories there. The designer is able to breathe life into a property with a compelling and authentic story.
  • Organized. In building scalable systems and managing projects you are able to manage highly interdependent, complex tasks and keep various work streams on track (ideally with Asana)
  • Ambitious. You are eager to make an impact, not just clock in and out. You thrive in a fast-moving, dynamic, hyper-growth start-up environment and are able to adapt accordingly.
  • Tastemaker. You are excited about designing in the Life House aesthetic as well as understanding the client’s vision for independent brands.
  • Meticulous attention to detail.

WHAT YOU’LL DO:

  • Produce Schematic Design packages. Oversee 3D rendering production, source materials, specify FF&E and design custom furniture and millwork. Create programming, test fits, and furniture plans for guestrooms and public spaces
  • Produce Design Documentation. Oversee drawing production and redline with attention to detail and knowledge of construction, furniture manufacturing, and ADA guidelines, etc.
  • Oversee Construction Administration including value engineering, redlining shop drawings, working closely with in-house procurement and development teams
  • Ensure project milestones are met in a timely manner

REQUIREMENTS:

  • 7+ years in Hospitality Interior Design
  • Experience designing hotels and restaurants from concept through development.
  • Experience working with tight budgets and timelines
  • Experience managing relationships with clients and vendors
  • Excellent Photoshop, InDesign, and AutoCAD skills
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills

Please email your portfolio & resume via the application form.

title: Intermediate Hydrogeology Specialist
description:
Location

Calgary, AB

Description

Hatfield has been awarded BC’s Top Employers for 2022 and we’re looking for more outstanding people to join our team! We do interesting and meaningful work with opportunities for career and professional growth. We also offer a competitive compensation package, flexible work hours, vacation allowances, and comprehensive health benefits including extended health coverage, an employee and family assistance program, and a RRSP matching plan.

Hatfield Consultants is seeking a highly motivated Intermediate Hydrogeology Specialist to become part of our growing Water Resources team and provide field, technical, and project coordination support for the implementation of hydrogeology, surface water and climate monitoring components of Hatfield’s energy, oil and gas, mining, and infrastructure projects in Alberta. The position is full-time permanent and would be a combination of office and fieldwork, based out of our Calgary office with frequent travel to Fort McMurray and other remote locations in western Canada. Start date is negotiable.

Responsibilities:

  • Plan and coordinate remote field programs, assist with resource scheduling and project management.
  • Prepare for, lead and/or participate in field programs required for hydrogeologic data collection and monitoring programs. When in the field, support the mentoring of junior staff with regard to data collection and monitoring activities.
  • Ensure equipment is maintained and calibrated to meet operational and field requirements.
  • Interact with a multidisciplinary team to assess potential project-related and/or climate change-related impacts on water resources and environmental values. This may include supporting the coordination and/or implementation of other water resource (e.g., water quality, climate, aquatic, fish, construction) monitoring programs.
  • Compile, manage and assess hydrogeologic, water use, water quality, and other environmental data.
  • Support ongoing data management (e.g., review of near-real-time telemetry data) and reporting (e.g., Draft technical reports and data summaries).

Education and Experience:

Mandatory requirements for this position include:

  • B.Sc. or technical diploma in natural/environmental sciences or engineering with some prior formal training (e.g., coursework) in geology and hydrogeology.
  • Appropriate qualifications for work in Alberta and British Columbia, and a valid Canadian driver’s license.
  • Excellent communication (verbal and written – including technical, scientific writing) skills.
  • Experience and interest in field work. This position will be based in Calgary, but will have frequent travel to remote locations, for various durations, based out of hotels and camps.
  • Experience and interest in data compilation and analysis.

Prior experience with the following is considered an asset for this position:

  • Field investigation and monitoring programs, focussed on hydrogeological programs.
  • Familiarity and comfort with remote site work including oil sands properties in Alberta
  • Project coordination, field project management, project management
  • Some prior formal training (e.g., coursework) in related environmental fields, such as hydrology, climate science, physical geography, biology or chemistry.
  • Other field experience, such as construction monitoring, hydrology monitoring, climate station monitoring and environmental effects monitoring etc.

Hatfield is committed to employment equity and workplace diversity. We strive for equity, inclusiveness and diversity, irrespective of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression or disability.

To apply, please submit your cover letter and CV describing your experience and salary expectations in confidence through the online form or email: resumes@hatfieldgroup.catsone.com (no phone calls please). Please indicate “CGY Hydrogeology” in your subject line. Due to the volume of applicants, only short-listed candidates will be notified but we will retain your resume for any future openings.

title: Corporate Sr. Travel Advisor
description:
Sr Corporate Travel Advisor

If working at a highly regarded corporate travel management company and offering exceptional service to high-profile clients sounds exciting, then we would like to hear from you.
We are recognized for ‘doing whatever it takes’ for our corporate clientele. We exceed industry standards in terms of service and ability in the most difficult and unexpected circumstances, consistently exceeding client expectations.

Position Overview

As a Senior Corporate Travel Consultant at Direct Travel, you will be working in a collaborative team environment that caters to our long-standing and new corporate clients.

Responsibilities

  • Managing all aspects of client travel reservations.
  • Developing creative solutions to serve client needs.
  • Keeping up to date with industry developments.
  • Fulfilling complex and unusual travel requests.
  • Reviews all reservations for travel policy and procedure compliance
  • Advising clients on lowest fare and routing option
  • Ensures that all reservation files pass quality control prior to ticket issuance
  • Follows all policy and procedures as outlined in the training manual
  • Provides quality service to each corporate client
  • Supports preferred vendor agreements
  • Responsible for developing relationships with travel arrangers and travelers
  • Callbacks to clients; Updating profiles
  • Researching client needs or special requests when required
  • Supporting team members with client requests

*
Expectations*

  • Strong knowledge of domestic and international corporate travel, international fare construction, and airline routings.
  • Ability to act with absolute discretion.
  • Able to work business hours Monday to Friday, with a willingness to occasionally work other hours as needed.

Preferred Qualifications

*
Minimum 2 years experience as a corporate travel advisor

  • Travel School Graduate preferred
  • Experience with Domestic, Transborder, and International reservations
  • Hands-on Car/ Hotel reservation knowledge
  • Extensive experience on designated team GDS
  • Excellent customer service ability
  • Excellent attention to detail and accuracy
  • Strong communications techniques
  • Problem solver and ability to think ‘outside the box’ for customers
  • Team player
  • Ability to be flexible and multi-task

Direct Travel is an EOE/AA/Veteran/People with Disabilities employer.
*
About Direct Travel*

Our growing company relies on excellence to deliver on our commitments to our customers. This starts with our employees. Our inclusive culture encourages entrepreneurial spirit empowering employees to build strong, long-lasting relationships with our clients and deliver innovative solutions. Direct Travel is one of the most respected Travel Management Companies in the industry providing our customers with smart consultation, tailored solutions and a true partnership. Our specific focus on the mid-market means our travel experts deliver personalized service to every client.

Additionally, Direct Travel offers full-service performance improvement solutions, including meeting and event management, group incentive travel and individual recognition solutions through its wholly-owned subsidiary Creative Group, Inc. An industry leader, Creative Group has been honored with the CMI 25 Award, which recognizes the top 25 most influential meeting and incentive management companies in the US each year since the award’s inception in 2007. The company is headquartered in Schaumburg, Illinois and maintains offices in Detroit, Appleton, San Francisco and Toronto. For more information about Creative Group, please visit www.creativegroupinc.com.

Together we will help our clients Navigate Their Way and Create Truly Moving Experiences. For more information, visit www.dt.com. Follow us on Twitter, YouTube and LinkedIn.

Job Type: Full-time

title: VP, Cruise
description:
Company Description


Founded in 2006, Kensington Tours is a $170 million privately held company that has been rapidly growing for the past few years. We are a multi-award-winning luxury tour operator offering tailor-made, private-guided experiences to the world’s most extraordinary destinations. Anchored by an industry-leading team of 150+ destination specialists, we deliver curated travel experiences for the most discerning clients. The success of Kensington Tours has been its ability to provide customized tours for each and every client in a market with increasingly sophisticated consumer knowledge and a heightened search for “authenticity of experience.” We do this with our pioneering technology platform that allows the company to connect tour experts all over the world into a single, streamlined database and booking engine.

Our tours consist of local hotels, private guides, airport transfers, transport between cities, and special experiences (e.g., hot air balloon ride). Our Procurement team finds destination management companies (DMC) around the world who provide these services, or they source them directly. The Product team curates these product components and then weaves them together into itineraries that span varying price levels and themes.

Kensington strives to surprise and delight at every turn with authentic, extraordinary, and unexpected experiences. Our brand promise - to create the experience that changes the life.


Job Description


Ideally based in Toronto, the Vice President, Cruise at Kensington Tours will be responsible for sales and product leadership for a newly created Cruise division. This includes defining the business strategy, building a sales team and expanding Kensington’s unique cruise product offering. Managing end-to-end sales operations processes including training, technology, client experience and employee engagement is also integral to the role.

The ideal candidate will have proven experience in the cruise industry and a combination of visionary leadership, sales management, operations strategy development and execution, a strong metrics/data driven orientation. The ability to create and lead high performing teams within a nimble, entrepreneurial environment is a must. The successful candidate is a leader who can tap into their people’s individual motivation, who leads by example and who models the behaviour needed to create success in his/her team. They will have proven experience in assessing the development needs required by the organization and the know-how to implement an efficient multi-phased sales program for both in-house and remote consultants. They will be a “process builder’, with the ability to transition between high-level visions and detail-oriented execution and have had success at translating business vision into action for aggressive growth.

Product and Marketing

  • Define the product and partner strategy.
  • Partner with Marketing to develop marketing plans for multi-channel (direct and agent) customers.
  • Work with the Product team to set the product direction and itinerary design.
  • Partner with Procurement on sourcing preferred cruise partners and pricing.

People:

  • Ability to motivate and drive profitable sales growth.
  • Lead the recruitment and training process for cruise specialists and other support staff.
  • Achieve sales training objectives by developing, implementing, and managing ongoing sales training programs that enable staff to achieve their potential and drive productivity, quality, employee engagement, satisfaction, and retention results.
  • Collaborate with our Learning & Development team in the development and implementation of sales and training budgets, performance metrics, KPI’s and targets aligned to sales, productivity, quality, and customer service standards.
  • Define an oversee incentive programs that motivate the sales team to achieve their sales targets.

Clients/Partners:

  • Accountable for Net Promoter Score response rate and results and sharing results with our partner network to support insight sharing, issue management & problem resolution to drive efficiencies and improve the end-to-end customer experience.
  • Analyze customer feedback from various sources to quickly identify opportunities for improvement with the development of a project plan/roadmap for achievement.
  • Lead and drive a customer focused culture, in collaboration with other key functional partners, to drive efficiencies and improve customer experience.
  • Collaborate with various stakeholder groups (i.e., Learning & Development, Product & Procurement) to develop customer-centric and relevant training solutions for both the Sales and Customer Care Teams that meet business and operational needs and standards.
  • Communicate Operations updates effectively with the sales floor via weekly and monthly updates, internal newsletters, and Sales meetings.
  • Work with our partners to support capability building, best practice, and standards implementation, strengthen two-way communication, collaboration and deliver a consistent brand experience across the network.

Process:

  • Use NPS and other customer feedback to gain insights on how to improve the customer experience and ensure the overall effectiveness of the team with the goal of driving innovation and continuous improvement.
  • Provide leadership for problem resolution/issue management, analyzing and providing solutions.
  • Work closely with multi-level customer contacts (sales team, vendor partners, client, agent) to answer questions, resolve problems and recommend corrective actions where needed to address escalated situations.
  • Ensure processes and systems are in place to effectively manage the operational details.

Technology:

  • Work with the technology platform director to develop a product roadmap to optimize performance for Destination Experts, Operations team, and external partners.
  • Work with Technology and Marketing to map the customer lifecycle journey and to personalize the client experience based on repeat traveler information.

Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree and associated industry or related business experience.
  • 15+ years of travel sales operations management experience in the cruise industry with demonstrated ability to drive revenue growth, streamline operations and improve profitability.
  • 10+ years in a management role leading cross-functional teams. Ability to collaborate and enable teams to work toward a common goal, both internally and externally.
  • Industry experience with luxury and bespoke travel product and their associated markets an asset.
  • Experience in a premium/luxury service business. Ability to bring a clear sense of style and brand consistency to our premium and luxury product.
  • Demonstrated experience working with key industry suppliers (Hotel chains/Cruise/Airlines) and an understanding of the Tours Market/Specialist Travel/Luxury Travel space is an asset.
  • Outstanding research and analytical capabilities.
  • Strong project management mindset and is hyper organized in approach in delivering and managing operations.
  • Demonstrated ability to think strategically yet maintain contact with day-to-day performance. Hands on with high energy, an entrepreneurial spirit, and a positive attitude.
  • Excellent communication skills.

Additional Information


Cultural Fit – people like working here if they:

  • Thrive working in a KPI driven organization.
  • Have an entrepreneurial mindset.
  • Learn from what’s working and not working.
  • Build trust and work maturely through conflict both upwards and downward.

We know our success is dependent on the people who join our team, which is why we recruit the best. Our team is made up of owners; people who are smart, low ego, and who are accountable for their results. We all play a part in the success of the company and are proud of what we do.

We thank all candidates for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

We are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If you require accommodation due to a disability at any stage of our hiring process, please advise us when completing your application.

title: SENIOR MANAGER OF PROPERTIES
description:
Elliot Lake Retirement Living is seeking applicants for the position of:

SENIOR MANAGER OF PROPERTIES

About Elliot Lake Retirement Living (ELRL)

ELRL is a premier provider of rental housing in the picturesque City of Elliot Lake, ON. ELRL owns and operates 1,375 residential rental units including houses, townhouses and apartments spread throughout the community of Elliot Lake, a 52-room hotel (Hampton Inn by Hilton Elliot Lake) and operates an 18-hole championship golf course (Golf Stone Ridge at Elliot Lake).

ELRL is a significant economic driver in the City of Elliot Lake and is responsible for attracting retirees from all over the Province of Ontario to live an active and affordable retirement. Not to be mistaken for retirement homes, all ELRL units are independent living properties and are rented to both retirees and non-retirees.

The Position

ELRL currently has an opening for a senior manager responsible for the organization’s Property Group. This manager reports directly to the General Manager.

This is a dynamic position which plays a critical role in the success of the community’s ability to be one of Canada’s premier destinations for affordable retirement living.

The Property Manager has a typical staff of 34, of which 23 work all year and the remaining 11 are seasonal. He/She can rely on three Supervisors to direct, supervise and co-ordinate activities of all staff in the Property Group.

This can be a rewarding position for someone who understands building science, property maintenance and wants to make a difference in the organization and community of Elliot Lake.

Job Functions

General Duties

  • The development and implementation of housing improvement programs
  • The delivery of excellent customer satisfaction and quality assurance
  • Creating and implementing annual business plans, budgets, and capital plans
  • Negotiating service contracts, purchasing materials and inventory control
  • Establish property standards and monitor adherence to standards
  • Ensuring properties are safe for occupants and guests,
  • Liaising with contractors, officials, and co-workers
  • Ensure ELRL adheres to all regulations and legislations
  • Participate in management and strategy planning sessions

Regulatory

The Property Manager along with other managers are responsible for ensuring ELRL and its employees, contractors and vendors comply with all applicable legislations and regulations, including but not limited to:

  • Ontario Residential Tenancies Act (RTA)
  • Ontario Health and Safety Act (OHSA)
  • Employment Standards Act (ESA)
  • Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA)
  • Fire Protection and Prevention Act (FPPA)
  • City of Elliot Lake Bylaws and Official Plan
  • Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA)
  • Ontario Human Rights Code (OHRC)

Regular verification of building logs, paperwork, and inspections are conducted to ensure compliance with all applicable legislations and ELRL policies and procedures.

Human Resources and Supervision

Management of employees in the Property Group fall under the authority of the Property Management. HR and supervisory responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Preparation of job postings in co-ordination with HR Co-ordinator
  • Preparation and regular review of job descriptions
  • Review expectations with employees regarding quality, production capacity and timelines
  • Perform annual review of job performance for direct reports
  • Provide input and approval of performance reviews for non-direct reports
  • Investigate concerns and/or complaints of employees and contractors who may not be following established policies and procedures
  • Establish work schedules and provide priority input as required
  • Ensure employees are working safely and in accordance with provincial legislations at all times
  • Maintain personnel records
  • Prepare onboarding plans for all new hires in the department
  • Prepare performance improvement and training plans for employees in the department
  • Investigate and attempt to resolve workplace conflicts and problems

Business Plans and Budgets

ELRL prepares annual business plans and budgets for presentation to the Board of Directors. Once approved these plans are implemented accordingly. Any significant deviation from the plan must be approved by the General Manager. With a large portion of the annual operating and capital budgets invested in the operation and maintenance of the properties, the Property Manager is a key participant in the preparation of the plans and budgets. Specifically, the Property Manager is responsible for:

  • Planning and managing the departments capital and operations budget
  • Participate in discussions regarding budget and business plans
  • Regularly review business plan goals and targets and adapt to changing circumstances to ensure overall operating and capital budgets are adhered to.
  • Monitor spending monthly, identify any budget variances and solutions for ensuring targets are met

Capital Planning

The Property Manager is responsible for all capital planning for the rental properties, office building and hotel.

  • Engage building assessment consultants and professionals through an RFP process to review elements of multi-unit and commercial buildings to determine condition of buildings and recommend 10-to-20-year capital investment requirements
  • Develop short-term, mid-term and long-term capital plans based on ELRL’s anticipated annual surplus and financial capacity
  • Identify annual capital requirements using established criteria for prioritization
  • Develop an annual business review of capital spending and provide the GM with annual capital requirements
  • Implement and monitor approved capital budget to ensure spending aligns with approved capital allowance
  • Ensure building systems including life-safety features, roofs, windows, doors, elevators, walls, structures, HVAC, electrical and plumbing are inspected annually or as required by professional consultants to identify any changes in condition

Supply and Contract Management

ELRL regularly enters contracts for the provision of maintenance services, consulting services, and capital projects. The Property Manager is responsible for contract management for all property related services and projects.

  • Procures materials, supplies, vendors, contractors for the provision of services, materials, and capital projects
  • Identifies qualified contractors for projects and develop business to business relationships with contractors
  • Prepares RFPs for the provision of consulting services
  • Participate in the design and development of technical projects and works with consultants to prepare tender documents and specifications and construction and service contracts
  • Negotiates pricing and contracts with suppliers for the provision and delivery of materials and supplies
  • Reviews bids and quotes to ensure accuracy, thoroughness and compliance with specifications, and tender documents.
  • Co-ordinate the inspection of work performed by contractors for compliance with drawings, specifications, quality, and timelines
  • Oversee warehouse operations to ensure materials are on hand when required and other Supply Chain Management processes
  • Oversee the management of warehouse operations

Property Repairs and Maintenance

  • Inspects properties on a weekly basis to identify any deficiencies and safety concerns and take immediate actions to prevent equipment and structural failures, and ensure the safety of tenants, employees, and the general public.
  • Issue work orders and purchase orders for the repair and maintenance of the properties
  • Co-ordinate the implementation of repairs, maintenance and renovations carried out on buildings and monitor progress and cost of work
  • Monitors the progress towards completion of work orders and purchase orders and works with staff and contractors to complete work in accordance with ELRL standards
  • Review work completed by staff and contracts to assess quality of the workmanship and adherence to ELRL safety practices
  • Examines drawings, specifications, and layouts for the provision of installations and repairs
  • Engage professionals for advice and problem solving as required
  • Implement and monitor schedules and procedures for safety inspections and preventative maintenance programs
  • Develop and implement plans for improving properties on both the interior and exterior of the sites
  • Arrange for cleaning, snow removal and landscaping services
  • Manage pest control services and ensure proper education of tenants
  • Monitor and manage utility consumption at properties and develop plans to reduce overall consumption
  • Implement Asbestos Management Program
  • Arrange for security and alarm system services to ensure compliance with regulations and safe building operations
  • Direct the maintenance and repair of machinery and equipment for electrical and mechanical systems
  • Oversee the unit make ready process to ensure minimal turnover time between vacancy and new tenant occupancy
  • Maintain records of property maintenance and improvements
  • Develop and implement risk management and accessibility programs.

Tenant Relations

ELRL recognizes the importance of customer satisfaction. The Property Manager is expected to deliver excellent customer service and ensure all staff in his/her department also do so.

  • Engage in dialogue with customers to resolve any issues of concern, including maintenance requests, unit modifications, disturbances, pets, and other complaints
  • Enforce the terms of the landlord’s lease agreement
  • Perform unit inspections
  • Ensure ELRL and tenant are following all terms of the lease, and applicable legislation and regulations
  • Initiate and/or respond to Landlord and Tenant Board applications
  • Participate in Landlord and Tenant Board hearings
  • Correspond with tenants for information, compliance, education, and notification purposes
  • Initiate and participate in tenant and staff appreciation efforts
  • Maintain records of customer interactions and resolutions

Business Development and Strategy

The Property Manager is a senior manager in the organization. He/she is expected to be an active participant in all discussions regarding the direction and improvement of business operations.

  • Prepare for and participate in regularly scheduled management meetings
  • Investigate and recommend actions to improve customer service, property maintenance, production, and employee satisfaction.
  • Participate in corporate events
  • Develop and implement Quality Assurance standards for properties, unit make ready and customer service
  • Identify staffing requirements
  • Identify capital requirements
  • Prepare presentations and recommendations regarding capital and operational spending which identify costs and benefits

Who Should Apply and Qualifications?

We recognize that successful managers possess a combination of knowledge, experience, and education. Our requirements below are our guidelines. They are not meant to discourage applicants from applying but to establish a base criterion for assessment of all applicants.

  • A minimum of 5 years management experience in a production, operations, project management or property management position.
  • Formal education in management, engineering, skilled trades, or other relevant field of study.
  • Proficient with Microsoft suite of programs, iOS,
  • Exceptional customer service skills
  • Demonstrated communication skills both oral and written
  • Experience in contract management, tendering, working with consultants
  • Experience in budget preparation and management
  • Experience in capital planning
  • People management

Why Apply

If you are an outgoing individual who loves the outdoors, Elliot Lake is a great place to live and work. If you possess the desire to improve the quality of life for your fellow citizens, you can do that at ELRL. The ideal Property Manager is driven to succeed and takes pride in accomplishing goals.

ELRL offers a comprehensive compensation package including a competitive wage, a benefit package which includes life insurance, health, dental and vision care, a defined contribution pension plan, performance-based incentives, and the pleasure of working with a fantastic group of people.

How to Apply

Submit your resume and the name of three references by 1:00 pm on Tuesday May 3rd, 2022. Submissions can be made electronically to:

Carole Amond

HR Co-ordinator

Elliot Lake Retirement Living

289 Highway 108 N

Elliot Lake, ON P5A 2S9

We thank you for your interest. All qualified applicants will be considered; however, only those chosen for an interview will be contacted.

ELRL is committed to ensuring equal access and participation for people with disabilities. Assistance and accommodation may be available during the application and hiring processes.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Application deadline: 2022-05-03
Expected start date: 2022-07-04

title: Technical Designer / AutoCAD Technologist
description:
Our Studio:

Ste. Marie is an internationally engaged Vancouver based creative strategy consultancy and interior design studio dedicated to realizing inspired and conceptually driven projects. We work with like-minded partners and clients to develop concepts and create spaces that are relevant, mindful and unique.

Ste. Marie treats design like a tool which we use to tell the story of a project and to service the market. Our process of research and discovery is disciplined and not overlooked as we believe that if the strategic thinking of a project is sound and we have good insight into the competition, foresee trends, understand the guests desires, needs and habits accurately, we can create an offer that is aligned with what the market demands. Coupled with strong technical execution and precise and thorough coordination, we consistently achieve well positioned and designed spaces.

Qualities we expect in a Technical Designer / AutoCAD Technologist:

Ste Marie Art + Design is seeking to fill the role of INTERMEDIATE TECHNICAL DESIGNER / AUTOCAD TECHNOLOGIST with an individual who is inspired and motivated to support senior staff in achieving completed projects with well-executed design. We seek an individual who understands through discipline, technical strengths, communication and motivation that they will reach a high level of professional accomplishment. As a Technician, this individual should have a clear ability to communicate verbally and through technical drawings. Note, this is not an Interior Designer role.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Minimum 3 years experience as an AutoCAD technician
  • Experience within Multi-Family Residential, Food & Beverage, Hotel & Hospitality and/or Retail Design sectors
  • Proficiency in Sketchup, Adobe Creative Suite, V-Ray, Podium considered an asset
  • Experience with Apple iOS, Numbers and Pages considered an asset
  • Strong technical detailing and project production skills
  • Working knowledge of local building codes and bylaws and a demonstrated understanding of building technology and materials
  • Strong understanding of construction and millwork joinery practices
  • 1-2 years of Interior Design contract administration experience
  • Completion of a certified Building Technology or Architectural program at a professionally recognized institution.
  • Have excellent English language written and spoken communication skills
  • Resourceful, pro-active and a lateral thinker
  • Organized and disciplined, in order to create accurate and complete schedules and drawings
  • Attention to detail and exceptional co-ordination skills
  • Ability to stay on task and effectively manage time in order to work independently on projects as assigned
  • Ability to evaluate and openly communicate workload and support needs within the Studio setting
  • Ability to collaborate within a team setting & to take direction from fellow team members
  • Must be able to read, create, understand and translate technical drawings at a high level
  • Passionate about design and motivated to execute compelling and thoughtful projects
  • Understanding and ability to fluidly maintain drawing standards, X-ref's, layer states, etc.

RESPONSIBILITES:

  • Work closely with Team Director, Principal Project Lead & Design team in all technical areas of a project.
  • Interpret and understand project briefs and conceptual design to create comprehensive drawings, schedules & specifications.
  • Assist with design development to conform with local construction details, materials, and processes.
  • Assist to create comprehensive Drawing Packages, including Coordination/Review, Tender sets, and all final Construction Documents.
  • Assist to complete all Specifications and Schedules.
  • Assist to complete all renderings, sketch-up, 3-D, and models when relevant.
  • Demonstrate knowledge of procedures for production of design developments and construction documents, perform non-typical and complex drafting assignments requiring application of standardized drawing techniques.
  • Understand and follow strict internal procedures regarding drawing standards, document creation and issuance, purchasing and account tracking.
  • Conduct field verification and site visits as required
  • Correspond with clients, consultants, contractors and trades as required to organize and administer projects to support Project Lead and Principal Project lead as per Ste Marie workflow process
  • Shop Drawing Review as directed by other team members
  • Ability to work independently with advice as needed from Management and Design team

Salary is dependent on level of experience and skill set of candidate.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $52,000.00-$65,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • Paid time off
  • Store discount
  • Wellness program
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Vancouver, BC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

  • AutoCAD: 3 years (required)
  • Interior Design or Architectural practice: 3 years (required)
  • Full-time drafting: 3 years (required)
  • Multi-Family Res, F&B, Hotel, or Retail design sector: 3 years (required)

Language:

  • English fluently (required)

title: CAD Manager / Technical Design Manager
description:
Our Studio:

Ste. Marie is an internationally engaged Vancouver based creative strategy consultancy and interior design studio dedicated to realizing inspired and conceptually driven projects. We work with like-minded partners and clients to develop concepts and create spaces that are relevant, mindful and unique.

Ste. Marie treats design like a tool which we use to tell the story of a project and to service the market. Our process of research and discovery is disciplined and not overlooked as we believe that if the strategic thinking of a project is sound and we have good insight into the competition, foresee trends, understand the guests desires, needs and habits accurately, we can create an offer that is aligned with what the market demands. Coupled with strong technical execution and precise and thorough coordination, we consistently achieve well positioned and designed spaces.

Qualities we expect in a Technical Design Manager / CAD Manager: Ste Marie Art + Design is seeking to fill the role of Technical Design Manager with an individual who is inspired and motivated to support senior staff in achieving lead a team to exceptionally well-executed design. We seek an individual who understands through discipline, technical strengths, communication and motivation that they will reach a high level of professional accomplishment. Individuals working within our Studio should have a strong yearning to learn about their field through the process of inquiry and research, and a potential to translate that learning through to project execution. As a Technician Design Manager, this individual should have a clear ability to lead a team, communicate well verbally and through technical drawing standards. Note, this is a leadership position.

Reports To: Team Director

Qualifications:

  • 7+ Years AutoCAD Technician experience
  • Proficiency in Sketchup, Adobe Creative Suite, V-Ray, Podium considered an asset
  • Experience with Apple iOS, Numbers and Pages considered an asset
  • Strong technical detailing and project production skills
  • Working knowledge of local building codes and bylaws and a demonstrated understanding of building technology and materials
  • Strong understanding of construction and millwork joinery practices
  • 5+ years of Interior Design contract administration experience
  • Completion of a certified Building Technology or Architectural program at a professionally recognized institution.
  • 4+ Years of prior management and/or teaching experience
  • Have excellent English language written and spoken communication skills
  • Resourceful, pro-active and a lateral thinker
  • Organized and disciplined, in order to create accurate and complete schedules and drawings
  • Attention to detail and exceptional co-ordination skills
  • Ability to stay on task and effectively manage time in order to work independently on projects as assigned
  • Ability to evaluate and openly communicate workload and support needs within the Studio setting
  • Ability to collaborate within a team setting & to take direction from fellow team members
  • Ability to lead a team and adapt to unique skill sets, personalities and approaches to ensure
  • Must be able to read, create, understand and translate technical drawings at a high level
  • Passionate about design and motivated to execute compelling and thoughtful projects

Responsibilities:

  • Autonomously lead the internal Technical Design team, providing leadership and development to CAD tech team members on a regular and ongoing basis, to not only improve quality, consistency and standardization of output but also training, developing and providing vision to junior members to strive for continual professional improvement
  • Manage and oversee all Internal CAD and Design Tech Team and External Contractors deployed to CAD and technical design deliverables, reviewing each set prior to issuance, ensuring high quality output and Ste Marie standards are consistently met
  • Provide CAD and design standards training to new team members regularly as well as during new team member onboarding
  • Develop, implement and enforce standardization, maintain CAD library and optimize areas of efficiency with in CAD and drawings standards, identifying ways to simplify and improve on a regular basis, ensuring operational efficiencies are achieve in training, support and integration
  • Monitor and assess the company’s ongoing design production capabilities, working with Team Director to adjust resources accordingly when required
  • Work closely with Team Director, Principal Project Lead & Design team in all technical areas of a project
  • Interpret and understand project briefs and conceptual design to create comprehensive drawings, presentations, schedules & specifications.
  • Assist with design development to conform with local construction details, materials, and processes.
  • Assist to create comprehensive Drawing Packages, including Coordination/Review, Tender sets, and all final Construction Documents, leading and providing support for plotting and electronic file submissions
  • Act as Contract Administrator for ongoing projects, collaborating with Design Lead and Team Director to ensure all aspects of the Contract Administration phase are followed, well-supported and understood
  • Understand and follow strict internal procedures regarding drawing standards, document creation and issuance, purchasing and account tracking.
  • Conduct field verification and site visits as required
  • Correspond with clients, consultants, contractors and trades as required to organize and administer projects to support Project Lead and Principal Project lead as per Ste Marie workflow process
  • Shop Drawing Review as directed by other team members

Salary is dependent on level of experience and skill set of candidate.

This description reflects the core activities of the role but is not intended to be all-inclusive and other duties may be required in addition to changes in the emphasis of duties as required from time to time. There is a requirement for the candidate to recognize this and adopt a flexible approach to work. Job descriptions will be reviewed regularly and where necessary revised in accordance with organizational needs. Any major changes will be discussed with the candidate.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $60,000.00-$75,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • Paid time off
  • Store discount
  • Wellness program
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Vancouver, BC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

  • AutoCAD: 7 years (required)
  • Interior Design or Architectural practice: 7 years (required)
  • Full-time drafting: 7 years (required)
  • Leadership: 4 years (required)
  • Multi-Res, F&B, Hotel design sector (confirm on CV): 7 years (required)

Language:

  • English fluently (required)

title: Project Manager - High Rise Construction
description:
At Claridge Homes, we are dedicated to quality and craftsmanship without compromise. Established in 1986 and located in Ottawa, ON, we pride ourselves on providing a healthy, diverse, and balanced work environment. Working with a team of over 250 full-time employees, top contractors and professionals, we have grown to become Ottawa’s largest land developer with residential communities, condos, retirement communities & the Andaz hotel in our portfolio!
Our team is an invaluable part of our business, and we show it every day. We promote inclusion, balance and diversity and encourage the development of the skills and abilities of our employees supporting them in all areas of their personal and professional development.
Join our innovative, passionate and dedicated team of highly regarded professionals and help us build the future of Ottawa together.

We are currently seeking Full Time High-Rise Project Manager to join our growing High-Rise construction team. This role will be taking on a new project in the City of Ottawa.

Reporting to the COO, we are looking for a candidate with the following to work on a new exciting project in Ottawa from ground-breaking start-up to completion:

Responsibilities:
  • Overseeing and managing all aspects of construction projects from conception to completion
  • Review project plans and specifications and comment on building design, scheduling, possible cost saving measures and potential construction problems
  • Create, monitor, and maintain the project construction schedule.
  • Create project budgets and estimates for the owner and develop and implement construction strategies.
  • Conduct meetings with the consultant team to develop the project drawings and specifications to meet the requirements of the owner throughout the permit and project construction process.
  • Submit city permit plans and specifications to city for application and coordinate with city, consultants, and owner for complete building permit review and approval process.
  • Conduct meetings and work closely with the site superintendent, project coordinator, consultants, and trades to ensure timelines, budgets, standards of the construction project are met from start to finish.
  • Maintain records of purchase and change orders for accounting department with assistance of the project coordinator.
  • Maintain project site instructions, change orders, and CCN’s for the duration of the project with the assistance of the project coordinator.
  • Prepare tendering scopes of work documents for subcontractor and supplier pricing based on construction drawings and documents
  • Negotiate with contractors and suppliers to obtain the best price and delivery schedule. Assist in selecting subcontractors and supplier and the terms of the contracts.
  • Monitor site safety and ensure safety requirements are met.
  • Review monthly progress draws and invoices from subcontractors.
  • Ensure final closeout documents, as-built drawings and specifications are prepared on an ongoing basis by trades and consultants for final close-out
  • Ensure final project deficiencies are created and implemented for final completion with assistance of site staff.
Education and Experience:
  • A university degree in civil engineering or a college diploma in construction technology.
  • 7+ years of experience in the construction industry, including experience in high rise construction.
  • Extensive experience in the construction industry may substitute for post-secondary education requirements.
  • Professional engineering status or construction trade certification would be an asset.
Claridge Homes is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer. Please advise in advance if you require any accommodation during the application or selection process. Any information you send us will be handled professionally, respectfully and in complete confidence.

While we thank all candidates for their interest, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

Assist in selecting subcontractors and supplier and the terms of the contracts.']

title: Intermediate Technologist
description:
CICCOZZI ARCHITECTURE INC. IS LOOKING FOR A NEW INTERMEDIATE TECHNOLOGIST TO JOIN THE TEAM

Ciccozzi Architecture Inc. is a mid sized architectural firm located in downtown Vancouver, BC. Our work covers a range of project types including Multi Family Residential, Mixed Use and Commercial.

The firm is growing, and we are now seeking talented, dedicated individuals to join our team on existing and upcoming projects including office towers, hotel, high rise, mid rise and townhouse residential projects as well as commercial and industrial projects.

We are currently looking for a Intermediate Technologist with a minimum 3+ years of experience to join our team.

The ideal candidate is a self-motivated professional with experience in the preparation of development and building permit application drawings, issuing for construction documentation, assisting with compliance checks and calculations, and consultant co-ordination along with general project support.

We require a person with strong communication skills and an ability to work with a team in residential and mixed-use projects. We offer a great work environment with friendly colleagues in an open-concept office. You will have the opportunity to work on a variety of projects with opportunities for ongoing career development and growth.

RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS:

  • A degree or diploma in architectural or building technology from an accredited institution
  • Minimum three years of work experience
  • Experiences in preparation of design and construction drawings, as well as documents as directed by Project Managers
  • Competence in coordination with design consultants
  • Contract administration and Field Review experience is an asset
  • Knowledge in the current versions of REVIT, AutoCAD and VectorWorks
  • Familiarity with MS Office, SketchUp and Adobe Creative Suite is an asset
  • Ability to work well with a team and independently
  • Knowledgeable of the BC Building Code
  • Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal)
  • Working knowledge of Specifications
Ciccozzi Architecture provides an open and collaborative teamwork environment with a potential for professional growth. A competitive salary and benefits package is available corresponding to qualifications and experience. Interested and qualified individuals are invited to submit their resumes to:

HOW TO APPLY

Submit your resume and portfolio in confidence by email (pdf please) to hr@ciccozziarchitecture.com indicating the position you are applying for in the “Subject” line.

We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls and drop-ins please.

title: Paint Truck Driver (DZ Licence)
description:
As a Paint Truck Driver, You Will:

  • Promote, lead, and execute a Safety-First culture for all employees, sub-contractors, and consultants in compliance with Miller Health, Safety and Environment (HSE) polices and contractual HSE obligation for the staff and public are met
  • Operate pavement marking trucks
  • Operate forklifts and loaders
  • Load/unload materials
  • Lay out and pre-mark on new and existing asphalt
  • Set up/take down traffic control, as per OTM book7
  • Maintain accurate documentation – driver logs, fuel records, time sheets and daily work logs
  • Book hotels, organize materials, plan daily routes and track inventory
  • Liaison with MTO and other clients
  • Other duties as assigned

What You'll Bring:

  • Class D commercial license with air brake endorsement (Z)
  • Previous experience operating highway line-striping trucks, an asset
  • Previous mechanical experience with the ability to perform minor repairs on equipment, considered an asset
  • Flexibility and organizational skills to multitask and manage time in a fast-paced environment with rapidly shifting priorities
  • Ability to perform manual labour and lift up to 50 pounds
  • Excellent team player to work productively in a highly functional team
  • Willingness to learn and appreciate Miller Values - safety, quality and integrity so we can continue “Building Greatness”
  • Willingness to work assigned shifts, including days, nights or weekends as required
  • Ability to travel with extended stays, when required

Job Type: Temporary

title: Project Coordinator
description:
The Project Coordinator is an important member of Nunastar's tight-knit team based in Edmonton, Alberta. Nunastar is the Arctic's premium hotel, residential, and commercial real estate developer. Each year Nunastar undertakes many projects, ranging from construction of new buildings to large and small renovations of our existing properties. As the Coordinator, you are instrumental in bringing these projects to fruition.

The Coordinator position should contribute a strong understanding of mechanical design, contract administration, and project management to add to the existing expertise Nunastar has on the architetectural, project management, development, and management aspects of the real estate business. The Coordinator will also have a significant role in the design and operation of the mechanical systems of our assets, which combined include over seven hundred hotel and residential units as well as commercial spaces.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Manage architects, engineers, and interior designers
  • Discuss the operational needs and priorities with our property management team
  • Propose options for the best systems, seeking advice and approvals from Nunastar's executives and clients
  • Summarize and present information to senior management for discussion and decision
  • Assess environmental, design alternatives, and construction risks associated with each project
  • Analyze and coordinate plans and drawings from all disciplines, highlighting any possible risks or problems
  • Work with the finance team for cost-benefit analyses, risk analyses, and ROI calculations to determine project feasibility
  • Value engineer throughout the design process to ensure budgets, ROI objectives and building performance objectives are achieved
  • Manage via a project plan for each project
  • Implement tender process, provide recommendations to management on bids and contracts, and finalize construction/renovation contract agreements
  • Review submissions, value engineer, negotiate and complete purchases
  • Source and purchase owner supplied items for construction projects
  • Manage project activities throughout the life cycle of the project
  • Act as the primary liaison with major contractors
  • Visit project construction sites to review progress, inspect work, troubleshoot, and gather design parameters and input project design and renovations
  • Manage completion requests, tenant occupancy dates, and project close-out meetings and dates
  • Manage project transition from contractor to in-house building operation team
  • Conduct project post-mortems to identify areas for improvement; make recommendations based on findings
  • Manage small projects alongside the building operations team
  • Support operations team with technical insights as well as planning and coordination activities
  • Ensure all company, safety, client, and project policies, procedures, and standards are followed
  • Ensure projects meet or exceed all planning, development, regulatory, health and life safety requirements
Qualifications:
  • Training as Mechanical Engineering Technologist or Mechanical Engineer
  • 5-10 years of relevant industry working experience, preferably in contract administration and design
  • Experience in Northern Canada is an asset
  • Competence with AutoCAD and/or Revit. Strong general computer skills and experience with Microsoft Office
  • Experience with BIM systems is considered an asset
  • Experience in project coordination throughout the entire design and construction process, managing both consultants and contractors
  • Exceptional organization skills
  • A keen attention to details
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • High integrity and ethical standards
  • A collaborative nature to understand that the best outcomes result from asking the right questions
  • A highly disciplined and accountable approach to your work
  • A desire to be part of a close-knit team with a family feel. A love of community and making a difference

title: Senior Design Technologist
description:
Design Technologist

Basecamp Properties, Canmore

About Basecamp Property Management Ltd

Basecamp Property Management Ltd is a rapidly growing boutique chain of hotels based in Canmore, Banff, Golden and Revelstoke. We are a younger and energetic team driven by our values and providing our guests with an exceptional experience in a home away from home. We are continuously expanding to better serve the resort communities of the Rocky Mountains.

Position Overview

We require a full-time Design Technologist to provide support in the design of various industrial, commercial, and residential development projects. Duties will vary greatly from project to project. The select candidate would be expected to assist with designing schematic plans for preliminary site investigations to space programming; coordinating design and construction activities; and providing internal guidance in the technical aspects to optimize building and space program efficiencies. This position will work under the VP of Development and requires collaboration with the Real Estate, Construction, Finance teams as well as external teams and consulting partners.

Location: Canmore

Position: Full-time/Permanent

Shifts: 8-hour/ day 40 work week

Key Responsibilities

- Prepares and revises documentation in various architectural phases including site plans, floor plans, building elevations, building sections, and details, as required.
- Interprets and applies building codes and requirements of other regulatory agencies.
- Attends project coordination and meetings with internal team members and external partner consultants. Prepare agendas and minutes, as required.
- Work with internal and external sales team to support the development of marketing materials.
- Complete property research and due diligence reports, as required.
- Assist with preparation and coordination of planning applications, as required.
- Participate in value engineering and basic cost estimating exercises, as required.
- Collaborative design work and problem solving; graphic support; other duties as assigned.

Skills and Experience

- Experienced in all phases of architectural document production.
- General knowledge and application of accessibility codes and applicable building codes.
- General knowledge of building construction systems, means and methods, materials, and industry associated standards is expected.
- Able to check own work for accuracy and completeness and manage time to meet project budget and schedule.
- Interpret sketches, drawings, building program and other similar material.
- Attention to detail.
- Experience with interpreting zoning bylaws and applicable municipal policies as it relates to site/building design.
- Excellent communication and presentation skills (written and verbal).

Requirements

- Minimum of 5 years in a designing or architectural field in an intermediate level.
- Graduate from a recognized Architectural Technology Program
- Current knowledge of building codes, ordinances, and accessibility regulations in Alberta and British Columbia.
- Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and AutoCAD.
- Experience with Adobe Creative Suite and SketchUP an asset.
- Experience with providing graphic support, i.e. illustrative designs, cross-sections and 3D massing an asset.

Why Work for Us?

- We have a health benefits plan.
- Family and Friends discount at Basecamp.
- We offer competitive wages.
- Advancement opportunities in our growing company.
- We believe in working hard and having fun!

Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis.

COVID-19 considerations:

Please note that Basecamp Property Management Ltd. is a fully vaccinated workplace, all employees must be fully vaccinated or have a medical exemption.

Job Type: Full-time

We are continuously expanding to better serve the resort communities of the Rocky Mountains.']

title: Coordinator, Construction - Mississauga, ON
description:
PURPOSE

The Coordinator, Construction is responsible for directing, organizing and controlling project activities, under the direction of the Construction Manager (CM) to ensure achieve the predefined project objectives in terms of scope, time, quality and cost to ensure that contractual obligations are met at all times within the Hotel and Multi-residential portfolios.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Project Scheduling & Communication
    Attends client meetings and assists with the creation of project proposals, RFP’s and schedules to ensure the smooth completion of projects; liaises with property operations, consultants, and contractors, where necessary, to proactively address any disputes related to ongoing projects that may arise and to escalate complex issues to the Construction Manager for a resolution.
  • Contract Administration
    Creates, reviews and prepares contracts with third-party suppliers, construction companies and consultants required for various projects insuring that organizational policies and procedures established for competitive bidding and third-party selection processes are adhered to at all stages to achieve the best cost/benefit result for the organization; supports procurement, expediting and quality control activities of all required construction materials, equipment and services received to meet organizational standard for quality and process efficiency.
  • Tracking of Construction Projects Performance
    Uses project scheduling and control tools to monitor project plans, work hours, budgets and expenditures and reviews field inspection reports from Consultants throughout the lifecycle of the project. Analyzes and summarizes performances of current construction projects and forecasts the future performance to facilitate management access to reliable information when examining future plans for the development function.
  • Project Documentation
    Assists with the coordination and maintenance of all required documentation for projects resulting in the smooth coordination between Construction Projects and Operations and to ensure projects are delivered within scope and on time and on budget as well as meet project goals and organizational requirements; prepares completion certificates and ensures all project close out documents are obtained.
  • Project Payables
    Coordinates with the Project Accountant and Accounting groups to ensure the proper coding invoices and charge-backs as well as the tracking of purchase orders, invoices, change orders, and work orders in a proactive manner.
  • Vendor and Third Party Coordination
    Resolves major vendor, supplier, trade and other third-party related challenges pertaining to development project activities. Reconciles/processes all necessary vendor adjustments, as approved, to ensure development projects continue on time, budget and without interruption.
  • Support to Annual Budgeting and Internal Reporting
    Assists with the preparation of annual construction budgets, current year forecasts for all residential properties and provides quarterly updates on construction status, monthly expenditures and variance reports.

Any other job related duties and/or projects that may be assigned.

Minimum Requirements

Skills, Knowledge, Experience and Education

  • Degree or Diploma in Project/Construction Management, or Architectural Sciences, Civil Engineering
  • 3-5 years of experience supporting Construction Managers in the delivery of development projects
  • Proficient in MS Project and the MS Office Suite of products fieldwire, planswift
  • Proficient in the use of project/construction management software
  • Knowledge of the building development/redevelopment industry
  • Familiarity with construction methods and the building codes
  • Effective communication skills including verbal, written and presentation skills
  • Proven ability to work effectively both independently and in a team based environment
  • Demonstrated willingness to be flexible and adaptable to changing priorities
  • Strong multi-tasking and organizational skills
  • Required to travel to properties by use of own vehicle and some travel out of province.

Core Competencies

  • Excellent organizational skills
  • Strong negotiation skills
  • Strong communication skills both verbal and written
  • Good problem solving skills
  • Creative thinking.

Additional Requirements

  • Exposure to Yardi is an asset.

title: Sales Rep
description:
What we’re looking for:
Our busy small import dealership is accepting applications for the position of a professional Sales and Lease Consultant. Previous automotive sales experience is not necessary, and your lack of experience is preferred as we offer full training and a little different culture than the average car dealership.

You will be responsible for meeting and greeting clients, guiding test drives, and assisting our clients in their purchases while building your business and career.

Who we’re looking for:
Phenomenal customer service before anything else. Ambitious. Driven. Thrives in a competitive environment. These are words and terms that describe the kind of person we’re looking for. We’re not looking for average, we’re looking for excellence.

You’ll be joining an established and successful team of professional Sales Consultants, and we’re looking to build your career with us to heights you might not think are possible.

Who should apply:
You’d be surprised who can really make it in our industry. We have success stories with recent university and college grads of all kinds, hotel staff, restaurant employees (particularly waiters and waitresses), even home improvement and big box store employees. Basically, if customer service is a big drive for you and you live every day with a positive attitude, you might like what we have to offer. A valid driver’s license is the only must for now.

What we offer:
Complete onsite training will be provided

Competitive compensation packages. The average sales consultant can earn $40 000 per year. A good sales consultant can earn $60-70 000 per year. Top performers will earn $100 000+. We’re not looking for average.

A positive, customer focused culture of service and reputation before a car deal.

Honesty and integrity are our watchwords. You’ll never need to compromise your excellent ethical and moral standards.

Be a part of the team at a Platinum Member of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies. Platinum membership is awarded to an elite group of companies that have been awarded as one of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies for at least six consecutive years.

Unlimited growth potential. The Murray Automotive Group owns 30+ dealerships from White Rock, BC to Yarmouth, NS, and leadership is promoted from within. The sky is the limit for the right applicant.
