title: CHIL Intermediate Interior Designer
description:
Our Firm

CHIL Interior Design is the Hospitality Interior Design studio of B+H Architects. CHIL is a boutique studio with a specialization and focus on luxury hotels and high-end multi-family residential design. We are one studio within B+H – a global, award-winning, full-service design firm recognized for excellence in sustainable design, technical expertise and the delivery of complex, large-scale projects. A legacy of over 60 years of design innovation and problem solving has endowed B+H with a depth of knowledge, skill and agility that benefits each client we serve, wherever they are in the world.

With dedicated CHIL Interior Design studios in Vancouver, Hong Kong and Toronto we bid and work on hospitality projects around the world. With B+H studios, we are represented in Toronto, Vancouver, Calgary, Seattle, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Singapore, Ho Chi Minh City and Dubai.

We believe in the power of design to elevate people’s lives and we are committed to doing everything necessary to deliver environments that outperform our clients’ expectations, now and in the future.

Our Interiors Practice

With a history of over 45 years in hospitality design and more than 9 years as an important studio of the B+H practice, CHIL Interior Design has been providing high-quality design for our varied and prestigious clients.

A thriving standalone business with projects independent and distinct from our architectural practice, CHIL has been established with 3 global hospitality interior design studios in Vancouver, Toronto and Hong Kong, where we lead the creative aspects of all hospitality interior design. We develop unparalleled luxury hospitality and restaurant spaces for brands including Accor, Shangri-La, Fairmont, Marriott, Hilton, Hyatt and Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts. CHIL also creates leading edge residential design with projects built and in development in Vancouver, Toronto, Calgary, and Edmonton, as well as in Seattle, the Middle East and Southeast Asia.

CHIL Interior Design , as a specialty service offering within B+H, focuses on creating unparalleled hospitality experiences. CHIL lends the experienced hand of a highly specialized studio to B+H’s global interior design team. Partnership and respect across our global teams allows CHIL to deliver the best of both worlds: the tailored, collaborative approach of a specialized hospitality interior design studio with the resources and expertise of full-service architecture and design firm.

THIS OPPORTUNITY

CHIL Vancouver is looking for a highly motivated Intermediate Interior Designer to join our Interiors Practice focusing on hospitality design. As a CHIL Interior Designer you will be creative, the one who is driven by success, and embraces being part of a high performance, best-in-class team.

CHIL is looking for a strong team player able to work in fast-paced collaborative environment and interested in working for a diverse, multi-disciplinary, multi-sector, global reaching firm. The Intermediate Interior Designer will be able to effectively interact and collaborate with a broad range of service providers (architects, engineers, contractors, suppliers, regulators, etc.)

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Work with the team to produce compelling and informative presentations that exceed visual expectations.
  • Accompany senior colleagues to client meetings, being an effective presenter and representative.
  • Meet with clients to analyze their goals, needs and resources.
  • Effectively coordinate with local suppliers, project consultants, client representatives, and team members to deliver project milestones.
  • Provide space planning that accurately reflects the Program, functional requirements, and design considerations of the project, and meets all building code requirements.
  • Lead development of 2 and 3D design concepts, with emphasis on high quality renderings.
  • Support internal teams on a variety of projects to best service our other industry clients.
  • Research, gather, recommend, and present to the team appropriate finishes and furnishings that capture the functional, aesthetic, environmental and budgetary requirements of the project, understanding how texture, light, color and other factors interact to create an environment.
  • Prepare documentation for the selection, specification, procurement and installation of furnishings and equipment, including detailed layout drawings and schedules.
  • Produce Design Development & Contract Documents (plans, elevations, sections, details, and schedules) in ideally both AutoCAD and REVIT.
  • Produce and manage projects and schedules, with a Project Manager as needed, according to project size.
  • Understand the requirements of the plans, life safety issues, building codes and other technical aspects; knowledgeable in the areas of design, drawing and details, finishes and building materials, specifications, local codes, technical drawing, contract administration and business practices.
  • Assist with permit and bid applications as required.
  • Complete contract administration from tender through project close out with assistance from Project Manager and CA staff as required.
  • Mentor and train Junior interior designers and technicians.
  • Other duties as required.

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE

As a successful candidate you possess the following knowledge, experience, and skill set:

  • A degree or diploma from a CIDA accredited Interior Design program.
  • 5+ years’ experience working with a recognized Interior Design or Architectural firm
  • Attained your NCIDQ certification or in the process of completion.
  • Sound knowledge of AutoCAD, REVIT, Windows (Word, Excel, Project, PowerPoint) and a host of 3D graphic programs such as Sketch-up, Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, etc.
  • A solid portfolio of diverse creative projects with emphasis in Workplace, Corporate and Commercial design. Only use this for workplace position. Swap out workplace, corporate and commercial for hospitality, residential and F&B
  • Technically savvy, able to learn and master new programs and apps.
  • Proficient with REVIT, both as a planning and modelling (3D) tool – only for workplace position, swap out for CAD for hospitality designer.
  • Self-directed, able to work independently and know when to reach out for guidance and support.
  • Ready to receive and welcome coaching from supervisors and colleagues, assimilate feedback and learn quickly from it.
  • Armed with excellent time management and organizational skills.
  • Passionate in design, positive outlook, collaborative, and patient individual

If this is a role you are interested in, we’d love to hear from you.


Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at B+H. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

B+H Architects is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.

title: Site Superintendent - Toro - Site
description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

Established in 1979, Toro Aluminum has become a leader in the development and manufacturing of window walls and doors for high-rise condominiums, office buildings and hotels, across Canada, the United States, and Mexico.

JOB SUMMARY

The Site Superintendent will be accountable for overseeing all field operations in multiple construction projects. This role will be the driving force in ensuring our project plans are successfully completed as per design, budget, and schedule. This position will lead and coach the Site Coordinators while being responsible for safety and quality. The Site Superintendent is expected to spend a minimum of 85% of their workweek on the jobsite.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES

Health and Safety
  • Create and maintain a culture of Safety First, leading by example and holding our site teams and site partners accountable
  • Works with the Project Manager and Site Safety Manager to ensure implementation of Toro Aluminum’s safety program and adherence to all safety requirements
  • Work in partnership with Site Coordinators to ensure all on site safety standards are being met
Site Management
  • Oversee, direct, coach, train, and mentor direct and indirect reports on the Project team
  • Effectively communicates with Site teams and subcontractors to ensure that performance, productivity, quality, and safety requirements are met
  • Collaborates with the project team in finding solutions to potential problems, identifying risks, work interferences and schedule conflicts.
  • Work in partnership with clients and other site contractors to ensure all parties are aligned with the project requirements
  • Designs and implements recovery plan if required
  • Assists to create, maintain, and execute the project plan and schedule to ensure compliance with budget and quality
  • Reviews and understands the contract and subcontracts
  • Develops and maintain strong customer focused relationships with all stakeholders
  • Contributes to company initiatives
  • Other duties as required
As the Site Superintendent, you will play a key role in modelling and recognizing our core values. You will strive to demonstrate the Toro Company Values and hold our Site team accountable to behave in accordance with them every day through both words and actions.
  • Do what you say – act with integrity so our customers and project teams trust us to deliver results
  • Get it done – find solutions to ensure the job gets done right
  • Be better every day – take pride and be passionate about improving our business, safety, and quality and strive to be the best
  • Think big picture – think long-term, be strategic and have a vision. Your investment in our business, is critical to our success.
  • Build strong relationships – value our employees, suppliers, and advisors as an essential part of our business. Develop and maintain strong relationships with our customers, contractors and stakeholders.
QUALIFICATIONS

Education
  • Journeyman certificate or Postsecondary diploma or degree in related field
  • Architecture
  • Construction
  • Building Science
  • Engineering
  • Management (Post-secondary in Management is an asset, but not required)
Experience
  • 5 years of experience in field supervision preferred
Skills
  • Successfully supervised a construction workforce
  • In depth knowledge of and experience in construction industry and company operations, including building materials, construction specifications, methods, and procedures
  • Ability to coordinate multiple scopes of a construction project
  • Understanding of contract language
  • In depth knowledge of and application of safety, environmental principles, procedures, and legislation
  • Ability to lead and run effective site meetings with the client, consultants, own forces, and internal employees
  • Demonstrated conflict resolution skills, problem solving abilities and professional judgement
  • Ability to develop and maintain effective stakeholder relationships
  • Knowledge of virtual construction software and tools
  • Knowledge of construction drawings and specifications
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite

title: Project Coordinator
description:
Pinnacle International is one of Canada's leading builders of luxury condominium residences, hotels, and commercial developments. Based in Vancouver, BC, Pinnacle has been involved in development, design, construction and management for over three decades. Our portfolio includes landmark locations in Vancouver, Toronto, and San Diego.

We are currently seeking a talented Project Coordinator to join our growing construction team in Vancouver. The ideal candidate is a self-motivated, detail-oriented professional with a strong initiative to take on a wide variety of tasks. If you are excited about the opportunity to learn from experienced professionals and thrive in a diverse and fast-paced environment, Pinnacle is the place for you.

Duties and Responsibilities

· Assist Project Managers and superintendents with overall project performance

· Prepare bid documents and clear, concise scopes of work

· Perform accurate, detail-driven take offs

· Maintain project budgets and perform cost estimating

· Analyze bids, prepare summaries and propose subcontractor selections

· Communicate project details and work cohesively with teams of subcontractors, clients/owners, consultants and other project stakeholders, and participate actively in meetings as required

· Prepare contracts and confidently negotiate revisions, changes and additions to contractual agreements

· Review project documentation, drawings and specifications in detail

· Administer requests for information and shop drawings, and manage submittal process

· Plan and manage daily operations, construction schedules while monitoring project progress

· Understand the importance of quality at every stage of the construction

Qualifications & Knowledge

· Post-secondary degree or diploma in engineering, construction management, or related field preferred

· Ability to read and interpret contract specifications, drawings and other construction documents

· At least one year of experience working in the Vancouver construction market for a Developer or General Contractor preferred

· Have proven capabilities in multi-tasking, problem solving and prioritizing workloads

· Fluent English and excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

· Experience using Microsoft office Suite

We provide a competitive salary and benefits package for the right candidate. If you believe that this position would be a good fit for you, please reply to this posting and submit your resume.

We thank all interested applicants for applying, however only qualified candidates will be contacted. No telephone calls please.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Vision care

title: Senior Architect
description:
CICCOZZI ARCHITECTURE INC. IS LOOKING FOR A NEW SENIOR ARCHITECT TO JOIN THE TEAM

Ciccozzi Architecture Inc. is a mid sized architectural firm located in downtown Vancouver, BC. Our work covers a range of project types including Multi Family Residential, Mixed Use and Commercial.

The firm is growing, and we are now seeking talented, dedicated individuals to join our team on existing and upcoming projects including office towers, hotel, high rise, mid rise and townhouse residential projects as well as commercial and industrial projects.

We are currently looking for a Senior Architect with 10+ years of experience, with a minimum of 5 years local experience to join our team.

The ideal candidate is a self-motivated professional with extensive experience in contract documentation and contract administration. We require a person with strong communication and leadership skills and an ability to lead a team in residential and mixed-use projects. Applicants must be registered with the AIBC, or eligible to be registered in the province of British Columbia. We offer a great work environment with friendly colleagues in an open-concept office. You will have the opportunity to work on a variety of projects with opportunities for ongoing career development and growth.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Work closely with the Partner and Senior Project Managers.
  • Lead a project team through the preparation of contract documents.
  • Establish and maintain effective and professional liaisons with clients and authorities having jurisdiction.
  • Be the prime contact to the General Contractor during construction phase until completion
  • Conduct on-site visits to review compliance with contract documents; to observe and report on work in progress; preparation of Field Reviews.
  • Exercise independent judgement and analysis of significant issues and find a resolution.
  • Respond to Contractor RFI’s, issue SI’s and perform submittal reviews.
  • Chair and prepare minutes for all contract document preparation/consultant coordination meetings and construction progress meetings.
  • Maintain up-to-date project records.
  • Establish and maintain project criteria and communicate it to project teams.
  • Working knowledge of the BC Building Code, land use and zoning requirements
  • Knowledge of current versions of VectorWorks, AutoCAD and Revit
  • Working knowledge of building envelope concepts, construction practice and building systems (including combustible and non-combustable construction)

REQUIRED SKILLS / EXPERIENCE / QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Proficiency with Vectorworks. AutoCAD and REVIT.
  • Have exceptional technical, communication and leadership skills, which enable you to manage projects with confidence and ease.
  • Have knowledge of applicable building codes/standards and a proven work history working with construction documents.
  • Be comfortable managing multiple projects concurrently.
  • Possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Have a proven track record of maintaining high quality standards while working to tight deadlines
  • Well organized, strict attention to detail
  • Good trouble shooter and problem solver who works well under pressure with a can-do attitude.
  • Have high initiative and be self-motivated.
  • Possess a minimum Bachelor of Architecture
Ciccozzi Architecture provides an open and collaborative teamwork environment with a potential for professional growth. A competitive salary and benefits package is available corresponding to qualifications and experience. Interested and qualified individuals are invited to submit their resumes to:

HOW TO APPLY

Submit your resume and portfolio in confidence by email (pdf please) to hr@ciccozziarchitecture.com indicating the position you are applying for in the “Subject” line.

We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls and drop-ins please.

title: Intermediate Hydrology Specialist
description:
Location

Calgary, AB

Description

Hatfield has been awarded BC’s Top Employers for 2022 and we’re looking for more outstanding people to join our team! We do interesting and meaningful work with opportunities for career and professional growth. We also offer a competitive compensation package, flexible work hours, vacation allowances, and comprehensive health benefits including extended health coverage, an employee and family assistance program, and a RRSP matching plan.

Hatfield Consultants is seeking a highly motivated Intermediate Hydrology Specialist to become part of our growing Water Resources team and provide field, technical, and project coordination support for the implementation of hydrology, climate and hydrogeology monitoring components of Hatfield’s energy, oil and gas, mining, and infrastructure projects in Alberta. The position is full-time permanent and would be a combination of office and fieldwork, based out of our Calgary office with frequent travel to Fort McMurray and other remote locations in western Canada. Start date is negotiable.

Responsibilities:

  • Plan and coordinate remote field programs, assist with resource scheduling and project management.
  • Prepare for, lead and/or participate in field programs required for hydrologic data collection and monitoring programs. When in the field, support the mentoring of junior staff with regard to data collection and monitoring activities.
  • Ensure equipment is maintained and calibrated to meet operational and field requirements.
  • Interact with a multidisciplinary team to assess potential project-related and/or climate change-related impacts on water resources and environmental values. This may include supporting the coordination and/or implementation of other water resource (e.g., groundwater, water quality, climate, aquatic, fish, construction) monitoring programs.
  • Compile, manage and assess hydrologic, water use, water quality, and other environmental data.
  • Support ongoing data management (e.g., review of near-real-time telemetry data) and reporting (e.g., Draft technical reports and data summaries).

Education and Experience:

Mandatory requirements for this position include:

  • B.Sc. or technical diploma in natural/environmental sciences or engineering with some prior formal training (e.g., coursework) in hydrology or physical geography.
  • Appropriate qualifications for work in Alberta and British Columbia, and a valid Canadian driver’s license.
  • Excellent communication (verbal and written – including technical, scientific writing) skills.
  • Experience and interest in field work. This position will be based in Calgary, but will have frequent travel to remote locations, for various durations, based out of hotels and camps.
  • Knowledge of standard operating procedures, industry standards and best practices for hydrometric data collection.
  • Experience and interest in data compilation and analysis.

Prior experience with the following is considered an asset for this position:

  • Field investigation and monitoring programs, focussed on hydrological programs.
  • Familiarity and comfort with remote site work including oil sands properties in Alberta.
  • Project coordination, field project management, project management.
  • Some prior formal training (e.g., coursework) in related environmental fields, such as geology/hydrogelogy, climate science, biology or chemistry.
  • Other field experience, such as construction monitoring, groundwater monitoring, climate station monitoring and environmental effects monitoring etc.

Hatfield is committed to employment equity and workplace diversity. We strive for equity, inclusiveness and diversity, irrespective of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression or disability.

To apply, please submit your cover letter and CV describing your experience and salary expectations in confidence through the online form or email: resumes@hatfieldgroup.catsone.com (no phone calls please). Please indicate “CGY Hydrology” in your subject line. Due to the volume of applicants, only short-listed candidates will be notified but we will retain your resume for any future openings.

title: Intermediate Climate Specialist
description:
Location

Calgary, AB

Description

Hatfield has been awarded BC’s Top Employers for 2022 and we’re looking for more outstanding people to join our team! We do interesting and meaningful work with opportunities for career and professional growth. We also offer a competitive compensation package, flexible work hours, vacation allowances, and comprehensive health benefits including extended health coverage, an employee and family assistance program, and a RRSP matching plan.

Hatfield Consultants is seeking a highly motivated Intermediate Climate Specialist to become part of our growing Water Resources team and provide field, technical, and project coordination support for the implementation of climate, surface water and groundwater monitoring components of Hatfield’s energy, oil and gas, mining, and infrastructure projects in Alberta. The position is full-time permanent and would be a combination of office and fieldwork, based out of our Calgary office with frequent travel to Fort McMurray and other remote locations in western Canada. Start date is negotiable.

Responsibilities:

  • Plan and coordinate remote field programs, assist with resource scheduling and project management.
  • Prepare for, lead and/or participate in field programs required for climate data collection and monitoring programs. When in the field, support the mentoring of junior staff with regard to data collection and monitoring activities.
  • Ensure equipment is maintained and calibrated to meet operational and field requirements.
  • Interact with a multidisciplinary team to assess potential project-related and/or climate change-related impacts on water resources and environmental values. This may include supporting the coordination and/or implementation of other water resource (e.g., hydrogeology, hydrology, water quality, aquatic, fish, construction) monitoring programs.
  • Compile, manage and assess climate, water use, water quality, and other environmental data.
  • Support ongoing data management (e.g., review of near-real-time telemetry data) and reporting (e.g., draft technical reports and data summaries).

Education and Experience:

Mandatory requirements for this position include:

  • B.Sc. or technical diploma in natural/environmental sciences or engineering with some prior formal training (e.g., coursework) in environmental and climate science.
  • Appropriate qualifications for work in Alberta and British Columbia, and a valid Canadian driver’s license.
  • Excellent communication (verbal and written – including technical, scientific writing) skills.
  • Experience and interest in field work. This position will be based in Calgary, but will have frequent travel to remote locations, for various durations, based out of hotels and camps.
  • Knowledge of standard operating procedures, industry standards and best practices for field investigation and monitoring for climate data collection.
  • Experience and interest in data compilation and analysis.

Prior experience with the following is considered an asset for this position:

  • Familiarity and comfort with remote site work including oil sands properties in Alberta
  • Project coordination, field project management, project management
  • some prior formal training (e.g., coursework) in related environmental fields, such as geology/hydrogeology, hydrology, physical geography, biology or chemistry.
  • Other field experience, such as construction monitoring, hydrogeology monitoring, hydrology monitoring and environmental effects monitoring etc.

Hatfield is committed to employment equity and workplace diversity. We strive for equity, inclusiveness and diversity, irrespective of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression or disability.

To apply, please submit your cover letter and CV describing your experience and salary expectations in confidence through the online form or email: resumes@hatfieldgroup.catsone.com (no phone calls please). Please indicate “CGY Climate” in your subject line. Due to the volume of applicants, only short-listed candidates will be notified but we will retain your resume for any future openings.

title: newCustomer Service Representative (Natural Health Company)
description:
Career with a heart! If you like helping people, and you want to feel supported in your work –– this is the opportunity for you. Every day, concerned people call the AlgaeCal helpline. They’ve just had bad news about their bones – and they’re scared they might snap at any moment. But after talking with YOU, their fear will melt away.

We call our Customer Care Representatives – Bone Health Consultants – and a typical day might include:

  • Chatting with customers about their bone scans
  • Answering questions about our supplements
  • Helping customers place orders
  • Talking with customers about possible medications interactions
  • But most importantly, setting our customers up for MAXIMUM SUCCESS

This opportunity is tailor-made for you if:

You’ve got a solid customer service background. You get a kick out of helping people find that aha moment – where they go from despair to hope. You’re organized. You’re humble. You don’t just accept feedback – you WANT feedback, because you’re hungry to be better than you were yesterday.

So if you want to work with some of the nicest people you’ll ever meet. And you want to feel good about making a difference in the world –– all while working in a well organized and supportive workplace –– send us your resume. And BTW… some of our senior executives started out in this role –– so if you’ve got the talent, there’s no telling where this job might take you :)

Other Goodies

  • Annual team trip (most recently, Los Cabos, Mexico!) which you are eligible for after one year of employment. This amounts to another week of paid vacation, plus we cover hotel, food, flights and entertainment.
  • $2000 flexible employee health benefits package
  • Monthly team events and activities
  • Flexible Stat Holidays with the option to bank days for later use
  • Weekly team lunches
  • Casual dress code

If this sounds like a position for you, please respond to this advertisement with your resume and cover letter. This is an essential part of your application. We need to make sure you’re a good fit for our happy team - that’s why we’ll be paying close attention to your carefully written cover letter.

Applications submitted without a resume and cover letter will be unsuccessful.

Please, read carefully:

1. Write a cover letter addressing:

  • Why you're the best Customer Service Representative for this role. Give quantifiable examples of related achievements.
  • Describe why you fit perfectly with our values. Read them here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1deCCJZ6tiDiOSlr_W0UdCuM_V_ahzPBs/view
  • What's the toughest challenge you’ve ever overcome in your life? How did you overcome it?
  • What are the last three books you’ve read?
  • What do you do for fun?
  • Explain what you’re doing now for a job:
    • If you don’t have one, explain why.
    • If you have one, explain why you’re looking elsewhere.

2. Upload your cover letter and resume:

  • Ensure that your cover letter and resume are saved and sent as one file.

Click the “Apply Now” button on this page and upload your (1) cover letter (2) resume.

title: newresponsable du service clientèle et gestion des comptes / cu...
description:
Randstad est à la recherche d'un(e) Conseiller(e) en recrutement et en gestion de comptes pour joindre la superbe équipe de recrutement de Randstad située à Montréal.

Ce rôle unique combine le recrutement ainsi que la prospection de nouveaux clients, en générant des revenus en s'engageant avec les clients, les talents et les collègues.


Vos responsabilités:

  • Répondre aux besoins des clients en matière de recrutement;
  • Effectuer et gérer le cycle complet de recrutement;
  • Assurer un service de qualité aux talents ainsi qu'aux entreprises clientes de randstad
  • Entretenir et développer une base de données clients;


Vos qualifications:

  • Plus d'un an d'expérience en vente / développement des affaires, prospection, appels sortants ou toute expérience pertinente en vente;
  • Expérience à titre d'assistant gérant, gérant, ou superviseur (restaurant, hôtels, centres d’appels…) est un grand atout;
  • Expérience ou grand intérêt pour le monde du recrutement;
  • Habile avec les technologies et les réseaux sociaux (un atout);
  • Bilinguisme anglais-français

Avantages:


  • Équipe de travail dynamique, plusieurs défis à la hauteur de vos attentes;
  • Travailler pour une entreprise dans le top 50 des entreprises où travailler au Canada;
  • Horaire flexible de jour;
  • Poste permanent avec un salaire compétitif;
  • Emplacement accessible en transport au commun;
  • Avantages sociaux complet;
  • 3 semaines de vacances en débutant;
  • Programme de bonification intéressant;
  • Nous fournissons gratuitement le cellulaire et l'ordinateur portable;

Randstad, un employeur de choix qui investit en vous:

  • Nous faisons partie des 50 meilleurs lieux de travail au Canada chaque année depuis 2006;
  • Nous sommes classés 7e meilleur employeur au Canada en 2019 dans les revues Glassdoor;
  • Nous sommes un leader en matière de diversité et d'inclusion;
  • Un salaire compétitif;
  • Poste permanent à temps plein;
  • Couverture médicale / dentaire / visuelle;
  • Forfait vacances / 12 jours de maladies et options d'achat de jours de vacances;
  • Programme d'achat d'actions, REER et plans de contribution en actions;
  • Bureau moderne avec une vue panoramique situé près des centres commerciaux et des restaurants;
  • Programme d'avantages et de réductions pour les employés;
  • 2x demi-journées d'été;

La politique en matière d'équité, de diversité et d'inclusion chez Randstad Canada:


Randstad Canada s’engage à favoriser une main-d'œuvre représentative de toutes les populations du Canada. Nous nous engageons en conséquence à développer et à mettre en œuvre des stratégies pour promouvoir l'équité, la diversité et l'inclusion dans toutes nos sphères d'activité en examinant nos politiques, pratiques et systèmes internes tout au long du cycle de vie de notre main-d'œuvre, y compris au niveau du recrutement, de la rétention et de l’avancement pour tout individu.

En plus de notre profond engagement sur le respect des principes des droits de la personne, nous nous engageons à prendre toute mesure positive pour influer sur les changements à mettre en place en vue de garantir la participation de tout individu dans le monde du travail et ce, sans obstacle, systémique ou autre, en particulier pour les groupes en quête d'équité généralement sous-représentés dans la main-d'œuvre au Canada, y compris les personnes qui s'identifient comme femmes ou personnes non-binaires/non conformes au genre, les Peuples et communautés autochtones, les personnes en situation de handicap (visible ou invisible), les personnes faisant partie des minorités visibles, les personnes racisées et des communautés LGBTQ2+.

Randstad Canada s'engage à créer et à maintenir un milieu de travail inclusif et accessible pour toutes les personnes candidates et employées en soutenant leurs besoins d'accessibilité et d'accommodation tout au long du cycle de vie de l'emploi. Nous demandons à toutes les personnes demandeuses d'emploi de bien vouloir identifier leurs besoins en matière d'accommodation en envoyant un courriel à accessibilite@randstad.ca pour s'assurer de leur capacité à participer pleinement au processus d'entrevue.

-

Randstad is seeking a Recruitment and Sales Consultant to join Randstad's superb recruitment team located in Montreal.

This unique role combines recruiting as well as prospecting for new clients, generating revenue by engaging with clients, talent and colleagues.



Your responsibilities:

  • Respond to clients' recruitment needs;
  • Perform and manage the full recruitment cycle;
  • Provide quality service to talents as well as to randstad client companies
  • Maintain and develop a client database;

Your qualifications:

  • 1+ years of experience in sales/business development, prospecting, outbound calling or any relevant sales experience;
  • Experience as an assistant manager, manager, or supervisor (restaurant, hotels, call centers) is a great asset;
  • Experience or great interest in the world of recruitment;
  • Skilled with technology and social networks (an asset);
  • Excellent level of spoken English and French

Benefits:

  • Dynamic work team, many challenges to match your expectations;
  • Work for a company in the top 50 of companies to work for in Canada;
  • Flexible daytime hours;
  • Permanent position with a competitive salary;
  • Location accessible by public transportation;
  • Full benefits;
  • 3 weeks of vacation time when you start;
  • Attractive bonus program;
  • We provide free cell phone and laptop;

Randstad, an employer of choice that invests in you:

  • We have been named one of the 50 Best Places to Work in Canada every year since 2006;
  • We are ranked the 7th best employer in Canada in 2019 by Glassdoor Reviews;
  • We are a leader in diversity and inclusion;
  • Competitive salary;
  • Full-time permanent position;
  • Medical / Dental / Vision coverage;
  • Vacation package / 12 sick days and options to purchase vacation days;
  • Stock purchase program, RRSP and stock contribution plans;
  • Modern office with a panoramic view located near shopping centers and restaurants;
  • Employee benefits and discount program;
  • 2x summer half-days;

Randstad Canada’s Equity, Diversity & Inclusion Statement:

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada’s workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to accessibility@randstad.ca to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Registered Massage Therapist
description:
Beauty Incubator Recruitment are pleased to announce that we have been retained by one of Ontario's leading destination spa's who are looking to hire Registered Massage Therapists to join their growing teams.

Our client is renowned for offering a 5-star service to their clients and these positions have arisen due to a significant and continued increase in client bookings.

You will be joining established and supportive teams of RMT’s, working in a busy & fast paced environment where continued professional development is encouraged.

We are currently looking for all levels of RMT’s from newly qualified through to experienced. This is a great opportunity to work with one of the most prestigious hotels and spas in Ontario.

Experience working in a similar environment is not required as full training will be given.

All bookings and scheduling are handled by our clients, all you have to do is turn up and preform the services! In return they are offering:

  • Attractive hourly rate + an industry leading commission split (starting at 15% [average service $200] on all services carried out)
  • Vacation and sick pay
  • Flexible schedule
  • AND medical benefits including vison, dental and extended benefits

These positions are both part time and full time and are located in the Burlington region.

If you are a Registered Massage Therapist of any level, we want to hear from you!

If you are waiting for your results, we want to hear from you – for the right candidates our client is prepared to wait for confirmation of your results.

To learn more about this exciting opportunity please get in touch. All conversations are treated in confidence.

Beauty Incubator Recruitment Inc. are niche recruiters for the esthetic and wellness sector. Our consultants have many years industry experience from consulting, medical practices, sales and education in both Canada and the US. With our extensive experience and contacts, we seek out the best jobs for our candidates and the best candidates for our clients.

Our mission is to enable esthetic & wellness professionals to unlock their full potential.

title: spécialiste du développement des affaires / business develop...
description:
• Permanent à temps plein 37.5 heures par semaine
  • Heures de bureau de jour
  • Poste en Télétravail
  • Salaire de base très compétitif plus bonis
  • Formation et encadrement fournis
  • Flexibilité, autonomie
  • Avantages sociaux après 3 mois
  • De beaux défis et évolution de carrière excitante!
  • Une belle équipe de travail basée sur la confiance et le respect

Randstad est à la recherche d'un(e) Conseiller(e) en recrutement et en ventes pour joindre la superbe équipe de recrutement de Randstad.

Ce rôle unique combine le recrutement ainsi que la prospection de nouveaux clients, en générant des revenus en s'engageant avec les clients, les talents et les collègues.


Vos responsabilités:

  • Répondre aux besoins des clients en matière de recrutement;
  • Effectuer et gérer le cycle complet de recrutement;
  • Solliciter ses prospects et clients régulièrement;
  • Entretenir et développer une base de données clients;

Vos qualifications:

  • Expérience de travail avec des objectifs de vente;
  • Expérience à titre d'assistant gérant, gérant, ou superviseur (restaurant, hôtels, centres d’appels…) est un grand atout;
  • Expérience ou grand intérêt pour le monde du recrutement;
  • Habile avec les technologies et les réseaux sociaux (un atout);

Avantages:

  • Équipe de travail dynamique, plusieurs défis à la hauteur de vos attentes;
  • Travailler pour une entreprise dans le top 50 des entreprises où travailler au Canada;
  • Horaire flexible de jour;
  • Poste permanent avec un salaire compétitif;
  • Emplacement accessible en transport au commun;
  • Avantages sociaux complet;
  • 3 semaines de vacances en débutant;
  • Programme de bonification intéressant;
  • Nous fournissons gratuitement le cellulaire et l'ordinateur portable;

Randstad, un employeur de choix qui investit en vous !!

  • Nous faisons partie des 50 meilleurs lieux de travail au Canada chaque année depuis 2006;
  • Nous sommes classés 7e meilleur employeur au Canada en 2019 dans les revues Glassdoor;
  • Nous sommes un leader en matière de diversité et d'inclusion;
  • Un salaire compétitif;
  • Poste permanent à temps plein;
  • Couverture médicale / dentaire / visuelle;
  • Forfait vacances / 12 jours de maladies et options d'achat de jours de vacances;
  • Programme d'achat d'actions, REER et plans de contribution en actions;
  • Bureau moderne avec une vue panoramique situé près des centres commerciaux et des restaurants;
  • Programme d'avantages et de réductions pour les employés;
  • Gâteries les jeudis, les vendredis sociaux, 2x demi-journées d'été;

La politique en matière d'équité, de diversité et d'inclusion chez Randstad Canada:


Randstad Canada s’engage à favoriser une main-d'œuvre représentative de toutes les populations du Canada. Nous nous engageons en conséquence à développer et à mettre en œuvre des stratégies pour promouvoir l'équité, la diversité et l'inclusion dans toutes nos sphères d'activité en examinant nos politiques, pratiques et systèmes internes tout au long du cycle de vie de notre main-d'œuvre, y compris au niveau du recrutement, de la rétention et de l’avancement pour tout individu.

En plus de notre profond engagement sur le respect des principes des droits de la personne, nous nous engageons à prendre toute mesure positive pour influer sur les changements à mettre en place en vue de garantir la participation de tout individu dans le monde du travail et ce, sans obstacle, systémique ou autre, en particulier pour les groupes en quête d'équité généralement sous-représentés dans la main-d'œuvre au Canada, y compris les personnes qui s'identifient comme femmes ou personnes non-binaires/non conformes au genre, les Peuples et communautés autochtones, les personnes en situation de handicap (visible ou invisible), les personnes faisant partie des minorités visibles, les personnes racisées et des communautés LGBTQ2+.

Randstad Canada s'engage à créer et à maintenir un milieu de travail inclusif et accessible pour toutes les personnes candidates et employées en soutenant leurs besoins d'accessibilité et d'accommodation tout au long du cycle de vie de l'emploi. Nous demandons à toutes les personnes demandeuses d'emploi de bien vouloir identifier leurs besoins en matière d'accommodation en envoyant un courriel à accessibilite@randstad.ca pour s'assurer de leur capacité à participer pleinement au processus d'entrevue.

-

  • Permanent full-time 37.5 hours per week
  • Daytime office hours
  • Work from home for now and some office post-Covid
  • Very competitive base salary plus generous bonuses
  • Extensive training provided
  • Flexibility, autonomy
  • Comprehensive Benefits after 3 months, paid by the employer
  • Great challenges and exciting career development!
  • A great team environment based on trust and respect

Randstad is looking for a Recruitment and Sales Consultant to join Randstad's superb recruitment team.

This unique role combines recruiting as well as prospecting for new clients, generating revenue by engaging with clients, talent and colleagues.

Your responsibilities:

  • Respond to clients' recruitment needs;
  • Perform and manage the full recruitment cycle;
  • Solicit prospects and clients on a regular basis;
  • Maintain and develop a client database;

Your qualifications:

  • Experience working with sales objectives in any capacity;
  • Experience as an assistant manager, manager, or supervisor (restaurant, hotels, call centers) is a great asset;
  • Experience or great interest in the world of recruitment;
  • Skilled with technology and social networks (an asset);

Benefits:

  • Dynamic team environment with high job satisfaction and growth opportunities;
  • Top 50 companies to work for in Canada;
  • Flexible daytime office hours;
  • Permanent position with a competitive salary;
  • Full benefits;
  • 3 weeks of vacation to start;
  • Attractive bonus program;
  • We provide free cell phone and laptop;

Randstad, an employer of choice that invests in you!

  • We have been named one of the 50 Best Places to Work in Canada every year since 2006;
  • We are ranked as the 7th best employer in Canada in 2019 by Glassdoor Reviews;
  • We are a leader in diversity and inclusion;
  • We provide competitive and generous salaries and bonuses;
  • Full-time permanent position;
  • Medical / Dental / Vision coverage, paid for by the employer;
  • Vacation package / 12 sick days and options to purchase vacation days;
  • Stock purchase program, RRSP and stock contribution plans;

Randstad Canada’s Equity, Diversity & Inclusion Statement:

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada’s workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to accessibility@randstad.ca to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: newIntermediate/Senior Architectural Technologist (High-Rise Ar...
description:
Company Description


We are a global architecture, engineering, planning, and technology firm defining the cities of tomorrow.

By connecting design and technology, we change how people experience their built environment. We work across disciplines to create the intelligent systems, sustainable buildings, and efficient infrastructure that shapes the way people live, move, learn, and heal.

With over 3,000 employees and 60+ offices around the world, we understand what it takes to work locally and scale globally.

At IBI, we’re defining the cities of tomorrow.


Job Description


Our award winning High-Rise Residential practice is seeking to grow their team and bring on board a seasoned Architectural technologist. This opportunity will encompass working alongside senior leadership, management of production and technical drawings. This position does not limit you to one project phase; from design to development and from construction documentation to contract administration.

Most of the things you’ll work on:

  • Prepare working drawings for all projects in mainly Revit with some AutoCAD
  • Responsible for the creation of technical content including details to the highest standard of excellence while ensuring the design intent is consistently maintained throughout the project
  • You will work closely with the Project Manager and coordinate with other staff members as well as coordinating all aspects of the project with the Mechanical, Electrical and Structural consultants
  • Responsible coordinating and communication within the production team
  • Assist with resolving difficult operating tasks or drawing production problems
  • Keeping up to date on construction practices, products, codes and technology
  • Work with Contract Administration Department in processing project Shop Drawings and administrative paperwork

Qualifications


You'll need to have:

  • University Degree in Architecture or Diploma in Architectural Technology or current OAA member.
  • Minimum of 3 or more years of related experience
  • Hotel & High Rise Residential experience preferred
  • Proficiency with Revit and AutoCAD.
  • Strong communication and time management skills
  • Proficiency with Ontario Building Systems and Ontario Building Code
  • Coordination of Mechanical/Structural/Electrical components and consultants
  • Site experience
  • Strong leadership and relationship building skills
  • Being able to take notes, create and distribute minutes of meetings
  • Be task oriented – able to switch between tasks and projects easily

Additional Information


We are currently in a work from home model during COVID-19, but when we do return to the office we're located at 55 St. Clair Ave West, this office is steps away from St. Clair station and is easily accessible by bike, TTC and car. Occupying 7 floors, with over 700 employees, it is the largest office at IBI Group. The floors are open concept and represent our collaborative approach to projects.

IBI Group provides a competitive benefit package and pays association dues and licensing fees.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to support the growth and equality of our people through initiatives like our Mentorship Program, Global Women’s Network, and Diversity & Inclusion Council. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of age, race, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

As part of IBI Group's selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record. Candidates will also need to confirm they are fully vaccinated in accordance with IBI Group’s mandatory vaccination policy in Canada.

We request applicants submit RESUME AND PORTFOLIO highlighting relevant work experience. Please limit PDF files to 10MB or provide a WebLink.

title: Full Time Senior Art Consultant
description:
Art Consultant - Whistler Contemporary Gallery (Whistler)

compensation: Base Salary Plus Commissions
employment type: Full-time
Sales associate – Contemporary Art Gallery
Job description:
The Gallery is one of Canada’s leading fine art galleries. Specializing in the representation of renowned Canadian and International artists with two locations in Whistler, BC. We are now interviewing applicants for the position of Sales Associate for our galleries located in The Four Seasons Hotel & Whistler Village.
About the Job:
We are looking for a Sales professional who is enthusiastic, motivated and interested in joining our team. The environment is dynamic and constantly evolving. With a small team, the available position offers a unique hands-on experience.
The responsibilities include:
Excellent sales abilities
Highly motivated
Excellent Negotiating skills
Possess leadership qualities, and are determined to be a winner
Providing excellent customer service to clients and delegate communications effectively that are engaging and creative.
Ability to establish rapport easily and put people “at ease”
Comfortable at generating leads, with the ability to positively engage
Possess an appropriate sense of urgency, and to bring a sales situation to a resolution
Effectively provide solutions for customers’ challenges
Initialization and the ability to focus on opportunities and solutions
Anticipate consequences and evaluate alternatives before acting
Work collaboratively with other employees to provide support on a wide range of administrative tasks and daily operations
Independently coordinating and executing gallery mailings, shipments, custom documentation and transportation logistics
Proactively work with team members to ensure input and assigned tasks are managed on a timely basis
Maintain a positive outlook
Able to work evenings & weekends
Qualifications & Skills:
Experience in a related position or field
Proficiency in the use of Google Apps (Chrome, Drive, Sheets, Docs, Gmail, Calendar), Mac OS X, MS Office (Word & Excel)
Basic knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite; Acrobat, Photoshop

Company Profile:
The WHISTLER CONTEMPORARY GALLERY continues its dedication to the promotion of distinctive Canadian and international contemporary art. We represent emerging, mid-career and established artists. Our art encompasses a diversity of styles including figurative, abstract and landscape. The gallery offers an exceptional selection of original paintings, multi-media work, glass and sculpture.

The gallery has two locations in the Hilton Resort and Spa and the Four Seasons Whistler Resort. The resort itself attracts over two million visitors each year and is often rated as #1 ski resort in North America.

With 26 years of experience in the art business, the gallery works with first time and experienced buyers to build their collections.

We are dedicated to serving our clients as well as our artists. We are passionate about art and are committed to bringing quality pieces to our collectors.
'
Whistler Contemporary Gallery showcasing contemporary fine art since 1992
Formerly known as The Whistler Village Art Gallery.

Job Type: Part-Time
Language:
English (Required)

Work remotely

  • No

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

title: Travel Consultant - Quebec-cxLoyalty
description:
Provide exceptional customer service for inbound calls to assist customers with redeeming their loyalty program points for travel accommodations, including, but not limited to: airline tickets, car rentals, hotel accommodations, and travel insurance to all cxLoyalty clients' customers within company guidelines and account specific requirements. Serve customers by providing product and service information, as well as resolving product and service problems.

Responsibilities:
  • Sell travel arrangements and related services for customers .
  • Use preferred vendors as determined by cxLoyalty to maximize profits.
  • Understand individual redemption travel loyalty program requirements. Proficient in all aspects of point redemption for appropriate clients.
  • Provide thorough, friendly, and effective customer service to all internal and external customers in a timely and accurate manner.
  • Maintain comprehensive working knowledge of all programs, tools and systems.
  • Strong computer skills, ability to navigate through multiple systems at once.
  • Participate in cross training and handle calls on multiple accounts.
  • Meet and maintain individual monthly metrics per company guidelines as determined by the operating group.
  • Participate fully as a team member to assist as needed in completing all functions related to servicing the client, including selling additional products.
  • Pro-actively stay informed about all airline rules and regulations, and other industry requirements and accurately apply this information when making travel arrangements.
  • Resolve product or service issues by clarifying the customer's complaint; determining the cause of the problem; select and explain the best solution to solve the problem; expedite correction or adjustment.
  • Work a flexible schedule during the clients' servicing hours which may include weekends and holidays and have the flexibility to attend staff and training meetings for ongoing updates in the travel industry, program guidelines, and office procedures, which may not be during your assigned hours.
  • Keep immediate supervisor promptly and fully informed of all problems or unusual matters and take prompt corrective action where necessary or suggest alternative coursed of action which may be taken.

Skills/Qualifications:
  • You must be located in Canada to apply for this role
  • Call Center experience required
  • Bi Lingual English/French required (verbal and written)
  • Quebec Travel Counsellor Certificate required. Having the certificate is an advantage and must be obtained prior to start date. cxLoyalty will assist in acquiring the certificate if it is not possessed at the time of offer.
  • Customer Service, Product Knowledge, Quality Focus, Problem Solving, Sales, Documentation Skills, Listening, Phone Skills, Resolving Conflict, Analyzing Information , Multi-tasking.
  • Travel Industry experience preferred
  • High school diploma preferred
  • Advanced knowledge / proficiency using multiple screens in an online environment
  • Ability to quickly and accurately enter data in a script driven environment
  • Intermediate to advanced knowledge / proficiency of GDS and /or other technology platforms including self-booking tools
  • Ability to work independently and also function as a team member

Same Posting Description for Internal and External Candidates

cxLoyalty, a subsidiary of JPMorgan Chase, is a leading provider of loyalty technology services with rewards content in relevant categories including travel, gift cards, merchandise and incentives while using data and analytics to personalize, optimize and deliver a world-class customer experience. We have more than 40 years of experience designing, administering and fulfilling market leading loyalty programs for our respected clients and their customers. Based in Stamford, Conn., cxLoyalty has more than 1,700 associates and provides services to consumers located in 14 countries.

Show more

title: Corporate Traveller - Corporate Travel Consultant - Toronto, Canada
description:
Job no: 512490
Brand: Corporate Traveller
Work type: Full time
Location: Ontario
Categories: Corporate & Group Travel

Corporate Travel Consultant

Who we are:

Think of us as the ultimate travel wing man. A world where tech and people work collectively to make corporate travel simpler, faster and easier.

Corporate Traveller, is one of Flight Centre Travel Group’s (FCTG) most successful brands, globally. Our mission is to dominate the SME market, making the end to end travel experience seamless. For decades, we’ve been helping ambitious businesses grow through travel.

It all comes down to cutting edge tech and travel experts working together in perfect harmony.

Powered by the best talent around and our platform Melon, we build long-term partnerships and offer tailored solutions that have an immediate and positive impact on the bottom line of our clients.

Who you are:

We are looking for a motivated and driven Corporate Travel Consultant who can hit the ground running and deliver the boutique level of service that Corporate Traveller is famous for. Our ideal candidate will have a minimum of 2 years travel consulting experience along with buckets of ambition and an insatiable appetite for delivering impeccable service.

  • Customer focused – consistently going above and beyond to deliver an amazing client experience
  • You obsess over details; take pride in being organized and can juggle competing priorities with the ability to quickly shift gears when needed.
  • Outstanding interpersonal skills and ability to build strong business relationships.
  • A problem solver who thinks outside of the box to provide creative solutions.
  • You embrace egalitarianism, irreverence, and ownership.
  • Empathetic, compassionate, and curious.
  • You thrive in a collaborative environment but can also produce quality work independently.
  • Excellent written and verbal communications skills
  • Ability to work in a fast paced, deadline driven environment.
  • Outgoing and enthusiastic, with a go-getter personality and a positive outlook
  • Tech Savvy – 2 years’ experience with a GDS system (Sabre preferred), confident using Microsoft suite, and comfortable learning new software

What you’ll be doing:

As a Corporate Travel Consultant you will be responsible for managing the day-to-day travel needs of corporate business accounts, including:

  • Assist in making professional and accurate business travel arrangements for our corporate accounts including air, car, hotel, and ground transportation reservations.
  • Follow company procedures, account guidelines and customer service standards
  • Work as a team member and assist other agents as needed in completing all functions related to servicing the client.
  • Build and maintain strong working relationships
  • Provide solutions to travel related problems clients may experience

Work Perks! - What’s in it for you:

FCTG is renowned internationally for having amazing perks and an even better culture. We understand that our people are our most valuable asset. It is the passion and dedication of our teams that keep the company on top of the industry ladder. It’s also why we offer some great employee benefits and perks outside of the norm.

  • Enjoy the freedom and flexibility of a hybrid work structure that combines both remote and in-person work.
  • Have fun: At the heart of everything we do at Flight Centre is a desire to have fun.
  • Reward & Recognition: Celebrate the success of yourself and others at our regular Buzz Nights and at the annual Global Gathering - You'll have to experience it to believe it!
  • Use your smarts: Our people use their quick thinking, expertise, and tenacity to always figure things out.
  • Love for travel: We were founded by people who wanted to travel and want others to do the same. That passion is something you can’t miss in our people or service.
  • Personal connections: We are a big business founded on personal relationships.
  • A career, not a job: We offer genuine opportunities for people to grow and evolve.
  • We back our people all the way: We are strongly committed to supporting every single employee in their professional and personal development.
  • Giving Back: Proud Corporate Social Responsibility platform through the Flight Centre Foundation and Brighter Futures programs supporting nominated charities through Workplace Giving, Volunteering and Fundraising.

Benefits Include:

  • Uncapped earning potential
  • Travel perks/discounts.
  • Health & Wellness Programs and Employee Financial Wellness Services
  • Generous paid-time off policy
  • Diversity & Inclusion initiatives
  • Benefits including vision, medical, and dental
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • RRSP with matching
  • Employee Share Plan
  • Ongoing training and professional development

Location - Toronto, Ontario

If this sounds like the opportunity you have been waiting for and you would like to be part of our award winning culture then APPLY NOW.

We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted.

Our promise is to provide an environment with equality of respect, dignity and opportunity for all our employees. We value an inclusive and supportive workplace which truly reflects the diversification of our society. Flight Centre Travel Group is committed to providing a barrier-free pathway throughout our recruitment selection process. If you require accommodation because of a disability at any stage of our hiring process, please let us know in advance by contacting our Recruitment Team at fccareers@flightcentre.ca

title: Travel Consultant
description:
Discovery Travel (a division of Cascadia Motivation) is a well-established luxury corporate travel agency looking for an energetic and committed personality to become a part of its team. Candidate will have excellent communication skills and experience working with the most discerning of clients.

Location: Red Deer, Alberta
Hours: 9:00 am – 5:00 pm Monday to Friday
Remote work from home located in Alberta, will be available for the appropriate candidate.

You provide the following skills:

  • Travel Agency experience
  • Proficient with travel agency back office and accounting procedures
  • Knowledge of SABRE or other GDS systems
  • Post-Secondary travel course or certification preferred
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office software
  • Effective verbal and written communication
  • Detail Oriented, extremely well organized and self-motivated
  • Ability to meet critical deadlines and handle multiple projects
  • Enthusiastic, customer-focused, team player

Responsibilities:

  • Determining customer needs and then providing the appropriate information and guidance
  • Making professional and accurate travel arrangements for our clients, including air, car, hotel, tour package and ground transportation reservations
  • Communicating with suppliers to collect and exchange information regarding hotels, resorts, airlines, schedules, and tour packages
  • Advising the customer of appropriate restrictions, terms and conditions of travel services
  • Selling travel insurance
  • Completing client files, reservation information, payment details and following proper accounting requirements
  • Following up on customer inquiries in a timely manner

We offer the rewards:

  • Exceptional salary, we are in the top 5% of Travel Consultant wages
  • Continuous professional training
  • Two company paid customized destination inspection trips per year
  • Comprehensive medical, dental, life insurance, short and long term disability benefits program

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Vision care
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • Overtime

Application question(s):

  • This position is based in Canada. Do you currently reside in Canada? Are you legally authorized to work in Canada? (Answer must be YES)

Experience:

  • Travel Consultant: 1 year (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-05-06

Show more

title: Sales Consultant
description:
Are you a go-getter who loves dealing with people? Do you have experience working with peole in a retail environment? We might be looking for you!

What we’re looking for:
Our busy import dealership is accepting applications for the position of a professional Sales and Lease Consultant. Previous automotive sales experience is not necessary, as we offer full training and a little different culture than the average car dealership.

You will be responsible for meeting and greeting clients, guiding test drives, and assisting our clients in their purchases while building your business and career.

Who we’re looking for:
Phenomenal customer service before anything else. Ambitious. Driven. Thrives in a competitive environment. These are words and terms that describe the kind of person we’re looking for. We’re not looking for average, we’re looking for excellence.

You’ll be joining an established and successful team of professional Sales Consultants, and we’re looking to build your career with us to heights you might not think are possible.

Who should apply:
You’d be surprised who can really make it in our industry. We have success stories with recent university and college grads of all kinds, hotel staff, restaurant employees (particularly waiters and waitresses), even home improvement and big box store employees. Basically, if customer service is a big drive for you and you live every day with a positive attitude, you might like what we have to offer. A valid driver’s license is the only must for now.

What we offer:
Complete onsite training will be provided

Competitive compensation packages. The average sales consultant can earn $40 000 per year. A good sales consultant can earn $60-70 000 per year. Top performers will earn $100 000+. We’re not looking for average.

A positive, customer-focused culture of service and reputation.

Honesty and integrity are our watchwords. You’ll never need to compromise your excellent ethical and moral standards.

Be a part of the team at a Platinum Member of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies. Platinum membership is awarded to an elite group of companies that have been awarded as one of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies for at least six consecutive years.

Unlimited growth potential. The Murray Automotive Group owns 30+ dealerships from White Rock, BC to Yarmouth, NS, and leadership is promoted from within. The sky is the limit for the right applicant.
Show more

title: Corporate Traveller - Corporate Travel Consultant - Calgary, Alberta
description:
Job no: 512496
Brand: Corporate Traveller
Work type: Full time
Location: Alberta
Categories: Corporate & Group Travel

Corporate Travel Consultant

Who we are:

Think of us as the ultimate travel wing man. A world where tech and people work collectively to make corporate travel simpler, faster and easier.

Corporate Traveller, is one of Flight Centre Travel Group’s (FCTG) most successful brands, globally. Our mission is to dominate the SME market, making the end to end travel experience seamless. For decades, we’ve been helping ambitious businesses grow through travel.

It all comes down to cutting edge tech and travel experts working together in perfect harmony.

Powered by the best talent around and our platform Melon, we build long-term partnerships and offer tailored solutions that have an immediate and positive impact on the bottom line of our clients.

Who you are:

We are looking for a motivated and driven Corporate Travel Consultant who can hit the ground running and deliver the boutique level of service that Corporate Traveller is famous for. Our ideal candidate will have a minimum of 2 years travel consulting experience along with buckets of ambition and an insatiable appetite for delivering impeccable service.

  • Customer focused – consistently going above and beyond to deliver an amazing client experience
  • You obsess over details; take pride in being organized and can juggle competing priorities with the ability to quickly shift gears when needed.
  • Outstanding interpersonal skills and ability to build strong business relationships.
  • A problem solver who thinks outside of the box to provide creative solutions.
  • You embrace egalitarianism, irreverence, and ownership.
  • Empathetic, compassionate, and curious.
  • You thrive in a collaborative environment but can also produce quality work independently.
  • Excellent written and verbal communications skills
  • Ability to work in a fast paced, deadline driven environment.
  • Outgoing and enthusiastic, with a go-getter personality and a positive outlook
  • Tech Savvy – 2 years’ experience with a GDS system (Sabre preferred), confident using Microsoft suite, and comfortable learning new software

What you’ll be doing:

As a Corporate Travel Consultant you will be responsible for managing the day-to-day travel needs of corporate business accounts, including:

  • Assist in making professional and accurate business travel arrangements for our corporate accounts including air, car, hotel, and ground transportation reservations.
  • Follow company procedures, account guidelines and customer service standards
  • Work as a team member and assist other agents as needed in completing all functions related to servicing the client.
  • Build and maintain strong working relationships
  • Provide solutions to travel related problems clients may experience

Work Perks! - What’s in it for you:

FCTG is renowned internationally for having amazing perks and an even better culture. We understand that our people are our most valuable asset. It is the passion and dedication of our teams that keep the company on top of the industry ladder. It’s also why we offer some great employee benefits and perks outside of the norm.

  • Enjoy the freedom and flexibility of a hybrid work structure that combines both remote and in-person work.
  • Have fun: At the heart of everything we do at Flight Centre is a desire to have fun.
  • Reward & Recognition: Celebrate the success of yourself and others at our regular Buzz Nights and at the annual Global Gathering - You'll have to experience it to believe it!
  • Use your smarts: Our people use their quick thinking, expertise, and tenacity to always figure things out.
  • Love for travel: We were founded by people who wanted to travel and want others to do the same. That passion is something you can’t miss in our people or service.
  • Personal connections: We are a big business founded on personal relationships.
  • A career, not a job: We offer genuine opportunities for people to grow and evolve.
  • We back our people all the way: We are strongly committed to supporting every single employee in their professional and personal development.
  • Giving Back: Proud Corporate Social Responsibility platform through the Flight Centre Foundation and Brighter Futures programs supporting nominated charities through Workplace Giving, Volunteering and Fundraising.

Benefits Include:

  • Uncapped earning potential
  • Travel perks/discounts.
  • Health & Wellness Programs and Employee Financial Wellness Services
  • Generous paid-time off policy
  • Diversity & Inclusion initiatives
  • Benefits including vision, medical, and dental
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • RRSP with matching
  • Employee Share Plan
  • Ongoing training and professional development

Location - Calgary, Alberta

If this sounds like the opportunity you have been waiting for and you would like to be part of our award winning culture then APPLY NOW.

We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted.

Our promise is to provide an environment with equality of respect, dignity and opportunity for all our employees. We value an inclusive and supportive workplace which truly reflects the diversification of our society. Flight Centre Travel Group is committed to providing a barrier-free pathway throughout our recruitment selection process. If you require accommodation because of a disability at any stage of our hiring process, please let us know in advance by contacting our Recruitment Team at fccareers@flightcentre.ca
