title: Catering Consultant
description:
The Catering Consultant is responsible for supporting the Director of Sales with the day-to-day tasks including guest interaction, document preparation, catering lead inquiries and any other necessary tasks.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Managing client requests in an accurate and timely manner while ensuring the appropriate documents and correspondence is completed.
  • Maintaining a positive and friendly relationship with Hotel clients and guests and ensuring all questions, concerns or problems are handled accordingly.
  • Ensuring all catering events is entered into the appropriate booking system and creating Banquet Event Orders (BEO’s) or contracts and sending to the event contact for approval.
  • General administrative responsibilities including collecting payments or deposits if required, filing, calendar updates, answering the telephone, site tours and other duties as assigned.

Desired Qualifications:

  • Minimum High School Diploma, diploma or degree from a recognized post-secondary institution in Business Administration or Hospitality/Tourism is preferred.
  • Three (3) years-experience in an administrative catering or banquet role or similar.
  • Experience using Sales Systems, Microsoft Office including Outlook, Excel and Word with the ability to easily learn new software programs.
  • Ability to communicate clearly in both written and verbal form with strong attention to detail, grammar and spelling.
  • Excellent interpersonal, customer service and organizational skills with the ability to prioritize multiple requests or orders.

Terms of Employment:

  • This is a full-time position that is required Monday through Friday, 8:30am – 5pm with occasional evening and weekend availability.
  • This is a salaried position that will depend on experience and qualifications,
  • Must be able to pass a basic security clearance.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • administrative catering or banquet role or similar: 3 years (preferred)

title: Travel Consultant - Africa Specialist
description:
ABOUT US

A part of The Travel Corporation family of brands, Lion World Travel specializes in group and individual tours to Southern Africa including such destinations as South Africa, Botswana, Kenya, Namibia and so much more. All of our staff have first-hand knowledge of Southern Africa and can confidently assist you in organizing a pleasurable and trouble free trip. Booking of hotel accommodations and conference facilities, both luxury and economy, are expertly taken care of by our agents.

ROLE SUMMARY

Lion World Travel has a position for a full time Reservations Consultant.

Only applicants with an excellent knowledge of South, Southern and East Africa and with experience in selling these areas as vacation destinations will be considered.

Duties:

  • Respond to telephone calls and emails requesting information on Lion World Travel trips
  • Accurately establish clients requirements and offer advice and information on what product would best fit these requirements
  • Create itineraries, including flights, accommodation and excursions using our preferred suppliers
  • Convert leads received via email and telephone to bookings
  • Book services as required
  • Keep administration work up-to date
  • Build close, professional relationships with clients
  • Follow up with clients after their return home
  • Attend staff training sessions
  • Keep up to date with suppliers and products
  • Other duties as assigned

*

Key required skills*

  • 4 years of experience selling South Africa, Southern and Eastern Africa
  • Excellent verbal and written skills
  • Proven sales ability
  • A mature approach to work by taking ownership and responsibility, coupled with a courteous and professional manner
  • Organizational and administration skills
  • Strong computer skills including working on Salesforce and of course Microsoft Office
  • GDS knowledge - preferably Amadeus
  • A commitment to provide excellent customer service
  • Detail oriented with a positive and passionate personality.

_

The Travel Corporation. is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environments. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise Human Resources of any accommodations needed to ensure you have access to a fair and equitable process. Any information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially_

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site childcare
  • On-site gym
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Application question(s):

  • Do you have excellent knowledge of South, Southern and East Africa and with experience in selling these areas as vacation destinations?

Experience:

  • Travel Agents: 1 year (preferred)
  • customer service: 1 year (preferred)

description:
L & L Travel Management Ltd. is looking for a travel consultant willing to learn and be a part of a great team. L & L is an owner operated agency specializing in both corporate and luxury tailor made travel since 1985. The L & L team delivers efficient, accurate, friendly, problem resolution and value to clients travel needs.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Must be professional and a strong communicator via phone and email
  • Positive work ethic with high attention to detail
  • Customer service experience

  • GDS experience - Apollo by Galileo preferred

Compensation includes base salary and extended health benefits

title: POS IMPLEMENTATION CONSULTANT - FOOD & BEVERAGE
description:
POS IMPLEMENTATION CONSULTANT - FOOD & BEVERAGE-220007M7

Applicants are required to read, write, and speak the following languages: English
Preferred Qualifications


Preferred Qualifications

POS IMPLEMENTATION CONSULTANT - FOOD & BEVERAGE

LOCATION: CANADA (REMOTE)

TRAVEL: UP TO 90%

This role requires 2-5 years of overall experience in an applicable role as an IT or POS Deployment Engineer or as an experienced user of the Simphony and/or RES POS or similar products. Candidates must have the ability to communicate effectively and build rapport with team members and clients. THIS POSITION REQUIRES UP TO 90% TRAVEL. The ability to travel as needed which can include weekends and holidays is a must. Training in the POS products will be provided in conjunction with shadowing on current installs.

Preference is given to individuals which have the below skills and knowledge:

  • 2 years or more experience working in the Hospitality Industry (Hotels and Restaurants)
  • Experience as user of POS systems such as but not limited to (Simphony various versions, MICROS 3700/8700/9700/e7, RES)
  • Technical experience as it relates to installing Hardware and troubleshooting that Hardware
  • Knowledge of Cloud based software systems
  • Knowledge of 3rd party interfaces
  • Fluency in English & French is an asset but not required
Detailed Description and Job Requirements
Intermediate implementation professional who analyzes customer needs, configures the solution, and installs it at the customer site.

Ensure the solution meets specifications and functions per customer specific operational work flow for multiple concepts, users, and service models. Resolve any gaps in functionality. Train the staff on the use of the new solution, and take the site live on the system after everything has been configured and everyone is trained. Ensure a smooth transition to the new system. Answer operational and application questions and consult the customer in a manner to transfer ownership of the system to the customer. After "go-live", provide technical support to the customer.

2-5 years of overall experience in relevant roles. Ability to communicate effectively and build rapport with team members and clients. Ability to travel as needed.

Job: Consulting

Travel: Yes, 100 % of the Time

Location: Canada

Job Type: Regular Employee Hire

Organization: Oracle

title: Office Coordinator
description:
Actalent Services is hiring an experienced Office Coordinator for a permanent role supporting our employees, leadership and office operations within our growing Montreal engineering office. The Office Coordinator provides superior service in the areas of administration, office operations, and employee engagement.

Essential Functions:

  • Provide outstanding customer service for all internal employees and office visitors.
  • Coordinate office events such as lunches, visitor meetings, get together, awards, etc. in partnership with Executive Director or Delivery Manager.
  • Answer and direct incoming phone calls and questions to responsible persons within Actalent.
  • Offer and provide outstanding levels of administrative support to all internal and external employees.
  • Maintain a professional work environment and drive the center culture in alignment with Actalent’s Guiding Principles.
  • Organize office social committee to support and drive participation in planning office events and celebrations
  • Maintain and organize inventory, order supplies and promotional items.
  • Assist in the management of travel requests which include (flights, hotels, rental cars, expenses) and tracking.
  • Support leadership with meeting preparation including but not limited to: assembling documentation, preparing slides, projects by request, and other materials.
  • Order Actalent promotional items and distribute to co-workers and new employees as needed.
  • Manage P-Card and reconcile monthly statements.
  • Maintain informational bulletin boards located at the center per state specific laws.
  • Oversee expenditures in regards to events and center outings as well as partner with the finance team for additional requests.
  • Maintain badges for new internal employees as well as visitors to meet security protocol per center policy.
  • Responsible for new employee’s desk set up, shipping/receiving of equipment, and ordering business cards.

Minimum Education/Abilities/Skills:

  • Minimum 3 years of professional experience in an administrative or customer-service related position.
  • Bilingual (English and French)
  • Strong ability to prioritize, organize, problem solve, and meet deadlines and goals.
  • Prior experience in an Administrative, Receptionist, or Customer Service-related role supporting technical and management-level employees preferred. Proven experience serving in executive admin function highly desired.
  • Previous experience planning events and managing calendars, appointments and meeting rooms.
  • Ability to coordinate and schedule travel (land/air).
  • Excellent proficiency in MS Office is required.

About Actalent:

Actalent (formerly EASi LLC - founded in 1981) is one of the fastest-growing global leaders providing critical services in engineering and sciences. By adapting to the constantly evolving needs of our customers, we have built specialized expertise and a multidisciplinary perspective — leveraging cutting-edge technology and processes — to constantly improve and deliver innovation. Headquartered in Hanover, Maryland, Actalent serves more than 4,500 clients in the U.S., Canada, Asia Pacific and Europe with 5,000 employees and 27,500 engineering and sciences consultants.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: $43,000.00-$46,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Profit sharing
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • No weekends

title: Coordinator, Residential Rentals Marketing
description:
As an integral member of the Four Seasons Residential Rental Marketing team, the Coordinator, Residential Rentals Marketing will be based out of Four Seasons Corporate Office in Toronto, reporting to the Manager, Rentals Marketing Strategy.
The Coordinator, Residential Rentals Marketing will help increase awareness of Four Seasons properties that include Private Retreats and Residential Rental inventory through management of global programs and campaigns. This position will support cross-functional integration with Four Seasons corporate and property level hotel sales and marketing teams.
Key Activities:
Brand, Content & Communications
  • Execute on a multi-channel global marketing strategy to drive profile and leads for the rental business across CRM, Print, Digital, Social and Paid Media channels
  • Support project management and launch of annual integrated multi-channel brand campaigns for Private Retreats business
  • Support the evolution and enhancement of guidelines, tools and best practices; updates to training and presentation materials; and creation of new support materials
  • Support Manager with day-to-day brand management of select projects and on-going support as required.
Digital Project Management
  • Responsible for maintenance of all Private Retreats content on owned digital channels; FS.com and FS app
  • Partner with Corporate Digital and Analytics team to analyze and optimize the FS.com website and app
  • Develop competitive analysis and assessments as required on the short -term rental market
  • Own and maintain the Private Retreats image library and creative assets on the shared drive.

Market Research & Analytics:
  • Manage ongoing audit and analysis of vacation rental industry market trends and data to help identify opportunities for growth and strategy refinement
  • Participate in relevant residential rental industry professional organizations/events
  • Collaborate with Corporate Analytics and Guest Insights teams to maintain and evolve rental program reporting.
Key Competencies:
  • Strong project management skills, with the ability to work collaboratively with multiple teams across a matrixed organization
  • Experience in a client service role or in a marketing communications function
  • Experience managing the creative design and production processes for the development and delivery of print and multimedia communications
  • Resource and budget management skills
  • Exceptional communication (written and verbal) and interpersonal skills, required to support a diverse team of employees, consultants and agencies on a daily basis
  • Works well under pressure and can manage multiple tasks under time constraints
  • Ability to think critically and evaluate best possible solutions and procedures
  • Able to work independently, solve problems, take initiative and use good judgment
  • Well-organized, able to set priorities and be detail-oriented
  • Strong in Microsoft Office tools, Photoshop and Indesign are an asset and Content Management System
Prerequisites - Professional Qualifications, Experience and Education:
  • Strong luxury brand aesthetic, with the ability to quickly embrace and enforce brand guidelines
  • Ability to create strong presentations, with a keen attention to detail
  • Highly results oriented with experience delivering and reporting on results
  • A minimum of 3-4 years of progressive experience in a marketing, communications or agency function
  • College or University degree, preferably in a business, marketing, communications or creative program
  • All internal applications must be approved in Workday by March 18, 2022.
  • The applicant must have eligibility to work in Canada.
Four Seasons is committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation.

title: Social Media Specialist
description:
SOCIAL MEDIA SPECIALIST

We are seeking somebody who is dynamic, personable and passionate to join our Sales & Marketing team as our Social Media Specialist! As a member of our team of champions, you will gain meaningful work experience in a welcoming and exciting environment where we lead by example and work together to deliver extraordinary experiences.

You will be responsible for managing the day to day social media platforms content and deployment as well as assist in developing the internal and external social media communication plans.

YOU WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO:

  • Continually curate content for social media posts by utilising own photography skills, as well as building relationships with external photographers
  • Manage day to day media relations/requests for brand and corporate issues
  • Build relationships with key media contacts; identify opportunities to pitch brand and stories through social media outlets
  • Develop written materials such as press releases, Q&A, media standby statements on brand and corporate issues as required
  • Assist with the creation of all brand PR materials to ensure communication is accurate, relevant and consistent with the Carmen's Group brand and overall messaging
  • Evaluate the effectiveness of social media programs and communicate results
  • Develop and implement an online communications strategy ensuring an alignment with the internal communications strategy
  • Collaborate with team members as needed and help provide creative solutions to communication problems
  • Manage the day to day social media platforms content and deployment
  • Assist in developing the social media communication plans
  • Uphold Carmen's Group vision, purpose & values
  • Other duties as required


REQUIREMENTS

  • Bachelor's degree in Communications, Public Relations, Journalism, English or a related discipline
  • 1-2 years' experience managing social media platforms with successful results
  • Strong working knowledge of communication principles and practices
  • Photography background required; photography experience within the hospitality industry is considered an asset
  • Must possess excellent oral, written and interpersonal communication with strong writing and editorial abilities
  • Demonstrated success with social media tools such as Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and others
  • Strong project management skills
  • Must be able to meet tight deadlines and execute flawlessly on projects in a fast paced, often pressured environment and see a project through to completion
  • Must have the ability to be an influential communications consultant within the organization
  • Must have the ability to work effectively in a team
  • Mist be capable of maintaining confidentiality, with a high level of accuracy regarding information
  • The ability to develop and maintain strong professional relationships with internal and external stakeholders and work effectively with all levels of employees is critical
  • Reliable transportation to travel between venues is required
  • Ability to attend and conduct presentations
  • Schedule flexibility required including weekend and evening availability


TEAM PERKS:

  • Worldwide hotel discounts
  • Professional development workshops
  • RRSP program
  • Group benefits
  • Bonus program
  • Fun building events and socials


Carmen’s group is an entertainment and hospitality company committed to creating extraordinary memories for our guests and clients. Driven by our passion, creativity, innovative thinking, and world class service, we have remained industry champions for over 40 years. We are committed to enriching the lives of our guests through providing one of a kind experiences at each of our venues including Carmen’s Banquet Centre, The Best Western Premier C Hotel by Carmen’s, The Lakeview by Carmen’s, Hamilton Convention Centre by Carmen’s, and fig&lemon. We are devoted to bringing excitement to Hamilton and Southern Ontario, and to enhancing the image of Hamilton with every strategic initiative we pursue.

Carmen's Group makes certain there is an equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment. Carmen's Group will strive to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability during the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources upon scheduling your interview.

title: Associate, Recruiting
description:
Position Summary:
As a member of the Toronto Recruiting team, assist in the development, planning, and execution of all Toronto Associate Consultant, Consultant, BEL, ADvantage, and summer intern program recruiting efforts.

Responsibilities and duties:
Event planning and execution
  • Coordinate logistics for (and in some cases, attend), marketing and closing events at undergrad and MBA schools; manage event invites, student sign up, catering, scheduling and RSVPs (combination of virtual, in the office and outside of the office)
  • Assist in screening logistics, including resume reviews, scheduling students, and Bain interview logistics memos using Avature (Bain recruiting system), book travel and send confirmations
  • Manage the in-office/Zoom interview process: point-of-contact for all candidates and interviewers, schedule interview times, create interview memos, etc.
  • Assist in the planning and coordination of all aspects of weekends for our undergrad and MBA offerees including venue sourcing and coordination, communication with recruits, offeree gifts, nametags, lunch/dinner/hotel reservations, catering
  • Assist in the planning and execution of the BEL, ADvantage, and summer intern programs in Toronto including intern training, social events, presentations, and reviews
  • Support our Recruiting DEI efforts, including our diversity internship programs
Communication management
  • Communicate & correspond with recruits on a regular basis. Maintain incoming inquiries, applications, and generate appropriate responses in a timely manner
  • Manage internal communications with local and global Bain consulting and recruiting staff (ie. referrals, global recruiting programs, etc.)
  • Manage external marketing communications with school career services offices and on-campus clubs and organizations, including email campaigns, invitations, marketing materials and room bookings on campus when in person, alternately schedule and host events via Zoom
  • Provide clear, timely responses to consulting staff involved in recruiting (e.g., interviewer schedules, managing commitments, recruiting events, etc.)
  • Utilize Avature (Bain Recruiting System) to update global team members on recruit status and event details
Other support
  • Utilize Avature for data entry, event management and reporting in a timely and accurate manner
  • Update trackers, excel files and power point presentations regularly with meticulous attention to detail
  • Create and track new hire paperwork
  • Assist in events commitments process for recruiting event
  • Assist with recruit gifts and expense reimbursements
  • Attend team meetings
  • Perform other duties as requested or as responsibilities dictate
Qualifications:
  • Associate or Bachelor’s degree or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience
  • Outstanding interpersonal, professional, written/verbal communication, project management, customer service and organizational skills
  • Ability to represent Bain to prospective candidates and school contacts
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and changing environment
  • Ability to meet deadlines, prioritize assignments and juggle multiple tasks simultaneously
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Windows, Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and MS Teams preferred
  • Flexibility with hours; ability to work overtime and evenings as needed
Applicant must have received, or be willing to receive, the COVID-19 vaccine, and be fully vaccinated (established 2 weeks following final dose) by date of employment with Bain & Company to be considered for Canadian based jobs, subject to required accommodation process.
Show more

title: Lifestyle Reservations Consultant
description:
Company Description


Founded in 2017, TripArc is a privately held software company that powers the top Travel Agencies and Tour Operators in North America. Our expansive and growing network of suppliers enables our clients seamless real time access to a comprehensive range of travel options and services globally with over $750 million worth of transactions managed through our platform annually - all at the industry’s best rates for travelers and rates of return for travel advisors and tour operators.

Our industry leading platforms address the current challenges the travel industry is facing because of the pandemic and offers solutions in technology, purchasing, finance and marketing. We deliver solutions to travel professionals in the most effective way possible based on our deep experience with two leading brands in the luxury travel space – Kensington Tours and Travel Edge – we have real insight into the needs of tour operators and travel agencies today.

TripArc’s goals are simple. To make our distribution network of over 1400 travel entities and our network of suppliers and agents more profitable, efficient and help them create truly unique travel for their clients. The travel industry was impacted by the pandemic, but as leaders in the industry, our turnaround has been significant and is gaining momentum. With the pent-up demand we are already seeing, we are here to help our clients make the most of it.


Job Description


As an integral member of the Trip-Arc Operations Team, the Lifestyle Consultant ensures that the Trip-Arc standards for service excellence are maintained throughout the quoting and booking life cycle. You will coordinate hard to get tickets, once in a lifetime experiences, luxurious amenities and Michelin starred dining experiences for our clients.

As a Lifestyle Consultant, you are dedicated to delivering an exceptional and discerning service, connecting the most prestigious brands to these sophisticated clients. As an early team member, you will actively participate in the development of and in the ongoing mentorship and training of new team members. A role that will have regular interaction with many stakeholders (sales team, suppliers, and clients) by phone and email, the successful candidate is highly detailed, an exceptional problem solver, can remain calm under pressure, is a polished communicator and understands the importance of delivering superior customer service.

Responsibilities:

  • Primary liaison between Kensington Tours and Travel Edge and our supplier partners to complete client reservation requests for services such as private car hire, tickets to a sold-out show, hotel suite upgrades and reservations at exclusive restaurants
  • Provide accurate reservation information for each enquiry in compliance with Service Level Agreement.
  • Process reservations that require direct communication with the service provider through both email and telephone.
  • Update reservations in proprietary booking system with supplier confirmations and arrange for payment.
  • Review current reservations for missing information, errors (Quality Control) and payment information on file.
  • Maintain accurate and detailed tracking and reporting documents with each reservation.
  • Make outbound calls to suppliers to obtain missing file information and ensure accurate reservations.
  • Create and action Virtual Credit Card payments, arrange wire transfers and other payment arrangements as necessary.
  • Be trusted in handling sensitive company financial information.
  • Provide mentorship and training to new team members when requested.
  • Provide insights and recommendations for improvements to work-flows and processes.
  • Develop and maintain proficiency with the proprietary booking system.
  • Provide problem solving expertise and superior customer service in emergency situations taking immediate action to contact necessary parties, propose operational changes, assist the client, and diffuse the situation.
  • Other client touch points, incident support when and where required.
  • Ad hoc projects as assigned.

Qualifications
  • Excellent organization and time management skills with the ability to take on additional projects when required.
  • A can do, self-starting attitude.
  • Highly developed communication (verbal and written) and listening skills - ability to adjust communication styles and deal with clients sensitively, tactfully, diplomatically, and professionally always.
  • Ability to master internal department processes, procedures, and systems.
  • Experience in a Customer Service or Travel Operations role would be an asset.
  • Exceptional customer service orientation. Exhibits service excellence in all interactions with internal and external customers.
  • Background in customer service, personal assistance, luxury travel and leisure, restaurant, or nightlife industries.
  • Demonstrated experience with critical incident management or providing emergency operational support an asset.
  • Demonstrated experience with issue resolution with the ability to make decisions quickly and confidently.
  • Proven critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
  • Superior attention to detail – experience with Quality Control/Data Management an advantage.
  • High degree of resourcefulness, flexibility, and adaptability.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast paced, high performance culture.
  • Ability to provide after-hours support on a rotational basis.
  • A positive, engaged, and collaborative team player.

Additional Information


Cultural Fit

  • Thrives working in a technology and KPI driven organization
  • Able to thrive in an entrepreneurial environment
  • Highly functional in a fast paced, constantly changing workplace - building plans through iterations from learning on what’s working and not working
  • Ability to build trust and work through conflict both upwards and downward

We know that our success is dependent on the people who join our team, which is why we recruit the best. Our team is made up of owners; people who are smart, low ego, and who are accountable for their results. We all play a part in the success of the company and are proud of what we do.

We thank all candidates for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Successful candidates will receive communications from the Navigatr Talent Acquisition team, our exclusive recruitment partner.

TripArc is committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If you require accommodation due to a disability at any stage of our hiring process, please advise us when completing your application.

title: Full Time Senior Art Consultant
description:
Art Consultant - Whistler Contemporary Gallery (Whistler)

compensation: Base Salary Plus Commissions
employment type: Full-time
Sales associate – Contemporary Art Gallery
Job description:
The Gallery is one of Canada’s leading fine art galleries. Specializing in the representation of renowned Canadian and International artists with two locations in Whistler, BC. We are now interviewing applicants for the position of Sales Associate for our galleries located in The Four Seasons Hotel & Whistler Village.
About the Job:
We are looking for a Sales professional who is enthusiastic, motivated and interested in joining our team. The environment is dynamic and constantly evolving. With a small team, the available position offers a unique hands-on experience.
The responsibilities include:
Excellent sales abilities
Highly motivated
Excellent Negotiating skills
Possess leadership qualities, and are determined to be a winner
Providing excellent customer service to clients and delegate communications effectively that are engaging and creative.
Ability to establish rapport easily and put people “at ease”
Comfortable at generating leads, with the ability to positively engage
Possess an appropriate sense of urgency, and to bring a sales situation to a resolution
Effectively provide solutions for customers’ challenges
Initialization and the ability to focus on opportunities and solutions
Anticipate consequences and evaluate alternatives before acting
Work collaboratively with other employees to provide support on a wide range of administrative tasks and daily operations
Independently coordinating and executing gallery mailings, shipments, custom documentation and transportation logistics
Proactively work with team members to ensure input and assigned tasks are managed on a timely basis
Maintain a positive outlook
Able to work evenings & weekends
Qualifications & Skills:
Experience in a related position or field
Proficiency in the use of Google Apps (Chrome, Drive, Sheets, Docs, Gmail, Calendar), Mac OS X, MS Office (Word & Excel)
Basic knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite; Acrobat, Photoshop

Company Profile:
The WHISTLER CONTEMPORARY GALLERY continues its dedication to the promotion of distinctive Canadian and international contemporary art. We represent emerging, mid-career and established artists. Our art encompasses a diversity of styles including figurative, abstract and landscape. The gallery offers an exceptional selection of original paintings, multi-media work, glass and sculpture.

The gallery has two locations in the Hilton Resort and Spa and the Four Seasons Whistler Resort. The resort itself attracts over two million visitors each year and is often rated as #1 ski resort in North America.

With 26 years of experience in the art business, the gallery works with first time and experienced buyers to build their collections.

We are dedicated to serving our clients as well as our artists. We are passionate about art and are committed to bringing quality pieces to our collectors.
'
Whistler Contemporary Gallery showcasing contemporary fine art since 1992
Formerly known as The Whistler Village Art Gallery.

Job Type: Part-Time
Language:
English (Required)

Work remotely

  • No

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

title: Travel Consultant - Quebec-cxLoyalty
description:
Provide exceptional customer service for inbound calls to assist customers with redeeming their loyalty program points for travel accommodations, including, but not limited to: airline tickets, car rentals, hotel accommodations, and travel insurance to all cxLoyalty clients' customers within company guidelines and account specific requirements. Serve customers by providing product and service information, as well as resolving product and service problems.

Responsibilities:
  • Sell travel arrangements and related services for customers .
  • Use preferred vendors as determined by cxLoyalty to maximize profits.
  • Understand individual redemption travel loyalty program requirements. Proficient in all aspects of point redemption for appropriate clients.
  • Provide thorough, friendly, and effective customer service to all internal and external customers in a timely and accurate manner.
  • Maintain comprehensive working knowledge of all programs, tools and systems.
  • Strong computer skills, ability to navigate through multiple systems at once.
  • Participate in cross training and handle calls on multiple accounts.
  • Meet and maintain individual monthly metrics per company guidelines as determined by the operating group.
  • Participate fully as a team member to assist as needed in completing all functions related to servicing the client, including selling additional products.
  • Pro-actively stay informed about all airline rules and regulations, and other industry requirements and accurately apply this information when making travel arrangements.
  • Resolve product or service issues by clarifying the customer's complaint; determining the cause of the problem; select and explain the best solution to solve the problem; expedite correction or adjustment.
  • Work a flexible schedule during the clients' servicing hours which may include weekends and holidays and have the flexibility to attend staff and training meetings for ongoing updates in the travel industry, program guidelines, and office procedures, which may not be during your assigned hours.
  • Keep immediate supervisor promptly and fully informed of all problems or unusual matters and take prompt corrective action where necessary or suggest alternative coursed of action which may be taken.

Skills/Qualifications:
  • You must be located in Canada to apply for this role
  • Call Center experience required
  • Bi Lingual English/French required (verbal and written)
  • Quebec Travel Counsellor Certificate required. Having the certificate is an advantage and must be obtained prior to start date. cxLoyalty will assist in acquiring the certificate if it is not possessed at the time of offer.
  • Customer Service, Product Knowledge, Quality Focus, Problem Solving, Sales, Documentation Skills, Listening, Phone Skills, Resolving Conflict, Analyzing Information , Multi-tasking.
  • Travel Industry experience preferred
  • High school diploma preferred
  • Advanced knowledge / proficiency using multiple screens in an online environment
  • Ability to quickly and accurately enter data in a script driven environment
  • Intermediate to advanced knowledge / proficiency of GDS and /or other technology platforms including self-booking tools
  • Ability to work independently and also function as a team member

Same Posting Description for Internal and External Candidates

cxLoyalty, a subsidiary of JPMorgan Chase, is a leading provider of loyalty technology services with rewards content in relevant categories including travel, gift cards, merchandise and incentives while using data and analytics to personalize, optimize and deliver a world-class customer experience. We have more than 40 years of experience designing, administering and fulfilling market leading loyalty programs for our respected clients and their customers. Based in Stamford, Conn., cxLoyalty has more than 1,700 associates and provides services to consumers located in 14 countries.

title: Corporate Traveller - Corporate Travel Consultant - Toronto, Canada
description:
Job no: 512490
Brand: Corporate Traveller
Work type: Full time
Location: Ontario
Categories: Corporate & Group Travel

Corporate Travel Consultant

Who we are:

Think of us as the ultimate travel wing man. A world where tech and people work collectively to make corporate travel simpler, faster and easier.

Corporate Traveller, is one of Flight Centre Travel Group’s (FCTG) most successful brands, globally. Our mission is to dominate the SME market, making the end to end travel experience seamless. For decades, we’ve been helping ambitious businesses grow through travel.

It all comes down to cutting edge tech and travel experts working together in perfect harmony.

Powered by the best talent around and our platform Melon, we build long-term partnerships and offer tailored solutions that have an immediate and positive impact on the bottom line of our clients.

Who you are:

We are looking for a motivated and driven Corporate Travel Consultant who can hit the ground running and deliver the boutique level of service that Corporate Traveller is famous for. Our ideal candidate will have a minimum of 2 years travel consulting experience along with buckets of ambition and an insatiable appetite for delivering impeccable service.

  • Customer focused – consistently going above and beyond to deliver an amazing client experience
  • You obsess over details; take pride in being organized and can juggle competing priorities with the ability to quickly shift gears when needed.
  • Outstanding interpersonal skills and ability to build strong business relationships.
  • A problem solver who thinks outside of the box to provide creative solutions.
  • You embrace egalitarianism, irreverence, and ownership.
  • Empathetic, compassionate, and curious.
  • You thrive in a collaborative environment but can also produce quality work independently.
  • Excellent written and verbal communications skills
  • Ability to work in a fast paced, deadline driven environment.
  • Outgoing and enthusiastic, with a go-getter personality and a positive outlook
  • Tech Savvy – 2 years’ experience with a GDS system (Sabre preferred), confident using Microsoft suite, and comfortable learning new software

What you’ll be doing:

As a Corporate Travel Consultant you will be responsible for managing the day-to-day travel needs of corporate business accounts, including:

  • Assist in making professional and accurate business travel arrangements for our corporate accounts including air, car, hotel, and ground transportation reservations.
  • Follow company procedures, account guidelines and customer service standards
  • Work as a team member and assist other agents as needed in completing all functions related to servicing the client.
  • Build and maintain strong working relationships
  • Provide solutions to travel related problems clients may experience

Work Perks! - What’s in it for you:

FCTG is renowned internationally for having amazing perks and an even better culture. We understand that our people are our most valuable asset. It is the passion and dedication of our teams that keep the company on top of the industry ladder. It’s also why we offer some great employee benefits and perks outside of the norm.

  • Enjoy the freedom and flexibility of a hybrid work structure that combines both remote and in-person work.
  • Have fun: At the heart of everything we do at Flight Centre is a desire to have fun.
  • Reward & Recognition: Celebrate the success of yourself and others at our regular Buzz Nights and at the annual Global Gathering - You'll have to experience it to believe it!
  • Use your smarts: Our people use their quick thinking, expertise, and tenacity to always figure things out.
  • Love for travel: We were founded by people who wanted to travel and want others to do the same. That passion is something you can’t miss in our people or service.
  • Personal connections: We are a big business founded on personal relationships.
  • A career, not a job: We offer genuine opportunities for people to grow and evolve.
  • We back our people all the way: We are strongly committed to supporting every single employee in their professional and personal development.
  • Giving Back: Proud Corporate Social Responsibility platform through the Flight Centre Foundation and Brighter Futures programs supporting nominated charities through Workplace Giving, Volunteering and Fundraising.

Benefits Include:

  • Uncapped earning potential
  • Travel perks/discounts.
  • Health & Wellness Programs and Employee Financial Wellness Services
  • Generous paid-time off policy
  • Diversity & Inclusion initiatives
  • Benefits including vision, medical, and dental
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • RRSP with matching
  • Employee Share Plan
  • Ongoing training and professional development

Location - Toronto, Ontario

If this sounds like the opportunity you have been waiting for and you would like to be part of our award winning culture then APPLY NOW.

We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted.

Our promise is to provide an environment with equality of respect, dignity and opportunity for all our employees. We value an inclusive and supportive workplace which truly reflects the diversification of our society. Flight Centre Travel Group is committed to providing a barrier-free pathway throughout our recruitment selection process. If you require accommodation because of a disability at any stage of our hiring process, please let us know in advance by contacting our Recruitment Team at fccareers@flightcentre.ca

title: Travel Consultant
description:
Discovery Travel (a division of Cascadia Motivation) is a well-established luxury corporate travel agency looking for an energetic and committed personality to become a part of its team. Candidate will have excellent communication skills and experience working with the most discerning of clients.

Location: Red Deer, Alberta
Hours: 9:00 am – 5:00 pm Monday to Friday
Remote work from home located in Alberta, will be available for the appropriate candidate.

You provide the following skills:

  • Travel Agency experience
  • Proficient with travel agency back office and accounting procedures
  • Knowledge of SABRE or other GDS systems
  • Post-Secondary travel course or certification preferred
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office software
  • Effective verbal and written communication
  • Detail Oriented, extremely well organized and self-motivated
  • Ability to meet critical deadlines and handle multiple projects
  • Enthusiastic, customer-focused, team player

Responsibilities:

  • Determining customer needs and then providing the appropriate information and guidance
  • Making professional and accurate travel arrangements for our clients, including air, car, hotel, tour package and ground transportation reservations
  • Communicating with suppliers to collect and exchange information regarding hotels, resorts, airlines, schedules, and tour packages
  • Advising the customer of appropriate restrictions, terms and conditions of travel services
  • Selling travel insurance
  • Completing client files, reservation information, payment details and following proper accounting requirements
  • Following up on customer inquiries in a timely manner

We offer the rewards:

  • Exceptional salary, we are in the top 5% of Travel Consultant wages
  • Continuous professional training
  • Two company paid customized destination inspection trips per year
  • Comprehensive medical, dental, life insurance, short and long term disability benefits program

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Vision care
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • Overtime

Application question(s):

  • This position is based in Canada. Do you currently reside in Canada? Are you legally authorized to work in Canada? (Answer must be YES)

Experience:

  • Travel Consultant: 1 year (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-05-06

title: Sales Consultant
description:
Are you a go-getter who loves dealing with people? Do you have experience working with peole in a retail environment? We might be looking for you!

What we’re looking for:
Our busy import dealership is accepting applications for the position of a professional Sales and Lease Consultant. Previous automotive sales experience is not necessary, as we offer full training and a little different culture than the average car dealership.

You will be responsible for meeting and greeting clients, guiding test drives, and assisting our clients in their purchases while building your business and career.

Who we’re looking for:
Phenomenal customer service before anything else. Ambitious. Driven. Thrives in a competitive environment. These are words and terms that describe the kind of person we’re looking for. We’re not looking for average, we’re looking for excellence.

You’ll be joining an established and successful team of professional Sales Consultants, and we’re looking to build your career with us to heights you might not think are possible.

Who should apply:
You’d be surprised who can really make it in our industry. We have success stories with recent university and college grads of all kinds, hotel staff, restaurant employees (particularly waiters and waitresses), even home improvement and big box store employees. Basically, if customer service is a big drive for you and you live every day with a positive attitude, you might like what we have to offer. A valid driver’s license is the only must for now.

What we offer:
Complete onsite training will be provided

Competitive compensation packages. The average sales consultant can earn $40 000 per year. A good sales consultant can earn $60-70 000 per year. Top performers will earn $100 000+. We’re not looking for average.

A positive, customer-focused culture of service and reputation.

Honesty and integrity are our watchwords. You’ll never need to compromise your excellent ethical and moral standards.

Be a part of the team at a Platinum Member of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies. Platinum membership is awarded to an elite group of companies that have been awarded as one of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies for at least six consecutive years.

Unlimited growth potential. The Murray Automotive Group owns 30+ dealerships from White Rock, BC to Yarmouth, NS, and leadership is promoted from within. The sky is the limit for the right applicant.

title: Corporate Traveller - Corporate Travel Consultant - Calgary, Alberta
description:
Job no: 512496
Brand: Corporate Traveller
Work type: Full time
Location: Alberta
Categories: Corporate & Group Travel

Corporate Travel Consultant

Think of us as the ultimate travel wing man. A world where tech and people work collectively to make corporate travel simpler, faster and easier.

Corporate Traveller, is one of Flight Centre Travel Group’s (FCTG) most successful brands, globally. Our mission is to dominate the SME market, making the end to end travel experience seamless. For decades, we’ve been helping ambitious businesses grow through travel.

It all comes down to cutting edge tech and travel experts working together in perfect harmony.

Powered by the best talent around and our platform Melon, we build long-term partnerships and offer tailored solutions that have an immediate and positive impact on the bottom line of our clients.

title: OPERATIONS MANAGER - HOTEL
company: Executive The Inn at Whistler Village & Mountain Side Hotel
description:
We are looking for a new member to join our busy and professional team in Whistler as the new Operations Manager. This is a hands-on position responsible for leading a small but capable team.

OPERATIONS & HOUSING MANAGER, Job description

The Operations & Housing Manager is responsible for all aspects of hotel operations by leading, coaching and mentoring of hotel employees, supervisors and managers, ensuring the maximization of revenues, market share, net operating income, guest satisfaction index, EOS through the development of a strong service culture and entrepreneurial spirit that displays the values and vision of the Hotel. Takes responsibility for overseeing staff housing operations.

Operations

· Effectively implements brand and hotel standards including property condition, cleanliness and quality of product and service.

· Takes responsibility for the operations departments (Front Desk & Housekeeping) in the absence of the respective department heads. Supports and develops operational managers on a daily basis.

· Analyzes property operations on a daily, weekly and monthly basis.

· Implements, reviews and updates employee training, incentive and development.

· Ensures written Standard Operating Procedures are being reviewed and followed.

· EOS delivery and communication to the leaders with strategies for areas to develop and improve.

· Reviews guest satisfaction score results daily and sets weekly action plans in conjunction with ‘report to”.

Human Resources and Development

· Creates a strong service culture in the hotel and maximizes guest satisfaction index.

· Assists hotel manager with Employee Legal, Benefits, Union, WCB claims, consults with external HR Consultant and internally through Regional Office.

· Yearly Performance Management reviews of employees.

· Supervises and counsels department managers in the efficient operation of their respective areas.

· Maximizes EOS through strong leadership, HR policies and effective practices.

· Participates in applicable hotel and corporate training programs.

· Develops retention strategies.

· Employee Recognition Program – Overall departments

Payroll

· Assists hotel manager and department heads to Process and submit all elements of payroll.

Financial

· Coaches department heads on Managing the operational budgeted expenses.

· Maximizes net operating income through effective execution of the budget.

· Follows the hotel’s revenue management strategies and contributes when required.

· Plans and reviews operational purchases to ensure efficient usage of available resources.

Supervision and Support

· Encourages open dialogue among all associates and cultivating an environment which encourages employee suggestions and involvement.

· Ensures coverage in time of manpower shortage, emergency situations and vacation.

· Assists with the roll out of any Corporate Initiatives.

· Continuous coaching and mentorship of the leadership teams.

Risk Management

· Ensures the health and safety of all Guests and Employees.

· Ensures Local, Provincial and Brand compliance with Health and Safety regulations.

Maintenance

· Supports the Maintenance Manager in overseeing the operations of the maintenance department.

· Assists the Maintenance Manager in purchasing materials, prioritizing and planning tasks.

· Audits property to assess maintenance standards. Attends maintenance meetings with General Manager to strategize and support the department.

· Jointly manages capital projects with Maintenance Manager.

Housing

· Assists hotel manager in maintaining relationship with staff house landlords.

· Administers and collects housing deposits.

· Approves all housing assignments and move requests.

· Ensures terms and conditions of leases are respected. Eg. # of permitted parking spaces.

· Performs monthly cleanliness inspections and departure inspections.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $55,000.00-$60,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Whistler, BC V8E1E3: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

  • Hotel Management: 3 years (required)
Show more

title: North American Travel Consultant
description:
POSITION: North American Travel Consultants

LOCATION: 3 Locations

  • Stittsville Travel Store – 5703 Hazeldean Road, Stittsville ON
  • Nepean Travel Sore - 1331 Clyde Avenue, Ottawa, ON
  • Orleans Travel Store – 2026 Tenth Line Road, Orleans, ON

Our retail travel business is growing! We need North American travel consultants to assist our Members with their Membership and Travel needs. Our retail travel stores are where Members go for their member benefits (maps, IDP and passport photos etc.) and where they can plan and purchase all types of trips and tours, merchandise, luggage etc. The schedule is 37.5 hours per week, including some Saturdays and Sundays.

If you love working with the public and can close sales, this is an excellent opportunity!

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Promote and sell CAA memberships, promoting upgrades and additional associates.
  • Provide members with Auto Travel materials, passport photos, International Drivers Permits, etc.
  • Promote and sell North American travel-related products such as air, theme park vacations, hotel, and car reservations, travel insurance, etc.
  • Answer member/client inquiries and collect leads for Senior Travel Consultants.
  • Various administrative duties including restocking brochures and merchandise, conducting inventory, etc.
  • Other related duties as required.

Qualifications and Skills: The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • TICO certification is required or must be attained within the probation period.
  • Completion of Travel Agency Certification course from established and recognized institution
  • Customer service experience an asset
  • Must possess the comfort level and drive to succeed in a part-commission sales environment
  • Self-motivated ability to build and retain a loyal clientele
  • Must actively pursue the CTC designation (supported by the Club)
  • Complete knowledge of Apollo and Travelport + GDS
  • Fluency in both official languages is an asset
  • Proof of COVID-19 Vaccination is required for all CAANEO employees

Compensation:

  • Base Salary: $34,500 - $39,500
  • Generous Incentive Structure
  • Health & Dental Plan
  • Pension Plan
  • CAA Membership

Employment is contingent on a successful Criminal Background Check and references.

Job applicants who have disabilities shall be provided with reasonable accommodation throughout the recruiting process.

Work remotely

  • No

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $34,500.00-$39,500.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Commission pay

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Store discount
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
Proof of COVID-19 Vaccination required for all CAANEO employees
All COVID-19 Safety Measures are strictly enforced and monitored

Experience:

  • Travel Sales: 1 year (preferred)
  • Retail Sales: 1 year (preferred)

Language:

  • English and French (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • TICO (preferred)

title: Travel Consultant
description:
POSITION: Travel Consultant

LOCATION: Hunt Club Travel Store, 2446 Bank St., Ottawa, ON

Our travel business is growing! We need travel agents to assist our Members with all their travel needs. Our retail travel stores are where Members go for their member benefits (maps, tour books and passport photos etc.) and where they can plan and purchase all types of trips and tours; merchandise, luggage etc. The schedule is 37.5 hours per week, including some weekends. If you love travel and can close sales, this is an excellent opportunity.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Promote and sell travel-related products such as air, tour, hotel car reservations, and travel insurance
  • Promote and sell CAA memberships, promoting upgrades and additional associates;
  • Provide members with Auto Travel materials, passport photos etc.
  • Answer member/client inquiries;
  • Various administrative duties including restocking brochures/merchandise, conducting inventory, etc
  • Other Related Duties as Required

Qualifications and Skills: The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • TICO certification is required or must be attained within the probation period.
  • Completion of Travel Agency Certification course from established and recognized institution
  • Customer service experience an asset
  • Must possess the comfort level and drive to succeed in a part-commission sales environment
  • Self-motivated ability to build and retain a loyal clientele
  • Must actively pursue the CTC designation (supported by the Club)
  • Complete knowledge of Apollo by Gemini automation
  • Fluency in both official languages is an asset
  • Proof of COVID-19 Vaccination required for all CAANEO employees

Employment is contingent on a successful Criminal Background Check and references.

Job applicants who have disabilities shall be provided with reasonable accommodation throughout the recruiting process.

Work remotely

  • No

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $34,500.00-$39,500.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Commission pay

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Store discount
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
Proof of COVID-19 Vaccination required for all CAANEO employees
All COVID-19 Safety Measures are strictly enforced and monitored

Experience:

  • Travel Sales: 1 year (preferred)
  • Retail Sales: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • TICO (preferred)

title: Travel Consultant - Call Centre
description:
Travel Consultant

If you have a natural flair for exceptional customer service, an aptitude for learning and a true passion for travel, this role is for you. With an intensive 11-week, paid training and mentoring program, here is your chance to become a highly skilled Travel Consultant. Our training program is best in class and you will receive training on par with the best educational facilities that provide a Travel Agent training program.

As mentioned above, this job is a work from site position. Our office is in the west end of Toronto, located at 191 The West Mall, Etobicoke. We are easily accessible by Toronto and Mississauga public transit, Go transit – close to Kipling station, close to Highway 427 and QEW.

Hours of Operation: 11:30 am to 1:00 am. 7 days per week/365 days per year

RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:

Once you have completed the training, you will be ready to take whatever travel request comes your way.

  • You will delight our Premium Card Members with unforgettable and unexpected experiences
  • As a consultant, you will refine understanding by asking personalized fact-finding questions
  • If you are not a travel expert yet, you will know where to look to find the information you need
  • You will research, plan, and execute customized travel experiences, through booking domestic and international flights, car and/or hotel travel arrangements
  • At times, you may need to de-escalate a Card Member’s stress, when unforeseen travel situations arise
  • You will always put the Card Member’s experience at the forefront of everything you do, reinforcing the WOW and winning their loyalty

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Proven ability to provide extraordinary customer service
  • Experience servicing customers ideally in travel, hospitality, high-end customer service or sales roles
  • A passion for building customer loyalty by carefully listening, building rapport, and providing extraordinary customer care
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Natural consultative skills, with the ability to offer confident recommendations
  • Excellent geography knowledge likely gained by being travel curious or through time spent exploring the world
  • The resilience and composure to remain positive under pressure and constantly evolving circumstances
  • Confident computer skills are vital as you will be using multiple tools and systems daily
  • Ability to thrive in a metric driven environment, with a healthy competitiveness to meet and exceed goals
  • A systematic approach to solving complex problems by gathering and capturing the correct details
  • Capturing value in innovative ways
  • The ability to continue to be effective despite demands and pressures
  • The flexibility to work shifts, including nights and weekends
  • Clear Background Check
  • Proof of Authorized Covid-19 Vaccination
  • Smart phone required for duo authentication secure sign-in

A little about us : )

Cloud5 has helped the most recognized brands in the world deliver an exceptional customer experience through a combination of the best technology in the industry and a world-class contact center that behaves as an extension of our client's brand voice and promise.

Whether it’s expertly designed, built and supported future-state networks, or powerful, flexible voice solutions, Cloud5 delivers communication solutions rooted in hospitality and refined for businesses that have built their brand on the promise of exceptional service. Add the expertise of our award-winning Contact Center for inbound customer service, voice reservations, virtual guest services, and loyalty programs to realize the increased revenue that comes from higher call conversion, and the loyalty that comes from an experience that impresses even the most discerning customer.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $18.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Night shift
  • Weekend availability

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Toronto, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

  • Call Centre: 1 year (preferred)
  • Travel: 1 year (preferred)
Show more

title: Travel Customer Service Representative
description:
BONUS, BONUS, BONUS!

We are offering a $500 bonus upon successful Training Certification!

**Please Note** If selected to move forward, you will receive a link to complete 3-4 Online Assessments within 48 hours. You must complete these assessments in order to be considered for this position. Please be sure to check your junk/spam folders for the assessment email.

The assessments will take approximately 30 minutes to complete.

Aspire Lifestyles- Travel Consultant

· Work from Home Opportunity

· Starting at $16.50/hr.
*We will be temporarily offering a $2.00/hr evening shift bonus

*MUST be able to work Full Time

*MUST be able to work Afternoons and Weekends

The Travel Consultant role is responsible for fulfilling travel specific requests for a very high-profile client program via phone, email and/or chat.

The successful candidate will research, plan, and execute customized travel experiences, through booking domestic and international flights, car and/or hotel travel arrangements. At times, you may need to de-escalate a Card Member’s stress, when unforeseen travel situations arise.

The Travel Consultant will use their knowledge to help Card Members access their exclusive benefits, including how to make the most of their Membership Reward points.

Why join Aspire Lifestyles?

· What we do here is UNIQUE and as such, it will provide you with a rewarding and satisfying work experience.

· The people – Our team encvironment is one of the things that sets us apart from other jobs. We recognize your efforts and will provide you the support you need to be successful.

· Work from the comfort of your own home.

· Paid Training - You will receive in-depth training to enable you to be a travel expert and you will know where to look to find the information you need to assist travelers with their changing travel plans such as trip cancellations, re-bookings, and exchanges. Troubleshooting any customer issues relating to the use of the travel website and expertly guiding customers whilst they navigate around the site.

· Health, dental and vision benefits after 30 days of employment.

· RRSP program with company match.

· Career advancement opportunities.

Please note that successful candidates must meet the following criteria in order to Work from Home:

· Must provide a private at-home office space, with a lockable door, free of distraction.

· Must have internet and maintain high speed internet access with a minimum speed of 25 mbps download / 5 mbps upload.

· Wired internet connection (cannot use Wi-Fi connection) capable of continuously supporting excellent call quality and high-speed response rate. Internet connection must be connected to modem /router through hard cable/ethernet cord.

·Satellite internet providers are prohibited and cannot be used due to the impact on call quality and the stability of service.

Here’s what you bring to the team:

· A passion for travel from a personal and/or professional perspective.

Excellent geography knowledge likely gained by being travel curious or through time spent exploring the world.

·The ability to deliver white glove customer service and handle card member requests on behalf of Aspire Lifestyles’ client, from a virtual workspace.

· The passion to always put the Card Member’s experience at the forefront of everything you do, reinforcing the WOW and winning their loyalty.

· Natural consultative skills, with the ability to offer tailored recommendations.

· Comfort in utilizing a variety of resources including search engines, websites and internal resources to research customer requests with the goal of delivering meaningful and valuable solutions.

· Detail oriented with a focus on quality and accuracy.

·Excellent multi-tasking skills.

· Able to work in a fast paced, structured call center environment.

Qualifications:

· High school diploma or equivalent is required; college experience is preferred.

· Must be able to complete a background check.

· 2+ years of customer service experience required preferably in a highly interactive hospitality or travel related role.

· Prior experience in the Hospitality or Travel industries preferred.

· Must be internet savvy and proficient at navigating multiple systems simultaneously.

If you are someone who has a passion for travel, that easily adapts to change, maintains a positive attitude, and strives to deliver extraordinary experiences…every time, then we want to connect with you today!

No sales required.

Aspire Lifestyles is committed to ensuring accessibility for all persons with a disability and to providing excellence in serving all customers including people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

INDCA

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $16.50 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Weekend availability

Application question(s):

  • Are you able to work full time, up to 40 hours a week?
  • Are you able to meet our internet speed requirement of 25 mbps for download and 5 mbps for upload?
  • Do you have experience in hospitality and travel?

Education:

  • Secondary School (required)

Experience:

  • customer service: 2 years (required)
  • Call Center: 1 year (required)

title: Digital Travel Consultant - Customer Service
description:
Cloud5 has helped the most recognized brands in the world deliver an exceptional customer experience through a combination of the best technology in the industry and a world-class contact center that behaves as an extension of our client's brand voice and promise.

Whether it’s expertly designed, built and supported future-state networks, or powerful, flexible voice solutions, Cloud5 delivers communication solutions rooted in hospitality and refined for businesses that have built their brand on the promise of exceptional service. Add the expertise of our award-winning Contact Center for inbound customer service, voice reservations, virtual guest services, and loyalty programs to realize the increased revenue that comes from higher call conversion, and the loyalty that comes from an experience that impresses even the most discerning customer.

Digital Travel Consultant

If you have a natural flair for exceptional customer service, an aptitude for learning and a true passion for travel, this role is for you. With an intensive 12-week, paid training and mentoring program, here is your chance to become a highly skilled Digital Travel Consultant in a 24/7 department.

Digital Travel Consultant Hours of Operation are 24/7.

NOTE: Additional $3.00 per hour premium for working overnight shifts. Overnight shifts are defined as any shift where the majority of the shift is after 7 pm.

RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:

Once you have completed the training, you will be ready to take whatever travel request comes your way.

  • Delight Card Members with unforgettable and unexpected experiences
  • Create a personalized rapport with the Card Member and represent the Customer’s brand to Partner Vendors
  • Stay current with Client product offerings and Travel Industry and Client changes
  • Research, plan and execute customized travel experiences, through booking flights, hotel, and/or car arrangements.
  • Assist Card Members with concierge requests by arranging fine dining reservations or obtaining tickets to unforgettable experiences.
  • Answer online navigation questions and offer assistance and troubleshooting with the co-browse function
  • Put the Card Members’ experience at the forefront of everything you do, reinforcing the WOW and winning their loyalty
  • Receive incoming chats and texts from Card Members
  • Research plan and execute customized travel experiences
  • Refine your understanding by asking personalized fact-finding questions.
  • De-escalate a Card Member’s stress when unforeseen travel issues arise
  • Provide exceptional customer service
  • Email servicing through client computer tools

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • High School Diploma is required, and 1-2 years of post-secondary education would be considered an asset
  • Experience servicing customers ideally in travel, hospitality, high-end customer service or sales roles
  • Passion for building customer loyalty by carefully listening, building rapport, and providing extraordinary customer care
  • Experience in or ability to thrive in a metric driven environment, with a healthy competitiveness to meet or exceed goals
  • Confident computer skills and the ability to use multiple screens and multitask with 2 chats simultaneously is essential
  • Excellent knowledge of geography or history
  • Passion for or interest in Travel and if they have spent time travelling it would be an asset
  • Strong work ethic and reliable
  • Resilience and composure to remain positive under pressure and constantly evolving circumstances
  • Flexibility to work shifts, including early mornings, evenings, and weekends in a 24/7/365 day environment with the possibility of permanent overnight shift if interested
  • Proven ability to provide extraordinary customer service
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Natural consultative skills, with the ability to offer confident recommendations
  • Home internet requirement:

Wired Internet
25 mbps download x 5 mbps upload min speed

Wired -cable broadband (no WIFI, satellite, Hotspots etc.) Connect to your internet and conduct your speed test

Visit www.speedtest.net and select GO

TRAINING:

  • Training may be on-site and/or virtual
  • Position can be worked from site or from work at home office
  • 12 weeks of training, which includes on the job training on the phones, followed by a transition to the Digital Travel Counselor role

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $18.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Nova Scotia: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

  • Customer service: 1 year (preferred)
  • Travel Consultant: 1 year (preferred)
